Headline: May has a 'good shot' of getting Brexit deal approved next week, UK junior minister
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has a good chance of getting her twice-defeated Brexit deal approved by parliament next week, a junior Brexit minister in her government said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain says EU could hold emergency summit to offer conditional Brexit extension
Description: The European Union could next week hold an emergency summit to offer a Brexit extension with potentially onerous conditions such as holding another referendum, British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said on Thursday.

Headline: Let the British parliament find a softer Brexit option, MP tells May
Description: The British parliament should be given the opportunity to find an alternative way to leave the European Union and MPs would support a Norway-style post-Brexit relationship, Conservative lawmaker Oliver Letwin said on Thursday.

Headline: Labour's Corbyn to discuss 'alternative' Brexit plan with EU leaders
Description: British Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn will travel to Brussels on Thursday to discuss an "alternative" Brexit plan with European Union (EU) leaders, including the bloc's chief negotiator Michel Barnier, his party said in a statement.

Headline: EPP's Weber: I can't imagine Brexit extension until June
Description: Extending Britain's departure from the European Union until June is not a good idea as it would have to participate in the European Parliament election, Manfred Weber, the centre-right's lead candidate in the vote, said on Thursday.

Headline: German foreign minister open to one last push for orderly Brexit
Description: Delaying Britain's departure from the European Union is justifiable if there is a real chance of securing an orderly Brexit, German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas told Germany's Funke media group.

Headline: May urges parliament to back her on Brexit, tells Britons 'I'm on your side'
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May made an impassioned appeal to MPs to support her on Wednesday after the European Union said it could only grant her request to delay Brexit for three months if parliament next week backed her plans for leaving.

Headline: May urges MPs to back her Brexit deal now
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she deeply regretted her decision to seek a Brexit extension from the European Union and she urged MPs, who have twice previously rejected her plan, to back her now.

Headline: Tusk invites EU leaders to agree short, conditional Brexit delay
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said on Wednesday he believed the EU should endorse a short delay of Brexit beyond March 29 if Britain's parliament ratifies the stalled divorce agreement next week.

Headline: EU leaders should cut UK some slack on Brexit extension - Irish PM
Description: European Union leaders should cut Prime Minister Theresa May some slack over her request to delay Brexit, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Wednesday.

Headline: Next Brexit defeat could mean election, May could say - Channel 4
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May could indicate in a statement later that another defeat for her Brexit deal could mean a general election, Channel 4's political editor Gary Gibbon said on Wednesday.

Headline: EU's Tusk sees short Brexit delay if UK backs divorce deal
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said on Wednesday that granting Britain a short postponement of Brexit was possible on condition that Britain's parliament votes in favour of the stalled divorce agreement next week.

Headline: Brexit minister: Parliament will debate EU exit plans on Monday
Description: Parliament will have the chance to discuss a motion on Brexit on Monday, Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said, confirming government plans to set out a process for parliament to find a way forward on Britain's departure from the European Union.

Headline: Brexit delay request will be rejected if no guarantees of deal success - France
Description: Britain's request for a delay to Brexit will be rejected by the EU if Prime Minister Theresa May cannot provide sufficient guarantees that her parliament will approve the divorce deal she negotiated, France's foreign minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK parliament to hold emergency debate on Brexit on Wednesday
Description: Britain's parliament will hold an emergency debate on Wednesday on Prime Minister Theresa May's decision to request a three-month delay to Brexit, the speaker John Bercow said.

Headline: Rumours of UK PM May speech on Wednesday - newspaper political editor
Description: There are unconfirmed rumours Prime Minister Theresa May will give a speech outside her Downing Street residence on Wednesday evening, the political editor of the Independent newspaper said on Twitter.

Headline: Brexit delay until European elections no legal problem, says Germany
Description: Delaying Britain's departure from the European Union until European elections in late May would not be legally problematic, a senior German official said on Wednesday, a day before EU leaders meet to discuss a possible extension.

Headline: Labour will press its Brexit plan, open to compromise - spokesman
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party will continue seeking talks on its alternative Brexit plan and believes a proposed three-month delay to the country's EU exit would be long enough to agree a new deal, a party spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Asked if long Brexit delay would make May resign, spokesman says way forward is clear
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has sent a clear signal about what she believes is the correct way ahead on Brexit, her political spokesman said when asked if she could resign if the country's EU exit is delayed for longer than she wishes.

Headline: Berlin welcomes PM's clear request for Brexit extension
Description: The German government welcomes British Prime Minister Theresa May's clear request for a three-month extension of the Brexit deadline beyond March 29, a spokesman said in Berlin on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit delay doesn't rule out no-deal EU exit - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday that delaying Brexit by extending negotiations did not rule out the possibility that Britain could leave the European Union without a deal.

Headline: May seeks delay to Brexit to June 30  - letter
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday asked the European Union to delay Brexit until June 30.

Headline: EU's Juncker warned PM May against Brexit extension beyond European elections
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker warned British Prime Minister Theresa May against requesting a Brexit delay beyond European Parliament elections due on May 24-26, unless the United Kingdom takes part, an EU spokeswoman said.

Headline: May: I am opposed to long Brexit extension, it is time to move on
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she was opposed to a long extension to the country's negotiations on leaving the European Union, saying it was time to move the national debate on to other subjects.

Headline: EU Commission resists May's June 30 Brexit date - document
Description: The European Commission opposes extending British membership of the European Union to June 30 as British Prime Minister Theresa May proposed on Wednesday, according to an EU document seen by Reuters.

Headline: UK Labour leader Corbyn heads to Brussels on Thursday for Brexit meetings
Description: British Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Wednesday he would travel to Brussels to meet EU leaders and officials on Thursday, the day when Prime Minister Theresa May is seeking approval for her request for a delay to Brexit.

Headline: EU's Tusk received Brexit delay letter from PM May - official
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk received a formal letter from British Prime Minister Theresa May requesting a delay to Brexit, an EU official told Reuters.

Headline: Labour to request emergency debate in parliament on Brexit delay
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party Brexit spokesman Keir Starmer will request an emergency debate in parliament on the length and purpose of any extension to the Article 50 Brexit negotiation period, the party said on Twitter.

Headline: Decision on UK participation in EU elections due by mid-April - EU official
Description: A decision on whether Britain should participate in the European Parliament election needs to be taken by mid-April, an EU official said on Wednesday, as British Prime Minister Theresa May is expected to ask the EU for a short delay to Brexit.

Headline: The EU needs clarity from Britain regarding Brexit - Danish PM
Description: The European Union needs clarity from Britain regarding the country's departure from the union, Denmark's prime minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: Trillion pounds of assets leave London ahead of Brexit - EY
Description: Assets worth around a trillion pounds are moving from London to hubs in the European Union ahead of Brexit, with the parallel shift in jobs likely to top 7,000, consultants EY said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK Labour lawmaker requests emergency debate on Brexit
Description: An opposition Labour lawmaker requested on Wednesday an emergency debate in parliament on Brexit, seeking to challenge Prime Minister Theresa May's pursuit of a short delay to Britain's departure from the European Union, her office said.

Headline: Labour: We will support fresh Brexit debate if May does not make statement
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party said they would support all steps to force a debate in parliament on Brexit if Prime Minister Theresa May does not make a statement on the subject, a party spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Austria expects short Brexit extension, would support it
Description: Austria expects there to be a short postponement of the date on which Britain will leave the European Union and would support it if London asked for one, Chancellor Sebastian Kurz said on Wednesday.

Headline: May must tell EU about any Brexit delay plan Thursday at the latest - official
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May must inform the other 27 EU national leaders of any plans to delay Brexit on Thursday at the latest, a senior EU official said on Wednesday.

Headline: Long Brexit delay would need parliamentary approval, UK's Leadsom says
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May would have to put a long delay to Brexit to parliament if that is what the European Union offer in talks this week, the leader of House of Commons Andrea Leadsom said on Wednesday.

Headline: Leadsom says Brexit 'absolutely essential' before EU parliament election
Description: Britain will seek a short delay to its departure from the European Union, due on March 29, and wants to be out before European Parliament elections are due to be held in late May, parliamentary leader Andrea Leadsom said on Wednesday.

Headline: Former Conservative leader warns PM May that Brexit delay would cause problems
Description: A delay to Brexit creates problems and can only be justified if British Prime Minister Theresa May can change her withdrawal deal, former Conservative party leader Iain Duncan Smith said on Wednesday.

Headline: Czech PM: we are ready to support delay of Brexit
Description: The Czech Republic may support a delay to the date of Brexit at the upcoming European Council meeting, Prime Minister Andrej Babis said on Wednesday.

Headline: EU can not budge any more on Brexit, says Juncker before summit
Description: The European Union has done a lot to accommodate Britain over Brexit and can go no further, European Commission head Jean-Claude Juncker said on Wednesday, as he played down hopes of a breakthrough at this week's EU summit.

Headline: Long Brexit delay won't solve uncertainty, UK education minister says
Description: A long delay to Britain's departure date from the European Union would not provide certainty, Education Secretary Damian Hinds said on Wednesday.

Headline: May will not request long delay to Brexit - Downing Street source
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will not request a long delay to Brexit and there is a case for giving parliament a little more time to agree a way forward, a Downing Street source said on Wednesday.

Headline: 'Interventionist' speaker centre-stage in parliament's Brexit drama
Description: With a wordy speech invoking a 17th-century precedent, and a cold stare aimed at stunned ministers, the grandiose Speaker of Britain's parliament cast Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit strategy into chaos.

Headline: May's letter to EU on Brexit extension to be sent Wednesday - BBC
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday will send a letter to European Council President Donald Tusk seeking an extension of her country's departure from the European Union beyond a March 29 deadline, BBC News' political editor reported in a tweet late on Tuesday.

Headline: Trump adviser Bolton says British establishment failing on Brexit
Description: U.S. National Security Adviser John Bolton accused Britain's political establishment on Tuesday of failing to implement the result of the 2016 referendum to leave the European Union.

Headline: EU, UK market watchdogs clash over no-deal Brexit share trading
Description: The European Union's markets watchdog published guidance on Tuesday identifying which shares investors in the bloc could no longer trade in London if there is a hard Brexit next week.

Headline: May seeks Brexit delay after third vote on her deal is derailed
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will ask the European Union to delay Brexit by at least three months after her plan to hold a third vote on her fraught divorce deal was thrown into disarray by a surprise intervention from the speaker of parliament.

Headline: EU's Barnier warns costs of long Brexit delay must be worth it
Description: Any long Brexit delay would pile on economic and political costs for the European Union, the bloc's chief negotiator Michel Barnier said on Tuesday, stressing that these would need to be weighed up carefully against potential benefits.

Headline: France ready to veto any meaningless Brexit delay: Elysee official
Description: France is ready to veto any British request for a Brexit delay that either kicks the can down the road without offering a way out of its deadlock or imperils European Union institutions, an official in President Emmanuel Macron's office said on Tuesday.

Headline: Labour's Corbyn holds talks with MPs who support softer Brexit
Description: Jeremy Corbyn, leader of the Labour Party, held cross-party talks with four MPs who support a close economic relationship with the European Union and they pledged to work together to break the Brexit impasse, a Labour spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain must have plan to push through deal to get Brexit extension - Coveney
Description: Britain must present a detailed plan how to push the agreement on its withdrawal from the European Union through parliament to get the EU's approval for an extension of the March 29th membership deadline, Irish foreign minister Simon Coveney said.

Headline: DUP's Dodds says Brexit talks good but deal not close - BBC reporter
Description: Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party has had good discussions with the British government, a BBC journalist quoted the party's deputy leader as saying on Tuesday, as Prime Minister Theresa May seeks its support for her Brexit divorce agreement.

Headline: Factbox: What does the speaker of Britain's parliament do, and who is John Bercow?
Description: The speaker of Britain's House of Commons threw Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plans into further turmoil this week by ruling that she could not put her divorce deal to a new vote unless it was resubmitted in fundamentally different form.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP may not back UK PM's Brexit deal - HuffPost
Description: The Northern Irish party that is crucial to Prime Minister Theresa May's hopes of getting her twice-defeated Brexit deal through parliament is unlikely to support it in a third vote unless it is convinced her deal can pass, HuffPost reported.

Headline: UK lawmakers will debate ways to break Brexit impasse from Monday - PM's spokesman
Description: British lawmakers will from Monday be able to debate ways to break an impasse over Brexit in parliament, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday, repeating a promise made last week.

Headline: Labour's Corbyn calls on UK opposition parties to work on Brexit plan
Description: Jeremy Corbyn, leader of Britain's main opposition Labour Party, called on other opposition leaders on Tuesday to work towards finding a majority in parliament for "a close economic relationship" with the European Union after Brexit.

Headline: EU impatient with Brexit, but resigned to delay
Description: European Union governments are exasperated by British dithering over quitting the bloc but have little appetite for pushing it out on schedule next week without a divorce deal, senior figures said on Tuesday.

Headline: Protesters in yellow vests invade UK Attorney General's office
Description: Protesters wearing yellow vests invaded the office of Britain's Attorney General in central London on Tuesday.

Headline: In Brexit chaos, UK eurosceptics see dream ticket - new leader, new deal
Description: In a week when Brexit was plunged into deeper uncertainty, eurosceptics in Theresa May's Conservative Party are eyeing their dream scenario - a new prime minister and a new deal to leave the European Union.

Headline: Tusk assures Ireland of EU unity on Brexit
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said he told Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar in Dublin on Tuesday that the European Union was united on Brexit and preparing if need be for Britain leaving the EU without a deal.

Headline: May seeking Brexit delay to June 30 with option of two-year extension - BBC
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will write to the European Union on Tuesday to ask for a Brexit extension until the end of June and with a possible two-year delay, the BBC's political editor said.

Headline: Britain could ask for longer Brexit delay, still hope to leave EU earlier - source
Description: Britain could theoretically ask for a longer extension to its Brexit negotiations and try to leave the European Union before the new end date is reached, a UK government source said on Monday.

Headline: May to write to EU's Tusk on Brexit extension Tuesday or Wednesday - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will write to European Council President Donald Tusk to request a delay to Brexit either on Tuesday or Wednesday, her spokesman said.

Headline: EU expects swift info from Britain on next steps in Brexit
Description: The European Union expects swift information from Britain on how it wishes to proceed in its exit form the EU, a spokesman for the EU executive said on Tuesday, noting EU leaders meet on Thursday to discuss Britain's withdrawal.

Headline: Germany's Merkel ready to fight to last minute for orderly Brexit
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Tuesday she would fight for an orderly Brexit right up until Britain's planned departure from the European Union on March 29.

Headline: How does the Brexit maelstrom end: Deal, no deal or no Brexit?
Description: The United Kingdom's exit from the European Union is uncertain nearly three years after the 2016 Brexit vote.

Headline: May's Brexit deal in chaos as Speaker sparks 'constitutional crisis'
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plans were thrown into further turmoil on Monday when the speaker of parliament ruled that she could not put her divorce deal to a new vote unless it was re-submitted in fundamentally different form.

Headline: Stop testing our patience, 'exhausted' German minister tells Brexit Britain
Description: Germany's Europe Minister urged London to come up "at last" with concrete proposals on how it wants to proceed with leaving the European Union after a ruling by the speaker of Britain's Parliament upturned the government's Brexit strategy.

Headline: French EU minister says London must break Brexit impasse
Description: Britain must come up with a reason for any Brexit delay and a no-deal divorce may well happen, French EU affairs minister Nathalie Loiseau said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU leaders unlikely to grant Brexit delay this week - ITV political editor
Description: European Union leaders are unlikely this week to grant an extension to Britain's departure date from the bloc, ITV political editor Robert Peston said on Tuesday.

Headline: Sweden wants to be constructive on Brexit, awaits news from London
Description: The European Union needs to hear from Britain on what it wants on Brexit before being able to decide its next steps, Swedish European Affairs Minister Hans Dahlgren said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK faces no-deal or no Brexit if it rejects May's deal - Barclay
Description: Britain's Brexit Secretary Steve Barclay warned lawmakers on Tuesday they risked either destroying Brexit or leaving the European Union without a deal if they did not back Prime Minister Theresa May's twice-defeated deal.

Headline: EU needs clarity from London on Brexit - Romanian minister
Description: The European Union needs clarity from London on Brexit, a Romanian minister said in Brussels on Tuesday before chairing talks among his European peers, a day after British Prime Minister Theresa May's divorce plan was undermined further.

Headline: Brexit hits ability of UK fintech to lure top talent - report
Description: Leaving the European Union is making it harder for fintech firms in Britain to recruit top talent, a report said on Tuesday, threatening to slam the brakes on a 7 billion pound growth sector just as EU states step up competition.

Headline: Pro-Brexit Conservatives threaten strike if May delays EU exit by a year - the Sun
Description: Eurosceptic Conservative MPs have threatened to go on strike if Prime Minister Theresa May delays Brexit by a year, the Sun newspaper reported on Monday.

Headline: Conservatives demand May's departure date for passing Brexit deal - FT
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has been told by senior Conservative party colleagues that she will have to set a timetable for her departure date from Downing Street in return for passing her Brexit deal, the Financial Times reported on Monday.

Headline: UK government notes parliament speaker's statement on Brexit vote - May's office
Description: The British government is considering a statement by parliament's speaker on Monday that Prime Minister Theresa May could not put her Brexit deal to a new vote unless it was fundamentally changed, May's office said on Monday.

Headline: UK reaches post-Brexit trade agreement with Iceland and Norway
Description: Britain on Monday reached an a deal with Iceland and Norway to allow trade to continue unchanged if it leaves the European Union without a deal, trade secretary Liam Fox said.

Headline: EU leaders could avoid final call on Brexit delay this week - diplomats
Description: European Union leaders could hold off making any final decision on any Brexit delay when they meet in Brussels later this week, senior diplomats in the bloc said, depending on what exactly British Prime Minister Theresa May asks them for.

Headline: Still a chance Brexit deal can be approved by parliament this week - Kwarteng
Description: British junior Brexit minister Kwasi Kwarteng said on Monday he believed there was still a chance parliament would approve Prime Minister Theresa May's European Union exit deal this week.

Headline: Brexit campaigner Matthew Elliott says May's deal will pass by March 29
Description: MPs are likely to pass Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit divorce deal by March 29, Matthew Elliott, the head of the 2016 campaign for leaving the European Union, said on Monday.

Headline: UK will seek Brexit delay ahead of March EU summit - Kwarteng
Description: Britain will request a delay to Brexit ahead of this week's European Council summit and expects a decision from the European Union to be reached at that meeting, junior Brexit minister Kwasi Kwarteng said on Monday.

Headline: UK parliament speaker deals new blow to May's Brexit plan
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May suffered a fresh Brexit setback on Monday when the speaker of parliament said any proposal she puts to lawmakers must be substantially different to the ones previously rejected by them.

Headline: UK parliament speaker says Brexit deal must be fundamentally different for third vote
Description: The British government is likely to need to win changes to its Brexit deal with the European Union in order to be allowed to put it to a further vote in parliament, the House of Commons Speaker John Bercow said on Monday.

Headline: UK parliament speaker did not forewarn government on statement - May's spokesman
Description: Britain's parliamentary speaker did not forewarn the government about his statement, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Monday after it was announced that May could not bring the same Brexit deal back for another vote.

Headline: Tea, prayers and Brexit - church to promote unity at cafe-style meetings
Description: British churchgoers will be encouraged to discuss Brexit over tea and prayers as the Church of England appeals for unity in the face of uncertainty and division over Britain's decision to leave the European Union.

Headline: Timeline: The United Kingdom's tortuous journey in and out of the EU
Description: The United Kingdom voted in 2016 to leave the European Union but it is still uncertain when or if that will happen.

Headline: No deal between DUP and UK government on PM May's Brexit accord this week - ITV's Peston
Description: There will be no deal agreed this week between the Democratic Unionist Party and the British government over whether it will support Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal, ITV's political editor said on Monday.

Headline: UK's parliamentary speaker to make a statement at 1530 GMT - office
Description: The speaker of Britain's House of Commons, John Bercow, will make a statement to parliament at 1530 GMT, his office said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit crisis tipped for British asparagus as EU seasonal workers stay away
Description: For almost 100 years, Chris Chinn's family has farmed asparagus in the rolling hills of the Wye Valley in western England.

Headline: EU fears Brexit paralysis, says UK foreign minister Hunt
Description: European Union foreign ministers fear a Brexit paralysis and they want the issue resolved, British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said after a meeting with his EU counterparts on Monday.

Headline: May could ditch Brexit negotiator Robbins to get her deal ratified - Evening Standard
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May could sacrifice her chief Brexit negotiator Olly Robbins in a last ditch attempt to get her divorce deal approved, the London Evening Standard newspaper reported on Monday, citing unidentified lawmakers.

Headline: DUP leader has no plans right now to travel for Brexit talks
Description: Democratic Unionist Party leader Arlene Foster has no plans at this stage to travel to London where her Northern Irish party are continuing Brexit talks with British Prime Minister Theresa May, a DUP spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: UK parliament to discuss urgent question on Brexit delay process
Description: A minister from the British government will be called to parliament later on Monday to answer an urgent question on the procedure for extending the negotiating period covering the country's exit from the European Union.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP unlikely to reach breakthrough on Brexit on Monday - UTV
Description: The Northern Irish Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) is unlikely on Monday to reach a breakthrough with Prime Minister Theresa May's government on her Brexit deal, UTV's political editor said.

Headline: May's spokesman: Talks with DUP on Brexit deal are ongoing

Headline: Brexiteer Rees-Mogg hints he could back May's Brexit deal

Headline: More work to be done to secure parliament's backing on Brexit - UK's Hunt
Description: British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said on Monday the government still had work to do to secure parliament's backing in a vote on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal, and that it would be redoubling its efforts to get there.

Headline: UK government hopes to go ahead with Brexit vote on Tuesday if numbers there - Hunt
Description: Britain's government will only hold another meaningful vote on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal on Tuesday if it is certain that the divided House of Commons would back it at a third attempt, the foreign minister said.

Headline: Factbox: What is Britain's next move on Brexit?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is expected this week to try to persuade parliament to approve her Brexit deal at the third time of asking, before heading to Brussels to request a short delay to the withdrawal process.

Headline: Not too late to get 'real change' to Brexit deal - Britain's Johnson
Description: Former British Foreign Minister Boris Johnson said on Sunday it was not too late for the government to get "real change" to  Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal and cautioned against holding another parliamentary vote on the agreement this week.

Headline: Worth giving time to reach Brexit deal - German foreign minister

Headline: Brexit spurs biggest cut in UK business investment in 10 years - BCC

Headline: Hammond says not there yet on Brexit vote support

Headline: Labour likely to back public vote on PM's deal, says Corbyn

Headline: Brexit, yellow vests take fizz out of champagne sales

Headline: Latvian foreign minister says he would back Brexit extension

Headline: Labour's Corbyn invites UK lawmakers to help break Brexit impasse

Headline: Labour will force confidence motion if May's deal fails - Corbyn

Headline: UK government will only hold Brexit vote if it believes it can win - Fox

Headline: EU war-gaming for the collapse of May's government - Observer

Headline: The DUP's price for supporting May's Brexit deal: seat at trade talks - Sunday Telegraph

Headline: UK must take part in EU elections if Brexit delayed - Austrian negotiator

Headline: Merkel ally floats idea of broader talks with UK if Brexit delayed

Headline: May's Brexit deal lives - Northern Irish kingmakers report 'good' talks with government

Headline: How does the Brexit maelstrom end: Deal, no Brexit or crash?

Headline: DUP's Dodds to return to London for talks on Monday

Headline: What is Britain's next move on Brexit?

Headline: EU's Barnier says current Brexit deal is only one available

Headline: UK cuts growth forecast for 2019 - Hammond

Headline: Hammond says his Brexit fiscal war chest has grown

Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Wednesday he could free billions of pounds for extra public spending or tax cuts, as long as parliament resolves its Brexit impasse.

Headline: Ministers who abstained on no deal Brexit vote will not be sacked  - Guardian reporter

Headline: Give us Brexit options or parliament will take over Brexit - Labour MP

Headline: We will keep voting down PM May's deal, says senior UK eurosceptic
Description: Senior eurosceptic MP Steve Baker said on Wednesday he would keep voting against Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal if it was put before parliament again.

Headline: PM May's statement after lawmakers reject no-deal Brexit
Description: Below is a text of the statement Prime Minister Theresa May delivered to the House of Commons after MPs voted to reject leaving the European Union without a deal in any scenario.

Headline: UK government would expect rebel ministers to resign, no comment on abstainers - spokesman
Description: A spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said ministers who voted against the government's instructions on Wednesday would be expected to resign, but did not say that those who abstained would also be expected to resign.

Headline: Brexit motion to be put to UK parliament on Thursday
Description: Following is the motion to be put to MPs in the House of Commons on Thursday by the government of Prime Minister Theresa May:

Headline: UK government will propose delay until June 30 if deal approved

Headline: Voting against no-deal Brexit is not enough, UK has to agree to a deal - EU

Headline: May - Britain could face long Brexit delay if no consensus found

Headline: MPs back proposal to take 'no deal' Brexit off the table

Headline: British parliament votes for ruling out no-deal Brexit in any scenario

Headline: UK would cut tariffs, have no checks on Irish border in no-deal Brexit

Headline: EU to apply normal tariffs on trade with UK in case of no-deal Brexit

Headline: DUP says May's Brexit deal is dead

Headline: UK lawmaker Spelman says no longer wants vote on her 'no deal' Brexit proposal

Headline: Italy would accept extension to article 50 on Brexit - junior minister

Headline: UK parliament will have to look at other options if May pursues her Brexit deal - Labour
Description: If Prime Minister Theresa May presses on with her Brexit deal after lawmakers vote to delay Britain's exit, parliament will have to look at other options, the opposition Labour Party's Brexit spokesman Keir Starmer said on Wednesday.

Headline: British minister Gove hints at indicative Brexit votes in parliament

Headline: UK Conservative lawmaker no longer backing her own no-deal amendment
Description: A British lawmaker who had proposed a vote to rule out a no-deal Brexit in any scenario is no longer backing the amendment, the BBC reported on Wednesday.

Headline: German Economy Minister - Disorderly Brexit must be avoided

Headline: UK lawmakers to vote on two proposed changes to government's 'no deal' Brexit motion
Description: British lawmakers will have the opportunity to vote on two proposed changes to Prime Minister Theresa May's next steps on Brexit on Wednesday, Speaker of the House of Commons John Bercow said.

Headline: Factbox - EU pros and cons of delaying Brexit beyond March 29

Headline: Factbox - What will be decided in parliament's latest Brexit votes?

Headline: Gove - leaving EU without a deal would be constitutionally challenging

Headline: Britain's government lawyer will not be changing opinion on Brexit assurances
Description: Britain's top government lawyer, Attorney General Geoffrey Cox, will not be changing the legal opinion he gave on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit assurances, his office said after speculation that he could give an additional opinion.

Headline: Objective is to avoid hard Brexit - Austria's Kurz
Description: EU heads of government would unanimously support any decision to avoid a hard Brexit, Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz said on Wednesday, suggesting a short delay to Britain leaving the European Union on March 29 may be necessary.

Headline: Goldman Sachs' best Brexit guess - May's deal passed eventually
Description: Goldman Sachs said it sees a 55 percent probability of Prime Minister Theresa May getting a Brexit divorce deal ratified even though parliament overwhelmingly rejected the deal for a second time.

Headline: BBC reporter says attorney general has more advice that may help PM May
Description: The BBC's assistant political editor said on Wednesday that he was hearing Attorney General Geoffrey Cox had further legal advice which might help Prime Minister Theresa May win over lawmakers to her Brexit deal.

Headline: EU's Barnier questions point of extending Brexit
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier questioned whether there was any point in delaying Britain's departure from the EU beyond March 29, saying on Wednesday that the British government would need to justify any request.

Headline: Czech PM says new Brexit referendum option cannot be ruled out

Headline: Boris Johnson says Britain will leave the EU on March 29 after last-minute deal

Headline: Volkswagen says no deal Brexit may force price hikes in Britain

Headline: Britain in Brexit chaos - parliament crushes May's EU deal again

Headline: JPMorgan still sees UK May's deal as the most likely Brexit option

Headline: London rejecting 'no-deal' Brexit could be a turning point - German minister
Description: Germany's Economy Minister Peter Altmaier expressed the hope that British legislators would vote decisively against a no-deal Brexit in a session of the London parliament later on Wednesday.

Headline: UK Parliament voted down its 'last chance' on Brexit deal - EU's Moscovici

Headline: UK Brexit minister says no Brexit is bigger risk than no deal
Description: Britain's Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said on Wednesday a failure to leave the European Union posed a bigger risk to Britain than leaving the bloc without a deal.

Headline: UK government has no plans for Irish border controls in case of no-deal Brexit - BBC
Description: The UK government does not intend to collect customs duties or have any other controls at the Irish border in the event of a no-deal Brexit, the BBC reported https://bbc.in/2TBk4gX on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain, EU should define future ties after Brexit deal rejection - Germany
Description: Britain is moving closer to crashing out of the European Union without a deal, German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas said on Tuesday, adding that both sides should now focus on defining their future relationship after Brexit.

Headline: EU says no more Brexit talks with UK, risk of no-deal increased

Headline: MPs table 'managed no-deal' plans before Wednesday vote

Headline: Dutch PM Rutte - Brexit delay request would need 'convincing justification'

Headline: UK must maintain threat of no-deal Brexit - DUP's Dodds

Headline: PM May's statement after second defeat of her EU deal

Headline: May has given up any pretence of leading Britain with free vote - Labour

Headline: May focused on winning Brexit vote in parliament - spokesman

Headline: Unilateral declaration by Britain on Brexit withdrawal deal
Description: Britain issued on Monday the following unilateral declaration to accompany the package of documents on the country's withdrawal from the European Union:

Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is likely to change the status of Tuesday's parliamentary vote on her Brexit deal, The Sun's political editor, Tom Newton Dunn, said.

Headline: Brexit talks deadlocked, no plans for PM trip to Brussels - UK source
Description: Talks with the European Union to secure changes to a Brexit deal are now deadlocked and British Prime Minister Theresa May has no plans to go to Brussels on Monday, a government source said.

Headline: Labour should support staying in EU if there is second Brexit referendum - Starmer

Headline: UK faces 'total uncertainty' if Brexit deal rejected - health minister

Headline: Factbox - Deal, no deal or delay: How will UK parliament decide on Brexit?

Headline: Labour Party could agree Brexit deal in weeks - finance chief McDonnell

Headline: EU's Tajani says Brexit date can be delayed few weeks at most - report

Description: Proposals from the European Union's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier that would give Britain the unilateral right to leave the customs union are a "non-starter", a Sky News reporter cited sources in the Democratic Unionist party as saying on Friday.

Headline: UK 'not impressed by Barnier's tweets' on Irish backstop - government source

Headline: No majority in British parliament for second Brexit referendum - Reuters analysis
Description: There is no majority in Britain's parliament in favour of holding a second Brexit referendum, according to a Reuters analysis of public comments made by lawmakers.

Headline: Irish PM says time for UK to compromise on Brexit

Headline: DUP says Brexit deal only possible with fresh approach from EU

Headline: 'One more push' needed to resolve Brexit deal concerns - May

Headline: UK must not win trade deals by going soft on economic crime after Brexit - MPs

Headline: History will judge UK, EU badly if they get Brexit wrong - Hunt

Headline: Labour will not support new Brexit referendum in all circumstances - The Independent

Description: Germany and its customs authority are prepared for all Brexit scenarios, including Britain crashing out of the European Union without a divorce deal setting out future relations, Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain matches EU offer to maintain flights in no-deal Brexit scenario
Description: Britain said on Thursday that flights to and from the European Union would continue after Brexit, even if it leaves without a deal, as it agreed to match an offer by the European Union to protect flying rights.

Headline: EU awaits reworked UK Brexit proposals, deal remains elusive
Description: The European Union told Britain to rework its Irish backstop proposal by Friday but feared it would struggle to secure a deal that satisfied pro-Brexit lawmakers before a key vote in the UK parliament on Wednesday.

Headline: UK top lawyer Cox: We are discussing text with EU on Brexit deal changes
Description: Britain is discussing text with the European Union as part of its efforts to win concessions from the bloc on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal, top government lawyer Geoffrey Cox said on Thursday.

Headline: UK parliament will vote on May's Brexit deal on March 12 - Commons leader
Description: British lawmakers will vote on whether to approve Prime Minister Theresa May's revised Brexit deal on March 12, the leader of the House of Commons Andrea Leadsom said on Thursday.

Headline: Nothing suggests Brexit impasse will change in next 48 hours - UK source
Description: Nothing at the moment suggests anything will change in Britain's Brexit talks with the European Union over the next 48 hours, a government source said on Thursday, adding that the EU was simply not moving.

Headline: Britain, EU must keep working together for orderly Brexit - May's spokesman
Description: Britain and the European Union must keep working together to secure the orderly Brexit the bloc says it wants, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday.

Headline: UK hopeful of Brexit talks breakthrough this weekend - Hunt
Description: Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said he was hopeful that a breakthrough could be made in Brexit talks with the European Union this weekend, a day after officials said talks to amend Prime Minister Theresa May's divorce deal made no headway.

Headline: DUP deputy leader says 'definitely a way through' Brexit talks
Description: The deputy leader of the Northern Irish party that props up the British government believes there is "definitely" a way to secure agreement on Britain's withdrawal from the European Union so long as Irish and EU officials are willing to compromise.

Headline: UK to set up Brexit advisory groups to find alternative arrangements for Irish border
Description: Britain said on Wednesday it was pushing forward with plans to find alternative arrangements to eliminate the need for an Irish "backstop" in Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal, part of a bid to break the impasse weeks before Britain exits the EU.

Headline: MPs demand clarity on tariffs in case of no-deal Brexit
Description: Britain's government should urgently unveil its plans for tariffs in the case of a no-deal Brexit, MPs said on Wednesday after media reports that levies could be slashed for  up to 90 percent of imports.

Headline: EU says 'difficult' Brexit talks unlikely to yield swift deal
Description: Talks with Britain on amending its divorce deal with the European Union have made no headway and no swift solution is in sight, EU officials said on Wednesday, a week before British lawmakers must vote on the plan to avoid a chaotic Brexit.

Headline: UK government loses House of Lords vote calling for EU customs union
Description: The House of Lords passed an amendment on Wednesday calling for the government to negotiate a customs union with the European Union, giving Prime Minister Theresa May a potential new headache in her Brexit plans.

Headline: Eurostar rail chaos as French customs staff stage no-deal Brexit checks
Description: Train services between Paris and London suffered long delays on Wednesday as French customs staff made extra security checks to highlight the pressure Britain's departure from the European Union could place on their workforce.

Headline: UK faces tough choice over tariffs in event of no deal Brexit - minister
Description: Britain will face a very difficult choice on whether to impose tariffs on imported goods if it leaves the European Union without a deal, business minister Greg Clark said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK will set out 'no deal' tariffs if we get to that scenario - Fox
Description: British trade minister Liam Fox said on Wednesday the government would set out the tariffs it plans to levy if Britain leaves the European Union without a deal at the point that becomes the likely outcome.

Headline: Liam Fox - 'number of ways' to mitigate tariff impact on vulnerable sectors
Description: British trade minister Liam Fox said on Wednesday there were a number of ways in which the government could try to mitigate the impact of low tariffs post-Brexit on vulnerable sectors.

Headline: UK lawmakers demand tariff details before key Brexit vote
Description: British lawmakers have demanded that the government make public its plans for import tariffs in the event of a no-deal Brexit before it asks them to vote next week on Prime Minister Theresa May's preferred Brexit plans.

Headline: Labour's Corbyn discussed Brexit with business organisations - spokesman
Description: Britain's opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn met with five big business organisations on Tuesday to discuss Brexit and his party's alternative plan for leaving the European Union, his spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Latest Brexit talks were 'difficult', but negotiations ongoing - PM May's spokesman
Description: The latest round of Brexit talks between Britain and the European Union were difficult, with a robust exchange of views, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Wednesday, adding that both sides planned to keep talking.

Headline: EU offered Britain more ideas on the Brexit backstop in talks on Tuesday - Commission
Description: The European Union offered Britain more ideas on Brexit backstop assurances in talks on Tuesday but the sides "have not yet been able to identify any solution", a spokesman for the bloc's executive said.

Headline: EU executive says Brexit talks 'difficult', no solution found for now
Description: The latest talks between EU and UK Brexit negotiators have been "difficult" and no agreement has been found yet, a spokesman for the bloc's executive said on Wednesday.

Headline: May courts support for Brexit deal with workers' rights offer
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will on Wednesday offer parliament a greater say over changes to workers' rights laws after Brexit, seeking to woo opposition lawmakers as she prepares to put her EU exit plan to the test next week.

Headline: 'Robust, strong views' were exchanged in Brexit talks, says lawyer Cox
Description: Britain's attorney general said the two teams locked in talks in Brussels exchanged "robust, strong views" as they sought to find a breakthrough in Brexit talks.

Headline: Carmaker McLaren: Short Brexit delay would be frustrating
Description: A delay of a month or two to Britain's exit from the European Union would be a "frustration" and only worth it if it helped bring about a more orderly Brexit, the chief executive of carmaker McLaren Automotive told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headline: U.S.-UK relationship will prosper after Brexit - U.S. ambassador
Description: Britain's relationship with the United States is more important than ever and will prosper as Britain leaves the European Union, Washington's ambassador to London Woody Johnson said on Wednesday.

Headline: Scottish parliament, Welsh assembly join forces to oppose Brexit
Description: Scotland's parliament and the Welsh national assembly voted on Tuesday to oppose the Brexit deal agreed by the UK government, the first time they have done so simultaneously in a sign of the United Kingdom's internal fracture over Brexit.

Headline: Reuters poll: Brexit to be put on ice, but only for a few months - economists
Description: Britain's scheduled departure from the European Union on March 29 will be delayed by a few months, a Reuters poll found, and a majority of economists say the two sides will eventually agree a free-trade deal.

Headline: May's top lawyer struggles for Brexit deal in Brussels
Description: Talks between British Prime Minister Theresa May's top government lawyer and European Union negotiators to win concessions from the bloc on Brexit ended with no agreement in Brussels on Tuesday.

Headline: Upbeat U.S. data lift dollar to two-week high, euro falls
Description: The dollar rose to a two-week peak against a basket of currencies on Tuesday as unexpectedly strong data on U.S. services industries and new home sales allayed some worries about the state of the world's largest economy.

Headline: Brexit hero or zero? British PM May's top lawyer takes on Brussels
Description: In his deep baritone, Geoffrey Cox, British Prime Minister Theresa May's top lawyer, relishes winning the argument.

Headline: Irish foreign minister says EU negotiations with Britain 'have been difficult'
Description: The Irish government is "cautious" about the prospects for the European Union and Britain reaching a deal that can be approved by the British parliament, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit secretary Barclay asks EU for help with citizens' rights - letter
Description: Brexit secretary Stephen Barclay has asked the European Union for its "formal views" on a proposal to preserve citizens' rights regardless of whether a Brexit deal is agreed, according a letter published by the government on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain's top lawyer to have 'detailed discussions' in Brussels - May's spokesman
Description: British Attorney General Geoffrey Cox is expected to have "detailed discussions" with European Union negotiators in Brussels on Tuesday, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said, adding that there was still work to do on Brexit.

Headline: UK foreign minister Hunt says 'reasonably positive' signs from EU over Brexit deal changes
Description: Foreign minister Jeremy Hunt said on Tuesday the European Union was giving "reasonably positive" signals about giving Britain changes to Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal which could help it get parliamentary backing.

Headline: Irish PM says willing to help UK get Brexit deal approved
Description: Ireland is willing to offer further assurances to the United Kingdom to help it secure parliamentary approval for Brexit withdrawal agreement, but it will not compromise on its position on the Irish border, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Monday.

Headline: Theresa May's lawyer seeks legal fix to the Brexit riddle
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's top lawyer will try to clinch a Brexit compromise with the European Union this week in a last-ditch bid to win over rebellious British lawmakers before crunch votes that could delay the divorce.

Headline: British attorney general rejects report he has abandoned backstop time-limit
Description: Britain's Attorney General Geoffrey Cox said on Monday much of a newspaper report that said he had abandoned attempts to secure a time-limit or unilateral exit mechanism for Britain from the Irish "backstop" was inaccurate.

Headline: Brexit bribe? PM May unveils £1.6 billion fund for Brexit-backing towns
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will on Monday set out plans for a 1.6 billion pound fund to help to boost economic growth in Brexit-supporting communities with ministers denying it was a bribe to win support for her EU exit deal.

Headline: Britain's Barclay, Cox to hold Brexit talks in Brussels on Tuesday - spokesman
Description: Britain's Brexit Secretary Stephen Barclay and Attorney General Geoffrey Cox will travel to Brussels for talks with the European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier on Tuesday afternoon, a spokesman for the bloc said.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP - We want treaty-level change to May's Brexit deal
Description: The Northern Irish party which props up British Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal wants "treaty-level change" before it will support her divorce deal, the BBC said.

Headline: Britain is seeking legally binding changes to Irish backstop - minister
Description: Britain's top government lawyer is seeking legally binding changes to the Irish border backstop and the Brexit negotiations are at a critical stage, Communities Secretary James Brokenshire said on Monday.

Headline: Cox scraps bid for Irish backstop time-limit, exit clause - Telegraph
Description: U.K. Attorney General Geoffrey Cox has abandoned attempts to secure a hard time-limit or unilateral exit mechanism for the Irish backstop, the Telegraph reported on Sunday.

Headline: Brexit supporters give UK PM May three tests for EU deal
Description: A group of Brexit-supporting lawmakers who rejected British Prime Minister Theresa May's European Union exit deal in January have set out the changes they want to see to her agreement in return for their support.

Headline: EU offering long Brexit delay 'not possible' - Fox
Description: It is not possible that the European Union will offer Britain a long delay to Brexit because of upcoming European elections, British trade minister Liam Fox said on Sunday.

Headline: Brexit casts shadow over stands at Geneva car show
Description: The usual mix of sports cars, offroaders and family saloons will be on display at the Geneva motor show this week, but with one big difference from previous years - they may be about to become harder and costlier to make, and more expensive to buy.

Headline: Irish PM sees Brexit extension to June as 'very likely' - Sunday Independent
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar has told Cabinet colleagues that a delay of Britain's exit date from the European Union from March 29 to June is "very likely", Ireland's Sunday Independent quoted an unnamed minister as saying.

Headline: Labour forced into backing second Brexit vote by May's actions - finance spokesman
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party does not want a second Brexit referendum but has been forced into supporting one by Prime Minister Theresa May running down the clock on negotiations, Labour's finance spokesman John McDonnell said on Sunday.

Headline: As many as 70 Labour lawmakers oppose second Brexit referendum - lawmaker
Description: As many as 70 of Britain's opposition Labour lawmakers oppose holding a second Brexit referendum, Labour lawmaker Caroline Flint said on Sunday.

Headline: UK likely to be forced into Brexit delay if PM May's deal rejected - junior minister
Description: Britain is likely to be forced into delaying its March 29 exit from the European Union if parliament rejects Prime Minister Theresa May's deal later this month, junior justice minister Rory Stewart told Sky News on Sunday.

Headline: U.S. ambassador says don't let farming 'smears' stop post-Brexit trade deal
Description: Britain should not follow the European Union's "Museum of Agriculture" and let false concerns over U.S. farming practices get in the way of a post-Brexit trade deal, the U.S. ambassador to London said on Saturday.

Headline: EU ready to give Britain more guarantees 'backstop' is temporary - Barnier
Description: The European Union is ready to give Britain more guarantees that the Irish "backstop" is only intended to be temporary, the bloc's chief Brexit negotiator said on Friday.

Headline: Slovenian president says 'a lot' of EU states would back Brexit extension
Description: Slovenia's president said his country and many other European Union states would be open to extending the date Britain is due to leave the bloc, a possibility British Prime Minister Theresa May has raised amid deadlock in parliament.

Headline: UK to follow EU food and agriculture rules for 9 months in 'no deal' Brexit - Telegraph
Description: Britain will unilaterally agree to follow all European Union food safety and animal health regulations for at least nine months in the event of a 'no deal' Brexit, to protect British farming, the Telegraph website reported on Friday.

Headline: Irish PM says hard Brexit on March 29 unlikely
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Friday that it was unlikely Britain would crash out of the European Union without a deal on March 29.

Headline: Spain to guarantee British residents' rights in event of no-deal Brexit
Description: Spain said on Friday it would allow its British residents to stay on if Britain leaves the European Union without a deal, giving them until the end of 2020 to apply for permanent residency and making it automatic for many.

Headline: Brexit extension could draw legal challenge - German parliament report
Description: Britain could face an EU legal challenge if it seeks to delay Brexit because of the impact on EU legislative elections, a legal opinion produced for Germany's Bundestag said, potentially making it difficult for Berlin to back anything but a short extension.

Headline: Customer deposits need protection in no-deal Brexit - EU watchdog
Description: The EU bank watchdog has urged member states to protect customer deposits in branches of British banks in the European Union if Britain leaves the bloc this month with no deal.

Headline: EU steps in to smooth Irish share trading in case of no-deal Brexit
Description: If Britain leaves the European Union without a deal, Irish customers will be temporarily allowed to continue settling stock and bond trades in London to avoid market disruption.

Headline: UK factories brace for Brexit, but consumers less worried
Description: British factories are cutting jobs and bracing for Brexit by stockpiling goods at a record pace, but consumers seem less worried, suggesting their spending might help to shore up the economy, data showed on Friday.

Headline: Spain says Brexit contingency plan aims to guarantee British citizens' rights
Description: Spain's contingency measures in case of a hard Brexit aim to guarantee that no Spanish or British citizens find themselves deprived of their rights, Foreign Minister Josep Borrell said on Friday.

Headline: UK pays Eurotunnel 33 million pounds over 'secretive' no-deal Brexit ferry contracts
Description: Britain has paid out 33 million pounds to settle a claim with Eurotunnel which runs the Channel Tunnel between Britain and France after the firm took legal action over the process to award ferry contracts to cope with a no-deal Brexit.

Headline: Britain settled Eurotunnel claim to protect no-deal Brexit plans - spokeswoman
Description: Britain agreed to settle a claim with Eurotunnel over the government's preparations for a no-deal Brexit in order to ensure that vital goods would still be able to flow into the country, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said.

Headline: German juggernaut may face economic jam as tariffs and Brexit loom
Description: Germany faces the risk of steep U.S. tariffs on cars and a no-deal Brexit, a double whammy which could bring a golden decade of growth in Europe's powerhouse economy to an end.

Headline: Means of changing PM May's Brexit deal less important than substance, ex-minister Raab says
Description: Former Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab said the substance of Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal with the European Union needs to change, particularly on the issue of the Northern Irish backstop, though the means to achieve that is less important.

Headline: Good riddance? EU's 'Brexit fatigue' limits UK extension options
Description: Britain has just four weeks left as a member of the European Union. Or maybe not. Staying weeks, months, even years longer is the talk of London; but such ideas are getting a frosty hearing on the continent.

Headline: Robert Walters says Brexit uncertainty affecting client, candidate confidence
Description: Recruiter Robert Walters Plc said on Friday that uncertainty surrounding Brexit will keep hurting client and candidate confidence in Britain, and to mitigate the cautious market it has been growing its operations outside the UK.

Headline: Brexit riddle goes on: May's deal, delayed no-deal or referendum?
Description: The United Kingdom is due to leave the European Union in less than a month, yet there is still no ratified divorce deal so it faces three main options - swing behind Prime Minister Theresa May's deal, leave without a deal in late June or throw the question back to the people.

Headline: EU migration to UK lowest since 2009 as Brexit approaches
Description: Net migration to Britain from the European Union fell to its lowest since 2009 in the 12 months to September, the decline steepening as Brexit draws closer, official data showed on Thursday.

Headline: JPMorgan plans temporary Paris hub for 200 staff if no-deal Brexit
Description: JPMorgan has secured additional office space on the outskirts of Paris to house up to 200 staff who could be billeted to the French capital at short notice, under plans to cope with the fallout from a 'no deal' Brexit, sources told Reuters.

Headline: Exclusive: UK chemicals industry says Brexit could cost sector £500 million
Description: UK chemicals companies face being shut out of a common EU products registry after Brexit and would need to pay around half a billion pounds to set up a British counterpart, the head of the Chemicals Industry Association told Reuters.

Headline: May gains two weeks' Brexit reprieve from MPs
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May won a two week reprieve on Wednesday from British MPs, who postponed a threatened rebellion aimed at blocking a no-deal Brexit after she agreed to a possible delay to Britain's departure from the EU.

Headline: Brexit date can be extended but only for good reason - EU's Barnier
Description: The March 29 Brexit date can be extended but it must be for a good reason, the European Union's chief negotiator Michel Barnier said on Thursday.

Headline: J.P. Morgan's best guess on Brexit: 45 percent chance of exit with current deal
Description: J.P.Morgan kept its best guess for Brexit unchanged on Thursday with its central assumption a 45 percent probability of an exit on the terms of the current divorce deal.

Headline: British MP: We want binding treaty change to pass May's Brexit deal
Description: Brexit-supporting British members of parliament will look at the deal that Prime Minister Theresa May brings back from Brussels but to pass it she must have achieved legally binding treaty change, former minister Theresa Villiers said on Thursday.

Headline: Timeline: Britain's tortuous journey in and out of the EU
Description: Britain is due to leave the European Union at 2300 GMT on March 29, 2019.

Headline: Britain's Labour Party leader backs Brexit referendum
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party will back a new referendum on Brexit after parliament defeated its alternative plan for leaving the European Union, its eurosceptic leader Jeremy Corbyn said, softening his reservations about a second popular vote.

Headline: UK Brexit secretary: No consensus in parliament on second referendum
Description: British Brexit secretary Stephen Barclay said on Thursday there was no consensus in parliament on holding a second referendum on leaving the European Union, or on what the question would be in any such vote.

Headline: UK's Howden Joinery shares fall on margin pressure, costs
Description: Shares of Howden Joinery Group Plc fell nearly 8 percent on Thursday after the British kitchen supplier flagged higher costs and margin pressures, as it exits markets and spends to expand in the UK and Northern Ireland.

Headline: Aston Martin boss - Brexit delay would prolong uncertainty
Description: A delay to Brexit would be a "further annoyance" which would prolong uncertainty, the boss of luxury carmaker Aston Martin said after Prime Minister Theresa May promised to give lawmakers a vote on extending the date for Britain to leave the EU.

Headline: UK house prices remain sluggish as Brexit nears - Nationwide
Description: British house prices rose by 0.4 percent in annual terms in February, only a small pick-up after they stagnated in January as the approach of Brexit weighs on the economy, data from mortgage lender Nationwide showed on Thursday.

Headline: Goldman Sachs cuts chances of no-deal Brexit to 10 percent
Description: Goldman Sachs has cut its chances for a "no-deal" Brexit to 10 percent from 15 percent previously, joining other banks and asset managers trimming their probability of Britain crashing out of the European Union without a deal next month.

Headline: Labour to back proposal for public Brexit vote
Description: Labour Party will put forward or support an amendment in favour of a public vote to prevent a damaging Brexit, the party's Brexit spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK government accepts proposal on citizens' rights in Brexit debate
Description: Britain will write to the European Union to try to secure guarantees on citizens' rights in the event of a no-deal Brexit, Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said on Wednesday, part of government efforts to take the sting out of a series of votes.

Headline: Brexit 'betrayal' would explode British politics, Farage's party warns
Description: A new party backed by Nigel Farage, the insurgent who helped shove Britain towards the EU exit, has a message for the country's leaders: The foundations of the political system will explode if Brexit is betrayed.

Headline: Explainer - How Wednesday's parliamentary Brexit debate will work
Description: British lawmakers on Wednesday were debating Prime Minister Theresa May's progress towards securing a Brexit deal and will have the opportunity to challenge her approach and vote on alternatives.

Headline: UK government accepts lawmaker's call for additional Brexit rights guarantee
Description: The British government will support a call for more action to be taken to guarantee the rights of European Union citizens regardless of whether a Brexit deal is agreed, Cabinet Office minister David Lidington said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK government will recommit to May's Brexit votes pledge - report
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government will on Wednesday formalise its promise to offer a vote on delaying Brexit by supporting a change to the wording of a motion being debated in parliament, the Daily Mail's political editor said on Twitter.

Headline: UK working on post-Brexit carbon trading scheme - energy secretary
Description: Britain is working to establish a domestic carbon emissions trading system (ETS) post Brexit which it hopes will link to the existing EU scheme from January 2021, energy secretary Claire Perry told members of parliament's upper house on Wednesday.

Headline: Head of Conservative eurosceptics softens on May's Brexit plan
Description: The leader of a pro-Brexit faction in British Prime Minister Theresa May’s Conservative Party on Wednesday scaled back his opposition to her deal for leaving the European Union ahead of a vote on the agreement next month. Jacob Rees-Mogg said he would no longer insist that the so-called Northern Irish backstop be removed as a condition for his support and other legal ways might ensure it was not permanent.

Headline: Macron strikes firmer tone than Merkel on Brexit delay
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Wednesday the EU could only agree to extend the Brexit negotiations if Britain gave a clear reason for requesting a delay, striking a firmer tone than Germany's Chancellor Angela Merkel.

Headline: MPs to vote on up to five proposed changes to May's Brexit plan
Description: British members of parliament will have the opportunity to vote on up to five proposed changes to Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plans on Wednesday, Speaker of the House of Commons John Bercow said.

Headline: Germany's Merkel: If Britain needs more time for Brexit, we won't refuse
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Wednesday that if Britain needed more time to sort out its departure from the European Union, she would not refuse.

Headline: Norway wealth fund shrugs off Brexit, plans rise in UK investments
Description: Norway's $1 trillion (£753 billion) sovereign wealth fund, the world's biggest, said on Wednesday it planned to keep increasing its investments in Britain, and it shrugged off uncertainties about Brexit.

Headline: Risk of no-deal Brexit receding, some banks say
Description: The risk that Britain will crash out of the EU without an agreement on March 29 has receded in the past few weeks, some banks and asset managers say, citing expectations that the exit deadline will be extended to allow members of parliament to reach a deal.

Headline: Amundi sees 40 percent chance of 'prolonged extension' to Brexit
Description: Europe's biggest asset manager Amundi reckons there is a 40 percent chance of a "prolonged extension" to the scheduled Brexit date of March 29, upping its previous forecast of 30 percent

Headline: EU's Barnier says he is doing all he can to ensure Brexit deal
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Wednesday that he was trying his utmost to ensure there was a deal on Brexit, though he reiterated the Irish backstop could not be renegotiated.

Headline: Germany's Roth - UK must propose something new to justify Brexit delay
Description: Britain could delay its withdrawal from the European Union once, for a short time but must put something substantially new on the table to make the case for a postponement, Germany's European Affairs Minister Michael Roth said on Wednesday.

Headline: May's Brexit deal, no-deal or delay? PM offers MPs a choice
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May on Tuesday offered members of parliament the chance to vote in two weeks for a potentially disorderly no-deal Brexit or to delay Britain's exit from the European Union if her attempt to ratify a divorce agreement fails.

Headline: No point in Brexit delay without clear purpose - French fin min
Description: France’s finance minister said that if Britain seeks to delay its exit from the European Union without clearly stating why, he would not see the necessity of granting an extension to the negotiating period.

Headline: Explainer - How Wednesday's parliamentary Brexit debate will work
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will on Wednesday update parliament on her progress towards securing a Brexit deal, giving lawmakers the chance to challenge her approach and vote on alternatives.

Headline: What do people think of May's plan for vote on delaying Brexit?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has offered lawmakers the chance to vote in two weeks for a potentially disorderly no-deal Brexit or to delay Britain's exit from the European Union if her attempt to ratify a divorce agreement fails.

Headline: May must explain why she wants Brexit delay - French finance minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will have to outline exactly why she wishes to delay Britain's exit from the European Union if her parliament demands she do so, France's finance minister said on Tuesday.

Headline: Bank of England likely to help economy after no-deal Brexit - Carney
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Tuesday the BoE would probably give more support to the economy if it suffers the shock of a no-deal Brexit, but that the options available to the British central bank would be limited.

Headline: Hard Brexit could wipe at least 0.5 percent off German GDP - BDI
Description: If Britain quits the European Union without a deal, that could shave at least 0.5 percent off Germany's gross domestic product (GDP), the head of Germany's BDI industry association said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU could grant Britain short Brexit delay
Description: The European Union would be ready to approve a short Brexit delay should Britain need more time to ensure parliamentary ratification of their divorce agreement, three EU officials said on Tuesday.

Headline: Likely no vote on plan to give UK parliament control of Brexit process - MP
Description: One of the authors of a plan to give parliament control of the Brexit process, Conservative lawmaker Oliver Letwin, said the plan would not be voted upon on Wednesday provided ministers confirmed earlier government promises.

Headline: Factbox: Through the Brexit Looking Glass - What happens next?
Description: Britain's parliament last month demanded Prime Minister Theresa May renegotiate a Brexit divorce deal that the other members of the European Union say they will not reopen.

Headline: EU lawmaker: Britain must seek Brexit delay if deal not approved on March 12
Description: Britain will have to ask the European Union to delay Brexit if their divorce agreement is not ratified by the House of Commons on March 12, said an EU lawmaker who deals with Brexit.

Headline: Brexit may clip wings of UK game shooters
Description: It may be a lesser consequence of Brexit, but Britain's shooting parties may find themselves short of pheasants and partridges to kill next season if transport delays prevent chicks being imported from France, game exporters say.

Headline: Brexit vote next week? More meetings make it difficult to say - PM's spokesman
Description: British ministers and officials are holding more meetings with the European Union to find a way to make changes to the Brexit deal, so it is not clear whether a new vote will take place next week, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Rees-Mogg warns against 'grievous error' of scrapping Brexit
Description: Leading Eurosceptic Jacob Rees-Mogg said it would be a "grievous error" if Prime Minister Theresa May's offer to delay Brexit leads to Britain ultimately scrapping its departure from the European Union.

Headline: May says EU is working to resolve Northern Irish backstop issue
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday that European Union leaders have told her they are working on resolving the issue of the so-called Northern Irish backstop to pave the way for a Brexit deal.

Headline: DUP cannot back Brexit deal without 'legally watertight' way out of backstop - Dodds
Description: The Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May's minority government cannot support any Brexit deal that does not have a way out of the so-called Irish backstop, its deputy leader Nigel Dodds said on Tuesday.

Headline: May's Brexit deal should be put to 'confirmatory public vote' - Corbyn
Description: If Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal is approved by parliament it should be put to a "confirmatory" public vote, opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit: Luxembourg says UK could nominate MEPs to facilitate new referendum
Description: The European Union should back any decision by Britain to hold a second Brexit referendum and could ease the path by allowing it to nominate MEPs rather than participate in May's European Parliament elections, Luxembourg's foreign minister said.

Headline: May says Brexit extension will not remove chance of no-deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday any extension to the Brexit negotiating two-year period would not take the option of Britain leaving without a deal off the table, instead it would create a "much sharper cliff edge".

Headline: UK will only leave EU without a deal on March 29 if parliament consents - May
Description: Britain will only leave the European Union without a deal on March 29 with the explicit consent of parliament, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday.

Headline: May proposes votes on no-deal exit and Brexit delay if her deal rejected - Telegraph
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is proposing that parliament votes on whether to leave the European Union without a deal or delay Brexit if her exit deal fails to win parliamentary approval, a Daily Telegraph reporter said on Twitter.

Headline: Labour's McDonnell: Only way left on Brexit is to go back to people
Description: The only way forward on Brexit now is to hold a fresh public referendum, the opposition Labour Party's finance spokesman John McDonnell told reporters on Tuesday.

Headline: Senior German Social Democrat backs Labour call for 2nd Brexit referendum
Description: A senior member of Germany's Social Democrats (SPD) said on Tuesday that he backed a call by Britain's Labour Party to hold a second Brexit referendum, adding that such a vote could prevent Britain exiting the EU chaotically without a deal.

Headline: Boeing shifting spare parts in preparation for Brexit - executive
Description: Boeing Co has been shifting spare parts between its distribution centres in the United Kingdom and elsewhere in the world in preparation for Brexit, an executive said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK finance sector ready for any type of Brexit - minister
Description: Britain's financial sector will continue to function properly whatever form Brexit takes, a junior minister said on Tuesday, though the head of an industry body said it would back proposals to avert Britain leaving the EU without a withdrawal deal.

Headline: May's Brexit deal should face public vote if passed - Labour spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal should be put to a second referendum if it is passed by parliament, the Brexit spokesman for the opposition Labour Party Keir Starmer said on Tuesday.

Headline: Banks losing battle to be no-deal Brexit ready
Description: Major banks are still not ready for a 'no-deal' Brexit as they grapple with delays in licences for new European Union businesses, staffing problems and snags in redrafting contracts.

Headline: UK parliament could vote on Brexit deal as early as next week - Lidington
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May could bring a Brexit deal to a vote in parliament as early as next week, her de-facto deputy said on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit to harm UK's cherished health service, experts say
Description: A British exit from the EU without a deal would have "an immediate and drastic" impact on availability of medicines and vaccines as well as affecting health system funding and staffing, experts warned on Monday.

Headline: May considers delaying Brexit deadline: Bloomberg
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is considering a plan to delay Brexit to ensure the UK does not leave the European Union without a deal, Bloomberg reported https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-25/u-k-s-theresa-may-is-said-to-consider-delay-to-brexit-date?utm_medium=social&cmpid%3D=socialflow-facebook-brexit&utm_campaign=socialflow-organic&utm_content=brexit&utm_source=twitter on Monday, citing people familiar with the situation.

Headline: PM May to formally propose ruling out 'no-deal' Brexit - The Sun
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will propose formally ruling out a "no-deal" Brexit scenario which could potentially lead to the delaying of UK's exit from the European Union by months, The Sun newspaper reported on Monday.
