Headline: Labour says it will back call for second Brexit referendum
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party said on Monday it would back calls for a second referendum on Brexit if parliament rejects its alternative plan for leaving the European Union.

Headline: PM May says deal within grasp, Brexit delay won't solve crisis
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said a timely exit for Britain from the European Union is "within our grasp" and insisted on Monday that delaying Brexit would be no way to solve the impasse in parliament over the departure.

Headline: UK says confident medicines supply to be uninterrupted in no-deal Brexit
Description: The British government said on Monday that it was confident that the supply of medicines and medical products should be uninterrupted if the country leaves the European Union without a deal on March 29.

Headline: Labour will back public Brexit vote if parliament rejects its exit plan - Brexit spokesman
Description: Labour will support a second referendum on Brexit if parliament rejects the party's alternative plan for leaving the bloc, its Brexit spokesman Keir Starmer said on Monday.

Headline: Labour still to decide timing of support for second Brexit referendum - spokesman
Description: The exact wording and timing of the opposition Labour Party's proposal to support a second Brexit referendum is still to be decided, a party spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Britain to scrap many EU tariffs on unfairly traded goods post-Brexit
Description: Sweetcorn from Thailand and tinned mandarins from China are among the goods Britain will scrap higher tariffs on after it leaves the European Union, the British government said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit delay will not solve the impasse over deal, May says
Description: Delaying Britain's exit from the European Union does not deliver a deal and merely delays the big decision on Brexit, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday.

Headline: UK ministers will demand PM May delay Brexit if deal not approved by March 13 - Sky News
Description: If British Prime Minister Theresa May cannot get a Brexit deal approved by parliament by March 13, ministers and lawmakers will demand she delay Brexit and rule out leaving without a deal, Sky News reported an unnamed minister as saying on Monday.

Headline: UK to publish 'no deal' impact analysis 'very shortly' - May's spokeswoman
Description: The British government will "very shortly" publish analysis of the impact of a no-deal Brexit on business and trade, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Monday.

Headline: Association of British Insurers warns on no-deal Brexit hit
Description: The Association of British Insurers (ABI) warned on Monday that if Britain leaves the European Union without a deal it could cause long-lasting damage to the UK insurance industry.

Headline: Britain, South Africa finalising interim post-Brexit trade deal
Description: South Africa is close to signing an interim trade agreement with Britain that would replicate arrangements with Europe and ensure trade will not be disrupted in the event of a hard Brexit, South African Trade Minister Rob Davies said on Monday.

Headline: UK and U.S. regulators build Brexit 'bridge' for derivatives
Description: Britain and the United States agreed on Monday a long-term pact to ensure that the $2 trillion (£1.5 trillion) a day transatlantic market in derivatives will not be disrupted by any type of Brexit.

Headline: Explainer - Britain's next Brexit flashpoint: What happens in parliament this week?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May faces another trial by parliament this week when she must tell lawmakers what progress she has made in talks with the European Union, as patience in her party wears thin and the risk of a disorderly Brexit rises.

Headline: Switzerland, UK aim to keep status quo for residents after Brexit
Description: Switzerland and the United Kingdom have signed an agreement to help their citizens living in the respective countries keep their existing rights, including being able to move and change jobs, after the UK leaves the European Union.

Headline: Factbox - Through the Brexit Looking Glass: What happens next?
Description: Britain's parliament last month demanded Prime Minister Theresa May renegotiate a Brexit divorce deal that the other members of the European Union say they will not reopen.

Headline: UK cannot examine Facebook until it has clarity on Brexit timing - CMA
Description: Britain's competition regulator cannot take a decision on whether to investigate Facebook's role in advertising and data until it has better clarity on the timing of Brexit and how to work with the European Union, its CEO said.

Headline: EU's Tusk says Brexit delay would be 'rational'
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said on Monday that delaying Brexit beyond the scheduled exit date of March 29 would be a "rational solution" as there was no majority in the British parliament to approve a divorce deal.

Headline: Brexit delay raised at May-Merkel meet but no substantive discussion of it - official
Description: The possibility of extending Article 50 was raised at a meeting of British Prime Minister Theresa May and German Chancellor Angela Merkel in Egypt, but there was no "substantive" discussion of it, a government official said on Monday.

Headline: UK attorney general will go to Brussels for talks on Tuesday - Sky
Description: Britain's Attorney General Geoffrey Cox will travel to Brussels on Tuesday to continue discussions as he seeks to find a legal compromise that will help Prime Minister Theresa May get her Brexit deal through parliament, Sky News reported.

Headline: EU executive says Brexit work must conclude by March 21-22 summit
Description: The European Commission on Monday said it was still the EU's assumption that Britain would leave the bloc as planned on March 29.

Headline: Ireland would not veto a long Brexit extension - Coveney
Description: Ireland would not veto a British request to extend the Brexit timetable for 21 months but it would prefer to see problems with the current deal resolved, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Monday after a speech at the U.N. Human Rights Council.

Headline: EU's Juncker had 'good' meeting with UK PM May
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said in Egypt on Monday he had a "good, constructive" meeting with Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May on Brexit on the sidelines of an EU-Arab summit.

Headline: 'We are sleep walking into no-deal' Brexit, Dutch PM Rutte quoted by BBC
Description: Britain and the European Union are sleep walking into a no-deal Brexit, Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said.

Headline: Brexit delay does not solve anything, UK education minister says
Description: Delaying Britain's exit from the European Union next month would not solve any of the underlying disagreements about Prime Minister Theresa May's withdrawal deal, British education minister Damian Hinds said on Monday.

Headline: Britain facing prospect of Brexit delay, junior minister says
Description: Britain is facing the prospect of having to delay its exit from the European Union beyond March 29, a junior defence minister said on Monday.

Headline: UK government mulls Brexit options, including possible delay, if deal fails
Description: Britain's government is considering different options, including possibly delaying Brexit, if parliament fails to approve Prime Minister Theresa May's deal by March 12.

Headline: May signals she is ready to fight on
Description: Theresa May signalled on Sunday she wanted to press on as prime minister, saying there was still more to do to live up to her promise when she took office to make Britain work "for every one of us".

Headline: May considers plan to delay Brexit by two months - The Telegraph
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is considering a plan under which Britain's exit from the European Union would be delayed for up to two months, the Telegraph reported https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2019/02/24/exclusive-brexit-will-delayed-two-months-plans-considered-theresa on Sunday.

Headline: May seeks more time - promises Brexit deal vote by March 12
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May put off a vote in parliament on her Brexit deal until as late as March 12 - just 17 days before Britain is due to leave the EU - setting up a showdown this week with MPs who accuse her of running out the clock.

Headline: Labour to work with lawmakers to prevent no-deal Brexit, Corbyn says
Description: Labour Party will work with lawmakers in parliament to prevent a no-deal Brexit, party leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Sunday.

Headline: UK parliament must restore common sense to Brexit - Labour lawmaker
Description: Parliament must try to "restore some commonsense" to Brexit in a vote later this week, a lawmaker from the main opposition Labour Party said on Sunday, proposing changes to stop Britain from leaving the European Union without a deal.

Headline: Irish PM says border backstop cannot have a time limit or unilateral exit clause
Description: Ireland cannot accept a post-Brexit border backstop that has a time limit or a unilateral exit clause, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Sunday.

Headline: Austria's Kurz says best to delay Brexit if UK MPs don't back it by start of March
Description: Austria's Chancellor Sebastian Kurz said on Sunday that it would be better to postpone Britain's departure from the European Union if British lawmakers failed to back at the beginning of March the Brexit deal negotiated with Brussels.

Headline: Labour Party says May's Brexit vote delay is reckless
Description: Labour Party said on Sunday that Prime Minister Theresa May's decision to delay a meaningful vote on her Brexit deal was a reckless attempt to force lawmakers to choose between her deal and a disorderly no-deal exit.

Headline: Another delay - May promises Brexit vote in parliament by March 12
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May promised on Sunday to bring a vote on her Brexit deal back to parliament by March 12, the latest delay in her attempts to win approval for a plan to ease Britain’s departure from the European Union.

Headline: Labour is moving closer to backing second Brexit referendum - senior lawmakers
Description: Opposition Labour Party is moving closer to supporting a second Brexit referendum and could do so as soon as this week, several of its senior lawmakers said on Sunday.

Headline: UK government is making progress on changes to Brexit deal - Gove
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is making progress in her efforts to negotiate changes to Britain's exit deal with the European Union, British environment minister Michael Gove said on Sunday.

Headline: UK independent lawmaker says would likely support May in confidence vote
Description: A British lawmaker who quit Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives said on Sunday she would not seek to force a national election if there was a confidence vote in her former leader.

Headline: Some of PM May's ministers undermining Britain's Brexit negotiation - lawmaker Duncan Smith
Description: Some of Prime Minister Theresa May's senior ministers have undermined Britain's Brexit negotiations by publicly warning they could vote to delay Brexit to avoid a no-deal exit, Conservative lawmaker Iain Duncan Smith said.

Headline: Conservative Party chairman confident of Brexit deal before March 29
Description: The chairman of Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party said on Sunday he believed Britain could get a Brexit deal approved by parliament in time for its March 29 exit date.

Headline: Second Brexit referendum important safety net to prevent 'no deal' - Labour's trade spokesman
Description: The idea of a second Brexit referendum will become more important as the possibility of Britain leaving the European Union without a deal draws closer, the opposition Labour Party's trade spokesman Barry Gardiner told Sky News on Sunday.

Headline: EU trying to provide reassurance to Britain on Brexit deal, Ireland says
Description: The European Union is trying to provide reassurance on Britain's exit deal with the bloc but will not reopen the text of the agreement, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Sunday.

Headline: A prayer for Brexit - Church of England spiritual leader to plead for unity
Description: The spiritual leader of the Church of England may lead five days of prayer with other Churches after Britain's March 29 exit from the European Union in an attempt to ease Brexit divisions, The Sunday Times reported.

Headline: Britain's next Brexit flashpoint - What happens in parliament on Feb. 26-27?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May faces another trial by parliament this week when she must tell members of parliament (MPs) what progress she has made in talks with the European Union, as patience in her party wears thin and the risk of a disorderly Brexit rises.

Headline: Three ministers throw weight behind Brexit delay to stop no-deal
Description: Three cabinet ministers publicly indicated on Saturday they will back plans to delay Brexit if MPs vote down Prime Minister Theresa May's plan for a new deal with the European Union.

Headline: EU expects UK request to help avoid food shortages under hard Brexit
Description: The European Union expects Britain to seek its assistance to avoid disruption to food imports in the event of a no-deal Brexit, the EU's agriculture chief said on Saturday.

Headline: Labour leader Corbyn says he could back a second Brexit referendum
Description: Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn said if his party won power he would renegotiate a Brexit deal with the European Union and could hold another referendum, as he comes under pressure to support giving the public another chance to stay in the bloc.

Headline: Brexit darts hang over Europe balloon in Brussels art exhibition
Description: Darts marked with England's St George's Cross flag hang above a silver helium balloon symbolising Europe in a Brussels art exhibition inspired by the uncertainties of Brexit.

Headline: UK senior ministers want May to step down after local elections - Guardian
Description: British cabinet ministers want Prime Minister Theresa May to stand down after local elections in May and allow a new leader to carry out the next phase of the Brexit negotiations, the Guardian newspaper reported.

Headline: Bye-bye Brexit - History haunts German woman leaving UK to avoid 'chaos'
Description: Actor Sonja Morgenstern, a German national who has lived in London since 1996, packed up and moved back to Nuremberg this week in hopes of rediscovering the peace and certainty she lost when Britain voted for Brexit in 2016.

Headline: "No deal in the desert," EU says of Brexit breakthrough in Egypt
Description: There will be no decisive breakthrough on a Brexit deal when Britain's prime minister meets other EU leaders at a summit with their Arab peers in Egypt at the weekend, an EU official said on Friday.

Headline: Corbyn could win back Scotland with second Brexit vote, says Blair
Description: British opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn could seize on a "huge opportunity" to win back key seats in its former Scottish heartland by endorsing a second vote on Brexit, former Labour prime minister Tony Blair said.

Headline: Work continuing "at pace" on changes to Brexit deal - May's spokeswoman
Description: Work is continuing at pace to secure the changes Britain is seeking to its exit deal with Brussels in order to win the backing of parliament, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Friday.

Headline: Macron to receive Merkel on February 27 for talks on Brexit, U.S., defence
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron will host Germany's Angela Merkel in France on Feb. 27 for a working meeting to discuss Brexit, U.S. relations as well as the two countries defence partnership, Macron's office said on Friday.

Headline: Some Conservative MPs warn May they are ready to back Brexit delay
Description: A group of Conservative lawmakers said on Friday they had warned Prime Minister Theresa May that they are ready to try to force a delay to Britain's exit from the European Union to prevent a disorderly 'no deal' Brexit.

Headline: No-deal Brexit would take a chip off UK home values - Reuters poll
Description: Britain's over-valued housing market will undergo a modest correction if the country leaves the European Union at the end of next month without a deal, a Reuters poll found, with London being affected to a greater degree.

Headline: EU's Barnier says cannot rule out that Brexit gets postponed
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday that he cannot rule out the possibility that Britain's EU withdrawal is pushed back.

Headline: Not there yet but closer - Britain and EU haggle over Brexit compromise
Description: Britain and the European Union on Thursday played down the chances of clinching an immediate Brexit divorce deal but diplomats said they were edging closer to a legal compromise that Prime Minister Theresa May hopes will win over the British parliament.

Headline: Report on no-deal Brexit tariffs delayed by Downing Street - The Sun
Description: Downing Street has delayed an announcement on no-deal Brexit tariffs to avoid backlash from MPs so that the report comes after the next Brexit vote in parliament, the Sun newspaper reported http://bit.ly/2E5ROZd.

Headline: Bank of Ireland launches 2 billion euro Brexit Fund
Description: The Bank of Ireland said on Friday it will earmark 2 billion euros (£1.74 billion) for lending to small and medium businesses that need capital to adapt to the challenges of Britain's departure from the European Union.

Headline: Germany makes it easier to fire top earners to lure banks after Brexit
Description: Germany's lower house of parliament on Thursday approved changes to labour laws making it easier for employers to fire high-income workers, a measure designed to encourage London-based financial institutions to move to Frankfurt after Brexit.

Headline: Brexit defections reveal frayed fabric of UK politics
Description: Brexit has torn the fabric of Britain's political system, say a group of 11 lawmakers behind a dramatic series of defections that have sent shockwaves through one of the world's oldest and most stable parliaments.

Headline: Spain welcomes provisional Brexit airline deal
Description: The Spanish government on Thursday welcomed a provisional European Union deal meant to mitigate the impact of a hard Brexit on airlines.

Headline: EU is closing down Brexit impasse options - deputy DUP leader
Description: The European Union is seeking to close down options for ending the Brexit impasse, the deputy leader of Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) said on Thursday.

Headline: UK says focus in Brexit talks is now backstop guarantees
Description: Britain's Brexit ministry said after talks in Brussels on Thursday that the focus of negotiations was now on getting new guarantees on the temporary nature of the Irish backstop.

Headline: Explainer - Britain's next Brexit flashpoint: What happens in parliament on February 26-27?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May faces another trial by parliament next week when she must tell lawmakers what progress she has made in talks with the European Union, as patience in her party wears thin and the risk of a disorderly Brexit rises.

Headline: Corbyn says May must seek customs union with EU to unlock Brexit
Description: British opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Thursday Prime Minister Theresa May must change her strategy and seek a close alliance with the European Union after Brexit to avert the dangerous prospect of an abrupt split.

Headline: Risk of no-deal Brexit has risen - EU's Timmermans
Description: The risk of Britain crashing out of the European Union on March 29 without a deal to ease Brexit has increased this month, the deputy head of the European Commission said on Thursday.

Headline: UK, EU closer to possible agreement on Brexit - EU diplomats
Description: The European Union and Britain are moving towards a separate legal statement in which the bloc would again stress the temporary nature of the so-called Brexit backstop for the Irish border, diplomats in Brussels said.

Headline: UK making progress in EU talks but still a lot of hard work to do - May's spokesman
Description: Britain has been making progress in negotiations with the European Union over potential changes to its exit deal but there is still "a lot of hard work" to do, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: UK govt source: It does not feel like we will have a Brexit deal by next week
Description: It does not feel like Britain will have secured the changes it needs to its exit deal with Brussels by next week, a British government source said on Thursday.

Headline: UK pensions minister hopes May will get her Brexit deal passed next week - BBC reporter
Description: British pensions minister Amber Rudd said she hopes Prime Minister Theresa May will get her revised Brexit deal through parliament next week, according to BBC's political correspondent Ben Wright.

Headline: EU's Juncker "not very optimistic" about Brexit deal
Description: Europe's chief executive said on Thursday he was "not very optimistic" about Britain's chances of leaving the European Union with a deal, also warning that any failure to agree an orderly Brexit deal will be economically costly.

Headline: Some British ministers tell May: delay Brexit if no deal or face rebellion - The Sun
Description: Some senior British ministers have warned Prime Minister Theresa May she must agree to delay Brexit if there is no European Union divorce deal or face a rebellion in parliament next week, The Sun newspaper reported.

Headline: Risk of no-deal Brexit has risen - Home Secretary Sajid Javid
Description: Home Secretary Sajid Javid said on Wednesday that the risk of a no-deal Brexit has risen and that the option could not be taken off the table.

Headline: UK attorney general plans for unilateral exit mechanism to Irish backstop - Telegraph
Description: Attorney General Geoffrey Cox is considering plans for a unilateral exit mechanism to the Irish backstop with a notice period of 12 months, the Telegraph newspaper reported http://bit.ly/2E0XHql late on Wednesday.

Headline: Corbyn to discuss Brexit impasse with EU's Barnier
Description: Opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn will meet European leaders in Brussels on Thursday to discuss how to try to break the deadlock over Brexit and seek to reassure them that parliament does not want to leave without a deal.

Headline: 'Time of the essence,' says May on latest Brussels shuttle
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May held "constructive" talks in Brussels on Wednesday as she sought concessions on Brexit from a sceptical European Union, her strategy under strain after the defection of three lawmakers.

Headline: Three Conservatives quit party in protest at "disastrous Brexit"
Description: Three lawmakers from Britain's governing Conservatives quit over the government's "disastrous handling of Brexit" on Wednesday, in a blow to Prime Minister Theresa May's attempts to unite her party around plans to leave the European Union.

Headline: Factbox: Who has quit May's Conservative Party? And what does it mean?
Description: Three pro-EU lawmakers from Britain's governing Conservative Party quit to join an independent group in parliament on Wednesday, in a blow to Prime Minister Theresa May's attempts to unite her party around her Brexit plans.

Headline: May "saddened" by three MPs quitting her party over Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she was saddened by the decision of three of her lawmakers to quit the Conservative Party over her Brexit policy, but said she was doing the right thing for the country.

Headline: Text: Resignation letter of 3 MPs who quit May's Conservatives
Description: Three pro-EU lawmakers from Britain's governing Conservative Party quit to join an independent group in parliament on Wednesday, in a blow to Prime Minister Theresa May's attempts to unite her party around her Brexit plans.

Headline: Anti-EU right wing has taken over Conservative Party - Soubry
Description: Britain's ruling Conservative Party has been taken over by right-wing, anti-EU lawmakers who will force out more moderate colleagues, Member of Parliament Anna Soubry said after she left the party on Wednesday.

Headline: EU won't renegotiate Brexit deal - Spain foreign ministry source
Description: The European Union will not agree to renegotiate the deal on Britain's exit from the bloc but there might be some margin of manoeuvre for a statement on the Irish backstop, a Spanish foreign ministry source told Reuters.

Headline: Don't blame Theresa May, EU's Juncker jokes of face wound
Description: Jean-Claude Juncker cut himself shaving on Wednesday -- hardly news, even in the hothouse Brussels' EU political bubble.

Headline: EU's Tusk - Longer Brexit talks would be better than no deal
Description: Brexit negotiations might be extended if Britain fails to work out a sensible deal for leaving the European Union, European Council President Donald Tusk said on Wednesday.

Headline: Irish backstop is temporary, May and Juncker say
Description: The "backstop" provision in Britain's EU divorce deal aimed at avoiding a hard border on the island of Ireland is temporary, European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker and British Prime Minister Theresa May said after a meeting in Brussels.

Headline: EU's Barnier rules out Brexit deal renegotiation - paper
Description: The European Union's top Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier ruled out on Wednesday changing the terms of the deal for Britain's departure from the bloc, he said in a French newspaper interview.

Headline: Progress made on Irish border backstop but time is of the essence - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday that progress had been made in solving the impasse over the backstop arrangements for the Irish border that has hindered her Brexit deal but added that time was running out to secure changes.

Headline: Up to 15 British ministers may vote to stop UK from leaving EU on March 29 - Bloomberg
Description: As many as 15 British government ministers may vote to stop the United Kingdom leaving the European Union on March 29 in the event that no Brexit deal has been agreed, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing sources familiar with the matter.

Headline: EU's Juncker sees no Brexit breakthrough in Wednesday talks with May
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker on Wednesday reiterated he had no expectations of a Brexit breakthrough when he meets British Prime Minister Theresa May in the evening.

Headline: May to have detailed discussions with EU's Juncker -spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will have detailed discussions with European Commision President Jean-Claude Juncker on Wednesday, her spokesman said.

Headline: Changing Irish backstop only way to seal Brexit deal - UK's Hunt
Description: Making changes to the contentious Irish backstop is the only way to secure a Brexit agreement, British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said before Prime Minister Theresa May heads to Brussels on Wednesday to try to salvage her deal.

Headline: Defining 'temporary' nature of backstop key to Brexit deal - Hunt
Description: The key to securing a Brexit deal the British government can get through parliament is to define more precisely the "temporary" nature of the Irish backstop, British Foreign Secretary Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said on Wednesday.

Headline: Revised Brexit accord being hammered out now - Bloomberg cites Spanish foreign minister
Description: A revised Brexit accord is being hammered out at the moment, Bloomberg quoted Spain's foreign minister as saying.

Headline: May could pass Brexit deal with promise of second referendum - lawmaker
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May could pass her Brexit deal if she agreed to hold another referendum to see if the public accepted it, one of the lawmakers who resigned from her party over the government's handling of Brexit said on Wednesday.

Headline: May wants support of her MPs in delivering Brexit - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May wants the support of her Conservative lawmakers in delivering Brexit, her spokesman said on Wednesday, after three quit the party over her government's "disastrous handling of Brexit".

Headline: Brexit vote will come back to parliament as soon as possible - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she would bring a vote on a revised Brexit deal back to parliament as soon as possible but only when it was the right time to do so after securing changes to it from the European Union.

Headline: May says she is seeking legally-binding changes to Brexit deal
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she would be seeking legally-binding changes to a proposed Brexit deal with the European Union as she looks to resolve lawmakers' concerns about the so-called Irish backstop.

Headline: "We are ready", EU executive says of no-deal Brexit
Description: The European Union is ready for the worst possible Brexit scenario under which Britain would crash out of the bloc with no agreement to mitigate disruption and manage the new relationship, the bloc's executive said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain has until mid-March to seal Brexit deal - EU diplomats
Description: Britain has until mid-March to seal a deal with the European Union, diplomatic sources in the bloc said, or it would otherwise be too late for the gathering of 28 national leaders later that month to approve it before Brexit day on March 29.

Headline: Hunt says he is hopeful Brexit deal can get done
Description: British foreign minister Jeremy Hunt said on Wednesday that he was hopeful that a Brexit deal could be passed by the British parliament if the government's attorney-general is in a position to change his advice on its implications for the Irish backstop.

Headline: Hammond says EU won't consider alternatives to backstop for now
Description: British Finance Minister Philip Hammond said on Tuesday it was clear the European Union will not now consider alternatives to the Irish backstop to help the UK government win support for its Brexit withdrawal deal, but that such options could be valuable in the future.

Headline: Hammond says no-deal Brexit would be 'mutual calamity'
Description: A no-deal Brexit would be a "mutual calamity" for Britain and the European Union that would deliver a sharp blow to the British economy, Finance Minister Philip Hammond said on Tuesday.

Headline: Kellogg, Mondelez stock up on Pringles, Milka for fear of Brexit
Description: As Brexit looms, Kellogg Co and Mondelez International Inc are taking measures to protect Britons from a potential shortage of Pringles chips, BelVita biscuits and Milka chocolate.

Headline: May heads to EU on Wednesday to push for Brexit breakthrough
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will meet top EU official Jean-Claude Juncker in Brussels on Wednesday, pressing on with efforts to find a way to get their Brexit deal through Britain's parliament.

Headline: UK will push options to Brexit backstop for future trading
Description: Britain will pursue alternative arrangements to the Irish backstop - the most contentious part of the Brexit withdrawal deal - in its future trading relations with the European Union, Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said on Tuesday.

Headline: Aviva, NatWest to join 'Brexodus' of business to EU
Description: England's High Court on Tuesday gave Aviva, Britain’s second largest insurer, approval to transfer around £9 billion in assets to a new Irish company just before the starting gun is fired on Brexit.

Headline: Brexit Minister says new proposals will be enough to secure Brexit deal - Sky News
Description: Brexit Minister Stephen Barclay said the UK would take new legal proposals to the European Union on Wednesday and that they would be sufficient to secure an agreement in the Brexit talks, a Sky News reporter tweeted http://bit.ly/2SRDdLi late on Tuesday.

Headline: 'Malthouse Compromise' on Brexit not dead - UK lawmaker after PM May talks
Description: A eurosceptic British lawmaker said the "Malthouse Compromise" - an attempt to redraft the contentious Irish backstop in the Brexit deal - was "alive and kicking" after a meeting with Prime Minister Theresa May on Tuesday.

Headline: Nobody will block Brexit extension, Juncker says
Description: If Britain asks for a delay to its departure from the European Union, none of the existing members will stand in its way, European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said on Tuesday.

Headline: Kerry forecasts 'grave' no-deal Brexit fallout for Irish food firms
Description: Ireland's Kerry Group warned on Tuesday of "grave consequences" for Irish food producers if Britain leaves the European Union without a replacement trade deal.

Headline: May's spokesman says wouldn't agree with reports on Brexit compromise plan
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday he disagreed with the characterisation of cabinet discussions in reports which said that the government was no longer considering a Brexit proposal known as the 'Malthouse Compromise'.

Headline: British farmers face Brexit date shipment conundrum
Description: British farmers and food producers must decide whether to proceed with shipments next week because exports could face tariffs if Britain leaves the European Union without a deal, a farming leader said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK prosecutors charge man over Brexit harassment of lawmaker
Description: British prosecutors have charged a man with harassment and public order offences after he protested outside the Houses of Parliament against a lawmaker who is opposed to Brexit.

Headline: May's spokesman: May-Juncker meeting is important step in Brexit process
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's meeting with European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker on Wednesday is an important stage in Brexit negotiations with the European Union, her spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Gove: Government will use tariffs to protect farming in no deal Brexit
Description: Britain will use import tariffs to protect its farming industry if it fails to reach a trade pact with the European Union, farming and environment minister Michael Gove said on Tuesday.

Headline: BoE would pump in emergency money after no-deal Brexit, minister says
Description: The Bank of England would have to step in to pump emergency money into the economy if Britain left the European Union without a deal, a junior business minister said on Tuesday.

Headline: Disorderly Brexit would be shock to European economy - ECB's de Guindos
Description: A disorderly Brexit would deliver "a significant shock" to an already weakened European economy, European Central Bank vice-president Luis de Guindos told French daily Le Monde.

Headline: UK likely to delay Brexit, former EU chief Barroso says
Description: Britain is likely to delay Brexit and not leave the European Union in March, former EU Commission President Jose Manuel Barroso said on Tuesday, adding the bloc would likely accept a request to extension to sort out the details of departure.

Headline: Ireland urges people not to stockpile medicines ahead of Brexit
Description: Ireland's deputy prime minister on Tuesday called on people not to stockpile medicine before Britain quits the European Union, saying the country had at least eight weeks of supply and was moving to source medicines from other EU countries.

Headline: Britain will not take part in EU parliament elections - Callanan
Description: Britain will not take part in the elections to the European Parliament in May because it will leave the European Union on March 29th, junior Brexit minister Martin Callanan told reporters on Tuesday.

Headline: Seven MPs quit Labour Party citing Brexit 'betrayal', anti-Semitism
Description: Seven Labour lawmakers quit on Monday over leader Jeremy Corbyn's approach to Brexit and a row over anti-Semitism, saying Britain's main opposition party had been "hijacked by the machine politics of the hard left".

Headline: Scotland to step up efforts to keep EU citizens after Brexit, Sturgeon says
Description: Scotland will step up efforts to persuade EU citizens to stay after Brexit, its First Minister will tell French lawmakers on Tuesday, amid concerns about potential workforce shortages in the largest of the United Kingdom's three smaller nations.

Headline: Barclays launches more than 100 Brexit 'clinics' for small businesses
Description: Barclays will host more than 100 clinics for small business customers in March to help them to prepare for Britain's exit from the European Union at the end of that month, the bank said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK manufacturers warn of 'catastrophic' no-deal Brexit
Description: Britain faces the "catastrophic prospect" of a no-deal Brexit next month due to the selfishness of some politicians and chaotic parliamentary proceedings, the head of the country's main manufacturing association said on Tuesday.

Headline: More EU-UK Brexit talks set after Cox sets out backstop changes
Description: Brexit Secretary Stephen Barclay said on Monday he would hold more talks with EU chief negotiator Michel Barnier at mid-week after British Attorney General Geoffrey Cox sets out proposed amendments to the tricky Irish border backstop.

Headline: Four cabinet ministers urge UK's May to stop using no-deal Brexit threat in talks - report
Description: Four of British Prime Minister Theresa May's senior ministers have urged her to stop using the threat of a no-deal Brexit in divorce negotiations with the European Union, the Guardian newspaper reported on Monday.

Headline: No one in Europe would oppose extension to Brexit talks - Juncker
Description: No one in Europe would oppose a British demand for an extension of talks on Britain's exit from the European Union beyond the March 29 deadline, the head of the European Commission Jean-Claude Juncker told the Stuttgarter Zeitung in an interview.

Headline: Japan keen to do post-Brexit trade deal quickly - UK trade minister Fox
Description: British trade minister Liam Fox said on Monday that Japan was keen to agree a post-Brexit trade deal and believed it could be done "quite quickly".

Headline: Ireland says no-deal Brexit would be 'crazy outcome'
Description: Ireland is spending hundreds of millions of euros on preparing for a no-deal Brexit, which would be a "crazy outcome" of three years of EU-UK negotiations, Ireland's Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Monday.

Headline: EU tells small businesses to brace for tax burdens in event of no-deal Brexit
Description: The European Union on Monday told small businesses to prepare for more bureaucracy and costs should Britain crash out of the bloc without a deal, the latest step in its contingency plans reflecting the potential impact of a hard Brexit.

Headline: Counting cost of stockpiling, UK bike maker gears up for Brexit
Description: Isla Rowntree, the founder of British children's bike maker Islabikes, has resorted to stacking spare parts in meeting spaces and office rooms as she gets ready for a potentially chaotic no-deal Brexit next month.

Headline: Britain's Labour Party splits over Brexit and anti-Semitism
Description: Seven lawmakers split from Britain's opposition Labour Party on Monday, saying that the party leadership's failures over Brexit, anti-Semitism and a culture of bullying in the party had left them no choice.

Headline: Germany warns it will stop extradition of its citizens to UK after Brexit - FT
Description: Berlin will stop extraditing Germans to Britain immediately after Brexit even if it leaves the European Union with a deal, the Financial Times reported https://on.ft.com/2DPMBED on Sunday, citing a formal notification submitted by Germany to the European Commission last week.

Headline: UK regional airline Flybmi goes into administration blaming Brexit
Description: British regional airline Flybmi has gone into administration and has cancelled all flights with immediate effect, the company said in a statement on Saturday, blaming Brexit uncertainty as one of the reasons for its collapse.

Headline: Airbus warns of no-deal Brexit, says has spent tens of millions preparing
Description: Airbus said on Sunday it would have to make "difficult decisions" about future investment if Britain crashes out of the European Union without a deal, adding it had already spent tens of millions of euros in preparations.

Headline: Irish backstop can't be changed for Brexit deal - Estonian president
Description: There can be no changes to the Irish "backstop", an arrangement to avoid a hard border between European Union member Ireland and British-ruled Northern Ireland after Brexit, Estonian President Kersti Kaljulaid told Reuters.

Headline: May to speak to every EU head in bid for Brexit deal changes
Description: Theresa May plans to speak to every European Union leader and the European Commission chief to seek changes to her EU withdrawal agreement, days after another defeat from her own lawmakers and as businesses brace for a no-deal Brexit on March 29.

Headline: France denies it has softened stance on Brexit
Description: France on Sunday denied British media reports that President Emmanuel Macron had offered concessions on the Irish backstop to end the stalemate over Brexit negotiations.

Headline: Brexit 'airbags' being tested by business with 40 days to exit day - KPMG
Description: With just 40 days until the United Kingdom is due to leave the European Union, businesses are testing their emergency Brexit preparations to ensure they have enough cash and staff in the event of a disorderly exit, KPMG said.

Headline: Brexit won't deter European security cooperation - intelligence chiefs
Description: Britain's exit from the European Union will not affect security cooperation with its NATO allies France and Germany, given the growing external threats to the continent's stability, the  intelligence chiefs of the three countries said on Friday.

Headline: Europe working to keep defence ties with UK after Brexit - German minister
Description: Europe is working on continuing defence cooperation with the United Kingdom after it leaves the European Union, German Defence Minister Ursula von der Leyen told Deutsche Welle in an interview on Friday.

Headline: Pro-Brexit members of UK government willing to accept five-year limit on backstop - Bloomberg
Description: Pro-Brexit members of Prime Minister Theresa May's government are willing to keep Britain tied to the European Union's customs regime for as long as five years in an attempt to break the deadlock in talks, Bloomberg reported https://bloom.bg/2SZIzD8 on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headline: Sceptical EU ready to help May with Brexit package - Ireland's Coveney
Description: The parliamentary defeat for Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit strategy has increased doubt among European Union states that she can seal a departure agreement, Ireland's foreign minister said on Friday.

Headline: Ireland frustrated by lack of Brexit clarity from UK - foreign minister
Description: Ireland and the European Union are frustrated by the lack of clarity from the British parliament on Brexit, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Friday after British Prime Minister Theresa May's government lost another vote.

Headline: Britain could accept Brexit backstop fix outside divorce deal - EU, UK sources
Description: Britain could accept legally-binding assurances on the disputed Irish border backstop that would not require reopening of the EU-UK Brexit deal, diplomatic sources said, signalling a possible shift from Prime Minister Theresa May's official line.

Headline: Brexit minister to hold talks with EU ambassadors - May's spokeswoman
Description: British Brexit minister Stephen Barclay will meet ambassadors from the European Union’s 27 other members on Friday, the prime minister's spokeswoman said, adding that government remained focused on securing changes to the so-called Irish backstop.

Headline: More Brexit embarrassment for May as parliament defeats her again
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May suffered a defeat on her Brexit strategy on Thursday that undermined her pledge to European Union leaders to get her divorce deal approved if they grant her concessions.

Headline: France fears border lorry queues as it braces for no-deal Brexit
Description: France will be ready to handle border inspections in the event of a no-deal Brexit but fears long tailbacks at the Channel as goods flow between Britain and Europe, its agriculture minister said.

Headline: Deal or delay? Wall Street doesn't believe no-deal Brexit threat
Description: As the United Kingdom's Brexit crisis deepens, Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan have differing views of the ultimate outcome but the two titans of Wall Street agree on one thing: They don't believe there will be a no-deal Brexit.

Headline: Ireland sees end-June as natural limit to any Brexit extension
Description: Any British request to extend Brexit talks would likely be met with a generous response from the European Union provided it came with a plan, and a natural limit to such a request would be the end of June, Ireland's foreign minister said on Friday.

Headline: Factbox: Through the Brexit Looking Glass - What happens next?
Description: Britain's parliament last month demanded Prime Minister Theresa May renegotiate a Brexit divorce deal that the other members of the European Union say they will not reopen.

Headline: Brexit: Irish PM confident EU's 'solidarity' to continue
Description: The solidarity of European Union members with Ireland on Brexit has been remarkable and anyone who expects that to change is in for a "nasty surprise", Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Friday.

Headline: Irish PM says Brexit extension possible but not inevitable
Description: It is certainly possible Britain will ask for an extension of its March 29 deadline to exit the European Union but not inevitable, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Friday.

Headline: Hotel group Millennium & Copthorne sees Brexit-led hiring crunch
Description: Britain's impending exit from the European Union is making it hard to hire workers from the bloc who are at the centre of London's hotel business, operator Millennium & Copthorne Hotels said on Friday.

Headline: Brexit - France tells Britain to hurry up
Description: Britain should decide what to do regarding its exit from the European Union as soon as possible, French European Affairs Minister Nathalie Loiseau said on Friday.

Headline: Britain is ready to leave EU next month without a deal - Leadsom
Description: Britain's government is ready to leave the European Union  without a divorce deal unless parliament votes for Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plan, the government's leader in the House of Commons, Andrea Leadsom, said.

Headline: RBS says 50 billion euros-plus of cross-border payments threatened by Brexit
Description: The political turmoil surrounding Britain's departure from the European Union threatens Royal Bank of Scotland's ability to clear more than 50 billion euros (44.08 billion pounds) per day in cross-border payments, the bank said on Friday.

Headline: May will fall if she relies on opposition to pass Brexit deal - Baker
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's government will collapse if she relies on the opposition Labour Party to pass her Brexit deal, an influential pro-Brexit lawmaker said on Friday.

Headline: Ireland under pressure over border plans for no-deal Brexit
Description: The European Union will give Ireland some leeway to establish new border arrangements with Northern Ireland in case of a no-deal Brexit, sources in the bloc's political hub Brussels said.

Headline: PM May to continue seeking changes to Brexit deal - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will continue to seek changes to her Brexit deal, a spokesman for her office said, after she suffered a symbolic defeat in parliament on her strategy.

Headline: May loses symbolic Brexit vote in parliament
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May was defeated in a symbolic vote in parliament on her Brexit strategy on Thursday, undermining her negotiating strength in talks with the European Union to secure changes to the agreement.

Headline: Anna Soubry pulls Brexit proposal on no-deal impact
Description: Pro-EU Conservative lawmaker Anna Soubry said on Thursday she would withdraw a proposal due to be voted on in parliament which called on the government to publish its analysis of the impact of a no-deal Brexit on business and trade.

Headline: Ireland says border infrastructure must be avoided, deal or no deal
Description: There will be an obligation on Dublin, London and Brussels to find a way of avoiding physical infrastructure returning to the Irish border even if Britain leaves the European Union without a deal, Ireland's foreign minister said on Thursday.

Headline: Pro-Brexit Conservatives say they will abstain on Brexit vote
Description: A group of Conservative pro-Brexit lawmakers have decided to abstain on a vote on Thursday, two Conservative lawmakers said, in a blow to the Prime Minister Theresa May who is seeking parliament's renewed backing for her Brexit renegotiation.

Headline: May held constructive calls with Merkel and other leaders - spokeswoman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May held constructive phone calls with European leaders, including German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Thursday to discuss the need for legally binding changes to backstop, her spokeswoman said.

Headline: Factbox - Brexit: What happens in Britain's parliament on Thursday
Description: The British parliament will hold a Brexit debate on Thursday. This is not a re-run of a vote last month on whether to approve the exit deal Prime Minister Theresa May negotiated with the European Union.

Headline: UK parliament must give govt time to finish work on changes to Brexit deal - minister
Description: British lawmakers should support the government's continued plan to renegotiate its Brexit deal with Brussels and give it more time to finish this work, Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said on Thursday.

Headline: Port of Rotterdam braces for the consequences of Brexit
Description: A no-deal Brexit could lead to serious problems in Rotterdam, Europe's largest port, which handles around 40 million tonnes of goods to and from Britain every year, port authorities said on Thursday.

Headline: UK will leave EU next month with or without a deal - Brexit minister
Description: Britain will leave the European Union next month without a deal unless the European Union offers concessions that will allow parliament to back Prime Minister Theresa May's divorce deal, Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said on Thursday.

Headline: MPs to vote on up to three proposed changes to May's Brexit plan on Thursday
Description: British lawmakers will have the opportunity to vote on up to three proposed changes to Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plans on Thursday, the Speaker of the House of Commons John Bercow said.

Headline: MPs should back May and send clear Brexit message to EU - spokesman
Description: British lawmakers should back Prime Minister Theresa May in a vote in parliament later on Thursday, her spokesman said, to send a clear message to Brussels about what changes the country wants to its Brexit deal.

Headline: UK's negotiating hand will be weakened if defeated in vote - government source
Description: Britain's negotiating hand in talks to leave the European Union will be undermined if the government loses a symbolic vote on Prime Minister Theresa May's strategy on Thursday, a government source said.

Headline: ConvaTec's shares plummet on weak results, draws up turnaround plan
Description: Shares of ConvaTec plunged on Thursday after the medical devices maker reported "disappointing" annual results and launched a turnaround plan, which would include a $150 million (117 million pounds) investment over three years to boost sales and profit.

Headline: UK will back Brexit deal if it excludes Irish backstop, Hunt says
Description: British lawmakers are certain to back a proposed Brexit agreement if it does not include the backstop, a controversial Irish border arrangement, British foreign minister Jeremy Hunt told a Polish newspaper.

Headline: EU watching UK Brexit votes on Thursday before making concessions - Fox
Description: European Union governments want to see how Britain's parliament votes on amendments to Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit strategy on Thursday to gauge whether they should make concessions to London, Britain's trade minister Liam Fox said.

Headline: 'Border buster' shows why Brexit frontier checks in Northern Ireland would matter
Description: Near one of the scores of small border crossings on the island of Ireland, a yellow digger stands as a monument to the lengths communities went to keep roads open during Northern Ireland's violent "Troubles".

Headline: More time needed, May returns to parliament for Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May returns to parliament on Thursday to seek renewed backing for her plan to renegotiate her Brexit deal with Brussels, just weeks before the March 29 leave date and amid warnings over the risk of a disorderly exit.

Headline: Delay Brexit, 40 former diplomats tell May - The Times
Description: More than 40 former British ambassadors have called on Prime Minister Theresa May to extend Britain's stay in the European Union, The Times reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Scottish First Minister Sturgeon calls for May to rule out no deal Brexit - ITV
Description: Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon has called on Prime Minister Theresa May to take a no deal Brexit off the table, ITV reported on Wednesday.

Headline: EU awaits realistic Brexit proposals from UK - EU's Tusk
Description: The European Union is still waiting for Britain to present solid proposals to break the impasse over its exit from the bloc, European Council President Donald Tusk said on Wednesday after earlier meeting the EU's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier.

Headline: Conservative pro-Brexit group will not back PM May's motion - BBC
Description: A pro-Brexit faction of Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party will not back her motion in parliament on Thursday that seeks renewed backing for her Brexit plan, the BBC's political editor reported without citing sources.

Headline: Irish backstop issue must be resolved, says Dutch Prime Minister
Description: Britain and the European Union need to resolve the Irish border question and keep the so-called "backstop" arrangement if they are to agree a post-Brexit deal, Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said on Wednesday.

Headline: Merkel strives for orderly Brexit but says deal must be fair
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Wednesday she would do everything she could to achieve an orderly Brexit before the March 29 deadline but said any deal must be fair and work in practice.

Headline: Labour pushes government to change Brexit 'red lines' - spokesman
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party pressed the government to change its "red lines" on Brexit on Wednesday after two policy chiefs held "frank and serious" talks with ministers, a party spokesman said.

Headline: Barclays says has spent up to £200 million on Brexit
Description: Barclays  has spent 100 to 200 million pounds moving operations and staff out of Britain to prepare for Brexit, its UK chairman Gerry Grimstone said on Wednesday as bank bosses detailed the costs involved.

Headline: Irish backstop not a bridge to future UK-EU ties - May's spokesman
Description: A backstop plan for the Irish border is not a "bridge" to Britain's future relationship with the European Union but an insurance policy that no one intends to use, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK government will set out which EU trade deals will not be replicated before Brexit - Fox
Description: The British government will set out in the coming days which European Union trade deals it does not believe will be rolled over before its March 29 exit from the bloc, trade minister Liam Fox said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK bid to replicate EU trade deals will 'go down to wire' - trade minister Fox
Description: Trade minister Liam Fox said on Wednesday he expected efforts to replicate European Union trade agreements with third countries in time for Britain's exit from the bloc would "go down to the wire".

Headline: Ford told May it could move business overseas because of Brexit
Description: Ford Motor Co  told British Prime Minister Theresa May during a conference call on Tuesday that it may have to move some production out of Britain because of Brexit, according to a source on the call.

Headline: Irish PM: I believe we will strike a Brexit deal
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said he believes the European Union will strike a deal with Britain to smooth its exit from the bloc, even as Dublin continue its preparations for all outcomes, including a no deal.

Headline: EU executive says any Brexit delay cannot be open-ended
Description: The European Commission said on Wednesday Britain has not requested a Brexit delay and that any such extension of negotiating time before the divorce could not be open-ended but leading to a concrete result.

Headline: Brexit: What will happen in the British parliament on February 14?
Description: The British parliament will hold a debate on Brexit on Feb. 14. This is not a re-run of a vote last month on whether to approve the exit deal Prime Minister Theresa May's negotiated with the European Union.

Headline: Britain's Galliford says projects being delayed by Brexit distraction
Description: Britain's government is being distracted from embarking on major projects by the impending exit from the European Union while private sector clients are also dragging their heels on starting work, builder Galliford Try said.

Headline: Swiss allow 3,500 work permits for Britons in case of no-deal Brexit
Description: Switzerland will introduce a quota system allowing Britons to come and work in the country in the event Britain crashes out of the European Union without an exit deal.

Headline: UK economy to make modest post-Brexit recovery if deal agreed - economists
Description: Britain's economy will barely grow in the run-up to Brexit amid concern the UK will leave the European Union without an agreement, but if there is a deal there will be a modest post-divorce upturn, according to economists polled by Reuters.

Headline: No deal Brexit hit to Ireland would be severe, immediate - central bank
Description: A sudden, no-deal Brexit next month would have a very severe and immediately disruptive effects on almost all areas of Ireland's economy, the head of the country's central bank said on Wednesday.

Headline: Hard Brexit would doom future merger of UK, Franco-German fighter projects - Airbus defence
Description: Britain's departure from the European Union without a deal would doom the prospects for a Franco-German next-generation fighter jet with a rival project in Britain, the head of Airbus Defence and Space told the Handelsblatt German newspaper.

Headline: UK Labour will back plan to force government Brexit decision by mid-March
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party will back a proposal to try to force the government to take "crucial decisions" on its Brexit plans by the middle of March, the party's Brexit spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: PM May appears determined to try and avoid no deal - Smurfit CEO
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May appears determined to try and avoid a no deal Brexit if she can, the chief executive of Irish packaging group Smurfit Kappa said following a call May held with business leaders on Tuesday

Headline: Homewares retailer Dunelm stocks up to brace for Brexit
Description: Homewares retailer Dunelm Group Plc on Wednesday became the latest British company to say that it was stockpiling some of its best-selling products to beat potential supply disruptions arising from Brexit.

Headline: Choice between Brexit deal or delay is not government's position - Barclay
Description: Britain does not face a choice between Prime Minister Theresa May's deal or a significant delay to Brexit, Brexit minister Steve Barclay said on Wednesday, adding reported comments by a senior Brexit negotiator did not reflect government position.

Headline: British MI6 spy chief set to stay on to steer through Brexit - The Times
Description: The head of Britain's MI6 foreign spy service is expected to stay on beyond his retirement date this year to guide the intelligence agency through the post-Brexit period, The Times newspaper reported.

Headline: Most London-based banks fleeing Brexit have made reasonable progress - ECB
Description: Most London-based banks moving to the euro area due to Brexit have made "reasonable progress" in preparing the move, European Central Bank director Sabine Lautenschlaeger said on Wednesday.

Headline: May seeks more time to find Brexit deal, tells lawmakers: Hold your nerve
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May told MPs on Tuesday to hold their nerve over Brexit and give her more time to negotiate a deal acceptable to both the European Union and the British parliament.

Headline: UK's chief Brexit negotiator says: It's May's deal or extension - ITV
Description: Britain's lead Brexit negotiator Olly Robbins has saidlawmakers face a choice between Prime Minister Theresa May's exit deal or a long extension of the March 29 deadline for leaving the EU, ITV news said, citing a private conversation.

Headline: Brexit: extending Article 50 would serve no purpose - FT quotes PM May
Description: British Prime Minster Theresa May told business leaders on Tuesday that extending the Article 50 process under which the UK is meant to leave the European Union on March 29 would serve no purpose, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.

Headline: Labour MP has new plan for parliament vote on no-deal Brexit
Description: British MP Yvette Cooper, one of the leading campaigners against Britain leaving the EU without an agreement with the bloc, unveiled a new plan on Tuesday to ensure parliament has a chance to vote on ruling out a no-deal Brexit.

Headline: Both sides want an EU exit deal, says UK Brexit minister
Description: Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said on Tuesday both Britain and the European Union wanted to see a Brexit deal, recognising that a British exit without an agreement would be in neither of the sides' interests.

Headline: "Real hunger" for Brexit deal - Jeremy Hunt
Description: Foreign minister Jeremy Hunt said on Tuesday it was still possible to get a Brexit deal by March 29 when Britain leaves, describing a "real hunger" to finalise the exit in the European Union.

Headline: France tells UK to make clear its Brexit intentions
Description: London still needs to make clear its next steps towards reaching a deal over the terms of its divorce with the European Union, France's foreign ministry said on Tuesday after talks were held with Britain's foreign secretary.

Headline: EU announces plans to keep Channel Tunnel rail link open after no-deal Brexit
Description: The European Commission announced plans on Tuesday to keep the rail link with Britain through the Channel Tunnel open on current terms for three months after a no-deal Brexit in an effort to minimise disruption expected from any abrupt split.

Headline: We can reach a Brexit deal parliament can support - PM May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday she believed she could reach a Brexit deal that parliament could support, allowing Britain to leave the European Union on March 29.

Headline: May says will speed up ratification of Brexit deal if time is tight
Description: The government will seek to speed up the ratification of its Brexit deal with the European Union if time gets too tight to pass legislation before Britain's March 29 exit day, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday.

Headline: PM May: Important we see a strong vote from across parliament for Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday she wanted lawmakers from all parties to back the Brexit deal she is aiming to strike, citing the need to pass further legislation to prepare for Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: UK parliament will not vote on revised Brexit deal this week - May's office
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May told her top team of ministers on Tuesday that parliament would not be asked to vote on a revised Brexit deal this week as she needed more time to negotiate with the European Union, her office said.

Headline: May to promise new Brexit debate in push for more negotiating time
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will pledge this week to give parliament another chance to voice their opinions on Brexit by Feb. 27 as she tries to buy more time to negotiate a new deal with the European Union.

Headline: Factbox: Brexit - What will happen in the British parliament on February 14?
Description: The British parliament is set to hold a debate on Brexit on Feb. 14 but this is not a re-run of a vote last month on whether to approve the exit deal Prime Minister Theresa May's negotiated with the European Union.

Headline: No need to be 'purist' about change to Brexit backstop - Leadsom
Description: Britain's parliament will not support Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal unless the Irish backstop measure is time-restricted but this does not necessarily mean the agreement has to be renegotiated, House of Commons leader Andrea Leadsom said.

Headline: May rejects pivot towards Brexit customs union compromise
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has rejected the idea of targeting a customs union with the European Union, pouring cold water on hopes from some that she could shift her Brexit policy to win over the opposition Labour Party.

Headline: Fox says Brexit is not the only reason for GDP slowdown
Description: Britain's economic slowdown should not be blamed entirely on Brexit, British Trade Minister Liam Fox said on Monday after data showed the economy last year grew at its slowest since 2012.

Headline: 'Something has to give,' EU's Barnier tells Brexit Britain
Description: European Union Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Monday British Prime Minister Theresa May should endorse a permanent customs union with the bloc - as proposed by the opposition Labour party - to break the impasse over their looming divorce.

Headline: "Something has to give," EU's Barnier tells Brexit UK
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier suggested on Monday British Prime Minister Theresa moves towards proposals by the opposition Labour Party on a permanent customs union with the bloc to break the impasse over the details of the looming divorce.

Headline: British cabinet ministers believe PM May preparing to resign - The Sun
Description: Cabinet ministers now believe Theresa May is preparing to resign as British Prime Minister this summer so she can influence who succeeds her, The Sun newspaper reported on Monday.

Headline: EU, UK Brexit negotiators hold 'constructive' talks - UK spokesperson
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier and Britain's Brexit Secretary Stephen Barclay held a "constructive" meeting in Brussels on Monday evening, a British government spokesperson said.

Headline: UK public services face post-Brexit squeeze, forecasters warn
Description: Many British public services risk ongoing real-terms cuts for years to come, despite a softer fiscal stance from finance minister Philip Hammond, a major think tank predicted ahead of a half-yearly budget update next month.

Headline: Post-Brexit UK ready to use "hard power" - defence minister
Description: Britain will use military force to support its interests after Brexit, defence minister Gavin Williamson said on Monday, in a speech setting out a global role for the armed forces but with little detail on how to fund such ambitions in the long term.

Headline: UK pitches 'global Britain' by flexing military muscle - defence minister
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's "Global Britain" slogan is more than a pithy phrase because the United Kingdom will be ready to flex its military muscles after it leaves the European Union, defence minister Gavin Williamson said on Monday.

Headline: PM May to make Brexit statement on Tuesday - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will make a statement on Tuesday to update lawmakers on her talks to win changes to the Brexit deal, her spokesman said on Monday, before parliament votes on her next steps.

Headline: Hammond says now not time for Brexit delay - Channel 4
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond does not believe the time is right for Britain to ask the European Union to delay its scheduled March 29 departure from the bloc, broadcaster Channel 4 reported on Monday.

Headline: EU's Moscovici - We must be prepared for all Brexit scenarios
Description: European Economic Commissioner Pierre Moscovici said on Monday that it was necessary for the European Union and all of its member states to be ready for all possible scenarios regarding Britain's expected departure from the European Union.

Headline: German minister - Can't accept hard border between Northern Ireland and Ireland
Description: German Justice Minister Katarina Barley said on Monday it was crucial to ensure that Britain's expected departure from the European Union did not create a hard border between Northern Ireland and Ireland.

Headline: UK needs an Irish backstop exit mechanism for Brexit deal - Boris Johnson
Description: The United Kingdom needs to secure changes to Brexit deal's Irish border backstop such as a time limit and an exit mechanism, former Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said on Monday.

Headline: UK approaches Gulf countries on post-Brexit trade pact - UAE minister
Description: Britain has approached the United Arab Emirates and other Gulf countries on a possible trade pact after Britain leaves the European Union, the UAE economy minister said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit referendum spurs British companies into investing in EU - research
Description: The 2016 Brexit vote spurred British companies into increasing investment in European Union countries sharply, likely at the expense of spending at home, an academic study showed on Monday.

Headline: UK and Switzerland to sign post-Brexit trade agreement
Description: Britain and Switzerland will sign an agreement on Monday to continue trading on preferential terms after Brexit, the British trade department said, protecting a trade relationship worth 32 billion pounds.

Headline: No deal Brexit chances are rising, says CBI business lobby
Description: The chances of Britain leaving the European Union next month without a deal have increased and the country has now entered "the emergency zone", the head of business lobby group the Confederation of British Industry told Sky news on Sunday.

Headline: May can secure a Brexit deal with EU - minister
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May can reach a deal with the European Union to alter parts of the Brexit agreement relating to the Northern Irish border, Treasury minister Liz Truss told Sky News on Sunday.

Headline: Irish prime minister says Brexit deal 'can be done'
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar on Friday said he believed "a deal can be done" to avoid a disorderly British exit from the EU, after a meeting with a key ally of British Prime Minister Theresa May that he said went very well.

Headline: Spain hires 1,700 new public workers to focus on Brexit issues
Description: The Spanish government approved on Friday a decree to hire 1,735 new public workers to deal with the consequences of Brexit, particularly in the areas of border and customs control.

Headline: EU urges May to seize Labour opening as way out of Brexit impasse
Description: It's a proposal that is not even on the table, and reverses Theresa May's determined position - but EU officials are still urging her to grasp an offer from the Labour opposition to break an impasse over the terms of Britain's EU exit.

Headline: In Brussels, EU gives May glimpse of Brexit hope
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May came away from a day in an increasingly impatient Brussels on Thursday with a pledge of renewed talks that held out some hope for a new Brexit deal, if no sign of compromise yet.

Headline: Lithuania sees flood of fintech firms apply for licences ahead of Brexit
Description: About 100 financial companies and start-ups from Britain and elsewhere are applying for a licence in burgeoning fintech hub Lithuania to ensure they have access to the European Union after Brexit, the country's central bank told Reuters.

Headline: EU's Barnier to reaffirm on Monday openness to rework Brexit political declaration
Description: The EU's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said he would reiterate on Monday at a planned meeting with Britain's Brexit minister that the EU would not re-open the Brexit deal, but was ready to rework the political declaration that accompanies it.

Headline: UK, Norway, Iceland agree on citizens' rights if no-deal Brexit
Description: Britain and the so-called EEA EFTA countries, Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway, have reached an agreement on citizens' rights should Britain leave the EU without a withdrawal agreement, Iceland's government said on Friday.

Headline: Bank of America appoints head of new EU unit in Brexit move
Description: Bank of America Merrill Lynch has named Sanaz Zaimi as head of its new Paris-based European Union broker-dealer unit BofA Securities Europe, the U.S. bank said on Friday.

Headline: May will press for changes to Brexit deal with Irish PM - spokeswoman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will use a dinner with Ireland's Leo Varadkar on Friday to build on talks she held with EU leaders and press her argument for legally binding changes to the Brexit divorce deal, her spokeswoman said.

Headline: Explainer - The Brexit backstop conundrum
Description: A row between London and the European Union over the "Irish backstop" is blocking a Brexit deal and could mean Britain leaving on March 29 without one, disrupting trade.

Headline: Factbox: Brexit - What will happen in the British parliament on February 14?
Description: The British parliament is set to hold a debate on Brexit on Feb. 14 but this is not a re-run of a vote last month on whether to approve the exit deal Prime Minister Theresa May's negotiated with the European Union.

Headline: May says EU leaders want to ensure UK leaves with a deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday that she saw and heard a desire from European Union leaders to ensure Britain leaves the bloc with a deal.

Headline: Authorities working to guard against hard Brexit fallout - German finance minister
Description: German finance minister Olaf Scholz on Thursday warned Germans to prepare for a hard Brexit, and said that European authorities would aim to minimize the risks of Britain withdrawing from the European Union without a deal.

Headline: More work to do for Brexit deal after Brussels talks - senior UK official
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May knows her government has "got work to do" to try to secure changes to her divorce deal with the European Union, a senior official in her office said, describing talks in Brussels as part of a process.

Headline: May approaches number of Labour MPs for amendment to withdrawal motion - The Sun
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has approached a number of members of parliament from the opposition Labour Party to put forward an amendment to her withdrawal motion, The Sun newspaper reported late on Thursday.

Headline: With Troubles in mind, Irish concern grows over British stance on border
Description: As Britain's exit from the European Union grows closer with no agreement reached on the Irish border, many in Ireland fear that pro-Brexit British politicians have forgotten the bombs and bullets of three decades of conflict in Northern Ireland and fail to grasp how high the stakes are for the entire island.

Headline: U.S. congressman tells London Irish border could weigh on UK-U.S. trade deal
Description: An influential U.S. Congressman warned Britain on Thursday that the prospects for any bilateral trade deal could be influenced by what agreement is reached over the Irish border in a Brexit accord.

Headline: Brexit deal needs insurance policy for Irish border - PM May's spokeswoman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is talking to the European Union about what form an insurance policy to ensure there is no return of a hard border on the island of Ireland should take, her spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: France would oppose Brexit delay without a plan - government official
Description: France would oppose any British request to delay Brexit if London was simply delaying making a decision, but could agree if London presented a credible political solution, a French government official said on Thursday.

Headline: EU's Tusk sees no Brexit breakthroguh, says talks will continue
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said that British Prime Minister Theresa May's visit to Brussels on Thursday brought no breakthrough but that talks on Brexit between the EU and the UK would go on.

Headline: EU's Verhofstadt - closer ties after Brexit could overcome backstop impasse
Description: The European Union is ready to have a closer relationship with the United Kingdom after Brexit so that the contentious Irish border backstop would never have to be used, the Brexit pointman for the bloc's parliament said.

Headline: BoE's Carney says surprised by Tusk's Brexit 'hell' jibe
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Thursday he was surprised by comments from European Council President Donald Tusk that there was a "place in hell" for British leaders who sold Brexit with no plan for delivering it.

Headline: Mobile roaming will not be protected in no-deal Brexit - UK minister
Description: British tourists could see the return of expensive mobile roaming charges when they go on holiday the day after Britain leaves the European Union in the event of a no-deal Brexit, Digital Minister Jeremy Wright said on Thursday.

Headline: BoE's Carney says Brexit might not be fully tied up by March 29
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Thursday that Britain's departure from the European Union, scheduled in 50 days' time, might not be fully "tied up" by then.

Headline: Eleventh-hour Brexit deal? Legislation backlog may still prompt delay
Description: If Britain's parliament has not approved a Brexit deal by the end of February, Prime Minister Theresa May is likely to have to seek a delay to Britain's March 29 exit from the EU as there will not be time to pass all the required legislation.

Headline: Factbox - What Brexit legislation does Britain still need to pass before EU exit?
