Description: The British parliament's vote on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal will determine the future of the country, the chief EU Brexit negotiator said on Thursday, insisting that the deal was the only route to secure an orderly withdrawal from the EU.

Headline: EU judges to rule on Brexit on eve of May's crucial vote
Description: The EU's top court will say on Monday whether Britain can unilaterally halt Brexit, potentially offering a boost to those opposed to leaving the European Union on the very eve of a crucial and tumultuous vote in the British parliament.

Headline: Hammond says too late to negotiate new Brexit deal
Description: Britain's Chancellor Philip Hammond said it is a delusion to think that the government will be able to negotiate a new divorce deal with the European Union if the prime minister's agreement is defeated in a vote in parliament next week.

Headline: Some cabinet members invited to see May on Thursday - Times reporter
Description: Some senior British ministers have been invited to see Prime Minister Theresa May at 1330 GMT on Thursday, a reporter from the Times newspaper said on Twitter.

Headline: UK parliament vote on Brexit deal will go ahead on Dec. 11 - House of Commons leader
Description: The British parliament's vote on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal will go ahead as planned on Dec. 11, the leader of the House of Commons, Andrea Leadsom, said on Thursday.

Headline: PM May says - It's my deal, no deal or no Brexit at all
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday that British lawmakers faced a choice ahead of a vote on her Brexit deal: approving her deal or facing an exit with no deal or even the reversal of Brexit.

Headline: Britain will be ready for a no deal Brexit - minister
Description: Britain will be ready for a no deal Brexit by March next year but significant work will be required, Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said on Thursday.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP says would not topple UK government in confidence vote
Description: The Northern Irish party that props up Theresa May's Conservative government would not vote to topple her in a confidence vote even if she loses a key vote on her Brexit deal next week, DUP lawmaker Sammy Wilson said.

Headline: "Brexit premium" drives up euro borrowing costs for UK firms as EU exit looms
Description: British companies are being forced to pay more to borrow on international bond markets than their European peers as investors demand a hefty premium to compensate for a future hit to business and the UK economy from Brexit.

Headline: Sterling's fate hangs on Brexit, UK growth to be weak - Reuters poll
Description: Sterling's near-term fate hangs on whether British Prime Minister Theresa May manages to get her Brexit withdrawal deal through Parliament, according to Reuters polls that also found economic growth will be weak.

Headline: UK economy risks severe damage without orderly Brexit - CBI
Description: Britain will struggle to achieve even modest economic growth next year unless the government secures an orderly Brexit in March, the Confederation of British Industry said on Thursday.

Headline: May's Brexit deal under fire as legal advice stiffens opposition
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal came under fire from allies and opponents alike on Wednesday after the government was forced to publish legal advice showing the United Kingdom could be locked indefinitely in the European Union's orbit.

Headline: UK aviation firms scramble to avoid red tape of 'hard Brexit'
Description: European regulators are handling bids from hundreds of British aviation firms for permits allowing them to keep doing business with continental airlines in the event of a disorderly exit from the European Union as planning for a "hard Brexit" intensifies.

Headline: Factbox: Britain's Brexit vote - How many MPs are backing May?
Description: Britain's parliament is debating whether to support Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal, a decision which will define Britain's departure from the European Union and could determine her own future as leader.

Headline: PM May's chief enforcer listens to eurosceptic concerns over Brexit - source
Description: One of Prime Minister Theresa May's chief party enforcers listened to the concerns of eurosceptics in the governing Conservative Party and Northern Irish DUP on Wednesday, part of a charm offensive to try to win the Brexit vote next week.

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP will support government in confidence motion if Brexit deal voted down - statement
Description: The Northern Irish party propping up Prime Minister Theresa May's government will vote against any attempt to topple her if she is defeated in a vote to approve her Brexit deal next week, a group of eurosceptic MPs said on Wednesday.

Headline: Scottish parliament vents anger at May's Brexit plan
Description: Scottish political parties joined forces on Wednesday to show their opposition to both Prime Minister Theresa May's "damaging" deal for leaving the European Union and the possibility of a no-deal Brexit.

Headline: EU 'willing to help' if May loses -- up to a point
Description: If British Prime Minister Theresa May loses a vote in parliament on her divorce agreement with the European Union next week, EU leaders won't rip it up and start negotiating again -- but they could help her try to win a second bout.

Headline: Re-opening Brexit deal holds potential dangers - PM's spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is clear on the potential dangers of reopening the deal to leave the European Union, her spokesman said on Wednesday, adding that the withdrawal agreement was complete.

Headline: UK housebuilder shares bounce as traders hedge Brexit bets
Description: Shares in UK housebuilders bounced off two-year lows on Wednesday as investors and traders covered bearish bets ahead of next week's vote on Prime Minister May's Brexit deal.

Headline: Brexit betrayal would hurt UK more than leaving - Hammond
Description: A Brexit outcome that left a large segment of the British people feeling betrayed would damage the country more than the small economic cost of Prime Minister Theresa May's preferred Brexit plan, Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Wednesday.

Headline: Javid says government is looking at ways of making Brexit backstop more acceptable
Description: British home secretary Sajid Javid said on Wednesday the government was listening and continuing to explore ways to make the so-called backstop arrangement in the Brexit deal more acceptable to members of parliament in a Northern Irish Party.

Headline: May's spokesman declines to confirm reports of backstop amendment
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is continuing to meet colleagues to try to find a way forward for her Brexit deal, her  spokesman said when asked about reports of a possible amendment in relation to the Northern Irish backstop.

Headline: May considering Northern Irish backstop amendment - ITV reporter
Description: UK Prime Minister Theresa May is discussing an amendment to her Brexit deal which would mean the government would need parliament's backing before it can enter into the Northern Irish backstop, in an effort to win more support for it, an ITV reporter said.

Headline: EU says ready for no-deal Brexit if UK sinks deal
Description: The European Union is continuing with contingency planning in order to manage Britain's withdrawal from the bloc in the event the British parliament next week rejects a Brexit deal, a senior EU official said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain could be stuck in 'protracted' Brexit talks via backstop - legal advice
Description: Britain risks becoming stuck in "protracted and repeating rounds" of negotiations to leave the European Union if it enters a so-called backstop arrangement, the government's legal advice said on Wednesday.

Headline: Irish backstop for UK's Brexit withdrawal deal could last 'indefinitely'
Description: Britain could be trapped "indefinitely" in a customs union with the European Union if members of parliament back Prime Minister Theresa May’s Brexit deal, according to details of the government's full legal advice on the deal published on Wednesday.

Headline: UK MPs' attempts to stop Brexit is stealing from British people - trade secretary
Description: Britain's trade secretary Liam Fox on Wednesday compared MPs' attempts to thwart the government's deal to leave the European Union to stealing Brexit from the majority of British people who voted in favour of it.

Headline: JPMorgan sees 40 percent chance of no-Brexit vs 20 percent previously
Description: There is now a 40 percent probability of Britain staying in the European Union, economists at JP Morgan said on Wednesday, citing a European Court of Justice opinion the previous day that Britain could unilaterally revoke Brexit if it wanted.

Headline: No deal Brexit is 'default' position if May loses vote - Leadsom
Description: Britain will leave the European Union without a deal in March if lawmakers vote against Prime Minister Theresa May's deal, Andrea Leadsom, leader of the lower house of parliament told BBC radio on Wednesday.

Headline: Senior Conservative says PM May's deal will fail - Telegraph
Description: A senior lawmaker in Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party said he would vote against her Brexit deal and predicted parliament would reject it by at least 80 votes, The Telegraph newspaper reported.

Headline: PM May suffers setbacks as Brexit debate starts in parliament
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May suffered embarrassing defeats on Tuesday at the start of five days of debate over her plans to leave the European Union that could determine the future of Brexit and the fate of her government.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP says will vote against May's Brexit deal
Description: The Northern Irish party propping up Prime Minister Theresa May's government will vote against her Brexit divorce deal in a key vote in parliament next week, according to one its MPs.

Headline: Former foreign secretary Johnson says hopes that parliament votes down government's Brexit deal
Description: Former foreign secretary Boris Johnson said on Tuesday he hoped parliament would vote against the government's Brexit deal, calling it a national humiliation that made a mockery of the decision to leave the European Union.

Headline: Corbyn - Brexit deal is a leap in the dark
Description: The leader of the Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, said on Tuesday that the government's proposed Brexit deal was a leap in the dark, and that Prime Minister Theresa May should seek a better one or step aside.

Headline: Don't let search for perfect Brexit stop deal - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday the Brexit deal she needs parliament to approve was not perfect but was the best one possible without risking a no-deal Brexit or no exit from the European Union at all.

Headline: Brexit backstop is no trap for UK - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday that a key backstop clause of her Brexit deal with the European Union, which is opposed by many MPs in her Conservative Party, was not a trap for Britain.

Headline: May's government loses contempt vote over Brexit legal advice
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government was found in contempt of parliament on Tuesday for refusing to release its full legal advice on Brexit, underlining the depth of opposition among MPs to her deal on leaving the European Union.

Headline: Brexit debate is corrosive, new referendum would make it worse - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday the debate about Brexit was corrosive and divisions would be worsened if the government held a new referendum on the country's membership of the European Union.

Headline: Chaos, or keep calm and carry on? What happens if May loses Brexit vote
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May needs to win approval for her Brexit deal in parliament on Dec. 11. But critics are lining up on all sides to say they will oppose it and the chances of the government winning a vote currently look slim.

Headline: Sterling skids to lowest since June 2017 after PM PM May loses Brexit contempt vote
Description: Sterling <GBP=D3> skidded on Tuesday to its weakest since June 2017 after Prime Minister Theresa May's government was found in contempt of parliament for refusing to release its full legal advice on Brexit.

Headline: UK government loses vote giving parliament more power over Brexit process
Description: The British government lost a vote in parliament on Tuesday that could force it to give parliament an increased say over the Brexit process if Prime Minister Theresa May's current exit deal is rejected by MPs.

Headline: UK lawmakers will debate move to take control of Brexit process
Description: British lawmakers will later on Tuesday debate whether to hand more power to parliament over what happens next if Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal is rejected on Dec. 11, in a move which could diminish the chances of a no-deal exit.

Headline: Factbox - Britain's big Brexit vote: What happens in parliament?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May must win a vote in parliament on Dec. 11 to get her Brexit deal approved or risk seeing Britain's exit from the European Union descend into chaos less than four months before it is due to leave.

Headline: UK will not revoke Article 50 after EU adviser says it could - PM's spokesman
Description: The British government is not going to revoke its notice to quit the European Union, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday after the EU's top legal adviser said Britain had the right to do so.

Headline: Brexit hash makes Britain 'hot heads' of Europe - city chief
Description: Mismanagement of Brexit has made Britain the new "hot heads" of Europe and caused damage to its valuable financial services industry that will take at least a decade to repair, the City of London's policy chief said.

Headline: Factbox - Impact on banks from Britain's vote to leave the EU
Description: With the terms of Britain's exit from the European Union still hanging in the balance, international banks are setting up subsidiaries across the bloc to ensure they can continue to serve clients after next March.

Headline: Britain can revoke Brexit unilaterally, EU court adviser says
Description: Britain should be allowed to unilaterally revoke its departure notice from the European Union, an adviser to the bloc's highest court said on Tuesday, before a landmark ruling in the coming weeks.

Headline: UK consumer spending slows in run-up to Brexit - industry data
Description: British consumer spending grew last month at its slowest pace in more than a year, excluding Easter distortions, with online Black Friday sales failing to offset a lack of confidence about the economy ahead of Brexit, industry data showed on Tuesday.

Headline: UK rakes in record 75 billion pounds in City taxes amid Brexit warnings
Description: Financial services firms in Britain paid a record 75 billion pounds in taxes in the last financial year, but City bosses warned a chaotic Brexit could blow a hole in the industry's tax receipts in future years.

Headline: Presenting legal advice, May fans flames of Brexit rebellion
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's government fought on Monday to defend its Brexit deal by outlining the legal basis for parliament to support its plan to leave the European Union, but instead seemed to fan the flames of rebellion.

Headline: Labour accuses May's government of breaking parliament rules
Description: Britain's opposition Labour party said Theresa May's government had ignored an instruction by parliament to publish in full its legal advice on the deal to leave the European Union.

Headline: 'Arguable case' UK government in contempt of parliament over Brexit advice, speaker says
Description: The British government may be in contempt of parliament for declining to release its full legal advice on Britain's exit from the European Union, parliamentary speaker John Bercow said on Monday.

Headline: House of Commons speaker to rule quickly on contempt proceedings
Description: Britain's parliamentary speaker John Bercow said he would make a decision as early as Monday evening on whether the government is in contempt of parliament for failing to release its full legal advice on Brexit.

Headline: UK watchdog cautions banks over hasty Brexit moves
Description: International banks in Britain should resist pressure from European Union regulators to shift their non-EU business to new hubs in the bloc because of Brexit, Britain's markets watchdog said on Monday.

Headline: Britain will not be trapped permanently in a customs union - government lawyer
Description: Britain's government is committed to the so-called backstop arrangement on the Northern Irish border after Brexit, but does not believe that it will be trapped permanently in a EU customs union, the government's Attorney General Geoffrey Cox said.

Headline: EU, UK can't end Northern Irish backstop unilaterally after Brexit - government lawyer
Description: The agreement on Britain's exit from the EU provided no unilateral right for the bloc or Britain to end a so-called backstop arrangement on the Northern Irish border after Brexit, the government's Attorney General Geoffrey Cox said on Monday.

Headline: UK will face some trade restrictions in Brexit backstop - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said Britain would face some restrictions for doing new trade deals if it had to enter a so-called backstop period as part of its departure from the European Union.

Headline: May says ahead of Brexit vote - I will still have a job in two weeks
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she would still be in her job in two weeks time, downplaying speculation that she might resign if she loses a key Brexit vote in parliament which is scheduled for Dec. 11.

Headline: 'Full reasoned position' on Brexit legal advice will be published - PM's spokesman
Description: Britain will publish a "full reasoned position statement" on the legal advice for Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal as promised, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Neither UK or EU want to use Brexit 'backstop' - May's adviser
Description: Neither the United Kingdom nor the European Union want to enter into a backstop agreement to avoid a return of border controls between Northern Ireland and the Irish republic, British Prime Minister Theresa May's Europe adviser said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit path unclear if May loses key vote - Brexit minister
Description: Britain's Brexit minister said it was unclear what would happen if the deal Prime Minister Theresa May has agreed with other European Union leaders is rejected in a key vote in parliament on Dec. 11.

Headline: UK government will not pull December 11 Brexit deal vote, minister says
Description: Next week's parliamentary vote on British Prime Minister Theresa May's deal will go ahead, interior minister Sajid Javid said on Monday, rejecting media speculation that the government might not go ahead with the vote because they could lose it.

Headline: Hoping to win Brexit support, May says world leaders ready for trade
Description: Several world leaders are keen to strike trade deals with Britain once the country is out of the European Union, Prime Minister Theresa May will say on Monday, pressing the case for her Brexit deal before a fateful Dec. 11 vote in parliament.

Headline: Sweden's Handelsbanken Brexit-proofs its UK operations
Description: Sweden's Handelsbanken said it had converted its British branch into a subsidiary that would operate as a standalone business, helping to shield the bank from any potentially disruptive Brexit next March.

Headline: Labour threatens May with new Brexit hurdle
Description: The Labour Party said on Sunday it would press for contempt proceedings against the government if Prime Minister Theresa May fails to produce the full legal advice she has received on her Brexit deal.

Headline: Publish legal advice on Brexit, says former foreign secretary Johnson
Description: Former foreign secretary Boris Johnson said on Sunday that Prime Minister Theresa May should publish the legal advice she was given on her Brexit deal, joining calls by the Labour Party.

Headline: Government can win Brexit vote in parliament - UK environment minister
Description: British environment minister Michael Gove said on Sunday he believed the government could win a vote in parliament on its Brexit deal, again arguing that the alternatives to the agreement were much worse.

Headline: Attorney general will make statement on legal advice to satisfy UK parliament - Conservatives
Description: Britain's attorney general will make a statement to parliament on Monday on what legal advice the government has received on its Brexit deal and lawmakers should be satisfied by it, the chairman of the governing Conservative Party said on Sunday.

Headline: I will be PM to take Britain out of EU, says May
Description: Theresa May said on Saturday she would be the prime minister to take Britain out of the European Union and that parliament should back her Brexit deal to ensure certainty for the future.

Headline: Japan's Abe urges UK PM May to avoid 'no deal' Brexit
Description: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe on Saturday urged British Prime Minster Theresa May to ensure stability as Britain leaves the European Union and asked her to do what she could to avoid a 'no deal' Brexit.

Headline: May says she's focussed on her Brexit deal, not a plan B
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday she was focussed on persuading lawmakers to back her EU divorce deal at a vote in parliament on Dec. 11 rather than preparing a plan B, accusing opponents of trying to betray voters over Brexit.

Headline: May says opposition Labour Party is playing politics with Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday that the opposition Labour Party was trying to betray voters by frustrating the government's attempt to implement Brexit.

Headline: EU's Tusk says no deal or no Brexit if UK parliament rejects deal
Description: Britain's choice would be to leave the European Union without a deal or abandon Brexit altogether if its parliament rejects an agreement between the EU and Prime Minister Theresa May, European Council President Donald Tusk said on Friday.

Headline: No plans for Christmas Brexit vote - PM's spokeswoman
Description: Britain's government does not plan to recall parliament over the Christmas period to push through legislation on leaving the European Union, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Friday.

Headline: PM has changed public mood in favour of her Brexit deal - trade minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has been effective in changing the public mood in favour of her Brexit deal, UK trade minister Liam Fox told BBC radio on Friday.

Headline: Brexit deal good for global economy, May to tell G20
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will tell world leaders on Friday that the Brexit agreement she has reached with the European Union will have positive consequences for the global economy.

Headline: Scottish parties unite against May's Conservatives on Brexit deal
Description: Scottish political parties will unite against the Conservatives, the party of British Prime Minister Theresa May, in a rare joint front to show their anger at her plan to leave the European Union.

Headline: UK lawmakers propose amendment to stop PM May's Brexit deal and no-deal
Description: A group of senior British lawmakers on Thursday put forward an amendment to block Prime Minister Theresa May's EU withdrawal deal and to rule out a no-deal Brexit when it comes before parliament for a crucial vote next month.

Headline: UK government will face votes on Brexit alternatives before final approval ballot
Description: The British parliament will vote on attempts to alter or thwart Brexit before Prime Minister Theresa May's own exit deal is put to a must-win ballot of members of parliament, the government's parliamentary spokeswoman, Andrea Leadsom, said on Thursday.

Headline: May says any Article 50 extension reopens the Brexit negotiations
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday that any decision to extend the Brexit negotiating period would reopen the exit deal she has agreed with the European Union, adding that she would not seek any extension.

Headline: Factbox: Britain's big Brexit vote - What happens in parliament?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May must win a vote in parliament on Dec. 11 to get her Brexit deal approved or risk seeing Britain's exit from the European Union descend into chaos four months before it is due to leave.

Headline: Britain biggest loser in disorderly Brexit - ECB's de Guindos
Description: The euro zone bank sector is prepared for a hard Brexit and the Bank of England is right to warn of a deep recession if Britain leaves the bloc without a deal, European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos said on Thursday.

Headline: It's the only deal possible, EU's Barnier tells Brexit Britain
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier told Britain on Thursday the Brexit deal the bloc agreed with Prime Minister Theresa May was the only one possible.

Headline: May: Political voting agreement with Northern Irish DUP continues
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday the "confidence and supply" voting agreement with Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party remained in place.

Headline: Losing Brexit vote would necessitate no-deal preparation - PM May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday that if she loses a vote in parliament to approve her Brexit deal, some preparations for leaving the European Union without an agreement would need to be undertaken.

Headline: Frankfurt expects 750-800 billion euros in assets transferred due to Brexit
Description: Banks are expected to transfer 750-800 billion euros (664-709 billion pounds) in assets to Frankfurt due to Britain's departure from the European Union, the city's lobby group Frankfurt Main Finance (FMF) said on Thursday.

Headline: BoE's Carney says Brexit transition deal in UK's best interest - BBC
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Thursday it was in Britain's best interests to strike a transition deal with the European Union, regardless of whatever form Brexit takes.

Headline: DUP leader says open to alternative Brexit solutions - BBC radio
Description: The leader of the Northern Irish party that props up Britain's Conservative government said on Thursday it was open to alternatives to Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal with the European Union, which it does not support.

Headline: U.S., UK reach new post-Brexit deal on air services
Description: The United States and Britain have reached a deal on a new open skies aviation agreement to govern air travel after the UK exits the European Union, the two governments said on Wednesday.

Headline: Extreme Brexit could be worse than financial crisis for UK - BoE
Description: Britain risks suffering an even bigger hit to its economy than during the global financial crisis 10 years ago if it leaves the European Union in a worst-case Brexit scenario in four months' time, the Bank of England said on Wednesday.

Headline: Labour to propose amendment aimed at avoiding no-deal Brexit
Description: Britain's main opposition Labour Party set out its bid to block a "no deal" Brexit on Wednesday, saying it wanted to put the idea to a vote in parliament during a debate on the exit agreement Prime Minister Theresa May has negotiated.

Headline: UK government to face challenges to May's Brexit plan in parliament
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's bid to win approval for her Brexit deal will have to overcome attempts to block or change it by rival lawmakers on Dec. 11, a proposed format for the debate published on Wednesday showed.

Headline: British banks withstand disorderly Brexit in Bank of England test
Description: All seven British banks and building societies in this year's Bank of England stress test passed, indicating they could withstand a disorderly Brexit without having to curb lending.

Headline: Worst-case Brexit more painful than global financial crisis, Bank of England warns
Description: Britain risks a bigger hit to its economy than during the global financial crisis a decade ago if it leaves the European Union in a "disorderly" manner in March next year, the Bank of England warned on Wednesday.

Headline: Bank of England's Carney gives news conference after Brexit report
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney and other officials at the central bank are speaking at a news conference after the BoE published a report on the impact of Brexit.

Headline: Factbox - The cost of Brexit: Britain sets out the scenarios
Description: Britain's government intensified its warnings on Wednesday about a no-deal Brexit, saying it would damage the economy while Prime Minister Theresa May's plan for leaving the European Union, opposed by many lawmakers, would soften the blow.

Headline: Labour could back option of second Brexit vote, says McDonnell
Description: The opposition Labour Party's finance spokesman said another Brexit referendum is an option if a vote of no confidence fails to bring down the government or trigger a general election.

Headline: Not possible to have second Brexit vote before UK leaves EU - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday it was not possible to hold a second Brexit referendum before Britain leaves the EU on March 29 next year, meaning those pressing for such a vote would delay the UK departure or increase the possibility of leaving without a deal.

Headline: Stopping Brexit would leave Britain fractured - Hammond
Description: Stopping Britain's exit from the European Union would leave the country fractured even though this would be the best outcome for the economy, the finance minister Philip Hammond said.

Headline: UK environment minister Gove throws support behind PM's Brexit deal
Description: Environment minister Michael Gove threw his support behind Prime Minister Theresa May's deal to leave the European Union on Wednesday, saying it was the best one for Britain and the only one he was advocating.

Headline: Norway may help 'find solutions' if Britain seeks to join EFTA - PM
Description: Norway may lend support for a potential bid by Britain to rejoin the European Free Trade Association (EFTA) if so wished by London after it exits the European Union, Prime Minister Erna Solberg said on Wednesday.

Headline: Analysis shows Brexit deal is best for Britain - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday her government's analysis of various Brexit scenarios showed that the deal she negotiated with Brussels was the best to deliver on a 2016 referendum and to protect the economy.

Headline: UK government ramps up Brexit warnings with new economic forecasts
Description: Britain's government intensified its warnings about a no-deal Brexit, saying it would deliver a big blow to the economy while Prime Minister Theresa May's plan, opposed by many members of parliament, would minimise the hit.

Headline: EU court adviser to publish opinion on Brexit reversibility case on Dec. 4
Description: The advocate general of the European Union's top court will give his opinion on Dec. 4 as to whether Britain can unilaterally reverse Brexit, the court said on Wednesday.

Headline: Banks extend UK plc's overdraft ahead of Brexit
Description: Banks in Britain are trying to prepare businesses for a potential cash crunch after Brexit, whether or not a deal agreed by the UK and Brussels this weekend is approved by parliament next month.

Headline: May's plan best for UK economy under Brexit - Hammond
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond, speaking ahead of a government report on the economic impact of various Brexit scenarios, said Prime Minister Theresa May's plan was the best one for the economy.

Headline: May pitches Brexit deal to Scotland ahead of crucial vote
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will take her Brexit sales pitch to Scotland on Wednesday, where she will likely face an uphill struggle to convince sceptical voters of the benefits of her deal for businesses and the fishing industry.

Headline: U.S. envoy to Britain says Brexit is for the British to decide - The Times
Description: The U.S. ambassador to Britain, Woody Johnson, said that Britain's exit from the European Union is for the British people to decide, but the United States remains keen to work out a trade deal with the UK, The Times reported on Tuesday, citing an essay written by Johnson for the newspaper.

Headline: Three quarters of UK carmakers fear no-deal Brexit - SMMT
Description: Three quarters of businesses in Britain's automotive sector think leaving the European Union next year without a transition deal would hurt them, an industry survey showed on Tuesday.

Headline: With parliament vote in doubt, PM tours UK to drum up support for Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May began a tour of the United Kingdom to drum up support for her Brexit divorce deal with the European Union, while her deputy said on Tuesday parliament might reject it if asked to vote on it now.

Headline: UK government and Bank of England to give Brexit reports on Wednesday
Description: The Bank of England and the British government will deliver their assessments of the economic impact of Brexit on Wednesday as Prime Minister Theresa May tries to overcome deep opposition to the deal she struck with Brussels.

Headline: UK to publish Brexit economic analysis on Wednesday - May's spokesman
Description: The British government will publish its economic analysis of a range of different Brexit scenarios on Wednesday afternoon, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said.

Headline: EU's top court urged to rule Brexit can be reversed
Description: Britain can unilaterally reverse its decision to leave the European Union, an urgent hearing of Europe's top court was told on Tuesday in a case supporters of EU membership hope could pave the way to a second referendum and ultimately stop Brexit.

Headline: Britain will head into unknown if Brexit deal is rejected - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May warned on Monday that Britain would be thrust into the unknown if parliament rejects the Brexit deal she has negotiated with the European Union, as members of parliament from all sides lined up to criticise the agreement.

Headline: Trump says Brexit agreement may hamper U.S.-British trade; UK differs
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday the agreement allowing the United Kingdom to leave the European Union may make trade between Washington and London more difficult, but the UK prime minister's office disputed his interpretation.

Headline: Wishful thinking that EU will reopen Brexit talks if parliament rejects deal - Lidington
Description: It is wishful thinking that the European Union will reopen Brexit negotiations if the British parliament votes down the deal Prime Minister Theresa May has agreed with Brussels, her de facto deputy David Lidington said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK parliament would reject Brexit deal if vote was held now - UK minister
Description: Britain's parliament would reject Prime Minister Theresa May's proposed Brexit deal if the vote was held now, her de facto deputy David Lidington said on Tuesday.

Headline: May's Brexit deal prospects ebb as top ally rejects it
Description: One of British Prime Minister Theresa May's most trusted lawmakers said on Tuesday he will not back her Brexit deal, further stacking the odds against it passing through parliament next month.

Headline: 'No plan B' - Lidington warns UK lawmakers not to shun Brexit deal
Description: Britain's government has no "plan B" if it cannot get the terms of its withdrawal agreement through parliament, Cabinet Office Minister David Lidington said on Tuesday.

Headline: Some UK lawmakers could support PM May's deal if she gives her exit date - The Times
Description: Some Brexit-supporting lawmakers in British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party could support her divorce deal if she sets out when she will quit, The Times newspaper reported.

Headline: Liam Fox to visit Israel to push post-Brexit trade
Description: British trade minister Liam Fox is visiting Tel Aviv on Tuesday to discuss post-Brexit trade opportunities with major Israeli investors and tech-companies, his office said.

Headline: May begins tour of Britain to sell Brexit deal benefits
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will travel to Northern Ireland and Wales on Tuesday as part of a tour of the United Kingdom designed to rally support for her widely criticised Brexit deal before a vote in parliament.

Headline: May to business - my Brexit deal gives you the certainty you need
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May told business leaders on Monday she hoped that her proposed Brexit deal would give them certainty and reassurance as she was acutely aware of the effects a disorderly Brexit might have on them.

Headline: Brexit terms will allow new UK-U.S. trade deal, PM May's office says
Description: Britain's agreement to leave the European Union allows it to sign trade deals with the United States, Prime Minister Theresa May's office said on Monday after U.S. President Donald Trump said it may hamper U.S.-UK trade.

Headline: Factbox - Who has submitted letters of no confidence in PM May?
Description: Some lawmakers in Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party have said they have submitted letters of no confidence in the British leader.

Headline: May apologises for saying EU workers can't 'jump the queue'
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May apologised on Monday for saying that European Union migrant workers coming to Britain would no longer be able to "jump the queue" after Brexit.

Headline: UK expatriates cannot challenge Brexit talks - EU court
Description: European Union judges dismissed a case brought by a World War Two veteran and other Britons living on the continent against the Brexit negotiation, ruling on Monday that their rights as EU citizens had not yet been infringed.

Headline: EU agrees 'best possible' Brexit deal, urges Britons to back May
Description: European Union leaders finally sealed a Brexit deal on Sunday, saying the package agreed with Prime Minister Theresa May was the best Britain will get in a warning to the British parliament not to reject it.

Headline: May faces Brexit moment of truth in parliament
Description: Agreeing a Brexit deal with the European Union may have been the easy part for Prime Minister Theresa May. Getting it through a divided parliament at home could be an altogether tougher battle.

Headline: Brexit deal is best option to protect British economy - Hammond
Description: Britain's draft deal to leave the European Union is the best available solution to safeguard the economy and start to reunite a divided country, Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Saturday.

Headline: Some UK ministers seeking EFTA Plan B if May's deal fails - The Sun
Description: Some senior British ministers and some Labour lawmakers are discussing the possibility of the United Kingdom joining the European Free Trade Association (EFTA) if Theresa May's Brexit deal is rejected by parliament, The Sun newspaper reported.

Headline: Labour says Corbyn would 'relish' debate with May - media
Description: Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn would "relish a head-to-head debate" with Prime Minister Theresa May "about her botched Brexit deal", a spokesman said, Sky News reported https://bit.ly/2PVkr46 late on Sunday.

Headline: You face a stark choice - May warns MPs over Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will tell MPs on Monday they face a stark choice - either back the deal she negotiated to leave the European Union or reject it and take Britain "back to square one" with "more division and more uncertainty".

Headline: Labour Party will oppose Brexit deal - Corbyn
Description: Britain's main opposition Labour Party will oppose the government's Brexit deal in parliament, its leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Sunday, describing the agreement approved in Brussels as "a miserable failure of negotiation".

Headline: Praised over Brexit, Barnier could target EU top job
Description: European Union leaders lavished their Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier with praise on Sunday for securing a divorce agreement with Britain, strengthening the Frenchman's hand should he decide to run for the bloc's top job next year.

Headline: Highlights - EU leaders' comments at special Brexit summit
Description: The 27 EU national leaders gathered on Sunday to endorse both a detailed treaty setting out the terms on which Britain will leave the European Union and a declaration outlining how Britain can keep close to its biggest market by following many EU rules after a two to four year transition.

Headline: Spain revives call for shared control over Gibraltar after Brexit
Description: Spain will revive its bid for shared sovereignty over Gibraltar once Britain has left the European Union, the country's prime minister said on Sunday, adding Madrid had the support of the bloc to resolve the 300-year-old dispute.

Headline: EU's only Plan B is preparing no-deal Brexit - official
Description: The European Union has no plan to address a possible rejection of Sunday's Brexit deal in the British parliament other than its current planning for Britain leaving without a deal, a senior EU official said.

Headline: Jeremy Hunt calls parliamentary arithmetic for Brexit deal 'challenging'
Description: Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said the arithmetic in parliament to approve Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal was looking "challenging", but rejecting the deal would result in "very big risks" for the country.

Headline: France's Macron says prepared for all options on Brexit
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Sunday that if the British parliament rejects the Brexit deal, it will be for Britain to make new proposals.

Headline: May calls on lawmakers to back Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May called on lawmakers on Sunday to back a deal to leave the European Union, saying it was not only the best agreement she could achieve but also that it was the only one on the table.

Headline: Factbox - With the DUP opposed, PM May's working majority is minus 7
Description: The small Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government has said it will vote against May's draft Brexit deal.

Headline: EU leaders endorse Brexit deal
Description: European Union leaders of the 27 states staying on together after Britain leaves the bloc on Sunday endorsed their Brexit deal with London, chairman Donald Tusk said.

Headline: EU's Juncker says of Brexit - 'This is the best deal ... the only deal possible'
Description: The head of the European Union's executive, Jean-Claude Juncker, on Sunday urged the UK parliament to ratify the Brexit deal the bloc sealed with British Prime Minister Theresa May, saying it was the only one possible.

Headline: Northern Ireland DUP's Foster - Will 'review' May support if her Brexit deal succeeds
Description: The leader of Northern Ireland's DUP said she would "review" the agreement that props up Britain's Conservative government if Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit divorce deal is passed by the UK parliament.

Headline: Elections, referendum still possible in Britain - Lithuania
Description: The European Union should not rule out several scenarios after leaders sign a withdrawal agreement for Britain's exit from the bloc, Lithuania's president said on Sunday, highlighting new British elections or a second Brexit referendum as possibilities.

Headline: Save our Brexit - May urges UK public to back her in letter to the nation
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May made a dramatic direct appeal to the British public to support her deal to exit the European Union on Sunday even as backing from her own party for the agreement appeared to elude her.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP says will vote against May's 'pitiful' Brexit deal
Description: The Northern Irish party propping up British Prime Minister Theresa May's government on Saturday said it would vote against her Brexit withdrawal agreement, which its deputy leader said would leave Britain in a "pitiful and pathetic place".

Headline: DUP says will vote against Brexit deal unless backstop removed
Description: The leader of the small Northern Irish party propping up Prime Minister Theresa May's British government said it will vote against her Brexit divorce deal unless the so-called Irish backstop is removed.

Headline: Boris Johnson, sniping at May, calls for 'no deal' Brexit minister
Description: Former foreign secretary Boris Johnson on Saturday called for the government to appoint a minister to prepare for a "no-deal" British exit from the European Union in order to increase London's leverage in talks with Brussels.

Headline: May says UK will always stand by Gibraltar
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Saturday the United Kingdom would "always stand by Gibraltar" after Spain got enough assurances over the peninsula to unblock the European Union's Brexit deal with London.

Headline: EU's Juncker speaks to Spanish PM, says dialogue is the European way
Description: The head of the European Union's executive, Jean-Claude Juncker, said that solidarity and dialogue were "the European way of finding solutions" after speaking to Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez on Saturday

Headline: Spain’s Sanchez confirms deal reached over Gibraltar
Description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Saturday that a deal had been reached on Gibraltar, clearing the way for an EU summit on Sunday to approve a Brexit deal with British Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: EU gives Spain reassurances over Gibraltar in Brexit deal  - document
Description: The European Union will declare in approving the Brexit deal with Britain on Sunday that any future arrangements regarding Gibraltar must be discussed directly with Madrid, a draft document seen by Reuters shows.

Headline: Britain says will hold talks with Spain on future of Gibraltar
Description: The UK government said in a statement on Saturday it would discuss the future of Gibraltar directly with Spain, part of reassurances given to Madrid to agree to the European Union's Brexit deal.

Headline: Britain gives Spain assurances on Gibraltar to unlock Brexit deal
Description: Britain provided assurances to the European Union on Saturday that it will not insist on interpreting the Brexit withdrawal agreement as binding the EU to apply a future EU-UK trade treaty to Gibraltar, soothing Spanish concerns on the issue.

Headline: EU's Tusk recommends that EU approves Brexit deal on Sunday
Description: European Union summit chairman Donald Tusk has recommended that the bloc approved the Brexit deal negotiated with Britain.

Headline: Spain reaches EU deal on Gibraltar, Brexit summit to go ahead - source
Description: Spain has reached a deal with the European Union on Gibraltar, clearing the way for an EU summit on Sunday to approve a Brexit  deal with British Prime Minister Theresa May, a diplomatic source told Reuters on Saturday.

Headline: EU's Tusk, Spain's Sanchez push for Gibraltar Brexit deal
Description: EU summit chair Donald Tusk said on Saturday that a Brexit summit on Sunday which had been in doubt over Spanish concerns on Gibraltar was now closer to going ahead as planned after he spoke to the Spanish prime minister.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP says will support Gibraltar cause in parliament
Description: Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party on Saturday pledged to use its 10 votes in parliament to support the cause of Gibraltar if necessary.

Headline: Spain digs in on Gibraltar before Brexit summit
Description: Spanish reservations over Gibraltar on Friday prevented the European Union clearing the last hurdle before the bloc signs off its Brexit deal with Britain, with Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez saying a summit on Sunday could be called off.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP says it could ditch May's government if Brexit deal passes
Description: The leader of the Northern Irish party propping up Britain's government warned British Prime Minister Theresa May on Friday that it could abandon her if she got her Brexit divorce deal through parliament.

Headline: PM faces parliamentary 'war of attrition' to deliver Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's trial by parliament to deliver on her Brexit plan is only just beginning.

Headline: Spain says EU summit to be called off if no deal on Gibraltar
Description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Friday that a summit of European leaders due to take place on Sunday to endorse a Brexit deal is likely to be called off if there is no agreement by then on the question of Gibraltar.

Headline: French banks scale back plans for post-Brexit staff moves
Description: French banks may end up relocating significantly fewer staff than originally expected from London to mainland Europe after Brexit, banking officials said on Friday.

Headline: Scottish salmon producers say May's Brexit plans pose "serious questions"
Description: Producers of Scottish salmon, Britain's biggest food export, are seeking reassurance that the Brexit deal will not link fishing in British waters by European Union boats with the supply of all British seafood products to EU markets.

Headline: EU wants closest possible partnership with Britain after Brexit - draft
Description: European Union leaders are to say at a summit on Sunday they want "as close as possible a partnership" with Britain after Brexit, their draft statement said.

Headline: Would market shock force parliament's hand on Brexit?
Description: There's nothing like a market crash to focus the minds of politicians, and Prime Minister Theresa May could find that only a plunge in British asset prices can persuade a divided parliament to back her Brexit deal.

Headline: Spain wants commitment on Gibraltar in writing before EU summit - government official
Description: Spain has a commitment from Britain to support the inclusion of clarifications on the status of Gibraltar in the Brexit package, Spanish Secretary of State for the European Union Luis Marco Aguiriano said on Friday outside a meeting in Brussels.

Headline: UK minister says Irish backstop would create issues for future trade deals
Description: Britain would have issues negotiating trade deals with new partners if an Irish border backstop arrangement came into effect, trade minister Liam Fox said on Friday, but reservations about it on both sides suggest it won't need to be used.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP's Foster: May should ask EU for a better deal
Description: The leader of the Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government said May should ask the European Union for a better Brexit divorce deal.

Headline: Spain insists future of Gibraltar must be settled through direct talks
Description: Spain on Friday insisted that a Brexit deal should make clear Madrid would have a direct say how the future relationship between the EU and Britain could impact Gibraltar, and this would have to be discussed bilaterally.

Headline: May: EU won't give us better Brexit deal if parliament rejects current one
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday the European Union would not renegotiate the Brexit deal if Britain's parliament rejected the current version of the exit agreement.

Headline: EU negotiators fail to agree on Gibraltar before Brexit summit
Description: European Union negotiators from the 27 states remaining after Brexit were unable to agree on Gibraltar during talks on Friday, diplomatic sources said of the outstanding issue before Sunday's summit of the bloc's leaders to seal the deal.

Headline: May's spokeswoman: We will work with Spain on Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will work with Spain on Brexit, her spokeswoman said on Friday, but added that Britain has worked openly with the European Union on Gibraltar and wants to ensure a good deal for the "whole of the UK family".

Headline: Germany confident Gibraltar will be settled before Sunday's Brexit summit
Description: The German government is working on the assumption that all open questions regarding an agreement on Britain's exit from the European Union will be settled by the time of a meeting of the EU's leaders on Sunday, a government spokesman said.

Headline: EU steps up preparations for euro clearing in 'no deal' Brexit
Description: European Union regulators began on Friday to implement plans to ensure that trillions of euros in cross-border derivatives transactions would not be disrupted in the event of a "no deal" Brexit.

Headline: UK fails to secure improvements to future EU financial services access
Description: Britain has failed to secure improvements to its proposed future trading relations in financial services with the European Union after Brexit, according to a draft document, disappointing some executives who expected concessions.

Headline: Gibraltar has worked with Spain on Brexit deal, chief minister says
Description: Gibraltar has worked with Spain to reach agreement over its place in the Brexit withdrawal agreement, its chief minister said on Friday, adding that any revision of the enclave's place in the deal would reopen the whole agreement to renegotiation.

Headline: Far-right activist Robinson appointed adviser to UKIP leader
Description: The leader of the eurosceptic United Kingdom Independence Party (UKIP) has appointed far-right activist Tommy Robinson as an adviser.

Headline: Bank of England's Saunders sees higher rates if Brexit goes smoothly
Description: The Bank of England would probably need to raise interest rates faster than investors expect if Britain manages a smooth exit from the European Union, though Brexit's implications for the BoE remain unclear, rate-setter Michael Saunders said.

Headline: Former Brexit minister Raab says PM May's deal will fail in parliament
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's deal to leave the European Union will be voted down in parliament, her former Brexit minister said on Friday, adding that alternative stopgap agreements could help provide a bridge in a no-deal scenario.

Headline: EU, Britain agree draft deal on future relations
Description: Britain and the European Union have agreed a draft text setting out a close post-Brexit relationship, though wrangling with Spain over control of Gibraltar must still be settled before EU leaders meet on Sunday in order to rubber-stamp the pact.

Headline: Germany is prepared for all Brexit scenarios - Scholz
Description: Germany hopes that Britain will leave the European Union in an orderly manner, but Berlin is also prepared for Britain crashing out of the bloc without a mutually agreed divorce deal, Finance Minister Olaf Scholz was quoted as saying on Friday.

Headline: UK prime minister, Austrian chancellor welcome agreement on draft Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May and Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz on Thursday welcomed the agreement on the terms of Britain's withdrawal from the European Union and the text on the political declaration on the future relationship, May's office said.

Headline: Brexiteers cast PM May's draft Brexit deal as 'surrender'
Description: Britain and the European Union agreed a draft text setting out a close post-Brexit relationship, though wrangles over fish and the future of Gibraltar must still be settled before leaders meet on Sunday.

Headline: Highlights of EU, UK declaration on post-Brexit ties
Description: Here are key elements of a 26-page Political Declaration on EU-UK ties after Brexit, due to be approved by leaders on Sunday. The full text is here: https://www.consilium.europa.eu//media/37059/20181121-cover-political-declaration.pdf

Headline: May believes she can win vote in parliament on the Brexit deal - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May believes she can win a vote in parliament on her Brexit deal and will focus her efforts on persuading members of her own party of the merits of the agreement announced earlier on Thursday, her spokesman said.

Headline: Brexit talks at critical moment after future ties agreed - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said Brexit talks were at a critical moment and that all efforts would be made to bring them to a conclusion after a framework for the future relationship with the EU was agreed on Thursday.

Headline: May must ditch Irish backstop for DUP support, MP says
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May needs to ditch her agreement to an Irish border backstop in her Brexit deal if she is to get the support of the small Northern Irish party which props up her government, a lawmaker from the party said on Thursday.

Headline: Gibraltar says it is ready for any Brexit outcome
Description: Gibraltar's chief minister Fabian Picardo said on Thursday that the peninsula was ready for any potential outcome regarding talks on Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: May hails deal on post-Brexit ties, set to seal it on Sunday
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday that a draft declaration on post-Brexit ties with the European Union had been agreed with the European Commission and that she would seal the deal on Sunday.

Headline: Gibraltar chief minister says Gibraltar will be part of any Brexit agreement
Description: Gibraltar's chief minister Fabian Picardo said on Thursday that the peninsula would be part of any agreement on Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: 'Operational cooperation': Brexit deal vague on EU-Britain security ties
Description: Britain has failed to win a guarantee of access to EU security databases once it leaves the European Union, according to a draft deal agreed between London and Brussels on future ties, leaving such co-operation open to negotiation.

Headline: Gibraltar still unresolved before Sunday EU's Brexit summit - draft
Description: A statement by 27 European Union leaders will say on Sunday that the bloc would show "particular vigilance" on how Britain behaves regarding fisheries and industry standards after Brexit, according to a draft seen by Reuters on Thursday.

Headline: EU 27 leaders to endorse separate statement on Gibraltar on Sunday
Description: The 27 European Union leaders on Sunday aim to endorse a separate declaration along with the Brexit package to cover fisheries, environmental standards and Gibraltar, EU diplomats said.

Headline: Irish central bank still receiving Brexit applications - official
Description: Ireland's central bank is still receiving applications from small to medium financial firms looking to set up or extend operations in Ireland as a result of Brexit and aware of more to be submitted, an official familiar with the authorisation process said on Thursday.

Headline: May discussing Brexit talks in cabinet conference call
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is updating her cabinet of senior ministers on the state of Brexit negotiations, her spokesman told reporters on Thursday after negotiators said they had agreed in principle the terms of future Britain-EU relations.

Headline: TheCityUK's McFarlane says PM's Brexit deal "infinitely better" than no-deal
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's proposed Brexit deal is "infinitely better" than the alternative no-deal scenario that could inflict "severe and unpredictable" damage on the economy, the chairman of lobby group TheCityUK John McFarlane said on Thursday.

Headline: EU hopes to clinch Brexit deal on Sunday
Description: The European Union's 27 national ambassadors will try on Thursday to finalise an outline declaration of future ties between the bloc and the United Kingdom ahead of a planned summit on Sunday.

Headline: PM May made good progress in Brussels - Hancock
Description: Britain's health minister Matt Hancock said that Prime Minister Theresa May had made good progress in Brussels, where she and European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker discussed the outline of Britain's future relations outside the EU.

Headline: May says to return to Brussels on Saturday in bid to seal Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said she would be returning to Brussels on Saturday to hammer out an outline of Britain's future ties with the European Union after her meeting with the head of the bloc's executive on Wednesday failed to bridge the gaps.

Headline: Irish parliament overwhelmingly backs Brexit divorce deal
Description: Ireland's parliament overwhelmingly backed the divorce deal struck last week by Brexit negotiators, with all major parties supporting the draft agreement that the government says achieves all its key priorities.

Headline: Hammond says no-deal Brexit would cost tens of billions
Description: Leaving the European Union without a transition deal would cost Britain tens of billions of pounds, and failure to support Prime Minister Theresa May's preferred plan could jeopardise Brexit altogether, Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Wednesday.

Headline: May, Spanish premier talk Brexit, Gibraltar - May's office
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May spoke to Spain's Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez about her commitment to agreeing a Brexit deal that works for the whole of the United Kingdom, including Gibraltar, May's office said on Wednesday.

Headline: Spanish PM says will vote no to Brexit deal if no change on Gibraltar
Description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said he would vote against the draft deal on Britain's exit from the European Union on Sunday if he does not obtain assurances on the disputed peninsula of Gibraltar.

Headline: PM May to return to Brussels on Saturday
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she will return to Brussels on Saturday for more talks with European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker after a meeting on Wednesday failed to yield a deal on Britain's future ties with the EU.

Headline: May, Juncker make "very good progress" on Brexit future plan
Description: A meeting in Brussels between Prime Minister Theresa May and European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker made progress on an outline of Britain's future relations outside the EU but have yet to reach a final deal, an EU spokesman said.

Headline: DUP leader Foster says won't withdraw support for UK PM May yet
Description: The Northern Ireland party whose 10 members of parliament back British Prime Minister Theresa May's government does not plan to withdraw its support yet despite opposition to her Brexit withdrawal deal, its leader said on Wednesday.

Headline: What is May's working majority without the DUP? Answer: 3 votes
Description: The small Northern Irish party which props up British Prime Minister Theresa May's government has withdrawn support in some recent votes on a finance bill because its lawmakers are upset with May's draft Brexit deal.

Headline: Labour's McDonnell says UK in disarray but parliament will block no-deal Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's government is in disarray over Brexit but there is no majority in parliament for damaging the economy by leaving the EU without a deal, the opposition Labour Party's finance minister-in-waiting said on Wednesday.

Headline: Factbox: Can EU states block Brexit deal?
Description: The Spanish prime minister's threats to block a Brexit deal this week over Madrid's claims to Britain's tiny territory of Gibraltar on the Spanish coast has raised questions of veto risks for the package.

Headline: EU, UK would need a 'no-deal deal' after hard Brexit - Irish PM
Description: Britain and the European Union would need to agree a "no-deal deal" on customs and regulations within weeks of a hard Brexit to avoid a hard border on the island of Ireland, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Wednesday.

Headline: The godfather of Brexit who gave Theresa May a lifeline - Michael Gove
Description: As Prime Minister Theresa May battled to save her draft Brexit deal in the face of resignations from her team and threats of a leadership coup, many believed one man could deal the fatal blow. But he didn't.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP says support deal with May shaky but still in place
Description: A deal to prop up Prime Minister Theresa May's government is still in place but is very shaky, Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) member of parliament Sammy Wilson said.

Headline: UK govt deal with DUP still in place - May's spokesman
Description: A deal in which Northern Ireland's Democractic Unionist Party props up British Prime Minister Theresa May's government is still in place, a spokesman for May said on Wednesday.

Headline: May says still negotiating with EU on future relationship
Description: A political declaration on Britain's future relationship with the European Union is still being negotiated, British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday.

Headline: British MPs won't vote for no-deal Brexit, Amber Rudd says
Description: Britain's parliament will not support a 'no-deal' Brexit, work and pensions minister Amber Rudd said on Wednesday, also playing down the prospect of a second referendum if lawmakers do not approve Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal.

Headline: Highlights: UK Labour Party's McDonnell speaks at Reuters
Description: John McDonnell, the man who would be Britain's Chancellor  if the opposition Labour Party was in power, is speaking at a Reuters Newsmaker event.

Headline: No rush to topple May's government, says opposition finance chief McDonnell
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party is in no rush to topple Prime Minister Theresa May's government over Brexit, the party's finance policy chief John McDonnell told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headline: With Carney warning of 1970s-style shock, UK firms ready for no-deal Brexit
Description: Companies began triggering plans to keep operating if Britain leaves the European Union without an agreement, a "no deal" scenario the Bank of England said could plunge the economy into a crisis not seen since the 1970s.

Headline: Northern Irish kingmakers send May a warning over Brexit deal
Description: The Northern Irish kingmakers who prop up British Prime Minister Theresa May's government sent her a stark warning over her draft Brexit divorce deal, pulling support in several parliamentary votes on a finance bill.

Headline: Brexit deal works for all UK, May tells Scottish leader
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May told Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon on Tuesday that the Brexit deal she has negotiated with the EU will work for all parts of the United Kingdom and deliver on the results of the 2016 referendum.

Headline: Spain to vote against Brexit accord if text on Gibraltar not changed - PM
Description: Spain will vote against the European Union's draft Brexit deal on Sunday unless it is modified to make clear that the future of the disputed British territory of Gibraltar relies on talks between Madrid and London, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said.

Headline: Boris Johnson, Chancellor Hammond expected to attend DUP conference - source
Description: British Chancellor Philip Hammond and former foreign minister Boris Johnson are both expected to attend the annual conference of the Democratic Unionist Party in Belfast this weekend, a source from the party told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headline: Ireland says Brexit withdrawal deal not open to change
Description: The text of Britain's withdrawal agreement from the European Union is not going to be changed, Ireland's Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Tuesday, despite calls by some British politicians for amendments.

Headline: Factbox: What might a no-deal Brexit look like?
Description: Britain is due to leave the European Union in just over four months' time but it still cannot count on a transition period to cushion the shock for its economy.

Headline: May heads to Brussels on Wednesday for Brexit talks
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will travel to Brussels on Wednesday evening to meet European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker as part of talks on future ties after Brexit, her office said on Tuesday.

Headline: EasyJet ready for Brexit as summer bookings rise
Description: Uncertainty about Brexit negotiations are not hurting sales at easyJet , CEO Johan Lundgren said on Tuesday, adding the British budget airline is well-prepared should the UK leave the European Union without a deal next March.

Headline: May not expected to agree final future framework with EU's Juncker - PM's spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is not expected to agree a final version of the declaration on Britain's future relationship with the European Union at a meeting with European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker on Wednesday, her spokesman said.

Headline: Bank of England chief Carney backs May's Brexit deal
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney gave his backing to a Brexit deal struck by British Prime Minister Theresa May, saying the alternative of leaving the European Union with no transition could be akin to the 1970s oil shock.

Headline: Bank of England's Carney speaks in parliament on Brexit
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney and other top monetary policy officials from the central bank were speaking to the Treasury Committee in Britain's parliament on Tuesday.

Headline: DUP's Wilson says his party will work to defeat May's Brexit deal
Description: Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party which props up British Prime Minister Theresa May's government will focus on trying to kill off her draft Brexit deal, the party's Brexit spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK's top court rejects government bid to stop ECJ hearing Brexit reversal case
Description: Britain's Supreme Court on Tuesday rejected a last ditch bid by the British government to stop Europe's top court from considering a case which seeks to determine whether London can unilaterally reverse Brexit.

Headline: PM May appeals to Northern Ireland voters to back Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May made a direct appeal to Northern Irish voters on Tuesday to back her Brexit deal, writing in the Belfast Telegraph that the deal would put the region in a "fantastic position."

Headline: easyJet CEO says no interest in Flybe at the moment
Description: The boss of British low-cost airline easyJet  said he did not have "any interest in this particular topic on Flybe  at the moment" when he was asked if he would be interested in buying the struggling airline.

Headline: Brexit - DUP says to work with UK PM May to try to change deal
Description: Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party will continue to work with British Prime Minister Theresa May's government to try to get her to change her EU withdrawal deal, the party's Brexit spokesman Sammy Wilson said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK minister Gauke says Brexit deal can get through parliament
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May can get her draft European Union divorce deal through parliament because opponents will see it is the only way forward and employers will put pressure on lawmakers, the UK's justice minister said on Tuesday.

Headline: BoE brings forward bank stress test results due to Brexit deal
Description: The Bank of England said on Tuesday it would bring forward publication of bank stress tests to Nov. 28 so that it could give analysis of how the central bank would cope with a possible "no deal" Brexit before parliament votes on a deal.

Headline: May sticks to Brexit deal as opponents seek formal challenge
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May vowed on Monday to stick to her draft European Union divorce deal as dissenting lawmakers in her own party tried to trigger a leadership challenge.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP fail to back May in finance bill votes
Description: The small Northern Irish Democratic Unionist Party (DUP), which supports British Prime Minister Theresa May's government, failed to back her in several votes on a finance bill on Monday after being vocally critical of her draft Brexit deal.

Headline: British government relents to MPs pressure with pledge to publish Brexit forecasts
Description: The British government on Monday pledged to publish economic forecasts that compare Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal with remaining in the European Union, relenting to pressure from lawmakers who sought to force the government to do so.

Headline: EU's Barnier says draft Brexit deal is 'fair and balanced'
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Monday the draft Brexit deal reached with London was "fair and balanced", as the bloc haggled with Britain over any extension to the envisaged transition period.

Headline: Spain seeks assurances over Gibraltar in draft Brexit deal
Description: Spain will not back the European Union's draft Brexit agreement unless it makes clear that Madrid must specifically agree on the status of Gibraltar, Spanish Foreign Minister Josep Borrell said on Monday.

Headline: Labour party won't countenance a no-deal Brexit - Corbyn
Description: British opposition Labour Party won't countenance a no-deal Brexit, party leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Monday, even as it plans to vote against Prime Minister Theresa May's draft deal to withdraw from the European Union.

Headline: DUP leader Foster calls on May to demand a better Brexit deal
Description: The head of the small Northern Irish party that props up the British government on Monday called on Prime Minister Theresa May to demand a better Brexit deal and said the suggestion that the only alternative was a no-deal Brexit was a "false choice."

Headline: UK business warns politicians - Don't trip us into no deal Brexit chaos
Description: British politicians are engaged in a high-stakes game of risk over Brexit which could lead to an accidental no deal, the head of Britain's main business lobby, the CBI, said on Monday.

Headline: Exasperated executives back May's Brexit, decry political psychodrama
Description: Embattled prime minister Theresa May's Brexit sales pitch won plaudits from the British business community on Monday, but executives said the political drama surrounding her survival was proving a damaging distraction.

Headline: May's government courts Northern Irish business to sell Brexit deal
Description: Britain's Northern Ireland minister on Monday called on businesses in the province to voice support for the draft EU divorce deal which is being fiercely resisted by the Northern Irish party that props up the UK government.

Headline: Germany's Weber says draft Brexit deal will not be renegotiated
Description: German conservative Manfred Weber, who is running to take over the European Union's top job next year, said on Monday that the draft Brexit deal would not be renegotiated and the ball was now in Britain's court.

Headline: May: Brexit transition phase must end before 2022 election
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday she wanted any post-Brexit transition phase to have ended by the time the country is due to hold a national election in 2022.

Headline: McLaren Automotive boss says PM May's Brexit deal gives certainty
Description: The draft Brexit agreement between Britain and the European Union gives certainty to British business whilst no deal would hinder free trade, the boss of carmaker McLaren Automotive said as Prime Minister Theresa May battles to win over her lawmakers.

Headline: WTO rules clear on border checks in no deal Brexit - UK Northern Ireland minister
Description: World Trade Organisation (WTO) rules are clear that checks would be required between EU-member Ireland and the British province of Northern Ireland if Britain crashed out of the bloc without an exit deal, the minister for the region said on Monday.

Headline: Twenty-five banks 'well advanced' in talks for post-Brexit EU licence - ECB
Description: Twenty-five banks are "well advanced" in their talks with the European Central Bank to retain a foothold in the European Union even after Britain leaves the bloc, the ECB's top supervisor Daniele Nouy said on Monday.

Headline: No better Brexit deal available, EU ministers tell Britain
Description: Germany and other European Union states told Britain on Monday their draft Brexit agreement could not be renegoitated.

Headline: UK could ask for Brexit transition beyond 2020, business minister says
Description: The United Kingdom could ask for a longer Brexit transition period if needed, Business Secretary Greg Clark said on Monday, not ruling out the possibility it could last until 2022.

Headline: Draft Brexit deal is better than no deal -  German minister
Description: There will be no new negotiations on Britain's departure from the European Union and the draft Brexit deal is better than a no-deal outcome, Germany's European Affairs Minister Michael Roth said on Monday.

Headline: Getting rid of me risks delaying Brexit - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Sunday toppling her would risk delaying Brexit and she would not let talk of a leadership challenge distract her from a critical week of negotiations with Brussels.

Headline: Conservative lawmaker says PM May faces day of reckoning on Monday
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May faces a day of reckoning on Monday as mutinous lawmakers try to trigger a no confidence vote over their opposition to her draft European Union divorce deal, a rebel member of her Conservative Party said.

Headline: No renegotiation of Brexit deal - German minister
Description: German Economy Minister Peter Altmaier ruled out on Monday a renegotiation of the Brexit deal reached between the European Union and Britain to make it more palatable to British lawmakers opposed to the agreement.

Headline: PM May's opponents six letters short of no confidence vote - The Sun
Description: Opponents of British Prime Minister Theresa May are six letters short of the threshold to trigger a no confidence vote, The Sun newspaper reported.

Headline: EU is 'prepared' in case of no-deal Brexit - ECB's Villeroy

Headline: Factbox - Who has submitted letters of no confidence in UK PM May?

Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has suffered 18 resignations from her government since last November, ten of which have been related to her approach to Brexit. Here is the list:

Headline: EU's Tusk to meet Brexit negotiator Barnier 0650 GMT Thursday
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk will meet EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier at 0650 GMT on Thursday, a statement said.

Headline: EU's Barnier to speak at 2000 GMT on Brexit
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier will brief reporters on the draft agreement endorsed by the British government on Wednesday at 2000 GMT in Brussels, the European Commission said.

Headline: EU's Verhofstadt says Brexit deal maintains close relationship with UK
