Description: The draft Brexit agreement endorsed by the British government on Wednesday will allow Britain to leave the European Union while keeping a close relationship with the bloc, the European Parliament's point man on Brexit said.

Headline: Lawmaker on EU parliament Brexit committee urges second UK referendum
Description: The draft Brexit agreement endorsed by the British government on Wednesday will show the British people that remaining in the European Union is their best option, a leading EU lawmaker said on Wednesday.

Headline: Ireland on board with draft Brexit deal - EU sources
Description: Ireland's envoy to the European Union told a meeting of the bloc's 27 national ambassadors in Brussels on Wednesday that Dublin was on board with the existing draft Brexit deal, diplomatic sources said.

Headline: UK Scotland minister sees no cabinet resignations tonight over Brexit - BBC
Description: No British government ministers will resign over Brexit tonight, Scottish Secretary David Mundell said, according to a Tweet by a BBC reporter on Wednesday evening following a cabinet meeting.

Headline: How does a leadership challenge to a Conservative prime minister work?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's position as leader of the Conservative Party - and consequently her premiership - is under threat, with media reporting that some MPs who are unhappy with the draft Brexit deal she has reached with the European Union are taking steps to call a confidence vote.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP MP says May's position 'very, very shaky'
Description: A lawmaker from the small Northern Irish party whose votes prop up the British government said on Wednesday Prime Minister Theresa May's position appeared to be "very, very shaky" due to opposition to her Brexit deal.

Headline: Raab no longer expected to travel to Brussels today - Bloomberg
Description: Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab is no longer expected to travel to Brussels on Wednesday to welcome a Brexit deal with the European Union's chief negotiator, Michael Barnier, Bloomberg https://www.bloomberg.com/news/live-blog/2018-11-14/brexit-draft-agreement-between-u-k-eu?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_content=politics&utm_campaign=socialflow-organic&cmpid%3D=socialflow-twitter-politics reported on Wednesday, citing a UK diplomat.

Headline: EU envoys end Brexit meeting, London position unclear - sources
Description: The European Union's 27 national ambassadors meeting on the draft Brexit deal in Brussels on Wednesday ended their session with no word from London on whether the British cabinet has approved it, diplomatic sources said.

Headline: Britain's big Brexit vote - Will parliament back May?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has agreed a draft exit agreement with the European Union, but has to persuade her divided cabinet and then a sceptical parliament to approve it.

Headline: No-deal Brexit would cost Britain 6 percent of GDP, IMF warns
Description: Leaving the European Union without a transitional trade deal would cost Britain about 6 percent of GDP -- roughly four years of economic growth -- compared with staying in the bloc, the International Monetary Fund said on Wednesday.

Headline: May to give short Brexit statement after cabinet meeting
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will give a short statement to media later on Wednesday after she finishes a meeting of her senior ministers to win their approval for a draft Brexit divorce deal, a Downing Street official said.

Headline: May 'likely' to face leadership challenge on Thursday - BBC
Description: Brexit supporters in Theresa May's party will "likely" call for a vote of no confidence in her as their leader on Thursday, BBC political editor Laura Kuenssberg said, citing a senior member of the Conservative Party.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP warns of "consequences" if May breaks Brexit promises
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May should keep her word with a Brexit deal which preserves the integrity of the United Kingdom or face the consequences, the leader of the small Northern Irish party which supports her government said.

Headline: PM May's Brexit cabinet meeting overrunning
Description: A meeting of British Prime Minister Theresa May's top ministers to discuss a draft European Union divorce bill on Wednesday was overrunning and was not expected to finish until at least 1800 GMT, possibly later, a government official told journalists.

Headline: Scots jarred by Brexit terms on Northern Ireland, fishing
Description: Scottish nationalists and their political opponents alike decried the terms expected to be offered to Northern Ireland in Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal on Wednesday, which some feel might foster resentment and boost the cause of Scottish independence.

Headline: PM May expected to make Brexit statement at 1700 GMT
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is expected to make a statement at around 1700 GMT on Wednesday outside her office after meeting senior ministers to discuss her Brexit deal, a Downing Street official said.

Headline: "Strong chance" Scotland minister will quit over Brexit - PoliticsHome
Description: There is a "very strong chance" that Scotland Secretary David Mundell will resign over Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal, the editor of PoliticsHome.com said on Wednesday without citing sources.

Headline: Two UK cabinet ministers will quit on Wednesday - Telegraph
Description: Two members of Prime Minister Theresa May's cabinet of senior ministers, Penny Mordaunt and Esther McVey, will resign on Wednesday, the chief political correspondent of the Telegraph said on Twitter.

Headline: There is hope for an orderly Brexit - German minister
Description: German Justice Minister Katharina Barley said there was hope that Britain would leave the European Union in an orderly fashion, harshly criticisng "Brexiteers" for their opposition to the withdrawal agreement reached between London and Brussels.

Headline: Germany on Brexit: Splitting single market would be lose-lose situation
Description: Splitting an integrated single market - as Britain's departure from the European Union will do - would necessarily create a lose-lose situation, German Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Twitter in response to a Tweet about Brexit.

Headline: Brexit draft deal "encouraging" but France still cautious - government spokesman
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron considers the draft Brexit deal agreed by UK and EU negotiators as an encouraging sign but remains cautious as the text still needs to be examined in detail, said government spokesman Benjamin Griveaux.

Headline: Irish PM appeals to Northern Irish unionists worried by Brexit deal
Description: Ireland's prime minister appealed directly to Northern Ireland's pro-British unionist community on Wednesday, saying Dublin would respect the territorial integrity of the United Kingdom amid concerns over how a Brexit deal would impact the province.

Headline: PM May says culture minister to set out gambling machine changes
Description: Britain's culture minister will set out further details later on Wednesday on the government's planned cut to the maximum stake on fixed-odds betting terminals (FOBTs), Prime Minister Theresa May said.

Headline: UK parliament speaker: Brexit statement in parliament likely on Thursday
Description: The speaker of Britain's parliament said he had been told to expect a government statement on Brexit to be delivered on Thursday, but he was open to it happening sooner.

Headline: EU-UK Brexit deal sees July 2020 decision on keeping Irish border open - EU sources
Description: The draft accord reached between the EU and Britain envisages a July 2020 decision on what would have to be done to safeguard an open Irish border after the post-Brexit transition runs its course and if a new trade deal is not in place, EU sources said.

Headline: May: Parliament will get proper analysis once final deal agreed with EU
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday promised parliament it would receive a proper analysis of any Brexit deal once it has been finalised with the European Union.

Headline: PM May: Our deal delivers Brexit, there will be no second referendum
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said her draft Brexit deal delivered on the outcome of a 2016 vote to leave the European Union, and that her government would never hold a second public vote on the subject.

Headline: May says cabinet will decide on next steps in the national interest on Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said her cabinet would decide later on Wednesday on the next steps in the national interest on Brexit, and that she would update parliament on their decision.

Headline: PM May's office "bullish" on DUP Brexit backing - Sky
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's office is "bullish" that the Northern Irish DUP party that supports her minority government will fall into line and vote to back her Brexit divorce deal, a Sky political reporter said on Wednesday.

Headline: EU Commission says could make Brexit statement soon
Description: The European Commission and its Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier could make a statement on negotiations with Britain as early as Wednesday, the EU executive's chief spokesman said.

Headline: Mordaunt wants further assurance over Brexit deal - Sun
Description: Britain's International Development minister Penny Mordaunt is waiting for further assurances before she will put her name to support Theresa May's Brexit deal, the political editor of the Sun reported on Wednesday.

Headline: German government: We welcome any progress towards an orderly Brexit
Description: The German government welcomes any progress towards an orderly Brexit, a spokeswoman said on Wednesday, as British Prime Minister Theresa May tries to convince senior ministers on Wednesday to accept a draft European Union divorce deal.

Headline: UK PM May faces a fight to seal Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May faces one of the most the most dangerous moments of her premiership as she tries to convince senior ministers and parliament to accept a draft divorce deal agreed with the European Union.

Headline: Northern Ireland cannot be cut adrift from UK - DUP leader Foster
Description: The leader of the small Northern Irish party that props up British Prime Minister Theresa May's minority government said she could not accept a Brexit deal that would cut the province adrift from the rest of the United Kingdom.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP hardliner - We will not vote for this Brexit deal humiliation
Description: A hardline member of the Northern Irish party propping up Britain's minority government said on Wednesday that his Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) will not be voting for what he called a humiliating Brexit deal.

Headline: Britain agrees Brexit divorce deal with EU, May's opponents vow to thwart it
Description: Britain struck a draft divorce deal with the European Union after more than a year of talks, thrusting Prime Minister Theresa May into a perilous battle over Brexit that could shape her country's prosperity for generations to come.

Headline: Instant View - Reaction after text of Brexit divorce deal agreed
Description: The European Union and Britain have agreed a draft text of a Brexit withdrawal agreement and Prime Minister Theresa May will present it to her senior ministers on Wednesday.

Headline: DUP leader warns May her party could block Brexit deal
Description: The small Northern Irish party propping up Prime Minister Theresa May’s minority government warned her on Tuesday that it would oppose any Brexit deal which it believed undermined the union between Britain and Northern Ireland.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP - May's deal could break up the United Kingdom
Description: Theresa May's proposed Brexit deal has the potential to break up the United Kingdom because it will treat Northern Ireland differently, Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) lawmaker Jeffrey Donaldson told BBC Radio on Wednesday.

Headline: May's five senior ministers will back Brexit deal - The Sun's political editor
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's five senior ministers Dominic Raab, Jeremy Hunt, Sajid Javid, Michael Gove and Geoffrey Cox will back the Brexit deal, the Sun newspaper's political editor said https://twitter.com/tnewtondunn/status/1062470005198110720 in a tweet on Tuesday, citing cabinet sources.

Headline: Brexit spells peril for Conservatives' future, says former minister Jo Johnson
Description: Former minister Jo Johnson said that the future of Britain's ruling Conservative Party would be in peril if Prime Minister Theresa May proceeded with Brexit, hours after Britain agreed the draft text for leaving the European Union.

Headline: Irish cabinet to meet on Wednesday on Brexit developments
Description: Ireland's cabinet will meet on Wednesday at 0930 GMT to discuss developments on Brexit, a spokesman for Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said, after Britain reached a draft agreement with the European Union on the terms of its exit from the bloc.

Headline: Opposition parties demand 'meaningful' vote on Brexit deal
Description: Britain's main opposition parties have written to Prime Minister Theresa May demanding a "truly meaningful" parliamentary vote on its withdrawal from the EU, after the government agreed a draft Brexit text with the bloc.

Headline: May to warn cabinet of implementing contingencies in event of no-deal Brexit - FT
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is to tell her cabinet that Britain will implement many of its contingencies for a 'no-deal' Brexit on December 1 if the treaty to withdraw from the European Union fails by the end of this month, the Financial Times said on Tuesday.

Headline: May will fail to get Brexit deal through parliament, Lib Dem leader says
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will fail to get her withdrawal deal with the European Union approved by parliament, Liberal Democrat leader Vince Cable said on Tuesday.

Headline: Czech Republic, Poland, Hungary face tough Brexit ride - ING
Description: The Czech Republic, Poland and Hungary face being hit hard by Brexit, a new ING report estimates, as changes to key supply chains and a drop in expat worker remittances compound what could be a 20 percent cut in the countries' EU funding.

Headline: Sinn Fein's McDonald says Brexit agreement must give legal effect to 'cast iron' guarantee
Description: The leader of the Irish Republican party, Sinn Fein, said on Tuesday that a Brexit withdrawal agreement must provide legal backing to the Irish prime minister's guarantee that there should be no hard border with the British province of Northern Ireland.

Headline: DUP will wait and see before voting down Brexit deal
Description: The small Northern Irish party propping up Britain's minority government will wait and see the actual text of Britain's draft divorce agreement before deciding if it will vote against it, its deputy leader said on Tuesday.

Headline: Government's days are numbered if Brexit deal is as reported - Iain Duncan Smith
Description: The British government is in danger of collapse if the terms of an agreement on the country's exit from the European Union are as reported, Conservative eurosceptic MP Iain Duncan Smith said on Tuesday.

Headline: Labour will vote against Brexit deal if fails to meet tests - Corbyn
Description: The Labour Party will vote against any Brexit agreement that does not meet its tests, and doubts that the deal will be good for the country, leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Tuesday.

Headline: Labour say unlikely May's Brexit deal is right for Britain
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is unlikely to have negotiated the right Brexit deal for Britain, the Labour party's Brexit spokesman said on Tuesday, adding that he needed to see details of the withdrawal agreement.

Headline: Special EU Brexit summit possible Nov. 25 if cabinet backs deal - sources
Description: European Union leaders could meet on Nov. 25 to rubber-stamp a Brexit deal if an existing technical agreement is approved by the British cabinet in London on Wednesday, diplomatic sources in Brussels said.

Headline: May's Brexit agreement is utterly unacceptable - Boris Johnson
Description: Boris Johnson said the Brexit withdrawal agreement with Brussels was "vassal state stuff" that would not protect Northern Ireland within the United Kingdom, and said he would vote against it when it comes before parliament.

Headline: Ministers should reject withdrawal deal, say critics of May's Brexit plans
Description: Opponents of Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plans called on her cabinet ministers on Tuesday to vote down an agreement on Britain's withdrawal terms if it bore any resemblance to  reports of the deal they had seen.

Headline: Eurosceptic MP Rees-Mogg urges cabinet to reject Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's top ministers ought to block her Brexit plan as it seemingly does not deliver on the vote of the British people to leave the European Union, eurosceptic Conservative MP Jacob Rees-Mogg said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU, UK have agreed Brexit text on Irish border - RTE
Description: British and European negotiators have agreed on a text that deals with the Irish border, the most vexed issue in the Brexit negotiations, Irish broadcaster RTE said on Tuesday, citing two "well-placed" sources.

Headline: DUP expects to be briefed on Brexit withdrawal text soon
Description: The Northern Irish party that props up Prime Minister Theresa May’s government expects to briefed soon on the text of a withdrawal agreement between Britain and the European Union, the party's Brexit spokesman said.

Headline: Brexit deal a "very, very hard sell" - DUP deputy leader
Description: It is going to be a "very, very hard sell" for British Prime Minister Theresa May to win parliamentary backing for her emerging Brexit deal, the deputy leader of the small Northern Irish party propping up her government said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU to adopt laws by end-Dec to safeguard against Brexit no deal - document
Description: The European Commission said on Tuesday it intended to adopt by the end of December all the legislation necessary to prepare the EU for a British exit without a divorce agreement should it be necessary by Brexit day on March 29.

Headline: British cabinet to meet on Wednesday after Brexit text agreed
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will convene her cabinet on Wednesday afternoon for a meeting on Brexit after the United Kingdom and the European Union agreed a draft text on the withdrawal agreement.

Headline: Text of Brexit withdrawal deal has been agreed - UK government source
Description: The text of a withdrawal agreement between Britain and the European Union has been agreed, a government source in London said on Tuesday.

Headline: DUP says its Brexit "red lines" well-known amid reports of Irish border deal
Description: The Brexit "red lines" set out by the small Northern Irish party propping up Prime Minister Theresa May's government are well known, a spokeswoman for the party said on Tuesday, as it waited to see the details of a final deal on Britain's withdrawal from the European Union.

Headline: EU envoys to meet on Brexit on Wednesday - diplomats
Description: Envoys from European Union member states will meet late on Wednesday to discuss Brexit, diplomats said, with some adding that they believed they could be briefed on a breakthrough in reaching a deal.

Headline: English FA to cut foreign players in Premier League - report
Description: In a bid to deal with Brexit and boost the number of homegrown players, the English Football Association (FA) is planning to reduce the number of overseas players in Premier League squads to 12 from 17, the Times newspaper reported on Tuesday.

Headline: UK government promises Brexit legal analysis, seeking to appease party rebels
Description: British lawmakers will have access to legal analysis of any EU withdrawal agreement and the chance to quiz the government's top legal advisor before being asked to vote to approve the deal, senior minister David Lidington said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU to cut Britain from emissions trading system in no-deal Brexit
Description: Britain will be excluded from the European Union's Emissions Trading System (ETS) and all other legislation to help limit the impact of climate change, if it leaves the bloc in March 2019 without a deal, the EU executive said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK cabinet to meet on Wednesday on Brexit - Times political editor
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's cabinet of senior ministers will meet on Wednesday to discuss Brexit, The Times political editor said.

Headline: Small number of issues remain in Brexit talks, negotiations ongoing - PM May's spokeswoman
Description: A small number of issues remain in Brexit talks and negotiations between London and Brussels are ongoing, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU moving to "make best" of Brexit deal - Juncker
Description: The European Union is not out to punish Britain for leaving and its chief negotiator Michel Barnier is moving toward an accord that can make the best of Brexit for both sides, European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU contingency to "bridge" through worst of no-deal Brexit - officials
Description: The European Union's executive is preparing temporary contingency measures to minimise the worst disruption in five key areas in case of a no-deal Brexit, the bloc's officials said on Tuesday.

Headline: DUP's Dodds says Brexit talks inching towards compromise deal
Description: The deputy leader of the Democratic Unionist Party, which props up British Prime Minister Theresa May's government, said on Tuesday that it appeared European Union and British negotiators were nearing a Brexit deal.

Headline: EU proposes visa-free travel for Britons after Brexit
Description: The European Union's executive proposed on Tuesday that Britons be allowed to visit the bloc without visas after Brexit and stepped up preparations in case of a no-deal divorce.

Headline: Labour aims to force May to publish Brexit legal advice
Description: The Labour Party said it would try to force the government in a special vote on Tuesday to publish its legal advice on leaving the European Union, including on how the deal will handle the sensitive issue of the Irish border.

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP will support publication of Brexit legal advice
Description: The small Northern Irish party propping up Theresa May's government said it would vote on Tuesday in support of an attempt by opposition lawmakers to force the government to publish the legal advice it has received on Brexit.

Headline: UK government says lawmakers will have access to legal analysis of Brexit agreement
Description: British lawmakers should have access to legal analysis of any EU withdrawal agreement before being asked to vote to approve it, Cabinet Office minister David Lidington said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU's Timmermans says working for Brexit deal as bloc advances no-deal preparations
Description: The European Commission has adopted some contingency plans for no-deal Brexit, deputy head Frans Timmermans said on Tuesday, adding that a negotiated divorce with Britain was still by far the bloc's preferred solution.

Headline: Fox: no one believes "no deal" is a good Brexit outcome
Description: British Trade Secretary Liam Fox said on Tuesday a lot of effort was being put into achieving a Brexit deal with the European Union as no one believed leaving without an agreement was a good outcome.

Headline: Premier Foods moves to Brexit-proof supplies of Oxo cubes, Mr Kipling cakes
Description: Premier Foods  will start stockpiling ingredients and packaging to ensure Britain doesn't run out of store cupboard favourites such as Oxo stock cubes and Mr Kipling cakes in the event it crashes out of the European Union without a deal.

Headline: Brexit deal "closer than it was yesterday" - UK government source
Description: Progress has been made in agreeing the text for Britain's divorce terms with the European Union, with only a couple "sticking points" left to finalise a withdrawal agreement, a government source said on Tuesday.

Headline: Boris Johnson says Brexit deal will make Britain an EU colony
Description: Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May and the European Union are stage managing a Brexit deal that will doom the United Kingdom to the status of a colony, former British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK's WTO ambassador - It is dawning on other members there is a possibility of no Brexit deal
Description: It is dawning on other members of the World Trade Organization that there is a possibility Britain leaves the European Union without a deal, Britain's Ambassador to the WTO said on Tuesday.

Headline: Hunt says unclear when Brexit talks will conclude
Description: Around 95 percent of the Brexit divorce deal is done but the remaining five percent is difficult and so it is unclear when talks will conclude, Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headline: Third of small UK firms see post-Brexit sterling slump - survey
Description: More than a third of small- and medium-sized British companies think the pound is likely to fall sharply after the country leaves the European Union in March next year, a survey showed on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit talks are nearing their endgame, May says
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday that there were still considerable unresolved issues with the European Union over Brexit as the two sides approached the "endgame" in negotiations for departure from the bloc.

Headline: May stares into Brexit abyss as domestic opposition mounts
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit strategy came under attack from all sides on Monday, putting in doubt her ability to steer any agreement through parliament and raising the risk of  a disruptive "no-deal" exit from the European Union next March.

Headline: May's spokesman says FT report on Barnier should be treated with scepticism
Description: A Financial Times report that the main elements of a Brexit treaty text are ready to present to the British cabinet on Tuesday should be treated with scepticism, British Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said.

Headline: Chaos, deal or new vote: What is the grand Brexit finale?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is trying to clinch a Brexit divorce deal with the European Union but the bigger challenge may be to get any agreement approved by the British parliament.

Headline: Ireland's Coveney: this week very important for Brexit deal, still work to do
Description: Ireland's foreign minister Simon Coveney said on Monday this was a very important week for talks on the terms of Britain's exit from the European Union and that there was still work to do as the issues remaining to be solved were the same as before.

Headline: May's spokesman - We expect cabinet to back PM on Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman on Monday said he expected cabinet ministers to keep backing their leader on Brexit, and that they would be called to a meeting to discuss an EU exit deal as and when there was something to talk about.

Headline: Gove: PM May is trying to get the best Brexit deal
Description: Britain's Environment Secretary Michael Gove said on Monday that Prime Minister Theresa May was trying to get the best Brexit deal.

Headline: Hard to see real Brexit progress in November - Belgium's Reynders
Description: It is unlikely that there will be a breakthrough in negotiations on Britain's exit from the European Union this month, Belgian Foreign Minister Didier Reynders said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit talks are ongoing, no emergency cabinet was scheduled - UK government source
Description: No meeting of Prime Minister Theresa May's cabinet was scheduled for Monday and negotiations to leave the European Union are continuing, a government source said.

Headline: Everyone must prepare for possibility of hard Brexit - Germany
Description: Everyone needs to make plans for a hard Brexit just in case, German Deputy Finance Minister Joerg Kukies said on Monday.

Headline: UK parliament will vote down May's Brexit deal, former minister says
Description: The British parliament will vote down Prime Minister Theresa May's possible Brexit so voters should be given a new referendum, May's former education minister said on Monday.

Headline: UK's Labour Party - If PM May's deal fails, we want an election
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party said that if Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal was voted down then it would push for a national election and also possibly another referendum, Brexit spokesman Keir Starmer said.

Headline: Change Brexit course or face total surrender - Boris Johnson
Description: Former British foreign minister Boris Johnson called again on Sunday for Prime Minister Theresa May to change course on Brexit, accusing her of forcing through a deal to keep the country locked in the EU's customs union in a "total surrender".

Headline: May cannot expect Labour to save her Brexit vote - Thornberry
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May cannot expect the opposition Labour Party to save her in a parliamentary vote on any Brexit deal, Emily Thornberry, Labour's foreign affairs policy chief, said on Sunday.

Headline: Change tack or face defeat, Brexit critics tell May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May was under growing pressure on Sunday to change her plan for Britain to leave the European Union to avoid defeat in a parliamentary vote.

Headline: Softly, softly for now, May's enforcers gear up for big Brexit vote
Description: Less than five months before Britain leaves the European Union, Prime Minister Theresa May's parliamentary enforcers are on the prowl.

Headline: Brexit negotiations moving slowly towards a deal, says EU's Juncker
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said progress is being made towards a definitive Brexit deal but that it is slow.

Headline: Eurosceptic minister shows support for British PM on Brexit
Description: Andrea Leadsom, leader of Britain's lower house of parliament, said on Sunday she supported Prime Minister Theresa May and did not expect other ministers to resign over Brexit.

Headline: Britain cannot push for unilateral end to Brexit backstop - Hinds
Description: Britain cannot push for a unilateral mechanism to end a so-called backstop arrangement to prevent the return of a hard border between Northern Ireland and EU-member Ireland, Education Minister Damian Hinds said on Sunday.

Headline: Britain's armed forces making contingency plans for 'no deal' Brexit - defence officials
Description: Britain's armed forces are making contingency plans for how they could support the country if Britain leaves the European Union without a deal, senior British defence officials said on Sunday.

Headline: British opposition spokesperson says Labour won't vote for 'blind Brexit'
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party will not vote in parliament for a bad Brexit deal or a "blind Brexit", Labour's defence spokesperson Nia Griffith said on Sunday.

Headline: Jo Johnson quits UK government, urges referendum to avoid Brexit chaos
Description: Jo Johnson, the younger brother of Boris, resigned from British Prime Minister Theresa May's government on Friday, calling in a withering critique for another referendum to avoid her Brexit plans unleashing Britain's greatest crisis since World War Two.

Headline: Jo Johnson quits UK government over "delusional" Brexit deal
Description: British junior transport minister Jo Johnson said on Friday he was quitting the government over its proposed Brexit deal, calling for a second referendum and saying Britain stood on the brink of the greatest crisis since World War Two.

Headline: Factbox - A year of resignations from May's government
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has suffered 14 resignations from her government in the last year and a day, six of which have been related to her approach to Brexit. Here is the list:

Headline: Instant View - Jo Johnson resigns from UK government, calls for new referendum
Description: Jo Johnson, the younger brother of Boris, resigned from Prime Minister Theresa May's government on Friday, calling for another referendum to avoid the vassalage or chaos that he said her Brexit plans would unleash.

Headline: Fox says Britain may not get a deal with the EU
Description: Britain may not be able to reach a divorce deal with the European Union because a number of contentious issues still stand in the way, trade minister Liam Fox said on Saturday.

Headline: Ministers present May with 'plan B' for no-deal Brexit scenario - Sun
Description: Cabinet ministers have drawn up a 'plan B' for a no-deal Brexit in case parliament votes down Prime Minister Theresa May's proposed plan to leave the European Union, The Sun reported on Friday.

Headline: Brexit distracting UK from bigger challenges, says BoE's Haldane
Description: Brexit is distracting Britain's government and businesses from the longer-term challenges of boosting productivity and living standards, Bank of England Chief Economist Andy Haldane said on Friday.

Headline: Northern Irish kingmakers tell PM May: Don't betray United Kingdom
Description: The Northern Irish party that props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government on Friday cast her Brexit negotiation as a betrayal and said it could not support a deal that divided the United Kingdom.

Headline: DUP leader says will not support May Brexit proposal in parliament
Description: The leader of the Northern Irish party that props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government said on Friday her 10 members of parliament would not support the government's current Brexit proposal if it is put to a vote.

Headline: Chance of no-deal Brexit holds firm at one-in-four as clock ticks - Reuters poll
Description: With less than five months left before Britain and the European Union officially part ways, there remains a one-in-four chance the sides fail to reach a deal on the terms of departure, according to economists polled by Reuters this week.

Headline: France's Macron to meet Merkel on Nov. 18 over eurozone reform
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron will meet German Chancellor Angela Merkel in Berlin on Nov. 18 to discuss implementation of the so-called Meseberg eurozone reform proposal agreed in June, the Elysee Palace said on Friday.

Headline: More work needed on Brexit deal, EU negotiators say
Description: EU negotiators told national envoys on Friday that they need more work yet to close a Brexit deal with Britain, diplomats familiar with the briefing told Reuters.

Headline: DUP says large number of MPs would reject PM May's proposed Brexit border deal
Description: The Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government said on Friday that it would not support her proposed deal with the EU on the Irish border in its current form and that many other members of parliament would likely reject it.

Headline: There will be no second EU referendum under any circumstances - PM May's office
Description: Britain will not have a second referendum on its membership of the European Union under any circumstances, Prime Minister Theresa May's office said on Friday after minister Jo Johnson resigned and called for a new vote.

Headline: Norway suspends arms export licences to Saudi Arabia
Description: Norway announced on Friday that it was suspending new licenses for arms exports to Saudi Arabia following recent developments in the Gulf kingdom and the situation in Yemen.

Headline: Germany confident Brexit deal can be reached - Foreign Minister
Description: The German government is confident that London and the European Union can clinch a deal on Britain's planned exit from the bloc, Foreign Minister Heiko Maas told the German lower house of parliament on Friday.

Headline: Irish PM says Brexit deal in coming weeks 'more likely than not'
Description: Ireland's Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said a deal between Britain and the European Union over Britain's exit from the bloc was "more likely than not" within weeks.

Headline: UK minister Lidington expects Brexit deal in coming weeks
Description: Britain's Cabinet Office Minister David Lidington on Friday said he believed his government could secure a Brexit withdrawal agreement with the European Union in the coming weeks and secure a majority in parliament to ratify it.

Headline: Irish PM says Brexit deal possible in next couple of weeks
Description: Ireland's Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said a deal between Britain and the European Union over Britain's exit from the bloc was possible within weeks.

Headline: German minister says Brexit deal more likely than not
Description: German Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Friday he was optimistic that Britain and its EU partners would clinch a deal on Brexit, saying success was more likely than failure.

Headline: UK will not accept Brexit deal which separates Northern Ireland from UK -  Jeremy Wright
Description: Britain's culture minister Jeremy Wright said the government would not accept a Brexit deal which separates Northern Ireland from the rest of the UK via a hard border down the Irish Sea.

Headline: British minister optimistic about Brexit deal with EU - Funke
Description: Britain's junior Brexit minister told a German media outlet he was optimistic that Britain and the European Union would reach a Brexit deal soon, adding that he hoped this would happen in the next three weeks.

Headline: EU wants customs border in Irish Sea in case of no-deal Brexit - Times
Description: The European Union wants a customs border in the Irish Sea, between Northern Ireland and the rest of the United Kingdom, in the event of a no-deal Brexit, a letter from Theresa May seen by the London Times newspaper suggested.

Headline: UK government source plays down talk of imminent Brexit deal - PA
Description: Media reports suggesting that Britain could seal a divorce deal with the European Union in the next few days should be taken "with a very large pinch of salt", a senior UK government source told the Press Association on Thursday.

Headline: Spoof London billboards seek to celebrate Putin's 'role' in Brexit
Description: Spoof billboards celebrating Russian President Vladimir Putin's "contribution" to Brexit have been put up in London by a satirical group which says it wants to secure recognition for the role Russian military intelligence played in the referendum.

Headline: Brexit deal to be published next week, draft timetable cited by Times reporter
Description: The United Kingdom's Brexit deal with the European Union will be published on Tuesday after the cabinet reviews the deal on Monday, according to a draft timetable being discussed in London, the deputy political editor for The Times said.

Headline: PM May dives into diplomacy in bid to clinch Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May steps up attempts to court European support for a Brexit deal on Thursday as negotiations on securing a smooth British divorce from the world's biggest trading bloc enter their final stages.

Headline: EU watchdog proposes derivatives fix in case of no-deal Brexit
Description: The European Union's markets watchdog has proposed a temporary fix to avoid uncleared derivatives contracts worth trillions of euros being disrupted if there is a no-deal Brexit next March.

Headline: British government cannot stop Brexit case going to ECJ, Scottish court says
Description: Britain's government cannot stop a case seeking to determine whether the country can unilaterally reverse Brexit - due to be considered by Europe's top court on Nov. 27 - Scotland's Court of Session ruled on Thursday.

Headline: EU wants Brexit Britain to stick to aid, environment, rights rules - sources
Description: The European Union wants Britain to stick to the bloc's rules on state aid, environment and workers' rights after Brexit to prevent it from gaining unfair access to the single market, diplomatic sources and officials told Reuters.

Headline: Hunt seeks to reassure France as Brexit deal inches nearer
Description: UK foreign minister Jeremy Hunt said a final Brexit deal was unlikely in the next seven days but would happen soon, as he sought to reassure France that bilateral relations would remain strong after Britain leaves the EU.

Headline: German conservative Merz sees "major impact" on EU economy from Brexit
Description: Brexit will have a major impact on continental Europe's economy, said German conservative Friedrich Merz, who is running to replace Chancellor Angela Merkel as leader of her Christian Democrats (CDU).

Headline: Javid: "We're in the closing stages" of Brexit talks
Description: Britain and the European Union are in the closing stages of talks about a deal on the terms of the UK's departure from the bloc, British interior minister Sajid Javid said on Thursday.

Headline: Cabinet meeting on Brexit unlikely ahead of next week - UK government source
Description: It is unlikely that a cabinet meeting of British Prime Minister Theresa May's top ministers to discuss Brexit will take place ahead of next week, a government source said on Thursday.

Headline: Irish foreign minister urges caution on Brexit breakthrough
Description: Ireland's foreign minister tried to dampen expectations on Thursday that a Brexit deal might be imminent and said it would be wrong to assume that any consensus within the British government meant that an agreement had been clinched.

Headline: Britain will not pursue "race to bottom" after Brexit: Hunt
Description: Britain will not pursue "a race to the bottom" after it leaves the European Union, its Foreign Minister Jeremy Hunt said in Paris on Thursday, seeking to allay European concerns that Britain might seek to diverge sharply from European regulations.

Headline: Brexit deal could be reached in coming days - Austrian newspaper
Description: London and Brussels could reach a deal on Britain's looming departure from the European Union in the coming days, Austrian newspaper Der Standard on Thursday cited European Commission sources as saying.

Headline: Irish PM sees fading chance of Brexit deal in November
Description: The chances of sealing a deal on Britain's withdrawal from the European Union this month are receding, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Wednesday, and the EU's Brexit negotiator called on Britain to make decisive choices.

Headline: UK government must show MPs legal advice on Irish backstop - Labour
Description: The British government must show MPs the full legal advice it has received on the so-called Irish backstop before they are asked to vote on any Brexit agreement, the opposition Labour Party said on Wednesday.

Headline: Leaked British memo gives a taste of PM May's possible Brexit finale
Description: A memorandum leaked from within the British government gives a taste of a possible finale to the Brexit drama: Prime Minister Theresa May hails a deal in just over 10 days, supporters cheer as arranged, and the pact is put to a vote in parliament on Nov. 27.

Headline: EU's Barnier cannot say when Brexit deal could be reached
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Wednesday it was impossible to say when divorce talks with Britain would be finalised and that there would be no deal agreed without a solid fix for the Irish border.

Headline: EU court sets Nov. 27 hearing on Brexit reversal case
Description: Judges at the European Union's highest court will hear a case on the Brexit process on Nov. 27, reviewing whether Britain could unilaterally withdraw its decision to leave the EU, the Court of Justice said in a statement on Wednesday.

Headline: EU's Tusk, May discuss "way ahead" on Brexit
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said he discussed the "way ahead" on Brexit negotiations with British Prime Minister Theresa May on Tuesday.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP - We're not afraid of UK election if Brexit deal falls short
Description: The Northern Irish party that British Prime Minister Theresa May depends upon for a majority in parliament are not afraid of a general election should they object to her Brexit deal, a senior lawmaker for the party said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit deal hopes send sterling to two-week highs
Description: Sterling erased earlier losses and headed back towards the day's highs in volatile trading on Tuesday on growing hopes of a Brexit deal breakthrough after a cabinet meeting.

Headline: May sets up business councils to advise on post-Brexit policy
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has created five new business councils to advise on issues facing core sectors of the economy as Britain leaves the European Union, her office said on Tuesday.

Headline: PM office rejects BBC report on November Brexit timetable
Description: Britain wants a Brexit agreement by the end of November and Prime Minister Theresa May would give a speech on Nov. 19 saying she had delivered on the referendum with a deal which brings the country back together, the BBC reported on Tuesday.

Headline: No deal yet as Irish border holds up Brexit, EU and UK say
Description: A Brexit deal is close but not yet done due to differences over the Irish border, Britain and the European Union said on Tuesday as sterling see-sawed on contrasting perceptions of how hard it will be for Prime Minister Theresa May to clinch an agreement.

Headline: DUP leader Foster says Dublin rhetoric could lead to no-deal
Description: The leader of the Northern Irish party propping up British Prime Minister Theresa May's government says the rhetoric surrounding the current Brexit negotiations suggests "we're heading towards a no-deal".

Headline: Spain seeks contingency plans with tour operators in case of no-deal Brexit
Description: Spain's tourism minister, who is meeting with British tour operators in London this week, said she is working on contingency plans to ensure that 18 million British visitors a year can still reach Spain in the event of a "no-deal" Brexit.

Headline: No Brexit deal, no transition without Irish backstop - EU's Barnier
Description: The European Union will not conclude an exit agreement with Britain or give London a transition period after Brexit without a deal that prevents a "hard" border in Ireland, the bloc's main negotiator said on Tuesday.

Headline: Barnier insists on "all-weather" Irish backstop
Description: A "backstop" arrangement for avoiding a hard border on the island of Ireland whatever happens after Brexit is a condition for any EU withdrawal agreement with Britain, EU negotiator Michel Barnier said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain says no special Brexit cabinet meeting scheduled yet
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has not scheduled an additional cabinet meeting for this week, her spokesman said on Tuesday, but senior ministers would meet again when the time is right to approve a Brexit withdrawal agreement.

Headline: Brexit deal could come by end of week, BBC reporter says
Description: The United Kingdom and European Union might have made enough progress to push the button on a deal by the end of the week, BBC Political Editor Laura Kuenssberg said on Tuesday.

Headline: 'We're heading for no deal Brexit,' Northern Ireland DUP lawmaker says
Description: The United Kingdom is heading towards leaving the European Union without a divorce deal, a senior member of the Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government said on Tuesday.

Headline: PM May says won't seek Brexit deal "at any cost", needs more time
Description: Britain needs more time to figure out a solution on the post-Brexit Irish border and will not accept a deal at any cost from Brussels, Prime Minister Theresa May told her cabinet on Tuesday.

Headline: Regrexit? British voters would now back staying in the EU, poll shows
Description: Britain would now vote to stay in the European Union as more young people and those who did not bother to vote in the shock 2016 referendum would now vote against Brexit, a survey of 20,000 voters showed.

Headline: British cabinet will meet again when it's decision time for Brexit - source
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's cabinet of top ministers will meet again when there is a decision to be taken on a Brexit deal, but so far no such meeting has been scheduled this week, a government source said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain's Fox: "impossible" to say if Brexit deal can be reached this month or next
Description: British trade minister Liam Fox said on Tuesday it was "impossible" for him to say if a Brexit deal could be reached with the European Union this month or next, but Britain wanted an agreement, and a deal is better than no deal.

Headline: Agreeing backstop review can move Brexit talks forward - Irish minister
Description: Agreeing a review mechanism that would allow the EU and Britain to decide when a "backstop" to keep the Irish border open after Brexit is no longer needed could help move talks along now, Ireland's European affairs minister said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK cabinet ministers to ask May to 'stare down' EU on Irish border issue - The Sun
Description: UK cabinet ministers are set to tell Prime Minister Theresa May to 'stare down' the EU on the Irish border issue or face Brexit deal being destroyed, the Sun newspaper reported http://bit.ly/2AOTXIt on Monday.

Headline: EU to offer Irish border compromise in Brexit talks - The Times
Description: The European Union is preparing to back a compromise proposal on the Irish border to resolve the last major hurdle in Brexit negotiations, the Times of London reported on Monday.

Headline: Ireland says UK cannot unilaterally scrap border backstop
Description: Ireland is willing to examine ways in which a "backstop" to keep the Irish border open after Brexit could be reviewed so long as it does not permit Britain to unilaterally walk away from it, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Monday.

Headline: PM May - Brexit withdrawal deal 95 percent complete, confident of Northern Irish deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May believes a deal in which Britain will leave the European Union is almost done and is confident of a solution on Northern Ireland, currently the sticking point for Brexit to happen in time for a March deadline.

Headline: EU's Barnier says 'leap into unknown' for expatriates in no-deal Brexit
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Monday that divorce negotiations with London were not driven by a sense of revenge and that a no-deal, or a "hard" Brexit would spell trouble for expatriates.

Headline: Irish foreign minister sees middle-ground position on backstop
Description: A middle-ground position on the "backstop" arrangement to keep the Irish border open after Brexit can be found but it must be legally sound, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney was quoted as saying on Monday.

Headline: Significant outstanding issues related to Irish backstop - PM May's spokesman
Description: There are significant outstanding issues in Brexit negotiations over the Irish backstop and work is ongoing to resolve them, British Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Britain's big Brexit vote: Will parliament back PM May?
Description: If British Prime Minister Theresa May is able to strike a Brexit deal with the European Union in the coming days or weeks, she will face a crucial vote in parliament when she asks lawmakers to approve it.

Headline: Britain confident of 'imminent' Brexit deal for financial sector
Description: The United Kingdom is confident that it is on the verge of reaching an agreement with the European Union to give London's vast financial centre access to EU markets after Brexit, Britain's financial services minister John Glen said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit ministry board member tells companies to prepare for no deal
Description: Susan Hooper, a British executive who sits on the board of the Brexit ministry, told businesses to prepare for a no-deal exit on Monday as time starts to run down on the "almost impossible task" of finding an agreement that works for everyone.

Headline: Britain tells Ireland it needs mechanism to end any Brexit backstop
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May on Monday told her Irish counterpart Leo Varadkar that there would need to be a mechanism to end any backstop arrangement designed to prevent a hard border between Ireland and Northern Ireland after Brexit.

Headline: Ireland willing to examine backstop review mechanism - PM
Description: Ireland is willing to examine ways in which a "backstop" to keep the Irish border open after Brexit could be reviewed so long as it does not permit a unilateral decision to end it, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit deal will not be agreed this week - Sun political editor
Description: No Brexit deal is likely to be agreed this week between Britain and the European Union and the prospective dates for an emergency summit to seal a deal have been pushed back to Nov. 27 or 28, The Sun newspaper's political editor said on Monday.

Headline: UK working to secure Brexit deal as soon as possible - PM May's spokesman
Description: Britain is working to secure a Brexit deal as soon as possible, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Monday, adding that a decision on whether to hold a special Brexit summit later this month is up to the European Union.

Headline: Chance of grounded flights in no-deal Brexit "close to zero" - Cyprus minister
Description: The chance that flights will be grounded between the UK and the European Union in the event of a no-deal Brexit is "close to zero", said Cyprus's tourism minister Yiorgos Lakkotrypis.

Headline: "We are not there yet," EU executive says on Brexit
Description: The European Union and Britain are still in technical negotiations to seal a Brexit deal, a spokesman for the bloc's executive said on Monday.

Headline: UK to assume no-deal Brexit unless a deal done in a week, ITV political editor
Description: The British government has decided that unless there is a deal struck with the European Union within a week, the default option of a no-deal Brexit becomes the probable outcome, ITV's political editor said on Monday.

Headline: Healthineers making plans for 'logistics crisis' in case of hard Brexit - CEO
Description: Siemens Healthineers  is making plans for how to protect itself against a potential "logistics crisis" in the case of a hard Brexit, its chief executive said on Monday.

Headline: Raab wants right to scrap Irish backstop after three months - media
Description: British Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab has privately demanded the right to pull Britain out of a "backstop" arrangement for the Irish border after three months, the Telegraph reported on Sunday.

Headline: UK Brexit-supporting lawmaker Baker - We must leave the EU customs union
Description: A prominent rebel lawmaker in Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party said on Monday that the United Kingdom must leave the European Union's customs union.

Headline: Raab presses May to back hardline plan on Irish border - FT
Description: Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab has written to Prime Minister Theresa May urging her to support his plan to demand the right to pull Britain out of an Irish border 'backstop' pact after three months, the Financial Times reported.

Headline: All-UK customs Brexit deal report is 'speculation' - PM May's office
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's office has dismissed as "speculation" a newspaper report that suggests an all-UK customs deal will be written into the legally binding agreement governing Britain's withdrawal from the EU

Headline: Dublin, London, DUP talk up chances of Brexit deal
Description: Senior Irish and British ministers and the leader of the Northern Irish unionist party propping up the minority British government all expressed confidence on Friday that a Brexit deal could be reached in the coming weeks.

Headline: Britain, Ireland plan regular summits to maintain ties post-Brexit
Description: Britain and Ireland will seek to hold regular summits between leaders and ministers after Brexit to maintain ties strained by Britain's decision to leave the EU, senior ministers from both governments said on Friday.

Headline: Ireland, UK hopeful of Brexit deal in coming weeks - ministers
Description: Britain's Cabinet Office Minister David Lidington said he "hoped and expected" that Brexit negotiators will secure a final agreement in the coming weeks, a view shared on Friday by Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney.

Headline: EU floats new Irish border compromise in tentative Brexit plan - FT
Description: European Union negotiators have floated a tentative Brexit plan to avoid a hard border on the island of Ireland and to give Britain stronger guarantees that a customs border would not be needed along the Irish Sea, the Financial Times said on Thursday.

Headline: UK and EU make progress on Brexit deal on financial services - UK official
Description: The United Kingdom and the European Union have made progress on a deal to give London's dominant financial centre basic access to EU markets after Brexit, two British officials said, but no agreement has yet been clinched.

Headline: European businesses demand urgent Brexit deal after meeting May
Description: European business leaders said on Thursday that British Prime Minister Theresa May must find a Brexit deal with the European Union as quickly as possible because uncertainty is damaging investment and undermining growth.

Headline: UK crime agency investigates Brexit campaigner Banks over loans
Description: Britain's serious crime agency began an investigation on Thursday into Brexit backer Arron Banks and one of the main groups that campaigned to leave the European Union over the true source of millions of pounds in loans.

Headline: UK has not seen any successful interference in its democratic processes - May's spokeswoman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Thursday that the government had so far not seen any successful interference in Britain's democratic processes but it remained vigilant.

Headline: European business leaders say Brexit agreement must urgently be found
Description: European business leaders said a Brexit agreement must urgently be found as uncertainty over Britain's exit from the European Union was leading to less investment and undermining growth.

Headline: PM May's spokeswoman declines comment on Brexit campaign funding probe
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Thursday she was unable to comment on the ongoing criminal investigation into funding of the pro-Brexit campaign.

Headline: Barnier says EU may grant or withdraw equivalence in financial services
Description: The EU's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier denied on Thursday a Times report of a deal with London on post-Brexit financial services, saying the EU could grant and withdraw equivalence for some financial services on its own.

Headline: EU executive: financial services arrangement only to be discussed after Brexit divorce deal
Description: The European Commission denied on Thursday a report by the Times newspaper that Britain had secured agreement with the EU on financial services after Brexit, saying such a relationship would only be discussed after a divorce deal has been finalised.

Headline: PM May's spokesman says reports of UK-EU financial services deal are speculation
Description: Prime Minster Theresa May's spokesman said reports that Britain was close to securing a deal to give it basic access to EU financial markets were speculation, and negotiations were ongoing.

Headline: UK-EU financial services deal has not been done - UK govt source
Description: A British government source denied a newspaper report that the UK and the EU had reached a deal on financial services.

Headline: Article on UK getting post-Brexit financial services deal is incorrect - EU official
Description: A report by the Times newspaper that Britain and the European Union had reached a tentative agreement on all aspects of a future partnership on services after Brexit is wrong, an EU official said on Thursday.

Headline: UK, EU financial services deal on some access nearly done - UK source
Description: A Brexit deal is nearly done that would give UK-based financial services firms some form of access to European markets, a British official told Reuters.

Headline: Future EU-UK relationship likely an FTA plus equivalence plus MoUs - EU's Huebner
Description: The future relationship between the European Union and Britain after Brexit is likely to be governed by a free trade agreement (FTA), legal equivalence rules for financial services and memoranda of understanding, an EU official said on Thursday.

Headline: EU executive wants divorce deal with Britain, tech level contacts continue
Description: The European Commission said on Thursday it wanted to reach a deal with Britain on its exit from the European Union and that technical contacts were continuing, but that no new high level meetings were scheduled so far.

Headline: EXPLAINER - Britain nears Brexit financial services deal with EU
Description: Britain and the European Union are close to a deal giving UK-based financial services firms basic access to the bloc's markets after Brexit, a British official said.

Headline: EU negotiator plays down hopes of Brexit divorce deal in three weeks - Telegraph
Description: A senior European Union negotiator has poured cold water on hopes that a Brexit divorce deal could be reached within three weeks, Britain's Daily Telegraph reported on Thursday.

Headline: May seeks to reassure business on Brexit progress
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May appeared assured when she met business leaders on Wednesday, attendees of the meeting said, and sounded confident on prospects for striking a Brexit deal despite concern that Britain might leave the European Union without one.

Headline: May gave robust update to business, admitted Brexit investment difficulties - Serco CEO
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May was robust in giving a pragmatic assessment of Brexit talks to executives on Wednesday but admitted there was little she could do to spur investment while uncertainty remained, Serco CEO Rupert Soames said.

Headline: May, Hammond batted away business requests for more investment - executive
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May and Chancellor Philip Hammond batted away on Wednesday requests from business leaders  for special treatment due to Brexit, a senior executive told Reuters.

Headline: May told executives Britain to be 'unequivocally' pro-business - May's office
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May told 150 business leaders that her government would be "unequivocally pro-business", May's office said on Wednesday, after criticism from some quarters that business had slipped as a priority in Brexit talks.

Headline: Britain plans diplomatic expansion as it eyes post-Brexit influence
Description: Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt on Wednesday set out plans to "reinvigorate and expand" British diplomacy after years of budget cuts as the country looks to boost its influence around the world after Brexit.

Headline: Citigroup to move 63 jobs out of London over Brexit
Description: Citigroup  said on Wednesday it was planning to move 63 jobs out of London, as it prepares for the possibility of a hard Brexit.

Headline: Britain says no date set for end of Brexit talks after Raab hints at November deal
Description: Britain on Wednesday said there was no set date for Brexit talks to finish, backtracking from a letter by Brexit secretary Dominic Raab that suggested a deal on the terms of its departure from the European Union could be finalised by Nov. 21.

Headline: Hunt: Brexit deal by November 21 entirely possible
Description: Foreign secretary Jeremy Hunt said on Wednesday it was entirely possible that there could be enough progress in Brexit talks for a deal with the European Union to be agreed by Nov.  21.

Headline: UK Brexit ministry says no set date for EU negotiations to end
Description: Britain's Brexit ministry said on Wednesday that there was no set date for Brexit talks to end and Nov. 21 was simply the date MPs proposed Brexit secretary Dominic Raab should appear before a Brexit committee.

Headline: Deal on Brexit is possible by November 21 - Irish foreign minister
Description: A deal on Britain's withdrawal from the European Union is possible by November 21, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Wednesday, but it will require British negotiators in particular to step up efforts.

Headline: Deal on Brexit is possible by November 21: Irish foreign minister
Description: A deal on Britain's withdrawal from the European Union is possible by November 21, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Wednesday, but it will require British negotiators in particular to step up efforts.

Headline: PM May's spokesman: No comment on Nov. 21 Brexit deal date, want agreement soon
Description: Prime Minster Theresa May's spokesman declined to say whether an EU exit deal was expected by Nov. 21, as indicated in a letter by her Brexit minister Dominic Raab earlier on Wednesday, but said government was working to get a deal as soon as possible.

Headline: Exclusive: Bentley warns worst case no deal Brexit would hit profitability, investment
Description: The boss of carmaker Bentley said failure to reach a Brexit deal would be "quite damaging" to annual profit in the worst case scenario, limit the company's ability to invest and could lead to its plant closing for an additional few days.

Headline: New 50 pence coin to commemorate Britain's Brexit day
Description: Britain will mint a new 50 pence coin to commemorate leaving the European Union in spring 2019, the finance ministry said on Monday.

Headline: UK confident of a good Brexit deal, health minister says
Description: Britain's health minister said on Monday he was confident that the United Kingdom will get a good deal with the European Union before it leaves the bloc next March.

Headline: Hammond to turn up heat on Brexit rebels in budget speech
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond will use his annual  budget speech on Monday to urge his divided Conservative Party to get behind the government's push for a Brexit deal, or put at risk a long-awaited easing of austerity.

Headline: Hammond says has money buffer in case of Brexit shock
Description: British Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Sunday he remained prepared to use money he has kept aside to help the economy cope with the shock of leaving the European Union without a Brexit deal.

Headline: UK budget and Bank of England take back seat to Brexit drama
Description: Britain's budget announcement on Monday and a "Super Thursday" at the Bank of England would normally be key moments for the world's fifth-biggest economy, but this time they are likely to be overshadowed by the drama of Brexit.

Headline: Fitch says it no longer assumes Britain will get a smooth Brexit
Description: Ratings agency Fitch said on Friday it no longer assumed that Britain would leave the European Union in a smooth transition and said an acrimonious and disruptive "no deal" Brexit could lead to a further downgrade of its sovereign credit rating.

Headline: ECB's Villeroy tells insurers to trigger hard-Brexit plans
Description: French insurers should trigger Brexit contingency plans now in case British and EU negotiatiors fail to reach agreement on the terms of Britain's departure from the bloc, the governor of the Bank of France said on Friday.

Headline: Merkel says Europe wants orderly Brexit, is not looking at other scenarios
Description: Europe wants an orderly solution to Brexit and is not debating other options as Britain negotiates its withdrawal from the European Union, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Friday.

Headline: UK signals failure of bid for quick Brexit transition at WTO
Description: Britain signalled on Thursday that its attempt to seal terms for its post-Brexit membership of the World Trade Organization by a fast-track procedure had failed, and it must now enter negotiations which are likely to be lengthy.

Headline: Hammond to warn of Brexit hit to spending hopes - NIESR
Description: British Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond is likely to warn that a no-deal Brexit would hit the public finances and prevent an end to austerity when he delivers his annual budget next week, a think-tank said.

Headline: Bank of England tells banks to build Brexit cash cushions by March
Description: Banks in Britain must hold enough cash to withstand any disorderly Brexit hitting financial markets next March, Bank of England Deputy Governor Sam Woods said on Thursday.

Headline: British 'all-UK' backstop falls short, may be part of solution - Irish PM
Description: Britain's proposal that a so-called "all-UK" backstop provide an insurance mechanism to avoid a hard border on the island of Ireland falls short of EU demands but could form part of a solution, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Thursday.

Headline: ECB's Draghi: As Brexit talks drag on, private sector must prepare for no deal
Description: European Central Bank President Mario Draghi said on Thursday the longer Brexit talks drag on, the more the private sector will have to prepare for the possibility of Britain crashing out of the European Union with no deal on their future relations.

Headline: May to meet business leaders to discuss Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May and the Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond will meet around 120 chief executives and international investors on Wednesday to discuss Brexit and next week's budget, her spokesman said.

Headline: UK and EU close to agreeing Brexit deal, Raab says
Description: The United Kingdom and the European Union are close to agreeing a Brexit deal, Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab said on Thursday.

Headline: UK says EU pragmatism could alleviate Brexit border blockages
Description: If a no-deal Brexit caused blockages at the borders of the United Kingdom then European Union pragmatism could help alleviate disruption, Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab said on Thursday.

Headline: UK car production slumps in September
Description: British car output fell by 16.8 percent last month, hit by new emissions regulations, model changes, trade tensions and uncertainty over diesel policy and Brexit, an industry body said on Thursday.

Headline: Google, Facebook executives meet with UK government over no-deal Brexit - Telegraph
Description: The UK chiefs of Microsoft Corp , Facebook  and Alphabet Inc's  Google met with British government ministers in London on Wednesday to seek assurances over the impact of a no-deal Brexit on jobs and investment, the Telegraph reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Exclusive: UK derivatives clearers may get no-Brexit deal reprieve - EU document
Description: The European Union might grant temporary permission for clearing houses in Britain to continue serving EU customers if there is a no-deal Brexit next March, an EU document seen by Reuters showed.

Headline: No-deal Brexit risks travel chaos, nightmare at airports - IATA
Description: A no-deal Brexit could wreak chaos for travellers and a nightmare at airports, global airline industry body IATA warned, calling on British and European Union aviation authorities to put in place a plan to avoid such a worst-case scenario.

Headline: PM May receives show of loyalty after talk of leadership challenge
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May received a show of support from her Conservative Party on Wednesday at a meeting in parliament, shifting the focus away from talk of an imminent leadership challenge over her Brexit strategy.

Headline: Conservative lawmakers air Brexit concerns but back PM May - former minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May heard lawmakers' concerns about Brexit at a meeting in parliament on Wednesday, but was also given their backing, former interior minister Amber Rudd told reporters.

Headline: Cheering heard as May arrives at meeting with Conservative lawmakers
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's arrival at a meeting of her Conservative Party's lawmakers was greeted with cheers and banging of desks, a Reuters reporter outside the private meeting said on Wednesday.

Headline: May's ministers go to Downing Street
Description: Some of Prime Minister Theresa May's senior ministers and lawmakers from the Northern Irish party which props up her government were seen entering her Downing Street residence on Wednesday, a Reuters photographer said.

Headline: Scotland's Sturgeon sees 'ever greater' prospect of no Brexit deal
Description: Britain looks increasingly likely to leave the European Union next year with no deal, Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Wednesday.

Headline: British politics damaging chances of Brexit deal - Irish PM
Description: The chances of Brexit negotiators reaching a deal are "very adversely affected" by politics in Britain that remain very divided just five months before it leaves the European Union, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar.

Headline: PM May clear she does not want indefinite post-Brexit transition period -spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has been clear she does not want to enter into an indefinite post-Brexit transition period with the European Union, her spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: EU ready to call Brexit summit when 'decisive progress' made - Tusk
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk told the European Parliament on Wednesday that he would be ready to call a special summit on Brexit whenever negotiators said "decisive progress" had been made toward a deal.

Headline: May to address her MPs on Wednesday after attacks over Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will address her Conservative Party lawmakers at a private meeting in parliament on Wednesday, her spokesman said, as she seeks to calm growing tensions over her Brexit strategy.

Headline: UK watchdog tells companies to spell out Brexit impact
Description: Britain's listed companies must spell out how Brexit could hit their business and not pad out annual reports with generic concerns, the Financial Reporting Council (FRC) said on Wednesday.

Headline: Explainer - How the Brexit deal is shaping up
Description: Even as British Prime Minister Theresa May battles critics in her own party, she may be closing in on a Brexit deal which has been stymied by arguments over the Irish border. Here's how:

Headline: May's Brexit transition plan could last for years - London Times
Description: UK Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plan could leave Britain in a "long running" multiyear transition period, the London Times reported on Wednesday citing leaked documents seen by the newspaper.

Headline: 'No deal' Brexit would mean costly border disruption - UK spending watchdog
Description: Companies will suffer and criminals could benefit from the inevitable border disruption that will ensue if Britain leaves the European Union without a deal, the country's public spending watchdog said on Wednesday.

Headline: London's popularity as tech hub slumps ahead of Brexit
Description: London's popularity among Europe's tech startup hubs has slumped as Brexit approaches and the city only kept its top spot in an European industry survey published on Tuesday by a narrow margin.

Headline: UK says Northern Ireland can not be in separate customs territory post-Brexit
Description: Britain cannot accept Northern Ireland being in a separate customs territory from the rest of the United Kingdom, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: May says confident of getting Brexit deal MPs can support
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May believes she can get a Brexit deal that will win the support of parliament, her spokesman said on Tuesday, brushing aside questions about a possible leadership challenge.

Headline: Threshold not yet reached to trigger challenge to PM May - BBC
Description: The threshold of 48 letters from members of parliament that would trigger a leadership challenge to British Prime Minister Theresa May has not yet been reached, BBC Political Editor Laura Kuenssberg said on Twitter.

Headline: Exclusive - Aston Martin considers flying in components, changing ports to handle Brexit
Description: Aston Martin  is considering flying in car components and moving more parts through UK ports other than Dover to avoid possible border friction after Britain leaves the European Union, its boss told Reuters.

Headline: Ireland says Brexit transition extension can't be alternative to Irish backstop - newspaper
Description: An extension to Britain's post-Brexit transition period cannot be an alternative to the "backstop" agreement governing the Irish border, Ireland's foreign minister was quoted as saying on Monday by the Irish Times newspaper.

Headline: EU's Barnier plays down 'backstop' checks on Northern Irish trade
Description: The EU's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier stood firm on the need for checks on goods shipped from mainland Britain to Northern Ireland after Brexit, while insisting this would not amount to a new border, in an interview published on Sunday.

Headline: Raab says open to extending Brexit transition as May's critics step up attacks
Description: Britain could accept extending the post-Brexit transition period by a few months if the European Union drops its proposals for a so-called Northern Irish backstop, Britain's Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Sunday.

Headline: UK Brexit minister Raab says open-minded on extending post-Brexit transition
Description: Britain is open-minded about extending the post-Brexit transition period if it means the European Union drops its proposals for the so-called Irish backstop, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Sunday.

Headline: UK could accept longer Brexit transition if EU drops backstop plan - UK minister
Description: Britain would accept a possible extension to its post-Brexit transition period with the European Union if the bloc drops its demand for an Irish backstop, Britain's junior Brexit minister Suella Braverman said on Sunday.

Headline: Hundreds of thousands take to streets in London demanding second Brexit vote
Description: Hundreds of thousands of supporters of the European Union marched through London on Saturday in the biggest demonstration so far to demand that the British government holds a public vote on the terms of Brexit.

Headline: UK wants deal to avoid Northern Ireland Brexit backstop - minister
Description: Britain's Brexit minister Dominic Raab wants the European Union to accept assurances that the country will remain tied to the bloc's rules for longer in return for making a hotly contested so-called backstop for Northern Ireland unnecessary.

Headline: UK firms near point of no return for Brexit contingency plans, CBI warns
