Description: Most British companies will implement their plans for coping with a disruptive Brexit by December if there is no clarity by then on how Britain will leave the European Union, a survey by a major employers group showed.

Headline: UK ready to drop Brexit demand on Irish border - Bloomberg
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is ready to agree to a fallback arrangement for the border between the United Kingdom and Ireland which does not have a time limit, to speed Brexit talks, Bloomberg reported on Friday, citing unnamed sources.

Headline: EU's Barnier says Brexit deal 90 percent done, but Ireland issue could derail it
Description: European Union negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday a Brexit deal with the United Kingdom was 90 percent done, although there was still a chance no accord would be reached due to ongoing stumbling blocks over the Irish border.

Headline: Ireland insists on Brexit 'backstop' - PM Varadkar
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Friday that a possible extension of Britain's post-Brexit transition period would not diminish Ireland's need for a "backstop" to avoid a hard border with Northern Ireland.

Headline: UK, South Korea to work on trade ties after Brexit - PM May's office
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May agreed to work on improving trade ties with South Korea after Brexit in a meeting with President Moon Jae-in in Brussels, May's office said.

Headline: Longer Brexit transition just an idea - UK PM May's spokeswoman
Description: People should not overplay the idea of an extension to a Brexit transition period during which Britain would keep EU rules in place after it leaves the bloc, a spokeswoman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday.

Headline: German industry "staring into abyss" of no-deal Brexit - BDI
Description: German industry association BDI on Friday called on European and British leaders to reach a swift and solid Brexit deal, warning that companies are "staring into the abyss" unless an agreement is struck.

Headline: Hunt - need more progress on future EU relationship to solve Irish backstop
Description: Britain's foreign minister Jeremy Hunt said it would be hard to resolve the issue of a backstop to the Irish border problem in Brexit talks without more detail on the future relationship with the European Union after Brexit.

Headline: Singapore PM says post-Brexit trade deal with Britain possible
Description: Singapore and Britain can do a trade deal after Brexit, Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said on Friday, adding that he would be prepared to extend the terms of the Asian country's recently agreed deal with the European Union to the UK.

Headline: Extension of Brexit transition would not solve the problems - German minister
Description: The European Union and Germany's government will not block an extension of the post-Brexit transition period, but an extension alone will not solve the problems on hand, European Affairs Minister Michael Roth said on Friday.

Headline: Despite 'big gaps', UK and EU talk up Brexit prospects
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May and other EU leaders voiced renewed confidence on Thursday they could secure a Brexit deal, saying they were working hard to overcome the hurdles that only days ago brought the talks to a halt.

Headline: Luxembourg's Bettel says on March 29, it's 'game over' on Brexit
Description: Talks on Brexit cannot extend beyond March 2019 when Britain will be out of the bloc whether or not a deal on its withdrawal is found by both sides, Luxembourg's Prime Minister Xavier Bettel said on Thursday at a summit of EU leaders.

Headline: Too early to know cost of Brexit transition extension - minister
Description: Britain's Cabinet Office Minister David Lidington said it was too early to estimate the cost of extending a Brexit transition period after the government indicated it would consider asking for one to break a deadlock in talks with the EU.

Headline: Brexit transition extension would have conditions - French presidency source
Description: France does not rule out a possible lengthening of Britain's post-Brexit transition period if it helps advance negotiations with London, but any extension would come with conditions, an official in President Emmanuel Macron's office said on Thursday.

Headline: Please, no Brexit talk: Merkel, Macron hit the bar for beer and fries
Description: Angela Merkel, Emmanuel Macron and the leaders of Belgium and Luxembourg surprised late-night drinkers by dropping by a Brussels bar for beer and fries after an evening of summitry on Brexit with British Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: May has full support of her top ministers on Brexit - Raab
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has the full support of her top team of ministers in Brexit negotiations, Britain's Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Thursday.

Headline: UK is considering other ideas to break Brexit deadlock - May's spokeswoman
Description: Britain is considering other ways of making progress in Brexit negotiations with the European Union, not just a mooted extension to the transition period, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman told reporters on Thursday.

Headline: Extending Brexit transition period is a bad idea - Rees-Mogg
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's plans to consider extending a so-called transition period to break the deadlock in Brexit talks is a bad idea, according to a leading eurosceptic lawmaker in her Conservative Party.

Headline: EU negotiator calls for "orderly Brexit" with Irish backstop
Description: Britain's departure from the European Union must be orderly and include an insurance against a hard border on the island of Ireland, the European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Thursday.

Headline: EU cultivates Asian leaders on trade, climate in message to Trump
Description: The European Union sought Asian support for free trade, the Iran nuclear deal and fighting global warming at a regional summit on Thursday that included China, Japan and Russia as a counterbalance to a more protectionist United States.

Headline: Take it or leave it? EU offers May few options on Brexit deal
Description: The European Union and Britain have given themselves a few more weeks to break the deadlock in their Brexit talks but for Brussels the delay seems mainly about Prime Minister Theresa May dealing with critics back in London.

Headline: May: Brexit backstop issues remain but we have made new proposals
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday that there were still considerable unresolved issues with the European Union relating to a backstop Irish border arrangement, but that Britain had made a new proposal on the subject.

Headline: Macron: onus on May to bring Brexit proposals with UK backing
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Thursday it was now up to British Prime Minister Theresa May to come back with new Brexit proposals that she can defend politically at home.

Headline: Irish PM sees "huge difficulties" with UK-wide Brexit border backstop
Description: The European Union would have "huge difficulties" agreeing to a United Kingdom-wide Irish border backstop as it would expose the bloc's single market to unfair competition, Ireland's Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Thursday.

Headline: May says will tell MPs to remember Britons voted for Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday she would tell parliament to remember that Britons voted to leave the European Union when she asks lawmakers to approve whatever Brexit deal she is able to strike with Brussels.

Headline: May says option to extend transition could solve Northern Irish backstop issue
Description: Britain is not proposing extending the post-Brexit transition period but the option to do so could help solve the issue of the Northern Irish backstop, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday.

Headline: UK ministers have discussed extending Brexit transition - May's spokeswoman
Description: British ministers have been discussing in recent weeks the idea of extending the country's post-Brexit transition period, but the idea is not yet a formal proposal, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: Germany is prepared for Brexit - deputy finance minister
Description: German Deputy Finance Minister Joerg Kukies said on Thursday that Germany was prepared for Britain's departure from the European Union and would tackle the rules for insurers and the financial sector if necessary.

Headline: Euler Hermes sees 70 percent chance of Brexit deal at last minute
Description: There is around a 70 percent chance that Britain and the European Union will reach a Brexit deal at the last minute, credit agency Euler Hermes said on Thursday.

Headline: Belgian PM says the ball in UK's court on Brexit
Description: Belgian Prime Minister Charles Michel said on Thursday that it was for London to make the next move in talks over Britain's withdrawal from the European Union.

Headline: We need "much more time" to reach Brexit deal - EU's Barnier
Description: The European Union's chief Brexit negotiator, Michel Barnier, said on Wednesday much more time was needed to secure an exit deal for Britain, but that officials would work calmly and patiently in the coming weeks.

Headline: May seeks to reassure EU leaders on Brexit deal
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May assured EU leaders in Brussels on Wednesday that she can still reach a Brexit deal, avoiding a showdown over stalled talks as Brussels stepped up planning for a failure of negotiations.

Headline: On Brexit, May urges EU to do "difficult deal" once again
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May urged the other leaders of the European Union on Wednesday to help secure a Brexit agreement, saying they had done "difficult deals" before and could again.

Headline: EU leaders to meet on Brexit when enough progress reported - official
Description: European Union leaders are ready to meet to finalise the terms of Britain's withdrawal as soon as negotiations get close enough, but with insufficient progress so far there are no plans for an extraordinary summit in November, EU officials said.

Headline: UK seeking to do Brexit deal as quickly as possible - May's spokeswoman
Description: Britain is working to make progress in Brexit negotiations as quickly as possible, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Wednesday when asked whether a deal with the European Union could slip into December.

Headline: May "neutral" on proposal to extend post-Brexit transition - Tajani
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May gave no indication of whether she favoured extending Britain's post-Brexit transition period when the head of the European Parliament raised the matter at a summit on Wednesday, President Antonio Tajani said.

Headline: UK's May had nothing new on Brexit for summit, but tone calm - Tajani
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May offered her fellow EU leaders no new Brexit proposals on Wednesday, though she appeared keen to reach an agreement, the head of the European Parliament said.

Headline: Brexit deal will need clear approval by UK parliament - Raab
Description: Britain's parliament must provide unequivocal approval for any Brexit deal the government reaches with the European Union, or risk creating uncertainty for businesses and citizens, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said.

Headline: UK PM May to brief 150 CEOs on Brexit negotiations on Friday - FT
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is to give a Brexit briefing to 150 chief executives on Friday, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Merkel says not there yet on Brexit deal
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel promised on Wednesday to do what she could to help the European Union clinch a Brexit deal with Britain but said that the two sides were not there yet.

Headline: May says Brexit deal is achievable
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she believed a Brexit deal was achievable if both sides worked "intensively" in the coming days and weeks.

Headline: Labour eye government collapse, new elections and then swift Brexit deal
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party could win power from Theresa May's ruling Conservatives in the coming months and quickly tie up a new and different Brexit deal with the European Union, the party's finance policy chief John McDonnell said on Wednesday.

Headline: Varadkar says all 27 EU states against hard border in Ireland
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Wednesday that he had the support of all remaining 27 European Union states on ensuring a Brexit deal delivers legally-binding guarantees there will be no hard border between Ireland and northern Ireland.

Headline: EU leaders prepare hardball Brexit summit for May
Description: European Union leaders will give British Prime Minister Theresa May a tough reception in Brussels on Wednesday, warning her to rally support at home for the Brexit deal on offer or be cut loose without one in March.

Headline: May says future relationship with EU must be linked to exit deal
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday that any framework on Britain's future relationship with the European Union must be detailed, and linked to its exit agreement with the bloc.

Headline: Berlin braced for all Brexit scenarios, including no deal - Merkel
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said there was still a chance of concluding an agreement for an orderly exit for Britain from the European Union, but Berlin was preparing for all options, including the possibility of a no-deal departure.

Headline: May says "Chequers" Brexit plan is not dead
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May told parliament on Wednesday her so-called Chequers plan for Brexit was not dead.

Headline: Britain looking at four options for carbon pricing after Brexit – govt official
Description: Britain is looking at four options for carbon pricing once it leaves the European Union, including launching its own emissions trading system, a government official said on Wednesday.

Headline: Auto parts suppliers warn hard Brexit may set UK sector back 25 years
Description: Failure to secure a trade deal for Britain when it exits the European Union next year could set the UK auto sector back two decades, leading parts suppliers said on Wednesday as they urged leaders to reach agreement at a summit in Brussels.

Headline: May met Tata patriarch Ratan as Jaguar warns on Brexit, diesel - source
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May and business minister Greg Clark met Ratan Tata, patriarch of the Indian Tata family, a few weeks ago as its car brand Jaguar Land Rover warns about the effect of Brexit and diesel policy, a government source said.

Headline: Irish foreign minister does not expect commitment to new Brexit summit date
Description: Irish foreign minister Simon Coveney said he did not expect a meeting of EU leaders later on Wednesday to agree a date for a special Brexit summit in mid-November.

Headline: Brexit deal not far away - French finance minister
Description: A Brexit deal is not far away and could be reached in the coming weeks, said French finance minister Bruno Le Maire on Wednesday.

Headline: Longer Brexit transition period would not hurt Europe - Asselborn
Description: It would not hurt Europe if Britain was allowed to remain in the European Union customs union and internal market beyond an agreed transitional arrangement, Luxembourg Foreign Minister Jean Asselborn said.

Headline: London attracts global finance under Brexit cloud - report
Description: Britain's financial sector brushed off Brexit uncertainty in 2017 to attract more inward investment than eight rival centres vying for its business, the City of London Corporation said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK won't lower food standards to win post-Brexit trade deals - minister
Description: Britain's trade minister Liam Fox will "categorically" deny on Wednesday that the government plans to lower foods standards to win trade deals after Brexit.

Headline: Liam Fox says UK needs longer transition period to make free-trade deal with EU - the Times
Description: British trade minister Liam Fox said the UK will need a longer transition period to make a free-trade deal with the European Union, The Times newspaper reported on Wednesday.

Headline: EU's Tusk bemoans lack of a 'Great' to cut Gordian Brexit Knot
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk on Tuesday bemoaned the lack of leaders great enough to overcome a deadlock on the Irish border in Brexit talks, which he compared to the Gordian Knot unravelled by Alexander the Great.

Headline: Barnier open to possibility of one-year extension to Brexit transition - FT
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier is open to extending Britain's Brexit transition by another year, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.

Headline: EU offered Britain extension of transitional period - FAZ report
Description: The European Commission has offered to allow Britain to remain in the EU customs union and internal market beyond an agreed transitional arrangement until the end of December 2020, the Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung reported on Tuesday.

Headline: France seeks Brexit urgency as Wednesday deal unlikely
Description: France believes a Brexit deal is within reach but there is now a real need for urgency in negotiations, a presidency official said on Tuesday, striking a firm-but-conciliatory tone towards British Prime Minister Theresa May on the eve of an EU summit.

Headline: Stand together, Britain's May calls for unity on Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May told her ministers on Tuesday they would secure a Brexit deal if they stood together, calling for a show of unity to silence those pressing her to rethink her strategy for leaving the European Union.

Headline: Barnier sees December "ultimate deadline" for Brexit deal - source
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier told ministers from member states on Tuesday that December was the latest that a Brexit deal could be struck if a treaty was to be ready by the time Britain leaves the bloc in March, an EU source said.

Headline: Still one-in-four chance of Britain leaving EU without deal - economists
Description: There is still a one-in-four chance Britain and the European Union part ways in less than six months without reaching a deal, according to a Reuters poll taken as EU leaders prepare to meet in Brussels later this week.

Headline: Irish PM concerned decisive Brexit progress not made
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said he still believes a positive outcome is possible in Brexit talks but is concerned that decisive progress has not been made despite a step up in engagement between the sides.

Headline: May has set out her Brexit position, spokesman says after demand for new proposals
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May set out her position in the Brexit talks earlier this week, her spokesman said on Tuesday when asked whether she would respond to a demand from European Council President Donald Tusk for new proposals.

Headline: Wells Fargo to shift European investment banking business to Paris as Brexit looms
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  said on Tuesday it had applied for an investment firm license in France as part of a Brexit strategy to shift some of its servicing of European mainland customers out of London.

Headline: EU's Tusk to ask May for new ideas to break Brexit impasse
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said on Tuesday he will ask British Prime Minister Theresa May this week if she has new ideas on how to break the impasse in Brexit talks, adding that he has become less optimistic about an immediate breakthrough.

Headline: Merkel says Brexit talks are like "squaring the circle" - sources
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said that efforts to negotiate a deal on Britain's withdrawal from the European Union were like "squaring the circle", two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headline: EU's Barnier says will work "seriously" in coming weeks for Brexit deal
Description: The European Union and Britain will work "calmly and seriously" in the next weeks to reach a deal on Britain's withdrawal from the bloc without creating a hard border between Ireland and Northern Ireland, the EU's chief negotiator Michel Barnier said.

Headline: Irish PM says good bit of work to be done on backstop
Description: There is still a good bit of work to do on the post-Brexit Irish border 'backstop', Ireland's Prime Minister said on Tuesday, expecting a country with as "proud" a history as Britain to keep its written commitments to keep that border open.

Headline: Irish FM says Brexit border backstop key "unless and until" new trade deal comes
Description: More time is needed for a Brexit deal between the European Union  and Britain that would maintain an open Irish border, Ireland's Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Tuesday.

Headline: Senior ministers back May ahead of EU summit - May's spokesman
Description: Senior British ministers supported Prime Minister Theresa May at a Brexit-focused cabinet meeting on Tuesday and there was no suggestion anyone would quit the government, May's spokesman said following the meeting.

Headline: Brexit delay "inevitable", former euro chief Dijsselbloem says
Description: Britain's withdrawal from the European Union will have to be delayed beyond March to give time to agree an orderly exit,  former top EU official Jeroen Dijsselbloem said on Tuesday.

Headline: Norwegian PM: Hope Brexit deal can be reached that ensures prosperity
Description: Norwegian Prime Minister Erna Solberg said on Tuesday that she hoped and expected Britain and the European Union would manage to come to a Brexit deal that ensured continued prosperity.

Headline: Brokenshire says colleagues must rally behind May on Brexit
Description: British housing minister James Brokenshire called on his government colleagues to rally behind Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plan before a meeting of her top ministerial team on Tuesday to discuss her proposals for a deal.

Headline: Brexit deal made harder by May comments - EU official
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's speech to the UK parliament on Monday has shown that reaching a deal on the country's exit from the European Union will be even harder than expected, a senior EU official said on Tuesday.

Headline: Germany well-prepared for all Brexit scenarios - German government official
Description: Germany is well-equipped for all Brexit scenarios, a government official said on Tuesday, adding that a swift Brexit deal would be best both for businesses and citizens.

Headline: May to be given floor on Brexit before EU leaders dinner on Wednesday
Description: Leaders of the other 27 EU member states will listen to British Prime Minister Theresa May give her view of the Brexit talks before they discuss among themselves how to proceed at a summit dinner on Wednesday, a senior EU official said on Tuesday.

Headline: Callanan says any customs arrangement with EU must be temporary
Description: Britain would not accept a border in the Irish sea and any customs deal with the European Union would only be temporary, the British minister of state for Brexit said on Tuesday.

Headline: Latvian foreign minister says there is still time for Brexit deal
Description: Latvian Foreign Minister Edgars Rinkevics said on Tuesday there is still time to reach a deal on Brexit even if it is not finalized this week.

Headline: Dutch minister hopes for deal but prepares for hard Brexit
Description: Dutch Foreign Minister Stef Blok said on Tuesday that the Netherlands was hoping for a deal on Britain's orderly exit from the European Union but he added his country was also preparing for a no-deal scenario.

Headline: May risks no-confidence vote on Brexit, eurosceptics warn - Telegraph
Description: Hardline eurosceptics in British Prime Minister Theresa May's party are threatening a vote of no confidence in her leadership within the next couple of weeks, unless she drops her "Chequers" plans for Brexit, the Daily Telegraph reported on Tuesday.

Headline: Germany urges May to 'take responsibility' to get Brexit deal
Description: Germany wants British Prime Minister Theresa May to come up with constructive ideas and take responsibility for getting her supporters to back a final Brexit deal, European Affairs Minister Michael Roth said on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit negotiation going in right direction - Austrian EU minister
Description: The Austrian EU Minister, Gernot Blumel, said on Tuesday that Brexit negotiation dynamics were going in the right direction, however there was not enough for a compromise yet.

Headline: Crypto exchange Coinbase opens Dublin office as Brexit looms
Description: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase has opened an office in Dublin, it said on Tuesday, joining the growing ranks of banks and financial firms with major British businesses developing European Union outposts as Britain's exit from the bloc looms.

Headline: May says Irish backstop can't derail deadlocked Brexit talks
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May urged the EU on Monday not to allow a stand-off over a 'backstop' for Ireland to derail Brexit talks, saying she believed a deal was still achievable as a top EU official said chances of a no-deal divorce had increased.

Headline: May tells Sinn Fein UK committed to no hard Irish border
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May reaffirmed on Monday in a meeting with Sinn Fein's leaders the UK's commitment to there being no hard border between Northern Ireland and Ireland and no border in the Irish sea, May's office said in a statement.

Headline: Farage, back in circulation, says Brexit talks 'hit a wall'
Description: Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage said he believed Britain's leaders had "hit a wall" in negotiations on leaving the European Union, and he was coming "out of retirement" to make sure Brexit really happened.

Headline: EU's Tusk says 'let's not give up' on Brexit, but warns of no deal
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said on Monday that the 27 states remaining in the bloc after Britain leaves must be ready for a no-deal Brexit, a scenario he said was "more likely than ever before".

Headline: Scotland's Sturgeon sees key hurdles to Brexit deal after update from UK PM May
Description: Britain and the European Union still have key hurdles to overcome before they can reach a Brexit deal, Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said after a short meeting with British Prime Minister Theresa May in London on Monday.

Headline: Boris Johnson warns against "Brexit in name only"
Description: Former foreign minister Boris Johnson said on Monday Britain must be able to vary tariffs and strike trade deals after Brexit, otherwise it would not have really left the European Union.

Headline: Border blockade: Irish riddle defies creative Brexit minds
Description: By Francesco Guarascio, Gabriela Baczynska and Alastair Macdonald

Headline: May has spoken to EU leaders ahead of summit - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has spoken to German Chancellor Angela Merkel and Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte in recent days and will have a call with French President Emmanuel Macron later on Monday, her spokesman said.

Headline: AstraZeneca will keep UK investment freeze if no Brexit clarity
Description: AstraZeneca  will keep its freeze on manufacturing investments in Britain if the country's exit from the European Union fails to give enough clarity on future trading relations, the drugmaker's chairman was quoted as saying on Monday.

Headline: UK will not be left in "limbo" after Brexit - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday she had been clear in negotiations to leave the European Union that a future trading relationship had to be linked to a divorce deal to avoid Britain being left "in limbo".

Headline: DUP's Foster hoping for "sensible" Brexit deal
Description: The leader of the Northern Irish party propping up British Prime Minister Theresa May's government very much hopes a "sensible" Brexit deal can be reached, calling on Monday for cool heads in the negotiations.

Headline: PM May says doesn't want to see Ireland Brexit backstop used
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said she wanted to have a new customs arrangement in place with the European Union by the end of December 2021, but ideally would like it to come in sooner so that a backstop arrangement would never have to be used.

Headline: Bracing for Brexit, Dutch regulator seeks more resources - sources
Description: The Dutch financial markets regulator, already scrambling to process a flurry of relocation requests from UK-based companies, will need about 10 percent more staff to cope with the extra work caused by Brexit, sources close to the matter told Reuters.

Headline: Brexit disagreements must not lead to no deal exit - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday that Britain and the European Union should not allow their disagreements over the Irish border leave the two sides facing a no-deal Brexit.

Headline: UK eyed customs deal to avoid Northern Ireland Brexit backstop - EU sources
Description: British negotiators urged the EU to accept assurances Britain would effectively stay in a customs union with the EU to avoid a hard border with Ireland and make a hotly contested "backstop" for Northern Ireland unnecessary, EU diplomats said on Monday.

Headline: Ireland's Brexit backstop, and why it matters
Description: Failure to agree a "backstop" mechanism on Northern Ireland's land border with the European Union has thwarted hopes of a Brexit deal this week. This is what it is and why it matters:

Headline: Brexit deal looking more difficult to clinch - Germany's Merkel
Description: Clinching a Brexit deal is looking more difficult even if 90 percent of an agreement on Britain's departure from the European Union is completed, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Monday.

Headline: Citizenship? Permanent residence? - Brits in France fret over Brexit
Description: Two years of Brexit uncertainty have given British citizens in France sleepless nights and a bureaucratic headache, with thousands of them hurrying to apply for nationality to secure their status before the divorce date set for next year.

Headline: Brexit deal still possible next month, may slip to December - Irish PM
Description: It is still possible that European Union leaders could hold an emergency summit next month to agree a Brexit deal but that timetable may slip to December, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Monday.

Headline: May to update parliament on Brexit negotiations on Monday - parliament leader
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will make a statement to parliament about the Brexit negotiations on Monday, the leader of the House of Commons said on Twitter.

Headline: UK believes there are ways to solve Brexit backstop - May's spokesman
Description: Britain believes there are a number of ways to achieve a so-called backstop arrangement for its only land border with the European Union and Prime Minister Theresa May is still confident of getting a Brexit deal, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: EU Commission says preparations for no-deal Brexit continue
Description: The European Commission said on Monday it was continuing its work to prepare for the possible failure of talks between Britain and the European Union over Britain's withdrawal from the bloc.

Headline: Germany: Time is pressing on Brexit, need Irish border solution quickly
Description: Negotiations on Britain's exit from the European Union will continue beyond an EU summit in October, a spokesman for the German government said on Monday, adding that a solution on the Irish border must be found quickly and time was pressing.

Headline: DUP Brexit spokesman says no deal 'probably inevitable'
Description: Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party, which British Prime Minister Theresa May's government depends on for support, believes a no-deal Brexit is "probably inevitable," the party's Brexit spokesman was quoted as saying on Monday.

Headline: DUP MP says EU Brexit backstop proposal would 'destroy Northern Ireland economy'
Description: The European Union's proposals to ensure that there is no infrastructure on the Irish border would destroy Northern Ireland's economy by creating barriers with Britain, a Democratic Unionist Party member of parliament said on Monday.

Headline: Hunt says Brexit deal possible but issues remain
Description: Britain's Foreign Minister Jeremy Hunt said on Monday that a Brexit deal with the European Union was possible with goodwill, but that there were issues still outstanding.

Headline: Brexit talks stall before midweek EU summit
Description: By Gabriela Baczynska, Alastair Macdonald and Elizabeth Piper

Headline: Agree Brexit deal for security, Hunt says to EU
Description: British foreign minister Jeremy Hunt will urge the European Union on Monday to agree a Brexit deal to ensure the region can tackle global threats such as cyber attacks, migration and terrorism.

Headline: Stand up to EU bullies, UK's ex-foreign minister Johnson says
Description: Britain must stand up to bullies in the European Union and press for a "super Canada" free trade deal, former foreign minister Boris Johnson said, increasing pressure on his former boss, Prime Minister Theresa May, over Brexit.

Headline: DUP's Dodds says Brexit talks becoming a 'battle for the union'
Description: Brexit talks have turned into a "battle for the union" of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, the deputy head of Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party Nigel Dodds, said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit progress made, but unresolved issues on backstop - UK Brexit ministry
Description: Britain and the European Union have made progress "in a number of key areas" in Brexit negotiations, but there remain a number of "unresolved issues relating to the backstop", Britain's Brexit ministry said on Sunday.

Headline: Britain and EU pause Brexit talks until Wednesday summit - sources
Description: British and EU negotiators called a pause in their talks on a Brexit deal on Sunday and will wait for the outcome of a summit  mid-week before any resumption, four EU sources told Reuters.

Headline: Irish border issue holds up Brexit deal - EU's Barnier
Description: The thorny problem of how to ensure Brexit does not mean frontier checks between Ireland and Northern Ireland is among issues holding up a deal on Britain's withdrawal, EU negotiator Michel Barnier said on Sunday.

Headline: Britain should stand 'rock solid' behind May - foreign secretary
Description: British foreign secretary Jeremy Hunt said on Sunday it was time for people to stand "rock solid" behind Prime Minister Theresa May over Brexit after a former colleague called on her cabinet to exert its authority to make her change her plans.

Headline: Brexit deal not likely on Sunday - EU sources
Description: Weekend negotiations in Brussels between British and EU officials have not yet produced a final Brexit deal for leaders to approve this week, senior EU sources told Reuters on Sunday.

Headline: Negotiators reach Brexit divorce deal - Politico cites EU diplomats
Description: Brexit negotiators have reached a deal on a withdrawal agreement, the Politico news website reported on Sunday, citing three EU diplomats.

Headline: EU ambassadors summoned to Brexit meeting - diplomatic sources
Description: Ambassadors for 27 member states of the European Union have been summoned to a meeting on Brexit at 1630 GMT in Brussels, diplomatic sources said on Sunday.

Headline: UK Brexit minister to hold talks with EU - source
Description: British Brexit minister Dominic Raab will hold talks with the European Union's chief Brexit negotiator, Michel Barnier, in Brussels later on Sunday, a diplomatic source said.

Headline: Labour will not vote for 'blind Brexit'
Description: Britain's main opposition Labour Party will not vote for a Brexit deal that offers little more than a "bridge to nowhere", its foreign policy spokeswoman said on Sunday, increasing pressure on Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: May's team must force change in Brexit policy, says former minister
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's ministers should "exert their collective authority" to force a change in her Brexit strategy, former Brexit minister David Davis said on Sunday, stepping up pressure on Britain's leader.

Headline: Britain will not stay 'indefinitely' in customs union with EU - Cleverly
Description: Britain will not stay "indefinitely" in a customs union with the European Union but the precise timing of a temporary customs arrangement with the bloc is up for debate, James Cleverly, deputy chairman of the Conservative Party, said on Sunday.

Headline: Conservatives do not need a new leader - Duncan Smith
Description: Conservative Party does not need a new leader to settle deep divisions over the government's Brexit strategy, Iain Duncan Smith, a former leader and eurosceptic lawmaker, said on Sunday.

Headline: DUP leader sees no-deal Brexit as 'likeliest outcome' - The Observer
Description: The head of the Northern Irish party that props up British Prime Minister Theresa May's government is "ready" to trigger a no-deal Brexit and now regards it as the "likeliest outcome," The Observer newspaper reported on Saturday, citing a leaked email.

Headline: DUP leader regards no-deal Brexit as 'likeliest outcome' -Observer
Description: The head of the Northern Irish party that props up British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative government regards a no-deal Brexit as the "likeliest outcome", according to a leaked email seen by The Observer newspaper.

Headline: May struggles to sell at home Brexit deal emerging with EU
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May struggled on Friday to find consensus on a Brexit plan that would be acceptable to her ministers, her divided Conservative Party and the Northern Irish lawmakers who prop up her minority government.

Headline: DUP says 'critical' that Brexit backstop is time-limited
Description: It is critical that any "backstop" deal between Britain and the EU to maintain an open Irish border be time-limited, the deputy head of the Democratic Unionist Party Nigel Dodds said in a Twitter post on Friday.

Headline: Unlimited Brexit backstop would leave UK trapped in unacceptable arrangements - DUP
Description: A Brexit backstop which is not time-limited would leave Britain and Northern Ireland trapped in unacceptable arrangements until the EU decided otherwise, the deputy leader of Northern Ireland's DUP said on Friday.

Headline: DUP MP says party would vote no-confidence in May if Brexit deal bad
Description: The Democratic Unionist Party would vote "no confidence" in British Prime Minister Theresa May unless a "sensible Brexit" is delivered, one of the party's 10 members of parliament told the BBC Radio Ulster's Inside Politics programme on Friday.

Headline: DUP sees possible developments in UK government's Brexit stance over weekend
Description: There could be developments over the weekend on the British government's position in negotiations over Brexit, the deputy leader of the Northern Irish party propping up Prime Minister Theresa May's government said on Friday.

Headline: Movement of horses from UK to the EU could be barred by no-deal Brexit
Description: The movement of horses between Britain and the European Union for racing or breeding could be stopped after March 2019 if there is no Brexit deal and Britain is not deemed a listed third party, the UK government said on Friday.

Headline: UK no-deal Brexit paper warns of complications for power imports
Description: Britain has warned operators of electrical power links with Europe that they will need to set up alternative trading arrangements if the country leaves the European Union next year with no exit deal.

Headline: Britain would lose EU rebate even if it decided to ditch Brexit - EU official
Description: The European Union's budget chief Guenther Oettinger said on Friday Britain would lose its rebate even in the "pleasant but improbable" event of it staying in the bloc.

Headline: Thomas Cook says air traffic could halt for a week after Brexit
Description: Air traffic could be grounded for up to a week after a disorderly exit of Britain from the European Union due to uncertainty over future air traffic rules, Christoph Debus, head of Thomas Cook Airlines , said on Friday.

Headline: UK minister cannot endorse Brexit deal without limit on customs union membership - BuzzFeed
Description: Britain's Brexit minister Dominic Raab cannot endorse a Brexit deal which does not include a set time limit on customs union membership, BuzzFeed reported on Friday.

Headline: Irish Foreign Minister warns against unfounded optimism on Brexit
Description: Optimism about an imminent breakthrough in Brexit talks reported in newspapers in recent days is "probably not well founded" and people should be realistic about time frames, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney told RTE Radio on Friday.

Headline: UK must take realistic approach to Brexit talks - Slovenian PM
Description: European Union members expect Britain to take a constructive and realistic approach to negotiations on its exit from the European Union, Slovenian Prime minister Marjan Sarec said on Friday after discussing Brexit with Chancellor Angela Merkel.

Headline: UK says it will maintain existing EU sanctions after no-deal Brexit
Description: Britain will continue to enforce European Union economic sanctions in force when it leaves the bloc on March 29, even if it does not secure an exit deal, the government said on Friday.

Headline: Juncker: a Brexit deal must be found
Description: European Commission Chief Jean-Claude Juncker said on Friday it was possible to strike a Brexit deal between next week's European summit in Brussels and a possible summit in November, but that the Irish issue remained the trickiest one.

Headline: EU's Barnier says in Poland: 'Constant dialogue with EU27' on Brexit
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator said on Friday he had a "constructive meeting" in Poland over Brexit.

Headline: May will never agree deal that could permanently keep UK in a customs union - spokeswoman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will never agree to a backstop plan to prevent a hard border with European Union member Ireland that means Britain could be permanently tied to the bloc's customs rules, her spokeswoman said on Friday.

Headline: Brexit talks positive but still big issues to resolve - Hammond
Description: Brexit negotiations have changed pace and have become more positive over the past week though there are still some big differences to resolve, British Chancellor Philip Hammond said.

Headline: Temporary period needed between Brexit transition and long-term deal - Hammond
Description: Britain will need a period of continuity after the Brexit transition ends and before a long-term partnership negotiated between London and Brussels comes into force, Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer said on Friday.

Headline: Several top ministers worried UK could stay in EU customs union indefinitely - BBC
Description: Britain's international trade, environment and Brexit ministers told Prime Minister Theresa May at a meeting on Thursday that they are concerned the whole of Britain could remain in the customs union for an open-ended period of time, the BBC said.

Headline: Brexit negotiators eye Monday breakthrough, Northern Irish party ups the ante
Description: British and EU negotiators making headway on the Irish border hope for a Brexit deal breakthrough on Monday, diplomats said, though the British prime minister's Northern Ireland ally has stoked uncertainty by warning it could vote against her.

Headline: Still big issues to be resolved in Brexit talks - May's spokesman
Description: There are still big issues to be resolved in the negotiations for Britain to leave the European Union, including over the so-called Northern Ireland backstop, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: EU says "we are not there yet" on Brexit deal
Description: There is "no breakthrough yet" in the European Union's divorce talks with Britain, a spokesman for the bloc's executive arm in Brussels said on Thursday.

Headline: DUP threatens to topple UK government but says compromise possible
Description: The Northern Irish party that British Prime Minister Theresa May's government relies on for support said on Thursday it would consider supporting a vote of no-confidence if May agrees to EU checks on goods entering the region in Brexit talks.

Headline: DUP says abstained in parliament vote as a warning to PM May
Description: The Northern Irish Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) that British Prime Minister Theresa May's government relies on for support abstained from a vote in parliament on Wednesday to remind her of the importance of its support amid crucial Brexit talks, a DUP lawmaker said.

Headline: UK to detail Irish backstop proposals - May's spokeswoman
Description: Britain will soon put forward its additional proposals for a backstop arrangement to prevent a hard border with EU member Ireland, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: DUP leader says May "could not in good conscience" back EU border plan
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May "could not in good conscience" back an EU proposal for checks on goods being imported to Northern Ireland from Britain, the head of the party that props up her government said on Thursday.

Headline: British PM May briefs inner Cabinet that Brexit deal is close - FT
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May briefed her inner Cabinet on Thursday evening that a historic Brexit deal was close, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit backstop talks likely to continue till November - British PM
Description: Talks between Britain and the European Union on the crucial question of how to avoid a hard border in Ireland are likely to continue until November, British Prime Minister Theresa May told reporters on Thursday.

Headline: Tony Blair says there is a 50-50 chance of another Brexit referendum
Description: Former British Prime Minister Tony Blair said there was a 50-50 chance of getting another Brexit referendum as Prime Minister Theresa May will be unlikely to secure a majority for any divorce deal in parliament.

Headline: Tony Blair sees 50-50 chance of another Brexit referendum
Description: Former British leader Tony Blair said there was a 50-50 chance of another Brexit referendum as Prime Minister Theresa May will be unlikely to secure a parliamentary majority for any divorce deal.

Headline: UK's proposed legal relationship with EU would leave ECJ in charge, lawyer says
Description: Britain's proposed judicial ties with the EU would still see the European Court of Justice take the binding decision on important cases in UK law after Brexit, according to a legal opinion seen by Reuters that could stir concern among hardline Brexit campaigners.

Headline: No agreement on way forward on Brexit deal yet - Irish foreign minister
Description: It is too soon to claim agreement has been reached on a deal for Britain to leave the European Union, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit deal next week 'within reach' - Barnier
Description: A Brexit deal is "within reach" next week, EU negotiator Michel Barnier said on Wednesday, even as he rammed home his insistence that Britain must accept possible checks on trade between its mainland and Northern Ireland.

Headline: EU's Barnier says Brexit deal may be 'within reach' next week, demands Irish checks
Description: European Union Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Wednesday an agreement with Britain could be "within reach" next week, calling for decisive progress in the talks in time for a summit of all 28 EU leaders.

Headline: Exclusive: BoE takes action to steer lenders through 'no-deal' Brexit - source
Description: The Bank of England (BoE) has asked lenders in Britain to provide six-hourly checks on their balance sheets in the days after a possible "no-deal" Brexit as it seeks to avert a sudden squeeze in credit supply, a senior industry source said.

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP says it won't be bullied on Brexit
Description: A lawmaker from the small Northern Irish party that British Prime Minister Theresa May's government relies on for support has said his party will not be bullied in Brexit talks, and that an unacceptable deal will be defeated in parliament.

Headline: UK minister Lidington says he expects a Brexit deal eventually
Description: A senior British cabinet minister said on Wednesday he expected that Britain would be able to strike a deal with the European Union to leave the bloc eventually, even if it was not a certainty.

Headline: Merkel welcomes Brexit progress but says devil is in detail
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Wednesday welcomed progress in negotiations on a Brexit deal and said she wanted a close relationship with Britain after it leaves the European Union, especially on security matters.

Headline: DUP leader says she will not accept diminished roles for Northern Ireland in UK
Description: The head of the Northern Irish party that props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government said on Wednesday that she would not accept a Brexit deal that diminishes the province's status.

Headline: Brexit backstop proposal would make UK an EU colony - Boris Johnson
Description: Brexit hardliner Boris Johnson, a former British foreign minister, said on Wednesday that Prime Minister Theresa May's  negotiation strategy could make Britain a "permanent EU colony".

Headline: Some British ministers will meet for Brexit update on Thursday - BBC
Description: Some senior British ministers will meet to be updated on the progress of Brexit negotiations on Thursday, the BBC's political editor said, adding that not all the cabinet would be involved.

Headline: DUP could vote against UK budget if Brexit red lines are breached - reports
Description: The DUP, the Northern Irish unionist party that props up Theresa May's government, could vote against this month's UK budget if the prime minister breaches the party's red lines over Brexit at an EU summit, the BBC and Sky News said on Wednesday.

Headline: May's cabinet to discuss Brexit next week - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will discuss Brexit with her cabinet of senior ministers at their regular Tuesday meeting next week, May's spokesman told reporters on Wednesday.

Headline: Labour plays down report that rebels would back May Brexit deal
Description: Britain's opposition Labour party played down a report earlier on Wednesday that 30 to 40 of its lawmakers would be prepared to defy their leader and back a Brexit deal that Prime Minister Theresa May is trying to strike with the European Union.

Headline: May appeals for cross-parliament backing on Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May appealed to lawmakers in parliament to prioritise the national interest when they are asked to approve whatever exit deal she is able to agree with the European Union.

Headline: EU's Barnier urges "decisive progress" on Brexit for summit next week
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier told the bloc's executive on Wednesday that "decisive progress" was needed in negotiations over Britain's exit from the bloc in time for a summit of all the 28 national leaders next week.

Headline: EU's commissioner says "we are not there yet" on Brexit
Description: The European Union's top migration official said on Wednesday that Brexit negotiators were holding intense talks but they have not yet concluded a deal.

Headline: Britain sees Brexit progress, again calls on EU to 'meet us halfway'
Description: Brexit minister Dominic Raab voiced confidence on Tuesday that Britain and the European Union would make progress on their divorce at a summit next week, but again asked the bloc to meet London "halfway" on the most difficult areas.

Headline: May's possible Brexit deal could be backed by 30-40 Labour MPs - Times
Description: Around 30 to 40 lawmakers from the opposition Labour Party would be prepared to back a Brexit deal that British Prime Minister Theresa May is trying to strike with the European Union, The Times newspaper reported, citing unidentified lawmakers.

Headline: Leading EU MP sees smaller risk now of no-deal Brexit
Description: A European Parliament lawmaker dealing with Brexit, Danuta Hubner, said on Wednesday she saw a smaller risk now than before of failing to reach a divorce agreement with Britain.

Headline: UK's May plans Brexit discussion at Tuesday's cabinet meeting - The Times
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is planning to have an extended discussion on Brexit at next Tuesday's cabinet meeting in hopes of outlining a compromise deal on the Irish border, The Times reported on Wednesday.

Headline: UK, EU make progress in Brexit negotiations over Irish backstop - ITV News
Description: Britain and the European Union have made progress in negotiations over the Irish border backstop, a key hurdle in reaching a Brexit deal, ITV News reported on Tuesday.

Headline: Only independence can resolve Scotland's Brexit quandary - Sturgeon
Description: The British government's "shambolic" handling of its divorce talks with the European Union demonstrates that Scotland needs to become independent, Scottish leader Nicola Sturgeon told her Scottish National Party (SNP) on Tuesday.

Headline: We expect progress at October EU meeting - Dominic Raab
Description: British Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Tuesday he expected to make some progress in negotiations at a summit of European Union leaders next week, describing it as an important milestone in the process of leaving the bloc.

Headline: Brexit talks will likely run into November - Irish foreign minister
Description: Brexit negotiations will probably need to run into November to finalise a withdrawal treaty, including a so-called "backstop" agreement to avoid a hard land border on the island of Ireland, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Tuesday.

Headline: No deal Brexit would lead to 'carnage' - Irish foreign minister
Description: If Britain leaves the European Union without an agreement it will lead to economic carnage, particularly for Britain itself, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK and EU could agree terms of Brexit divorce by Monday - Dow Jones
Description: Britain and the European Union could agree the terms of their Brexit divorce by Monday, Dow Jones reported on Tuesday, citing unidentified diplomats.

Headline: Britain's big Brexit vote: Will parliament back May?
Description: If British Prime Minister Theresa May is able to strike a Brexit deal with the European Union in the coming weeks, she will face a crucial vote in parliament when she asks lawmakers to approve it.

Headline: UK clinical trials fall as Brexit clouds drug approval process
Description: The number of new clinical trials started in Britain last year was 25 percent lower than the average for 2009-16, as anxiety about Brexit's impact on future medicines regulation made companies hesitate about running studies in the country.

Headline: Bank of England tells EU to move now to avoid hard Brexit hit to markets
Description: The Bank of England urged the European Union on Tuesday to do more to protect cross-border financial services from the risks of a "cliff-edge Brexit", saying the need for action was now pressing.

Headline: Northern Ireland's Foster, in Brussels, rebuffs EU Brexit compromise
Description: The leader of Northern Ireland's biggest party on Tuesday ruled out any checks on trade with the British mainland after the EU's Brexit negotiator tried to persuade her that such controls could be "de-dramatised".

Headline: Brexit deal possible in weeks, says Northern Irish party that props up May
Description: A Brexit deal is "eminently possible" within weeks but there can be no regulatory barriers within the United Kingdom, the head of the Northern Irish party that props up British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday.

Headline: Conservatives face "dire consequences" with Brexit strategy - David Davis
Description: Britain's former Brexit minister David Davis said on Tuesday that the ruling Conservative Party will face dire consequences at the next election if it sticks with Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plans, the Sun newspaper reported.

Headline: Ireland said "central case" is Brexit deal in coming weeks
Description: The Irish government's "central case" is that a Brexit deal will be done in the coming weeks between Britain and the European Union, but it is continuing to plan for the possibility that no deal is agreed, Finance Minister Paschal Donohoe said.

Headline: UK pressing 'intensive' Brexit talks before EU summit - PM's spokesman
Description: Britain is pressing on with "intensive" talks to try to hammer out a Brexit agreement with the European Union, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday before the two sides meet at a summit in Brussels.

Headline: German FinMin aims for post-Brexit transition period until end-2020 in tax law - WiWo
Description: German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz aims for German tax law to treat Britain like a member state of the European Union after it leaves the bloc until the end of 2020, German magazine WirtschaftsWoche reported, citing a draft law.

Headline: EU's Barnier "working hard" to explain border fix to Northern Irish
Description: European Union Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier met Northern Irish politicians on Tuesday and said he was "working hard to explain and de-dramatise" the Irish border backstop, a key hurdle in Brexit negotiations.

Headline: Dominic Raab to make statement in parliament on EU talks - Labour
Description: British Brexit minister Dominic Raab British will make a statement on negotiations to leave the European Union in parliament on Tuesday, the opposition Labour Party said.

Headline: EU envoys schedule late Friday talks in Brexit countdown
Description: The European Union's national ambassadors will meet late on Friday afternoon in Luxembourg without Britain to discuss Brexit, sources said, as divorce talks between London and the bloc are in their final stretch.

Headline: German firms would face billions in extra tariffs in hard Brexit - IW
Description: A hard Brexit would result in extra tariffs of more than 3 billion euros (2.6 billion pounds) for German companies per year, a German institute said on Tuesday, adding that German exports to Britain could drop by up to 57 percent.

Headline: Leader of Northern Ireland's DUP says Brexit deal 'eminently possible'
Description: The head of the Northern Irish party that props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government said on Tuesday a Brexit deal was "eminently possible" within weeks, but she would not accept different regulations from the rest of the United Kingdom.

Headline: At least 40 of May's MPs willing to vote down Brexit deal, ex-minister says
Description: At least 40 lawmakers in Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party are willing to vote down her possible Brexit deal if it leaves the United Kingdom 'half in and half out' of the European Union, a senior lawmaker said on Tuesday.

Headline: Leader of Northern Ireland's DUP says wants Brexit that works for Ireland
Description: The Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government said on Monday that it wanted a Brexit that worked for the Republic of Ireland too, as its leader travels to Brussels for talks with EU negotiator Michel Barnier.

Headline: Scotland should have its own Brexit backstop - Sturgeon
Description: Scotland should have its own version of the Brexit "backstop" plan that the European Union and United Kingdom are trying to agree for the Irish border, Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Monday.

Headline: Voters' confidence in May's handling of Brexit rises - ORB poll
Description: British voters approval of Prime Minister Theresa May's handling of Brexit negotiations has risen for the first time in five months, the ORB International pollster said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit Secretary Raab not heading to Brussels this week, Sun editor
Description: British Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab has no confirmed visit to Brussels this week, the Sun newspaper's Political Editor Tom Newton Dunn cited Downing Street as saying.

Headline: Thousands of German firms sought advice on Brexit, industry chief tells paper
Description: Thousands of German businesses sought advice in recent weeks on how to prepare for Britain's exit from the European Union in a sign they are "highly uneasy", the head of the DIHK Chambers of Industry and Commerce was cited as saying on Monday.

Headline: Brexiteers set limit for May's trade deal with EU - The Times
Description: Brexiteers warned UK Prime Minister Theresa May on Sunday night that she could keep Britain within European Union customs arrangements only until 2022, The Times reported on Monday.

Headline: Brexit uncertainty is "starting to bite" for UK firms - surveys
Description: Britain's businesses are suffering from Brexit-related uncertainty as exports slow, recruitment difficulties mount and investment plans are scaled back, two surveys showed on Monday.

Headline: Dogs owners march on UK parliament demanding new Brexit 'Wooferendum'
Description: Around a thousand dogs and their owners marched on Britain's parliament on Sunday demanding an end to Brexit via a second vote on the terms of the country's exit from the European Union.

Headline: PM May seeks support as others draw Brexit battle lines
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May appealed to wavering British voters on Sunday ahead of a defining few months in which she hopes to secure a Brexit deal and face down opponents who say her EU exit plan is too hard, too soft, or just plain wrong.

Headline: Japan's Abe says would welcome Britain to TPP - FT
Description: Japan would welcome Britain "with open arms" into a Trans Pacific trade pact, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe told the Financial Times on Sunday.

Headline: Scotland's Sturgeon promises independence plan once UK Brexit deal known
Description: Scottish National Party (SNP) leader Nicola Sturgeon said on Sunday she would set out her plans for a fresh independence drive as soon as she sees what kind of Brexit deal Prime Minister Theresa May brings back from Brussels.

Headline: Lloyd's of London accelerating Brexit contingency plans - BBC
Description: The outgoing chief executive of insurance market Lloyd's of London, Inga Beale, said her firm is accelerating Brexit contingency plans to transfer contracts to a Brussels subsidiary as she feel Britain is getting closer to leaving the European Union without a deal.

Headline: Irish foreign minister says good chance of getting Brexit deal - Sky
Description: Irish foreign minister Simon Coveney said on Sunday he thought the chances of agreeing a withdrawal treaty between Britain and the European Union were good.

Headline: Irish PM says still 'fair bit of work' to do in Brexit talks
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Saturday that he is hopeful that there will be decisive progress in the next two weeks to conclude a Brexit deal but that there is still more work to be done.

Headline: EU's Juncker upbeat on Brexit agreement, no-deal not an option
Description: The European Union and Britain will reach a deal on Brexit in November if they do not do so this month, European Commission president Jean-Claude Juncker told Austrian newspapers.

Headline: EU's Tusk says Brexit deal possible by end of 2018
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said on Saturday it was possible to agree a deal with Britain on leaving the European Union by the end of 2018.

Headline: In haste to go Dutch, Unilever misjudged concerns in Brexit-bound UK
Description: Unilever's reputation for valuing all stakeholders rather than just shareholders boosted its corporate governance credentials, but landed the consumer goods firm in trouble when it tried to move its headquarters from London.

Headline: EU negotiators say Brexit deal 'very close' but details missing
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiators believe a divorce deal with Britain is "very close", diplomatic sources said, in a sign a compromise on the most contentious issue - the future Irish border - might be in the making though details were scarce.

Headline: ECJ to hear case on whether UK alone can reverse Brexit on November 27 - source
Description: The European Court of Justice has set a Nov. 27 date for a hearing to decide whether Britain's parliament can unilaterally change its mind on Brexit, a legal source told Reuters, adding that the case is moving fast.

Headline: Asset managers accounting for bulk of Irish Brexit moves
Description: Asset management and investment firms make up about half of the more than 100 finance companies that have applied to set up or extend operations in Ireland as a result of Brexit, the state agency competing to win foreign business said on Friday.

Headline: Barnier meets Northern Irish parties, stresses Brexit backstop
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said he stressed the need for a binding deal to avoid a disruptive EU border for Northern Ireland when he met leading politicians from the British province on Friday.

Headline: Ireland says 'hard to know' if British backstop proposal will work - Irish Times
Description: It is "hard to know" if the new "backstop" proposal Britain is working on for how to avoid a hard border on the island of Ireland would work, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney was quoted as saying on Friday.

Headline: EU's Juncker hopes for Brexit deal in November
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said on Friday he was fully focused on making Brexit negotiations a success and hoped for a deal in November.

Headline: Germany says no-deal Brexit not in UK, EU or German interests
Description: A no-deal Brexit would not be good for Britain, Europe or Germany, a German government spokesman said on Friday, adding that Chancellor Angela Merkel sees that close cooperation with Britain will be possible in some areas.

Headline: UK will preserve integrity in any Brexit deal, Brexit ministry says
Description: The United Kingdom's integrity will be preserved as part of any Brexit deal and there will be no new regulatory barriers between Northern Ireland and the rest of the UK unless the province's executive agree, the Brexit ministry said on Friday.

Headline: Border deal cannot rely on Northern Ireland assembly - Irish minister
Description: Any agreement on how the border between Ireland and Northern Ireland operates after Britain leaves the EU cannot rely on Belfast's devolved government to approve future regulatory changes, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Friday.

Headline: Northern Ireland cannot accept economic barriers with UK - DUP deputy leader
Description: Northern Ireland cannot accept economic barriers between its territory and the rest of the United Kingdom, the deputy leader of the province's Democratic Unionist Party told BBC radio on Friday.

Headline: Tusk slams UK slurs on EU, urges 'Canada plus plus plus' Brexit deal
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk sharply criticised what he called "emotional" and "insulting" statements about the EU by British ministers and urged London on Thursday to accept an offer of very close post-Brexit ties.

Headline: Britain's Johnson welcomes Tusk's talk of a Canada-type deal
Description: Britain's former foreign minister Boris Johnson, who has led calls for Theresa May to ditch her Brexit plan, on Thursday welcomed a proposal from Brussels for the two sides to agree a Canada-style deal.

Headline: EU court may decide before Christmas if UK can unilaterally reverse Brexit
Description: Scotland's Court of Session has asked the European Court of Justice (ECJ) for a preliminary ruling on whether the British parliament can change its mind about leaving the European Union without the bloc's agreement, the Scottish court said on Thursday.

Headline: Seeking Brexit deal, EU eyes compromise on Irish border
Description: European Union negotiators see the outline of a compromise on the Irish border issue which is holding up Brexit talks, EU sources told Reuters on Thursday, raising hopes that a new British offer could unlock a deal.

Headline: New British proposal for Irish border 'step in right direction' - EU source
Description: New British proposals for avoiding extensive border checks on the island of Ireland after Brexit are "a step in the right direction" and "make finding a compromise possible", a European Union source close to the negotiations told Reuters on Thursday.

Headline: Ireland expects formal UK backstop proposals in next week - minister
Description: Ireland is not aware that Britain has yet tabled its planned formal new "backstop" proposal on how to avoid a hard border on the island of Ireland but hopes to see it over the next week or so, Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Thursday.

Headline: EU's Barnier - Brexit deal must have legally sound Ireland backstop
Description: A divorce deal with Britain requires a legally sound solution for the border between Ireland and Northern Ireland, the European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Thursday after talks with Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar.

Headline: Brexit-linked dangers being underestimated, ECB's Nowotny says
Description: The dangers linked to Brexit for Europe continue to be underestimated, European Central Bank policymaker Ewald Nowotny said on Thursday.

Headline: Brace for volatility if little Brexit progress by November - Irish cenbank
Description: European regulators need to be braced for financial market volatility if very clear progress is not evident in Brexit negotiations by November, Irish Central Bank Governor Philip Lane said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit crunch time - Diary dates for Britain's EU departure
Description: With just six months to go until Britain is due to leave the European Union, negotiations between the sides to agree a divorce settlement and a blueprint of new relations after Brexit are in the final stretch.

Headline: Nissan, RBS join chorus of warnings over disorderly Brexit
Description: Japanese carmaker Nissan  and Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS)  have became the latest companies to warn about damage to the economy if Britain fails to secure a trade deal before leaving the European Union.

Headline: Irish PM wants Brexit deal by November 'if at all possible'
Description: Ireland's Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Thursday that Brexit talks were entering "a critical and ultimate phase" of negotiations and that he hoped a deal would be reached within the next month.

Headline: UK markets watchdog says cooperation with EU to aid smooth Brexit
Description: European Union regulators have recognised the need to cooperate with their UK counterparts to avoid disorderly markets if no agreement is reached on the terms of the UK's departure from the EU, Britain's financial watchdog said on Thursday.

Headline: Ireland processing over 100 Brexit-related applications from finance firms - central bank
Description: Ireland's central bank has seen a surge in financial services firms seeking to set up or extend their operations in Ireland as a result of Brexit and is processing over 100 applications, its governor Philip Lane said on Thursday.

Headline: UK medicines regulator preparing for no-deal Brexit
Description: Britain's medicines watchdog is preparing for the possibility of the country leaving the European Union without a deal next March, in which case it would have to operate as a stand-alone drugs and medical devices regulator.

Headline: Britain should get off 'high horse' for sake of Brexit deal - German lawmaker
Description: Britain needs to climb down from its "high horse" and face the reality that its European Union partners will not allow cherry picking in negotiations on its planned exit from the bloc, a senior German conservative lawmaker said on Thursday.

Headline: May planning to rush Brexit through parliament - Bloomberg
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's officials are planning to rush her Brexit deal through Parliament to stave off a rebellion from her own party, Bloomberg reported on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit bill could go up as new data show rise in EU budget liabilities
Description: Britain may be required to channel more money than expected into the European Union budget after it leaves the bloc because EU liabilities are going up driven by higher pension costs and financial guarantees, EU data released on Thursday show.

Headline: End divisions or put Brexit at risk, Britain's May tells party
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May appealed to her Conservative Party on Wednesday to unite behind her plan to leave the European Union, warning critics their arguments could put Brexit in jeopardy.

Headline: Brexit talks must focus on divorce deal before future ties - Czech official
Description: Britain and the European Union must focus on getting a divorce deal with an Irish border fix before they embark on discussions on their post-Brexit trade ties, the Czech Republic's pointman on Europe said.

Headline: Ireland does not want border down the Irish Sea - minister
Description: Ireland does not want a notional border to emerge in the Irish Sea that would divide Northern Ireland from the rest of the United Kingdom, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Wednesday.

Headline: EU schedules Brexit summit for October 17
Description: European Union leaders will meet to discuss a possible Brexit deal with Britain over dinner in Brussels on Oct. 17, the European Council said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit minister Raab denies Northern Ireland's DUP have whip hand in Brexit talks
Description: UK Brexit minister Dominic Raab denied on Wednesday that the small Northern Irish Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) which supports the Conservative government had the "whip hand" in talks to unblock an impasse with the European Union over the Irish border.

Headline: EU watchdog seeks to avert Brexit disorder in euro clearing
Description: European Union banks should be allowed to continue using British clearing houses for derivatives transactions even under a no-deal Brexit, a top EU regulator said on Wednesday, in an effort  to quell rising concern in markets.

Headline: May defends Brexit plan after dancing onto stage
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May defended her Brexit plans on Wednesday, but cautioned that she would rather leave without a deal than accept the carve up of the United Kingdom.

Headline: Brexit minister Raab optimistic about finalising EU deal in November
Description: Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Wednesday he was optimistic that Britain would agree an approach to the outstanding issues in negotiations with the European Union in time for details of a Brexit deal to be finalised in November.

Headline: UK citizens in France to get reciprocal rights post-Brexit, says minister Loiseau
Description: British citizens living in France will get reciprocal rights along with French citizens in the United Kingdom following Brexit, said French European Affairs Minister Nathalie Loiseau.

Headline: UK austerity is over nearly a decade after crash - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May declared on Wednesday that her government's austerity push was over after nearly a decade of spending cuts in many areas of public services.

Headline: EU wants to get Brexit deal - spokesman
Description: The European Union is trying to get a Brexit deal with Britain, a spokesman for the bloc's executive said of Boris Johnson's Tory Party conference comments.

Headline: Conservative MP calls on PM May to resign just minutes before speech
Description: British Conservative lawmaker James Duddridge on Wednesday called on Prime Minister Theresa May to resign just minutes before she took the stage for the party's annual conference.

Headline: 'Don't bully us', Britain takes new combative tone to Brexit talks
Description: Britain cannot be bullied, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Monday, sharpening the government's criticism of the European Union for taunting Prime Minister Theresa May and souring difficult Brexit talks.

Headline: 'Chuck Chequers', Johnson challenges May on Brexit
Description: Former British foreign minister Boris Johnson set out his stall to the Conservative Party faithful on Tuesday, stopping just short of an outright leadership bid to replace Prime Minister Theresa May but tearing into her Brexit blueprint.

Headline: KPMG expects tougher British financial regime post-Brexit
Description: KPMG expects Britain to ignore calls to loosen banking rules after Brexit and said in a report on Wednesday it may even become tougher with measures to protect consumers and defend its financial stability from cyber attacks.

Headline: A 'no-deal' Brexit better than a bad deal - French minister
Description: Not having any deal on Brexit would be better than a bad deal, French minister for European affairs Nathalie Loiseau said on Wednesday, adding she still hoped a deal could be reached with Britain regarding its exit from the European Union.

Headline: Leader of North Ireland's DUP says - Our red line is blood red
Description: The Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May warned that its "blood red" line was that there could be no Brexit deal that would divide Northern Ireland from the rest of the United Kingdom.

Headline: Beyond the rhetoric, Britain and EU preparing to move on Brexit
Description: "Unworkable", "unacceptable", "impasse" - the words used to describe Brexit talks between Britain and the European Union do little to temper concerns that the two are heading for a chaotic divorce.

Headline: Boris Johnson - May's Brexit plans are an outrage
Description: Boris Johnson, Prime Minister Theresa May's former foreign secretary, said her Brexit plans were a constitutional outrage that would humiliate the United Kingdom by leaving it under the European Union's sway for generations to come.

Headline: Boris Johnson says - Chuck May's Brexit plan
Description: Britain's former foreign minister, Boris Johnson, called on the Conservative Party to chuck out Prime Minister Theresa May's "Chequers" Brexit proposals which he said were an attempt to mislead British voters.

Headline: Factbox - Who wants to be Britain's next Prime Minister?
Description: Possible successors to Prime Minister Theresa May are using the Conservative Party's annual conference this week to set out, with varying degrees of subtlety, their visions for Britain, turning the event into a parade of potential future leaders.

Headline: Irish PM expects hit to economic confidence if Brexit talks drag on
