Description: Brexit negotiators risk creating a significant impact on confidence in their economies if talks on agreeing a withdrawal agreement run on into November, December or even the New Year, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain should change Brexit course, not its PM - former minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May needs to change course on Brexit but she should remain as leader, former junior Brexit minister Steve Baker said on Tuesday.

Headline: Carmakers step up warnings over disorderly Brexit
Description: Carmakers ratcheted up their Brexit warnings on Tuesday, with France's PSA Group  and Germany's BMW  both saying UK production would suffer if Britain leaves the European Union without a deal.

Headline: Conservatives gripped by 'Mogg-mania' as diehard eurosceptic draws the crowds
Description: Sighing at the sight of a queue of hundreds of people that snaked its way around the conference centre and out of the door, one Conservative Party member complained: "They should have put him on the main stage".

Headline: EU official to Britain - you can't leave our house and keep the key
Description: Britain cannot leave the European house but keep the key and the right to swing by anytime, a top European Union official told London as Brexit negotiations are entering their final stretch.

Headline: Alternative Brexit conference shows threat to May from party rebels
Description: A day after Prime Minister Theresa May urged her party to use their annual conference to unite behind her Brexit plans, rebel members of parliament were running out of patience with her decision to proceed with proposals many feel do not make a clean enough break from the EU.

Headline: Brexit uncertainty weighs on Jaguar's electric car investment decision
Description: Britain's biggest carmaker Jaguar Land Rover has yet to make an imminent decision on whether to build electric cars in its home market partly due to uncertainty over the final Brexit terms, its boss told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit must not mean return to 'lite touch' regulation - UK watchdog
Description: Britain's departure from the European Union next year should not be seen as triggering a "race to the bottom" in regulatory standards, a top UK regulator said on Monday.

Headline: BMW would up Dutch production in hard Brexit scenario - CEO

Headline: DUP leader says Northern Ireland must leave EU on same terms as rest of Britain

Headline: France ramps up border controls in preparation for no-deal Brexit

Headline: Disorderly Brexit scenarios are 'highly worrying' - Daimler CEO

Headline: UK's May says has shown nothing but respect to EU - LBC
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday that she had shown "nothing but respect" during Brexit talks with the European Union, and that Britain deserved the same.

Headline: Britain is preparing new proposal on Irish border - UK PM May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday she is preparing to make a new offer to the European Union aimed at breaking the deadlock in the Brexit negotiations.

Headline: Britain's PM May says she's in the job "for the long term"
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she planned to remain in the job "for the long term" as she called on her party to come together and back her plan for Brexit.

Headline: Britain's PM May says she's in the job "for the long term"
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she planned to remain in the job "for the long term" as she called on her party to come together and back her plan for Brexit.

Headline: May's Brexit is 'wilful economic vandalism' - Sturgeon
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's plans to leave the European Union are damaging and inviable, Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon will say on Tuesday.

Headline: UK could go it alone on digital services tax - Hammond
Description: Britain will unilaterally implement a digital service tax if there is no international agreement soon on how to tax big internet companies, Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond said on Monday, blaming U.S. tax reforms for slow multilateral progress.

Headline: Brexit proposals are not undeliverable, it is about political will - Raab
Description: Britain's Brexit proposals are not undeliverable but rather it is political will holding up negotiations, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Monday.

Headline: Three of May's ministers privately 'see argument for' second Brexit vote - MP
Description: Three British government ministers privately support the idea of holding a second referendum on the final Brexit deal, a former junior minister said on Monday.

Headline: British seem to think the EU is quitting the UK - Juncker
Description: The discussion in Britain over its departure from the European Union is still far removed from reality, the European Commission's President Jean-Claude Juncker said at a public forum in the German city of Freiburg.

Headline: Conservatives should back May, says lawmaker Rees-Mogg
Description: Changing Conservative leader could cause more problems than it solves and the party should back Prime Minister Theresa May, senior Eurosceptic lawmaker Jacob Rees-Mogg said on Monday.

Headline: Britain must not pull the rug out under trade with EU - Hammond
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Monday  rebalancing trade with the EU was a delicate process which should be done gradually, and that product standards should stay the same after Brexit.

Headline: Britain looking at regulatory checks for Brexit Irish border fix
Description: Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Monday Britain was looking at how regulatory checks on some goods could be used as part of a solution to move Brexit talks, notably a "backstop deal" for the Irish border, forward.

Headline: Blockchain may resolve Irish border Brexit problem - Hammond
Description: A solution to providing frictionless trade across the Irish border after Britain leaves the European Union might be found using technology such as Blockchain, finance minister Phillip Hammond said on Monday

Headline: Raab says Britain needs a credible response from EU
Description: Britain is waiting for a credible response from the European Union to the government's proposals on the future trading arrangement, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Monday.

Headline: Raab confident Britain has time to get good Brexit deal
Description: British Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Monday that he was confident there is time for Britain to get a good deal in negotiations to leave the European Union

Headline: No-deal Brexit would cost European firms up to $18 billion - Fox

Headline: We must prove EU wrong about the UK's Brexit plans - Hammond

Headline: French watchdog calms UK asset manager fears over Brexit

Headline: Brexit minister Raab tells EU - Do not try to bully us

Headline: UK parliament would back Norway-style Brexit with customs union - senior lawmaker

Headline: Hammond says UK can cope with no-deal Brexit

Headline: Hammond says EU is in the mood for a Brexit deal

Headline: UK has fiscal capacity to cope with no-deal Brexit, Hammond says

Headline: UK could change business rates to help high street - business minister

Description: Leading Eurosceptic lawmaker Jacob Rees-Mogg on Sunday predicted that neither the British parliament or the European Union would accept Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plan, and that leaving the bloc without an exit deal should hold no fear.

Headline: Extending Article 50 would not make Brexit issues easier to solve - Clark

Headline: EU disrespect to May 'beyond the pale', says UK trade minister

Headline: Canada-style Brexit deal would make things more difficult for business - Clark
Description: A Canada-style Brexit deal with the European Union would make things harder for businesses by creating friction at the border, business minister Greg Clark said on Sunday.

Headline: Brexit has cost Britain 500 million pounds a week, study says

Headline: PM May says her Brexit plan addresses manufacturers' concerns

Headline: 'No deal' Brexit would force many UK firms into EU shift - BCC

Headline: EU accepts no-deal Brexit would still include some deals - diplomats

Headline: EU's Barnier says working for Brexit deal, close economic ties later
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Thursday he was working for a Brexit deal and a close economic relationship afterwards.

Headline: Brexit and the City - A barometer for London's financial outlook
Description: London's skyline is changing fast, pierced by gleaming new skyscrapers which defy predictions of a Brexit-related slowdown in the capital's two financial districts.

Headline: Labour Party's Corbyn to say will vote against PM May's Brexit deal as it stands

Headline: EU negotiator seeks orderly Brexit, new partnership respecting UK sovereignty

Headline: EU's Barnier to meet Labour's Corbyn on Thursday

Headline: Timeline - Brexit at breaking point? Diary dates for Britain's EU departure

Headline: Snap election not in UK's interest during Brexit talks - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday it would not be in Britain's national interest to hold another general election just as she is negotiating the terms of Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: Factbox - Reuters surveys UK financial services jobs post-Brexit

Headline: EU has more pressing priorities than Brexit - French finance minister

Headline: Labour set to vote against Brexit deal, open to second referendum

Headline: Post-Brexit Britain will be staunchly 'pro-business' says May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will pledge on Wednesday that her government will be "unequivocally pro-business" as it seeks to forge a future role outside the European Union.

Headline: Brexit deal ratification not a given - Irish PM

Headline: Labour increasingly likely to vote against Brexit deal - Starmer
Description: It is increasingly likely Britain's opposition Labour will vote against any Brexit deal reached by Prime Minister Theresa May, the party's Brexit spokesman Keir Starmer said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain must make clear what it wants on Brexit - Merkel

Description: Britain's Labour will vote on a motion on Tuesday that says the party should oppose a "no deal" Brexit and keep the idea of a second referendum on the table if talks with the European Union fail or any deal is voted down in parliament.

Headline: Brexit developments are dangerous, this will cause damage - BDI
Description: Recent developments regarding Britain's decision to leave the European Union were dangerous, Germany's BDI industry association said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK to favour skilled migration, no EU preference after Brexit - reports
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May and her ministers have agreed to focus Britain's post-Brexit migration system on high-skilled migrants and will not offer preference to European Union workers, newspapers said.

Headline: 'No-deal' Brexit would hit trucks, airlines and pet owners - government papers

Headline: May to meet Trump in New York to discuss Brexit and trade

Headline: Britain needs a fair Brexit deal, not a no deal, says Hungary

Headline: May's ministers still fully behind her Brexit plans - spokesman

Headline: No UK cabinet minister challenged May over Brexit - Sun
Description: No members of British Prime Minister Theresa May's cabinet challenged her over her so-called Chequers plan for Brexit at a meeting earlier on Monday, a journalist from the Sun newspaper reported.

Headline: May tells ministers to hold their nerve over Brexit - Downing St

Headline: UK would allow EU airlines to fly in no-deal Brexit, would keep EU safety rules

Headline: Mind your tone when talking to Britain, Merkel ally urges Europeans

Headline: We hope to keep Britain close after Brexit - Merkel
Description: Germany wants a Brexit deal to keep Britain as close to the European Union as possible, Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Monday.

Headline: UK to hold nerve after Brexit talks hit impasse - Brexit minister

Headline: Factbox - UK details what a no-deal Brexit would mean for planes, trucks and pets
Description: Britain's government published its third batch of advice to companies and individuals on how to prepare for any disruption that might follow a disorderly Brexit where there is no deal with the European Union.

Headline: Beware of 'no-deal' Brexit, UK warns owners of cats, dogs and ferrets

Headline: UK will seek bilateral agreements to keep haulage moving if no Brexit deal

Headline: British, EU airlines could see flights grounded in no-deal Brexit

Headline: Labour keeps second Brexit referendum on table

Headline: Labour's finance spokesman sees parliament rejecting any May Brexit deal

Headline: Next four weeks 'fundamental' for Brexit deal - EU lawmaker

Headline: Ditch EU for change, Corbyn supporters stick to Brexit script
Description: On a cold autumn night, trade union activist Paula Barker made a passionate plea to fellow members of Britain's Labour Party to be positive about leaving the European Union and make way for leader Jeremy Corbyn's radical new agenda.

Headline: Labour says it will vote down a Brexit deal that fails to meet its tests

Headline: Macron does not want Brexit talks to drag - French presidency official

Headline: No special rules for Britain in Brexit talks - German minister

Headline: Labour to keep second Brexit vote on table, but only on final deal - McDonnell

Headline: Raab says confident of Brexit deal, needs two to tango
Description: British Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab said on Monday that he was confident that the United Kingdom will make progress and eventually clinch a Brexit deal with the European Union.

Headline: Majority of May's cabinet supports Canada-style Brexit deal - Telegraph

Headline: Labour Party to vote on motion including second Brexit referendum - BBC political editor

Headline: UK housing minister says time for EU to evolve its stance on Brexit
Description: Britain's housing minister said it was time for the European Union to evolve its stance on Brexit as leaders gather for an informal summit in Austria in a bid to near an agreement on the terms of Britain's exit from the bloc.

Headline: Barnier offers better Irish terms to get Brexit deal

Headline: UK economy would contract without a Brexit deal - IMF's Lagarde

Headline: May's spokesman - We are confident of reaching Brexit deal

Headline: EU's Barnier says Brexit talks continue in spirit of good cooperation

Headline: Technical fix for Irish border could allow Brexit breakthrough - Britain's Johnson

Headline: EU must do all it can to avoid hard Brexit - Austrian chancellor

Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party is set to vote against any Brexit deal reached by Prime Minister Theresa May and the lack of a viable exit from the European Union will force May from office before Christmas, a senior Labour lawmaker told the Financial Times.

Headline: Brexit talks 'closing in on workable solutions', Raab says
Description: British and European Union negotiators are "closing in on workable solutions" to the outstanding issues in Brexit talks, Britain's Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab said after a phone call with EU chief negotiator Michel Barnier.

Headline: Carney warns of 'no-deal' Brexit house price crash - newspaper
Description: Britain's property market would crash and mortgage rates spiral up in the event of a chaotic no-deal Brexit, with house prices falling 35 percent over three years, Bank of England Governor Mark Carney told ministers, The Times newspaper reported.

Headline: UK court rules against electoral watchdog in Brexit spending row
Description: Britain's electoral regulator misinterpreted the spending law when it allowed the main Brexit campaign to donate to a smaller, aligned group during the 2016 referendum campaign, London's High Court ruled on Friday.

Headline: 'No-deal' Brexit would complicate driving, data and roaming, UK says
Description: Leaving the European Union without a divorce deal could increase Britons' mobile phone roaming charges, upset data sharing and force motorists to get an international licence to drive in Europe, the government said on Thursday.

Headline: Vital EU-UK agree Brexit trade deal, stakes are very large -Eurogroup president
Description: Britain and the European Union must agree a Brexit trade deal because the risks to the economy and the financial sector in particular without one are very large, the head of the euro zone finance ministers group said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit no-deal may stop Eurostar trains entering France -French minister
Description: Eurostar trains heading from London to Paris may not be allowed into France if there is no Brexit deal and sufficient preparations have not been made, France's European Affairs minister said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit deal cannot be a 'fudge'- Raab
Description: Any Brexit deal has to set out a clear model for the relationship between London and Brussels after Britain leaves the European Union, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Thursday.

Headline: UK will pay 'substantially' less to EU in event of no Brexit deal - Raab
Description: Britain will pay "substantially" less to the European Union than the roughly 39 billion pounds withdrawal bill agreed with the bloc if there is no final agreement, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain hands over more Northern Ireland trade data to Brussels - EU official
Description: Britain has handed over more data on trade flows with Northern Ireland at the request of chief negotiator Michel Barnier, an EU official said on Thursday, part of efforts to address the border question with EU member Ireland.

Headline: Britain's aim is to get Chequers-based Brexit deal - May's spokesman
Description: Britain's firm aim is to secure a deal with the European Union based on Prime Minister Theresa May's so-called Chequers plan, her spokesman said on Thursday after she met her cabinet team of top ministers.

Headline: European mobile roaming not guaranteed in no-deal Brexit
Description: Britain said surcharge-free roaming for mobile users could no longer be guaranteed after a no-deal Brexit, meaning consumers could be hit with higher charges to make calls, send texts and use mobile data when travelling in the European Union.

Headline: UK manufacturers would need goods retested by EU in 'no deal' Brexit - paper
Description: British manufacturers selling goods ranging from machinery to toys into the European Union would need to have their products retested by EU safety regulators in the event of a "no deal" Brexit, the British government said on Thursday.

Headline: Raab says confident of getting good Brexit deal
Description: British Brexit minister Dominic Raab told the BBC he was confident of getting a good exit deal with the European Union but said Britain must be prepared for the possibility of leaving without an agreement.

Headline: EU leaders to discuss November Brexit summit next week - diplomat
Description: European Union leaders will discuss when they meet in Austria next week whether to hold a special summit on Brexit in November, a senior EU diplomat said on Thursday.

Headline: Roche boss says Brexit and curbs on drug use pose threat to UK science
Description: Uncertainty over drug regulation and a reluctance by Britain's health service to use certain pricey modern medicines pose a threat to the country's respected life sciences sector, the head Swiss drugmaker Roche  said on Thursday.

Headline: Factbox - Britain sets out no-deal Brexit impact on businesses and consumers
Description: Britain has published the second batch of advice to companies and individuals on how to prepare for any disruption that might follow a disorderly Brexit where there is no deal with the European Union.

Headline: Mergers meeting EU thresholds may be reviewed by UK and EU regulators in 'no deal' Brexit
Description: Mergers that currently meet relevant European Union standards will in some cases be reviewed by both Britain's Competition and Markets Authority and the European Commission if Britain leaves the bloc without a divorce deal, Britain said on Thursday.

Headline: UK says free flow of personal data from EU not guaranteed if no-deal Brexit
Description: British organisations would need to take action to ensure they could continue to receive personal data about their customers in the European Union in the event of the UK leaving the bloc without a deal next year, the UK government said on Thursday.

Headline: UK driving licences may not be valid in EU after no-deal Brexit - UK government
Description: Britons may not be able to rely on using just their British driving licences when driving in the European Union after March 29 if there is no Brexit deal, the British government warned on Thursday.

Headline: UK government wants to uphold CO2 rules in no-deal Brexit
Description: Britain's government said on Tuesday that it would try not to impose extra burdens on the auto industry for reporting carbon dioxide emissions if it leaves the European Union without a deal, but that it would seek to maintain ambitious rules.

Headline: British companies, academics excluded from EU Galileo space project if no-deal Brexit
Description: British companies and academics will be excluded from the future development of the European Union's Galileo space project if the country leaves the bloc without a deal in March 2019, according to a series of technical notices published on Thursday.

Headline: EU tells Britain it won't renegotiate Brexit divorce bill
Description: The European Union will not reconsider parts of the Brexit agreement with Britain that have already been agreed on, like the divorce bill London will have to pay, a spokesman for the bloc's executive said on Thursday.

Headline: BoE's Carney attended 'no deal' Brexit cabinet meeting - May's spokeswoman
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney attended a meeting of the government's top ministers on Thursday to outline the bank's preparations for the possibility of a no deal Brexit, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said.

Headline: UK businesses using Brexit as an excuse for poor performance - Raab
Description: It is easy for British businesses to use Brexit as an excuse rather than taking responsibility for their poor performance, Brexit minister Dominic Raab told BBC Radio on Thursday.

Headline: Raab - Brexit deal attainable, but no deal means no EU payment: Telegraph
Description: A deal on the future relationship between Britain and the European Union is within reach, Brexit Minister Dominic Raab said on Wednesday, although he confirmed London would withhold any financial settlement in a "no deal" scenario.

Headline: EU stepping up efforts to reword Brexit Irish text to 'de-dramatise' talks
Description: European Union officials are working on re-drafting a sensitive Irish protocol to the draft Brexit treaty with Britain, as part of what EU negotiator Michel Barnier has called efforts to "de-dramatise" the issue and get a deal, EU officials said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain outlines post-Brexit farm policy in bill
Description: Britain will introduce legislation on Wednesday for agricultural policy after it leaves the European Union that will link support for farmers to the provision of public benefits such as tackling climate change or preserving beautiful landscapes.

Headline: EU must grasp world role as U.S. retreats, Juncker says
Description: The European Union must flex its muscles as a world power, EU chief executive Jean-Claude Juncker said on Wednesday, as he spoke critically of U.S. President Donald Trump's retreat from international engagement.

Headline: EU's Juncker says ties with UK will always be close but Brexit demands remain
Description: European Commission head Jean-Claude Juncker on Wednesday renewed a pledge of close trade and security ties with Britain after Brexit, but said the European Union would not compromise on key withdrawal terms.

Headline: EU's Juncker confirms aims for close ties with UK after Brexit
Description: European Commission head Jean-Claude Juncker on Wednesday renewed a pledge of close trade and security ties with Britain after Brexit but said the European Union would not compromise on key withdrawal terms.

Headline: Bemoaning UK handling of Brexit, a pro-Leave planemaker looks to EU, U.S.
Description: One of Brexit's most fervent supporters, the planemaker Britten-Norman, is now complaining about Britain's handling of its planned exit from the European Union and is considering moving some functions into the EU or to the United States.

Headline: UK eurosceptics say they will release 'Plan B' for Ireland on Wednesday
Description: Eurosceptic rebels in Britain's ruling party said on Tuesday  they would soon produce a "plan B" alternative to a key element of Prime Minister Theresa May's proposal for Brexit, despite pulling the plug on a broader draft circulated last week.

Headline: Greece's Tsipras says confident of Brexit solution for citizens
Description: Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras said on Tuesday he was "confident" the European Union and Britain would eventually reach a deal on Brexit.

Headline: Hammond says BoE governor to stay on as Brexit turbulence looms
Description: Mark Carney will stay on as Bank of England governor until the end of January 2020 to help navigate the turbulence of Brexit, Britain's finance minister said on Tuesday, as he warned time was running out to secure a deal with the EU on future ties.

Headline: Rejecting Brexit plan is not a confidence vote on PM May - Conservative MP
Description: Lawmakers from British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party can vote against her Brexit plans without it being a vote of confidence in her government, the head of an influential group of pro-Brexit lawmakers said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU Salzburg summit is a staging post in Brexit talks - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May sees an informal EU summit next week as a "staging post" in Brexit negotiations, that will allow the bloc's leaders to discuss her proposals to leave the European Union for the first time.

Headline: Time running out to agree a Brexit deal with EU, UK's Hammond says
Description: Britain is devoting all its efforts to securing a Brexit deal but time is running out in negotiations with the European Union to agree the terms of its departure, British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Tuesday.

Headline: Pound gains on cautious Barnier Brexit deal comment
Description: A cautious comment by the EU Brexit negotiator that there could be a deal by November if unrealistic demands are taken off the table boosted sterling on Monday amid new optimism among investors.

Headline: UK focussed on securing Brexit deal in October - May's spokesman
Description: Britain is focussed on securing a Brexit deal in October, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said, after the European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said an agreement with Britain could be agreed in six to eight weeks.

Headline: EU leaders expected to hold special Brexit summit on Nov. 13 - Guardian
Description: European leaders are expected next week to announce that they will hold an extraordinary Brexit summit in November, the Guardian newspaper reported. It said the summit would most likely be held on Nov. 13.

Headline: UK government refuses to say if it has taken legal advice on second Brexit referendum
Description: The British government has refused to confirm whether it has taken legal advice on holding a second referendum on the final Brexit deal, saying revealing such information would harm its negotiating position in talks with Brussels.

Headline: May hopes parliament will support her Brexit plan - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May hopes parliament will support her plan for Brexit, her spokesman said on Monday, adding it was the only one on the table which delivered on the will of the British people while avoiding a hard border in Northern Ireland.

Headline: May wraps 'suicide vest' around UK over Brexit, says Johnson
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal wraps "a suicide vest around the British constitution" and hands the detonator to the European Union, former foreign secretary Boris Johnson said in comments that drew strong criticism.

Headline: Chequers plan is only deal on the table with EU - Javid
Description: British interior minister Sajid Javid said on Sunday that the prime minister's so-called Chequers plan was the only one on the table with the European Union, suggesting that Theresa May is not planning to succumb to pressure to change tack over Brexit.

Headline: Britain must focus on moving ahead with May's Brexit plan - Brokenshire
Description: Britain must focus on moving forward with Prime Minister Theresa May's plans to leave the European Union, housing minister James Brokenshire said on Sunday, after her proposals were criticised by her former foreign minister.

Headline: Germany has no interest in a 'hard' Brexit - foreign minister
Description: Germany has no interest in a 'hard' Brexit but such a scenario cannot be ruled out, German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas said on Saturday.

Headline: UK wants deal on Brexit by November at latest - Lidington
Description: Britain believes an orderly, agreed exit from the European Union is still the most likely outcome but time is running out and a deal should be done by November at the latest, cabinet office minister David Lidington said on Saturday.

Headline: EIB considering capital hike, changes to shareholding post Brexit
Description: The European Investment Bank (EIB), owned by European Union governments, is considering a capital increase to allow some of its shareholders to increase their stake after Britain pulls out of the EU and the EIB in March next year, EU officials said.

Headline: Britain's Hammond says he is sure Brexit deal will be reached by October deadline
Description: British Finance Minister Philip Hammond said on Friday he was sure Britain will reach an agreement with the European Union on its exit from the bloc by an informal October deadline, in contrast to growing expectations of a no-deal Brexit.

Headline: Irish PM says he wants Brexit agreement by November at latest
Description: Ireland wants to see a Brexit withdrawal agreement between the European Union and Britain concluded by November "at the latest", Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Friday.

Headline: 'Hurry up,' Calais region urges EU, UK leaders as no-deal Brexit looms
Description: Time is running out for regions on the frontline of trade between Britain and Europe to cope with the impact of a no-deal Brexit, from finding vets to building customs infrastructure, a northern French region's "ambassador" to Britain said.

Headline: UK's former EU ambassador warns of Brexit crisis - Guardian
Description: Britain's former ambassador to the European Union has warned that there is a higher risk of a Brexit crisis than financial markets are currently pricing in, the Guardian reported.

Headline: UK, U.S. urge EU not to lock out foreign banks
Description: Britain's top markets regulator, backed by the United States, urged the European Union to soften its stance and grant broad access to UK banks after Brexit to avoid hitting investors and harming markets.

Headline: French drugmakers urge Brexit negotiators to safeguard supply chain
Description: French drugmakers are urging European and British negotiators ahead of a crunch Brexit meeting next month to ensure the free circulation of medicines is maintained if Britain leaves the bloc without a deal next year.

Headline: Irish PM says no 'dramatic moves' to report in Brexit talks
Description: Ireland has not received any indications that there have been  "dramatic moves" by either side towards progress in Brexit talks, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Thursday.

Headline: UK sets out plans for visas for non-EU migrant farm workers post-Brexit
Description: British fruit and vegetable farmers will be able to recruit non-European Union migrants on temporary visas after Brexit to help ease labour shortages during busy periods, the British government said on Thursday.

Headline: Irish consumer sentiment falls back as Brexit worries weigh
Description: Irish consumer sentiment slipped in August as worries about Brexit grew, a survey showed on Thursday, erasing a July bounce put down to unusually warm weather and the start of the summer holidays.

Headline: Britain would now vote to stay in the EU, new poll shows
Description: Britons would choose to stay in the European Union if given the option, according to an opinion poll on Wednesday that showed a six-point swing away from Brexit and the highest support for EU membership in such a survey since the 2016 referendum.

Headline: Germany readies for all Brexit options, including no-deal
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel's government said on Wednesday it is preparing for all Brexit scenarios, including a no-deal, after its cabinet approved a draft law on a transition phase for Britain after it leaves the European Union next year.

Headline: Germany has full trust in Barnier on Brexit - government spokesman
Description: The German government has full trust in the European Union's chief Brexit negotiator, who represents the bloc's 27 members in talks with Britain, a spokesman told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headline: Parliament needs to be able to make informed decision on future EU relationship - May's spokesman
Description: The British parliament will need to be able to make an informed decision about Britain's future relationship with the European Union when it votes on whether to back any Brexit deal, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit minister Raab says May's Brexit plan only way to keep UK intact
Description: Brexit minister Dominic Raab dismissed suggestions put forward by Brexit supporters for Britain to pursue an enhanced Canada-style free trade deal, saying Prime Minister Theresa May's plan was the only one to keep the United Kingdom intact.

Headline: Merkel says EU, Britain must negotiate Brexit to ensure close ties
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Wednesday said it was important to negotiate Britain's exit from the European Union in a way that ensured continued good and close relations.

Headline: May says still working towards October Brexit deal deadline
Description: Britain is still working towards reaching a Brexit deal with the European Union in October, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday.

Headline: Merkel's allies want close ties with Britain, reject hard Brexit
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel's CSU Bavarian allies said on Wednesday that they wanted to have a close relationship with Britain after its departure from the European Union.

Headline: Former BoE chief says UK heading for "Brexit in name only"
Description: Former Bank of England governor Mervyn King said the United Kingdom was probably heading towards a 'Brexit in name only' because the British political elite had been so incompetent in negotiating an exit from the European Union.

Headline: UK's upbeat Brexit progress report given short shrift by parliament
Description: An exit deal between Britain and the European Union is within sight, Brexit minister Dominic Raab told parliament on Tuesday, as lawmakers from all sides told him the current negotiating plan had little hope of winning their approval.

Headline: Merkel to commit all creativity to Brexit deal, but cannot promise success
Description: Germany is doing all it can to ensure the European Union and Britain reach a divorce deal, Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Tuesday, warning that success was not guaranteed.

Headline: Germany working hard to secure Brexit deal, but can't rule out failure - Merkel
Description: Germany and its partners in the European Union are putting all their energy into securing a deal with Britain on its planned exit from the bloc, Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Tuesday, adding there was no guarantee an agreement would be reached.

Headline: Britain must press EU members to help get Brexit deal - May
Description: Britain must step up contact with members of the European Union to try to get a Brexit deal as talks to leave the bloc enter a "crucial and intense phase", Prime Minister Theresa May agreed with her ministers on Tuesday.

Headline: UK finance minister will set out budget timing in 'usual way' - May's spokesman
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond will set out the timing for his next budget in "the usual way", a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday after a newspaper reported that his fiscal statement would come early.

Headline: UK has looked at economic impact of Brexit plans - Senior Brexit ministry official
Description: The British government has done work looking at the economic impact of Prime Minister Theresa May's "Chequers" Brexit proposals, the most senior official in the Brexit ministry said on Tuesday.

Headline: Senior UK Brexit ministry official says confident plans in place for 'no-deal' Brexit
Description: The most senior official in Britain's Brexit ministry said on Tuesday he was confident that plans were in place for the possibility of Britain leaving the European Union without a deal.

Headline: No-deal Brexit odds hold at one in four, economists say - Reuters poll
Description: The chances Britain will leave the European Union in March without a deal are one in four, a Reuters poll found, and the Bank of England is likely to wait until after Brexit before raising borrowing costs again.

Headline: Critics 'chuck rocks from both sides' at May's Brexit plans
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit strategy means disaster for Britain, her former foreign secretary Boris Johnson said, as critics at home and officials in Brussels stepped up their opposition to her plans for how to leave the European Union.

Headline: EU Parliament aims to endorse any deal just two weeks before Brexit day
Description: The European Parliament expects to be able to endorse any deal with London just two weeks before Britain leaves the EU on March 29, a leading lawmaker said on Monday, highlighting how tight the schedule is to agree on divorce terms and future ties.

Headline: PM May's Brexit plan only credible one, can get parliament's support - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May believes that her Brexit proposal is the "only credible and negotiable plan" for Britain to leave the European Union and that it can get the support of parliament, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: May stands firm on her Brexit plan, but scepticism persists
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said she would not allow compromises to her Brexit strategy that went against the national interest, seeking to allay fears among some in her Conservative Party that she will cave in to Brussels' demands in negotiations.

Headline: EU-Britain customs union deal would prevent disruption - Barnier
Description: Companies will face disruption to their supply chains if Britain leaves the European Union without securing continued access to the bloc's single market or a customs union, EU chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier told a German newspaper.

Headline: EU, Britain talk up chances of autumn Brexit deal
Description: EU and UK negotiators on Friday talked up prospects of agreeing a Brexit deal this autumn, citing recent progress in detailing very close security cooperation to take effect after Britain leaves the bloc.

Headline: Raab 'stubbornly optimistic' of Brexit deal with EU
Description: Brexit minister Dominic Raab said he was "stubbornly optimistic" that Britain would reach a deal with the European Union on the terms of its departure from the bloc in time for an October meeting of EU leaders.

Headline: FTSE to lag peers as investors fret about no-deal Brexit - Reuters poll
Description: Britain's FTSE 100 will take until the end of next year to return close to record levels, according to a Reuters poll, held back in the near-term as investors grapple with the possibility that Britain leaves the European Union with no deal.

Headline: UK consumers defy Brexit blues, but companies fret - surveys
Description: British consumers appear little fazed by the possibility of a no-deal Brexit, but businesses have turned more worried, surveys showed on Friday.

Headline: UK sees record drop in foreigners' holdings of government debt
Description: Foreigners' net holdings of British government debt fell by a record amount last month, a move partly driven by a large volume of maturing bonds but one which also revived concerns about the effect of Brexit on investor appetite.

Headline: Germany urges Europe not to adopt a 'Europe First' policy
Description: Germany's finance minister warned against following a "Europe First" policy and said it was unclear whether the European Union would reach a Brexit agreement with Britain.

Headline: German finmin believes much euro clearing will move to Frankfurt
Description: German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Thursday he believed a large part of euro clearing would move to mainland Europe and Frankfurt over time.

Headline: EU's Barnier says must prepare for a 'no-deal' Brexit
Description: The European Union's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Thursday the bloc must prepare for a no-deal Brexit, even if its goal was an orderly exit.

Headline: EU's Barnier offers Britain close ties but 'no single market a la carte'
Description: The European Union is prepared to offer Britain an unprecedentedly close relationship after it quits the bloc but would not allow anything that weakened the body's single market, chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK sees several possible causes of no-deal Brexit
Description: A British departure from the European Union without an agreed exit deal could be triggered by several different events, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Wednesday, adding that Britain was prepared for the risks.

Headline: UK minister: If EU punishes City of London, non-EU financial centres will benefit
Description: Financial centres outside the European Union would be the benefactors if the European Union sought to punish the City of London as Britain leaves the bloc, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Wednesday.

Headline: Barnier offers Britain close ties but no 'single market a la carte'
Description: The European Union's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said the bloc was prepared to offer Britain an unprecedentedly close relationship after it quits the EU, but it would not permit anything that weakened the body's single market.

Headline: UK could hold back EU payments without Brexit deal - UK's Raab
Description: Britain could choose to withhold some payments to the European Union if a deal to ease its exit from the bloc is not reached before it leaves in March, Brexit minister Dominic Raab told legislators on Wednesday.

Headline: UK's Brexit plan has had 'reasonably positive' reaction from EU states - minister
Description: Britain's negotiating stance on Brexit, published in July, has received a reasonably positive reaction from other members of the European Union, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Wednesday.

Headline: Germany tells drugmakers to check supply chains for no-deal Brexit risks
Description: German drugmakers have been asked by the government to examine their supply chains for any vulnerability that could cause shortages of essential drugs in the event that Britain leaves the European Union without a Brexit deal.

Headline: Talk of no-deal Brexit is 'a negotiating position' - Irish minister
Description: Talk of Britain leaving the European Union without an exit deal is more a negotiating position than a reality as such a scenario would benefit neither side, Ireland's foreign minister told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headline: May says no-deal Brexit not 'the end of the world' - Sky
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has said that failing to secure a deal with the European Union before Britain leaves the bloc next year "wouldn't be the end of the world", Sky News reported on Tuesday.

Headline: Liam Fox urges Asia counterparts to convey Brexit views to EU - CNBC
Description: Trade Secretary Liam Fox has urged his Asian counterparts to make their views on Brexit known to the European Union, he told CNBC on Tuesday.

Headline: Germany's Maas says hard Brexit 'not yet off the table'
Description: German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas on Tuesday said there was still the risk of a hard Brexit and the European Union must prepare for every outcome in its divorce talks with Britain.

Headline: Germany wants to avoid no-deal Brexit - Maas
Description: Germany's Foreign Minister Heiko Maas said on Tuesday that Berlin wants to avoid a disorderly Brexit, meaning the risk of Britain crashing out of the European Union without a deal, but he added that officials were also preparing for such an outcome.

Headline: Irish foreign minister urges UK to clarify its Brexit stance
Description: Ireland's Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Tuesday that more clarity was needed about Britain's stance regarding its planned departure from the European Union.

Headline: France to make contingency plans for no-deal Brexit
Description: French Prime Minister Edouard Philippe on Monday asked his ministers to prepare contingency measures in case of a no-deal Brexit.

Headline: Macron says Brexit cannot divide EU, criticises Trump's isolationism
Description: President Emmanuel Macron on Monday said preserving European Union unity was more important than forging a close relationship with post-Brexit Britain, and hit out at what he called U.S. President Donald Trump's "aggressive" isolationism.

Headline: Conservatives split again by Hammond's Brexit warning
Description: The split in Britain's ruling party over how to leave the European Union was exposed again on Friday as pro-Brexit MPs turned on the Chancellor for his latest warning that a so-called hard Brexit would hurt the economy.

Headline: UK says Brexit could hit banks' stock of 'risk free' EU debt
Description: Britain could force European Union banks operating in London to start holding capital against inventory of riskier EU government bonds in the case of a 'no-deal' Brexit.

Headline: UK food exports to EU may be stalled by 'no deal' Brexit - NFU
Description: Britain could be barred from exporting some food to the European Union for months if it leaves the bloc without a deal, the National Farmers Union said on Thursday after the government published reports on that scenario.

Headline: UK minister says November Brexit deal would be manageable
Description: Britain would be able to handle a delay in securing a Brexit deal with the European Union if the talks extended into November and missed their informal October deadline, cabinet office minister David Lidington said on Friday.

Headline: No-deal Brexit will bring tangle of red tape, Britain warns companies
Description: Britain on Thursday told companies trading with the European Union they would face a tangle of red tape, possible border delays and more costly credit card payments if the government fails to negotiate an exit deal before Britain leaves the bloc.

Headline: Hunt says parliament will only approve Brexit deal consistent with vote
Description: Foreign secretary, Jeremy Hunt, said on Thursday he believed the British parliament would only approve a Brexit deal that was consistent with the "letter and spirit" of the 2016 referendum result in favour of leaving the European Union.

Headline: Austria's Kurz wants to help EU's Barnier avoid a hard Brexit
Description: Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz, whose country holds the rotating European Union presidency, said on Thursday he wanted to help the EU's chief Brexit negotiator avoid a hard Brexit.

Headline: Britons living in EU could lose access to UK bank services in no-deal Brexit
Description: Britons living in the European Union could lose access to their UK bank account services and businesses on the continent could be cut off from investment banks in London if there is a no-deal Brexit, the British government said on Thursday.

Headline: British businesses relieved at no-deal Brexit VAT tweak
Description: British business welcomed a commitment from the government to change how import VAT has to be paid should Britain leave the European Union without a deal - a technical accounting tweak that should avert a cashflow "time bomb" for many companies.

Headline: 'Safe as houses'? Brexit looms over UK real estate market
Description: Investors are ditching British real estate as Brexit uncertainty, rising interest rates and inflation erode house prices and office values in a market hurtling towards a potentially messy exit from the European Union.

Headline: UK calls for extra six weeks of Brexit drug stockpiles
Description: The British government called on Thursday for drugmakers to build an additional six weeks of medicines stockpiles to cope with potential supply disruption in the event of a no-deal Brexit - a target the industry said would be challenging.

Headline: Factbox - Reaction to the British government's 'no deal' Brexit plans
Description: Britain on Thursday set out a series of notes detailing what could happen if it fails to reach a Brexit deal with the European Union, acknowledging that firms would face a tangle of red tape and possible delays at the border.

Headline: Factbox - Britain sets out plans for 'no-deal' Brexit
Description: Britain has published 25 so-called technical notices advising companies and people how to prepare for any disruption that might arise from a disorderly Brexit where there is no deal with the European Union.

Headline: Brexit minister confident Britain will reach deal with EU
Description: Britain's Brexit Minister Dominic Raab said he was confident a good deal with the European Union remained in sight, but it was right to set out a "measured and proportionate" approach outlining the risks if the two sides cannot agree.

Headline: Scotland's Sturgeon says Brexit endangers economy
Description: Scotland's pro-independence First Minister said Britain's impending departure from the European Union would damage the economy in Scotland and the rest of the United Kingdom, and that she would not block another Brexit referendum.

Headline: Exclusive - Britain extends lead as king of currencies despite Brexit vote
Description: Britain has extended its lead in the global currency trading business in the two years since it voted to leave the European Union, in another sign London is likely to continue to be one of the world's top two financial centres even after Brexit.

Headline: EU expects delay in Brexit deal beyond October target
Description: European Union leaders are likely to have to hold an emergency summit in November to consider any Brexit agreement struck with Britain, missing an informal deadline the previous month, diplomats in Brussels said.

Headline: EU expects delay in Brexit deal beyond October target
Description: European Union leaders are likely to have to hold an emergency summit in November to consider any Brexit agreement struck with Britain, missing an informal deadline the previous month, diplomats in Brussels said.

Headline: EU's Barnier says Brexit must keep bloc's single market intact
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator said on Tuesday any agreement with Britain on their future relationship must respect the bloc's single market rules.

Headline: Raab hopes Brexit deal with EU still possible in October
Description: Britain is confident it can reach a Brexit agreement with the European Union in October, the country's chief negotiator on leaving the bloc said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain presses for more EU sanctions against Russia
Description: Britain pressed the European Union on Tuesday to increase sanctions against Russia, saying it should stand "shoulder to shoulder" with the United States, which hit Moscow with new economic restrictions this month.

Headline: Kremlin declines to comment on UK call for more EU sanctions against Russia
Description: The Kremlin on Tuesday declined to comment on a British call for the European Union to increase sanctions against Russia, saying it was not yet familiar with the details of what London was proposing.

Headline: UK says aims to boost exports to 35 percent of GDP, gives no timeframe
Description: Britain aims to boost exports to 35 percent of gross domestic product after leaving the European Union as it looks to increase trade ties with the rest of the world, its trade minister said on Tuesday, but he gave no timeframe for reaching the target.

Headline: Britain can't afford to close door to EU banks after Brexit
Description: Britain is expected to keep the door open for European Union banks and investors after Brexit to try to preserve London's global financial clout, irrespective of whether it gets a good trade deal from the bloc, bankers and industry officials say.

Headline: Britain can't afford to close door to EU banks after Brexit
Description: Britain is expected to keep the door open for European Union banks and investors after Brexit to try to preserve London's global financial clout, irrespective of whether it gets a good trade deal from the bloc, bankers and industry officials say.

Headline: UK trade minister - EU risks hurting image with Brexit handling: Sky News
Description: British trade minister Liam Fox said on Tuesday that the European Union risks damaging its standing in the world if it pursues a Brexit that puts its own "ideological purity" ahead of needs of its citizens.

Headline: UK households upbeat about their income, worried over Brexit
Description: British households are the most upbeat about their finances since early 2015, buoyed by near-record employment, but the approach of Brexit and concerns about inflation are making them worry more about the future, a survey showed on Monday.

Headline: Brexit vote could 'in theory' be reversed - EU minister Moscovici
Description: Britain's vote to leave the European Union could "in theory" be reversed although there is a still a strong probability it will go ahead, said the European Commissioner for Economic and Financial Affairs Pierre Moscovici on Monday.

Headline: May could face trouble over Brexit deal, Conservative lawmaker warns
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May could face trouble getting her Brexit deal approved by the British parliament before exit day unless she changes her proposals, the head of an influential group of pro-Brexit lawmakers said in an interview published on Sunday.

Headline: Superdry co-founder gives 1 million pounds to campaign for second Brexit vote
Description: The co-founder of fashion brand Superdry  is donating a million pounds ($1.28 million) to the campaign for a referendum on the final Brexit agreement as Britain prepares to outline in more detail how a no-deal outcome would work.

Headline: UK hopes to pick up Brexit talks pace with Raab-Barnier meeting on Tuesday
Description: Britain's Brexit minister Dominic Raab will travel to Brussels on Tuesday in a bid to pick up the pace of Brexit talks with the EU's chief negotiator Michel Barnier, Prime Minister Theresa May's office said on Saturday.

Headline: London mayor Khan consults disaster planners over no-deal Brexit
Description: London's mayor Sadiq Khan said on Friday he had asked the organisation that deals with militant attacks and disasters in the British capital to assess the impact of a "no-deal" Brexit on access to medicines and food and on law and order.

Headline: Significant short-term market impact to no-deal Brexit - Hunt
Description: The short-term market impact will be significant if Britain leaves the European Union without a deal, Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said during a visit to Latvia on Wednesday.

Headline: Can Britain alone stop Brexit? Scottish court hears appeal
Description: Pro-EU campaigners seeking to establish legally that Britain alone could stop the Brexit process took an appeal to Scotland's top court on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit deal should be flexible, open to adjustments - Merkel
Description: Any agreement Britain reaches with the European Union on its exit from the bloc should be flexible and open to future adjustments, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Tuesday, as the risk of a no-deal Brexit increases.

Headline: Risk of no-deal Brexit rising, 'everyone needs to prepare' - Hunt
Description: The risk of a no-deal Brexit has been increasing and the European Union commission needs to change its attitude if a deal is to be reached, foreign secretary Jeremy Hunt said on Tuesday.

Headline: Moody's converts Stockholm to subsidiary to navigate Brexit
Description: Credit ratings agency Moody's  is converting its Stockholm branch into a subsidiary as the sector faces regulatory pressure to have enough staff in the European Union post Brexit.

Headline: That sinking feeling? Sterling traders prepare for Brexit meltdown
Description: Having sunk to 13-month lows, sterling could fall by up to another 10 percent in the coming months should Britain crash out of the European Union without a deal on future trade ties, luring more speculators to bet against the currency.

Headline: Disorder, deal or dead-end - How will Brexit play out?
Description: The United Kingdom is due to leave the European Union on March 29, yet little is clear: There is, so far, no divorce deal, rivals to Prime Minister Theresa May are circling and some MPs are pushing for a rerun of the 2016 referendum.

Headline: UK gilt curve gives another glimpse of 'no deal' Brexit nerves
Description: The risk of Britain crashing out of the European Union without a trade agreement has dragged sterling to its lowest in almost a year this week, and the prospect of a 'no deal' Brexit has also infected the UK government bond market in recent months.

Headline: UK voters should make final Brexit decision if talks with EU collapse - poll
Description: If Brexit talks break down without a deal, half of Britons believe the final decision over whether to leave the European Union should be taken by the public in a referendum, according to a survey of more than 10,000 people published on Friday.

Headline: Brexit uncertainty is depressing UK growth - Hammond
Description: Uncertainty over Brexit is depressing economic growth in Britain, Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Friday after official data showed lacklustre year-on-year expansion.

Headline: Banks' post-Brexit 'fragmentation' plans hold risks and costs
Description: Banks that move some of their business and staff out of London to cities scattered across Europe after Brexit could be taking on extra risks and costs without being sure of boosting revenues.

Headline: Goldman Sachs sees orderly Brexit with May getting deal through parliament
Description: Goldman Sachs sees Prime Minister Theresa May clinching a Brexit deal on access to European Union markets for goods and getting it approved by the British parliament, though it cautioned that a disorderly exit and national election remained possible.

Headline: Treasury readying Brexit contingency plans for finance industry
Description: The Treasury said on Thursday it would soon start putting contingency arrangements in place for financial services regulation if the country crashes out of the European Union without a deal.

Headline: Hedge fund boss Odey says pound could fall further as Brexit deadline looms
Description: Sterling and UK government bonds will fall further in the run-up to Brexit, even after the pound slumped this week to its lowest in almost a year, prominent Brexit-supporting British hedge fund manager Crispin Odey said on Thursday.

Headline: Chances rise of 'no deal' Brexit that would hit sterling - Reuters poll
Description: The likelihood Britain crashes out of the European Union without a trade deal has increased, an outcome that would hurt an already weak pound, according to economists and foreign exchange strategists polled by Reuters.

Headline: Britain walks Brexit high wire over financial services
Description: Britain must avoid tying Brussels up in red tape or antagonising its soon to be former European Union partners and the United States if it is to maintain access to the bloc's financial services market after Brexit.

Headline: UK firms struggle to hire with Brexit, record low jobless rate
Description: The number of people recruited for permanent jobs in Britain grew at its slowest pace in nine months in July, reflecting record low unemployment and a shortage of migrant workers from the European Union, a recruiters' body said on Wednesday.

Headline: HSBC shifts European branches to French unit control ahead of Brexit
Description: HSBC  has shifted ownership of its Polish and Irish subsidiaries from its London-based entity to its French unit, and will do so for seven more European branches, as it prepares for Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: Brexit jobs feast pushes up wages in Ireland's financial sector
Description: Ireland's allure as a post-Brexit base for global financial firms has driven wages for some roles considerably higher with some positions offering 15 percent more than a year ago.

Headline: PM May to meet Scotland's Sturgeon after Brexit standoff
Description: Scottish leader Nicola Sturgeon accused the British government of "talking-up" a no-deal Brexit, making it more likely the United Kingdom will just drop out of the European Union at great cost to the economy.

Headline: In England's forgotten 'rust belt', voters show little sign of Brexit regret
Description: To Paul Green, a club steward in northern England's 'rust belt', Britain is so broken that he would vote for Brexit again were he to get another chance.

Headline: No-deal Brexit? What it might mean for Britain
Description: The prospect of a "no-deal Brexit" appears to have grown after the European Union's negotiator rejected last month central elements of Prime Minister Theresa May's proposals for a new trade agreement.

Headline: Timeline - Brexit at breaking point? Diary dates for Britain's EU departure
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has less than eight months to negotiate a Brexit deal, sell it to her divided Conservative Party and win parliamentary approval.

Headline: May still believes Britain will win a good Brexit deal - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May still believes that Britain will negotiate a good Brexit deal with the European Union rather than failing to win any agreement for its departure from the bloc, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Support for May's handling of Brexit falls to record low - ORB poll
Description: British voters approval of Prime Minister Theresa May's handling of Brexit negotiations has fallen to 22 percent, according to the ORB International pollster on Monday, the lowest figure it has recorded.

Headline: BoE's Carney sees 'uncomfortably high' risk of no-deal Brexit
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Friday Britain faces an "uncomfortably high" risk of leaving the European Union with no deal, comments that drove sterling to an 11-day low against the dollar.

Headline: Eyeing Brexit, Scottish fund firm Baillie Gifford to open Dublin office
Description: Scottish fund manager Baillie Gifford said on Friday it will open a small office in Dublin to lead the expansion of its growing European business as Britain leaves the European Union.

Headline: Less than a third of UK business leaders planning for Brexit - survey
Description: Less than a third of 800 UK business leaders surveyed have carried out contingency planning on Brexit, the Institute of Directors (IoD) said on Friday.

Headline: Bank of England raises rates above crisis lows, signals no rush for next hike
Description: The Bank of England pushed interest rates above their financial crisis lows on Thursday, but signalled it was in no hurry to raise them further as Britain heads for Brexit next year with no clear plan for leaving the European Union.

Headline: Bank of England's Carney speaks after raising interest rates
Description: The Bank of England raised interest rates on Thursday to 0.75 percent, their highest level since the financial crisis.

Headline: BoE's Carney says one rate rise a year a good rule of thumb - BBC
Description: Financial market expectations of one Bank of England interest rate rise a year for the next few years are a good rule of thumb, BoE Governor Mark Carney told the BBC after the central bank raised interest rates on Thursday.

Headline: Macron, May meeting not an attempt to sidestep Barnier - Elysee
Description: President Emmanuel Macron has full trust in Michel Barnier, the European Union's Brexit negotiator, and Friday's meeting with Prime Minister Theresa May is not an attempt to hold parallel talks, a French presidency official said on Thursday.

Headline: Pound extends losses on Carney comments, dollar strength
Description: The pound extended losses on Thursday after the Bank of England raised interest rates from crisis era lows but was cautious about any further tightening with an uncertain Brexit on the horizon.

Headline: BoE's Carney - rates could end up higher in many Brexit outcomes
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Thursday there were many ways that the eventual outcome of Britain's divorce with the European Union could result in higher interest rates.

Headline: BoE's Carney - policy needs to walk, not run
Description: The Bank of England's approach to policy should be to "walk - not run", Governor Mark Carney said on Thursday after the central bank raised rates to a new post-financial crisis high of 0.75 percent.

Headline: Ambitious EU-UK trade deal possible after Brexit, need Ireland solution first - EU
Description: Britain and the European Union can have a trade agreement of unprecedented scope after Brexit if each retains control over their laws and there is a deal how to avoid a physical border between Northern Ireland and Ireland, a top EU official said.

Headline: London Stock Exchange dismisses Frankfurt euro clearing threat
Description: The London Stock Exchange said on Thursday that more customers were clearing euro-denominated contracts, as it sought to quell concerns that rival Deutsche Boerse  was beginning to steal significant market share.

Headline: UK says Brexit no-deal warnings are 'Project Reality', not 'Project Fear'
Description: Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt denied on Wednesday that warnings about fallout from a disorderly exit from the European Union were an attempt to scare opponents of the government's preferred Brexit plan into supporting it.

Headline: Sanofi has been stockpiling drugs for no-deal Brexit - WSJ
Description: French drugmaker Sanofi  has been making drug-shortage contingency plans for more than a year to prepare for Britain and the European Union failing to reach a Brexit transition deal, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing a source.

Headline: More drugmakers build Brexit stockpiles as EU agency faces exodus
Description: Sanofi and Novartis said on Wednesday they planned to increase stockpiles of medicines in Britain in preparation for potential disruption if the UK crashes out of the European Union without a deal.

Headline: EU drugs agency sees 30 percent staff losses, more cuts in Brexit move
Description: The European Medicines Agency (EMA) is to scale back operations further as it copes with higher than expected staff losses, triggered by the watchdog's forced relocation from London to Amsterdam because of Brexit.

Headline: Banks say UK finance exports underscore need for good Brexit deal
Description: Britain's exports of financial services to the European Union hit a record high last year, highlighting the need for the City to preserve access to the bloc after Brexit, industry officials said on Tuesday.

Headline: Poland sees higher risk of no-deal Brexit
Description: Poland said on Tuesday that the risk of Britain dropping out of the European Union with no agreement on post-Brexit ties "cannot be ruled out" and it would spike if London and the bloc fail to agree details in October.

Headline: Britain's car industry cautions: No-deal Brexit is our nightmare
Description: A no-deal Brexit would seriously damage the car industry in Britain and the European Union by raising costs and sowing chaos for carmakers and consumers alike, the head of Britain's car industry warned on Tuesday.

Headline: Hunt urges France and Germany to push EU for Brexit deal
Description: Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt urged France and Germany on Tuesday to lobby European Union negotiators for a sensible outcome to Brexit talks, warning that Europe would also suffer "if Brexit goes wrong".

Headline: No deal Brexit is not an option, Britain's car industry warns
Description: A no-deal Brexit is not an option for Britain's car industry, given the costs and disruption that carmakers and consumers would suffer, the head of the country's automobile industry  group said on Tuesday.

Headline: Hunt to warn France, Austria of costs of no-deal Brexit
Description: British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt will visit Paris and Vienna this week to discuss Brexit and warn of the costs to Britain and the European Union of failing to reach a transition deal, his office said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain to set out 'sensible precautions' for no deal Brexit - May's spokesman
Description: Britain will set out 'sensible precautions' in a series of notes looking at how to prepare for a possible exit from the European Union without a formal divorce deal, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Britons see Brexit turning sour, half want chance to vote again - poll
Description: Two-thirds of Britons now think the government will end up with a bad deal when Britain leaves the European Union early next year, and half want the chance to vote on what happens next, Sky News reported on Monday, citing its own poll.

Headline: Credit Suisse to shift 50 jobs to Madrid from London for Brexit - source
Description: Credit Suisse  is looking to shift about 50 jobs from London to Madrid as part of its efforts to continue doing business in the European Union after Britain leaves the bloc in 2019, a source close to the bank said on Monday.

Headline: UK tells EU - give the City access to EU or your financial firms could suffer: Guardian
Description: Britain has warned the European Union negotiators that EU financial firms will face obstacles to working in the country after Brexit unless the City of London is allowed to operate in the bloc as it does currently, the Guardian reported on Monday.

Headline: China tempts Britain with free trade, says door to U.S. talks open
Description: China offered Britain talks on a post-Brexit free trade deal on Monday, reaching out to London as Beijing remains mired in an increasingly bitter trade war with Washington, even as a senior Chinese diplomat reiterated its door remained open for dialogue.

Headline: 'Terrible mistake' - Hunt misidentifies wife as Japanese rather than Chinese
Description: In a slip of the tongue during his maiden trip to China as Britain's new foreign secretary, Jeremy Hunt on Monday told his Chinese counterpart that his wife was Japanese, but backtracked quickly.

Headline: Austria seeks to avoid hard Brexit, Kurz tells May
Description: Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz said it was important to avoid a "hard" or disorderly Brexit, but negotiations about Britain's exit from the European Union were going quite well.

Headline: Brexit on agenda for September EU leaders' meeting in Salzburg - Britain
Description: European Union leaders will discuss Brexit when they next meet in the Austrian city of Salzburg on Sept. 20, British Prime Minister Theresa May's office said after discussions with Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz.

Headline: Ex-Trump strategist Bannon targets Britain in anti-EU campaign
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's former political strategist Steve Bannon has been in contact with three potential rivals to British Prime Minister Theresa May and will make another trip to Europe in August, he told Reuters in an interview.

Headline: Fix Irish border or face hard Brexit, EU lawmakers warn May
Description: The British government has so far failed to offer a "workable" backstop plan to avoid Brexit border frictions in Ireland and must do so now if the European Parliament is to endorse a smooth transition out of the EU, lawmakers warned on Friday.

Headline: EU rejects Britain's key elements of special customs plan after Brexit
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier rejected key elements of Britain's new trade proposals on Thursday even as he and his new British counterpart Dominic Raab voiced a shared determination to reach a deal by October.

Headline: UK voters back Brexit deal referendum as May's ratings plunge - polls
Description: The proportion of voters who favour a referendum on the final terms of any Brexit deal has overtaken those who do not for the first time, while Prime Minister Theresa May's approval ratings have plunged, according to opinion polls.

Headline: British voters increasingly unhappy with PM May and her government - poll
Description: British voters are increasingly dissatisfied with Prime Minister Theresa May and her government, according to an opinion poll on Friday, with less than a third of respondents happy with May's leadership.

Headline: Raab confident over Irish backstop, says must be time-limited
Description: Britain's Brexit minister said on Thursday he was confident that a workable "backstop" could be found to resolve the issue of the border with Ireland after Brexit, but said any such backstop needed to be limited in time.

Headline: Portugal wants Britain to welcome all EU migrants after Brexit
Description: Portugal's foreign minister told Britain on Thursday it should keep its doors open to "construction workers and waiters" as well as high-end professional migrants after it leaves the European Union.

Headline: EU medicines agency faces court fight over $660 million rent bill
Description: The European Medicines Agency, which is moving from London to Amsterdam because of Brexit, has been taken to court by its UK landlord, which wants it to keep paying a rent bill estimated at around 500 million pounds.

Headline: May says public should not be alarmed by medicines stockpiling
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said the public should be reassured rather than alarmed by government plans to stockpile medicines and blood products ahead of a possible no-deal Brexit.

Headline: City of London warns of regional hit from bad EU deal for finance
Description: A bad Brexit deal with the European Union for financial services  would hit provincial British cities harder than the sector's base in London, research showed on Thursday.

Headline: May says Brexit offers 'unique opportunity' for farmers
Description: Brexit offers a "unique opportunity" for Britain to transform its food, farming and environmental policies, Prime Minister Theresa May will tell farmers on Thursday, stepping up efforts to sell her vision for leaving the European Union.

Headline: Clark to warn in Italy of Brexit no-deal damage to both sides
Description: Business Secretary Greg Clark will warn of the economic damage to both the EU and Britain of either a bad or no Brexit deal when he meets Italian politicians and firms on Thursday in the latest leg of a charm offensive to win over European capitals.

Headline: Barclays boss says UK finance sector will dodge Brexit bullet
Description: Britain's banking industry will emerge largely unscathed from Brexit and retain its position as one of the world's top two financial centres for the foreseeable future, Barclays' Chairman John McFarlane told Reuters.

Headline: Europe launches Galileo navigation satellites amid Brexit row
Description: Europe launched four more Galileo satellites on Wednesday, taking the number in orbit to 26 and moving a step closer to having its own navigation system, just as the programme has become the latest flashpoint in Brexit negotiations.

Headline: Ireland would support Britain if it asked for more time to leave EU - foreign minister
Description: Ireland would "absolutely" support Britain if it asked for an extension to the Article 50 timetable for leaving the European Union, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Wednesday.

Headline: Too much talk of unlikely no deal Brexit - Irish foreign minister
Description: There is too much focus on the possible negative consequences of Britain crashing out of the European Union without a deal given that it is still an unlikely scenario, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK heatwave will hit food supplies, could worsen Brexit disruption - food lobby
Description: Britain's prolonged heatwave will impact food supplies later this year and would exacerbate any disruption caused by a hard Brexit, an industry lobby group warned on Wednesday.

Headline: UK will resist any new barriers between Britain and Northern Ireland - Hammond
Description: Britain will resist any further divergence in regulations between Northern Ireland and the rest of the United Kingdom that might be proposed to smooth trade across the Irish border, Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brussels, Greece among EU Brexit options for London insurance brokers - trade body
Description: Brussels, Athens and Piraeus are among cities London insurance brokers could consider for European Union subsidiaries, with time running out to plan for a hard Brexit, a trade body said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain must move in Brexit negotiations, Germany says
Description: German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas said in a media interview published on Wednesday that the British government needs to get moving in Brexit negotiations, including on the Northern Ireland border issue.

Headline: Britain and EU formally start splitting WTO membership agreements
Description: Britain and the European Union formally filed for divorce at the World Trade Organization on Tuesday, following many months of diplomatic preparations to smooth the way for the historic move.

Headline: 'A real offer' - Raab suggests Brexit proposal to EU may be final
Description: Britain has put forward a "real offer" to a win a deal on leaving the European Union by October, Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab said on Tuesday, suggesting the government would not shift much from its agreed negotiating stance.

Headline: May says she will lead Brexit talks from now on
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday she would now lead negotiations with the European Union, shifting the focus of the Brexit department towards preparing for Britain's departure from the bloc.

Headline: Brexit Secretary Raab says government will ensure food supplies if no EU exit deal
Description: The British government will ensure that there are adequate food supplies in case the country is unable to secure an exit deal with the European Union, Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab said on Tuesday.

Headline: Full Brexit deal with EU by March will be a challenge - Raab
