Description: Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab said on Tuesday that it will be "challenge" to reach a full agreement with the European Union on what their future trading relationship will look like by March next year.

Headline: Raab tells EU - it is time to speed up talks
Description: Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab said on Tuesday it was now up to the European Union to respond after the government published a long-awaited white paper policy document if the bloc wanted to a reach a deal on Britain's departure by October.

Headline: UK's Brexit negotiating position a 'far advanced offer' - Raab
Description: Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab said on Tuesday the government's negotiating stance set out this month by Prime Minister Theresa May was a "far advanced offer", suggesting it would not be changed fundamentally in talks.

Headline: Britain to keep EU laws during Brexit transition
Description: Britain set out on Tuesday how it plans to keep European Union laws during its transition from the bloc after next March, saying elements of the 1972 laws which make Britain a member of the bloc would need to be saved, including a role for the European Court of Justice (ECJ).

Headline: End 'botched' Brexit and protect jobs, Corbyn says
Description: Jeremy Corbyn criticised the government on Tuesday for failing business with its "botched" Brexit plan, saying only his Labour Party could make Britain's departure from the European Union work for manufacturers.

Headline: 'Brexodus' to cost UK up to 12,000 finance jobs - City chief
Description: Brexit will cost Britain up to 12,000 financial services jobs in the short-term, the City of London financial district's leader said on Tuesday, and many more jobs might disappear in the longer term.

Headline: UK to set out more details of Brexit plans on Tuesday - Martin Callanan
Description: Britain's government will publish proposals on Tuesday setting out more details of how it plans to leave the European Union, a junior Brexit minister said on Monday.

Headline: Britain warns EU - we face 'Brexit no-deal by accident' unless you change course
Description: Britain called on European Union negotiators on Monday to urgently change their approach to Brexit or face the turmoil of a "no-deal by accident".

Headline: British reject May's Brexit plan, some turn to Boris and far right - poll
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's plans to leave the European Union are overwhelmingly opposed by the British public and more than a third of voters would support a new right-wing political party committed to quitting the bloc, according to a new poll.

Headline: UK's Brexit plans useful, but questions remain - Barnier
Description: Britain's proposals on its future relationship with the European Union contain constructive elements, but many questions remain,  EU chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday.

Headline: UK ship insurer London Club setting up Cyprus office over Brexit
Description: British ship insurer London P&I Club is setting up a new subsidiary in Cyprus to ensure continued access to trade in the European Union in case Britain loses single market access, the group told Reuters on Friday.

Headline: Under pressure at home, May demands new deal from EU on Irish border
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May on Friday called on the European Union to strike a new deal to prevent a hard border in Northern Ireland and demanded Brussels quickly respond to her plan to avoid a damaging no-deal Brexit.

Headline: Ireland says EU reaction to Brexit white paper lukewarm - minister
Description: Ireland's foreign minister said on Friday reaction from EU capitals to Prime minister Theresa May's Brexit white paper was lukewarm but said there was agreement it formed the basis for negotiations.

Headline: EU drug regulators step up work to prepare for 'no deal' Brexit
Description: Drug regulators across Europe are hiring extra staff and increasing their workload as the role of British experts in the EU-wide system of medicines supervision winds down ahead of Brexit.

Headline: PM calls on EU to evolve its position on Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May called on the European Union to evolve its position in response to her new plan which has outlined a blueprint for the UK's post-Brexit relationship with the bloc.

Headline: May frustrated Northern Ireland lacks devolved government
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday that she was frustrated that Northern Ireland had been without a devolved government for over eighteen months.

Headline: Forget Brexit for a while and count the butterflies, Attenborough tells Brits
Description: Naturalist David Attenborough suggested the British public take a break from squabbling over Brexit and instead take part in the world's biggest count of butterflies.

Headline: Ireland open to 'better' Northern Ireland border backstop - finance minister
Description: Ireland is open to the possibility of an alternative "backstop" deal between Britain and the EU to prevent a hard border in Northern Ireland so long as it is better than the EU's current proposal and is legally operable, its finance minister said.

Headline: Visiting Northern Irish border, May to defend her Brexit plan
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will tell the people of Northern Ireland on Friday that her Brexit plan is the best way to avoid a hard border with Ireland, standing firm against critics in her own party.

Headline: UK to warn public every week over 'no-deal Brexit' - The Times
Description: Britons will from next week start receiving weekly information bulletins from the government about how to make sure they're ready for a disorderly Brexit, The Times reported on Friday.

Headline: UK's new Brexit envoy optimistic, as EU warns of Brexit crash
Description: London's new Brexit minister said he was confident he could reach a deal, on his first trip to Brussels on Thursday as the EU warned business to get ready for Britain crashing out of the bloc without agreed terms to cushion the economic disruption.

Headline: Brexit progress suggests no deal with EU is unlikely - PM's spokeswoman
Description: The progress Britain has made in talks to leave the European Union suggests that the country will not crash out of the bloc without a deal, a spokeswoman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday.

Headline: No-deal Brexit would cost European Union 1.5 percent of GDP - IMF
Description: European Union countries will suffer long-term damage equivalent to about 1.5 percent of annual economic output if Britain leaves the bloc without a free trade deal next year, the International Monetary Fund said on Thursday.

Headline: France's Dassault calls for UK-EU to agree post-Brexit ties quickly
Description: The head of France's Dassault Aviation  urged Britain and the European Union to settle differences over the UK's departure from the bloc and define a new partnership as quickly as possible to avoid hurting hundreds of suppliers.

Headline: Raab wants to 'heat up' Brexit talks
Description: Britain's new Brexit negotiator Dominic Raab on Thursday said he was looking forward to intensifying talks with the European Union, as an October deadline draws nearer.

Headline: UK watchdog and EU tell banks to prepare for hard Brexit
Description: Britain's banks and insurers must plan for a "hard" Brexit in case a transition period is not in place next March, a senior British regulator said on Thursday in a warning echoed by Brussels.

Headline: EU Commission calls on members to step up Brexit preparations
Description: The European Commission on Thursday called on EU countries to increase preparations for all outcomes in Brexit negotiations, saying Britain's withdrawal from the bloc was likely to cause disruptions.

Headline: 'It's not too late to save Brexit,' Johnson tells UK parliament
Description: Boris Johnson, who quit as Britain's former foreign minister last week, accused Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday of planning a phoney Brexit that would betray voters by failing to take the country completely out of the European Union.

Headline: 'Brexit continues to mean Brexit' - May presses on with her plan
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May refused to budge from her position on Brexit on Wednesday, brushing aside criticism from all corners of parliament and saying her strategy was already being negotiated with the European Union.

Headline: Watching Westminster, Brussels wills May on
Description: If Prime Minister Theresa May can survive and steer her Brexit plan through parliament, the European Union is keen to help her reach a deal that can avoid Britain lurching chaotically out of the bloc, EU officials say.

Headline: Ireland to hire 1,000 customs and veterinary officials for Brexit
Description: The Irish government on Wednesday agreed to hire 1,000 customs and veterinary officials to deal with new trade rules between Britain and Ireland that are likely to come into effect once Britain's Brexit transition deal ends in March 2021, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said.

Headline: Conservative MPs back May on EU approach, says UK minister
Description: The Conservative Party has come together to support a vision for the country's future ties with the European Union put forward by Prime Minister Theresa May, a minister in her cabinet team said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK to consult public on possible bid to join Pacific trade pact
Description: Trade Secretary Liam Fox said on Wednesday he will consult the public about a possible bid to join a Pacific trade group that includes Canada, Australia and Mexico, once Britain leaves the European Union.

Headline: We are not closer to a no deal Brexit, says May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she did not believe that Britain was getting close to a so-called "no deal" Brexit, where the country crashes out of the European Union without an exit agreement.

Headline: There is enough time for Brexit deal, says May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday there was enough time to negotiate a Brexit deal with the European Union.

Headline: Britain already talking to EU on future ties based on white paper - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday her government was already negotiating with the European Union on future ties, based on a white paper policy document published last week.

Headline: EU needs to know Britain is also preparing for a no-deal Brexit - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday Britain needed to make clear to the European Union that it was preparing for a no-deal outcome to the Brexit negotiations despite wanting to leave with an agreement.

Headline: Back May or face national election, Brexit rebels told
Description: Pro-European Union rebels were threatened with a general election this summer if they defeated Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plans on customs, a lawmaker said on Wednesday, threatening to widen rifts in the PM's party.

Headline: Irish foreign minister says EU to negotiate Brexit on UK's white paper only
Description: The European Union plans to negotiate Britain's withdrawal on the basis of the British government's white paper on Brexit and will not focus on amendments passed by parliament, Ireland's foreign minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: May to visit Northern Ireland to offer Brexit reassurances
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will make a two-day visit to Northern Ireland on Thursday, seeking to reassure businesses that her government will avoid a hard border after Brexit between the province and European Union member Ireland.

Headline: AstraZeneca to stockpile drugs as Brexit 'safety net'
Description: AstraZeneca  is increasing stockpiles of those medicines in Britain and Europe that could be affected by Brexit by around 20 percent, in preparation for potential disruption if the UK crashes out of the EU without a deal.

Headline: UK Brexit amendments won't change Ireland's position - PM Varadkar
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's decision on Monday to accept the demands of hardline Brexit campaigners will not change Ireland's negotiating position on Britain's exit from the EU, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Tuesday.

Headline: May narrowly avoids defeat in parliament on EU trade laws
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May narrowly avoided a defeat in parliament at the hands of pro-EU lawmakers from her own party on Tuesday, fending off a rebellion that had threatened to deepen a crisis over her Brexit strategy.

Headline: 'Fanatical' pro-Brexit lawmakers pushing UK towards new election - former PM Major
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May could be forced to call another election in months if the "fanatical" pro-Brexit wing of her party do not compromise over how Britain leaves the EU, former prime minister John Major warned on Tuesday.

Headline: May suffers parliament defeat over plans to leave European medicines network
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May suffered an embarrassing defeat on a trade law that means ministers must now seek to secure an agreement that allows Britain to have continued participation in the European medicines regulatory framework.

Headline: May U-turns on plan to give lawmakers extended summer holiday
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May cancelled an attempt on Tuesday to end parliament early and give lawmakers an extended summer holiday, as members of parliament criticised the move as a ploy to ease pressure on her leadership.

Headline: UK government wins approval for Brexit trade law in lower house of parliament
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May won approval from the lower of house of parliament on Tuesday for a law needed to let Britain pursue an independent trade policy once it leaves the European Union.

Headline: May defeats rebels over plans to remain in EU customs union
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May narrowly avoided a defeat in parliament at the hands of pro-EU lawmakers from her own party on Tuesday, fending off a rebellion that threatened to worsen a crisis over her Brexit strategy.

Headline: Lead Brexit campaign group faces police inquiry over its spending
Description: Britain's officially designated Brexit campaign group, Vote Leave, was fined 61,000 pounds on Tuesday for breaching spending rules in the 2016 referendum and was referred to the police by the Electoral Commission.

Headline: May wins parliament vote after bowing to Brexit pressure
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May won a series of votes in parliament on Monday, keeping her over-arching strategy to leave the European Union just about on track after bowing to pressure from Brexit supporters in her party.

Headline: Jetmakers see brisk start to air show as UK tries to soothe Brexit worries
Description: Planemakers racked up more than $20 billion (15.08 billion pounds) of deals on the opening day of the Farnborough Airshow on Monday, suggesting demand for new passenger jets remains in rude health despite worries over trade tensions and Brexit.

Headline: UK government wins approval for customs bill in lower house of parliament
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May won approval from the lower of house of parliament on Monday for a law designed to create an independent customs policy after Brexit.

Headline: UK junior defence minister resigns, votes against government - BBC
Description: British junior defence minister Guto Bebb resigned after voting against a government-backed amendment on the customs bill, part of plans for Britain's exit from the European Union, BBC news reported on Monday.

Headline: Pro-Brexit lawmakers' amendment to customs bill narrowly passes with UK government backing
Description: A pro-Brexit lawmakers' amendment that will stop Britain collecting tariffs for the European Union after Brexit unless there is a reciprocal arrangement was narrowly approved by parliament on Monday with the government's support.

Headline: Britain plans to bring forward parliament's mid-year break - official
Description: Britain's government intends to bring forward parliament's mid-year recess to Thursday, a parliamentary official said on Monday.

Headline: May says her Chequers plan on Brexit is not dead
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May rejected on Monday the suggestion that the Brexit negotiating strategy she agreed with her cabinet earlier this month was dead, and denied she had caved to pressure from eurosceptics.

Headline: May accepts amendments by pro-Brexit MPs on customs law - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will accept four changes to its customs legislation proposed by eurosceptics within her party on a law designed to create a functioning and independent customs policy, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Government makes concession to eurosceptics on customs law - BBC political editor
Description: The British government will accept four changes to its customs legislation proposed by eurosceptics within Prime Minister Theresa May's party, the BBC reported, neutralising a planned rebellion by MPs who reject her Brexit plan.

Headline: May promises to protect planemakers' supply chains in Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will on Monday seek to reassure aviation bosses that her under-fire Brexit plan won't disrupt their supply chains, and promise that the industry will flourish as Britain leaves the European Union.

Headline: There will be no second Brexit referendum, says May's spokesman
Description: There will be no second referendum on Brexit, a spokesman for Britain's Theresa May said on Monday, repeating the prime minister's belief that her plan for leaving the European Union was the only way to get a deal that meets the government's aims.

Headline: Former UK minister calls for second vote on Brexit to end stalemate
Description: A former senior British minister called on Monday for a second referendum to solve a parliamentary stalemate on Brexit, saying Prime Minister Theresa May's proposals for new ties with the European Union were a fudge that satisfied no one.

Headline: Planemakers plot course through trade, Brexit worries to air show deals
Description: Aerospace firms are setting out wares from luxury jets to lethal drones at back-to-back British air shows this week, hoping trade tensions will not deter airlines from buying jetliners even as geopolitical uncertainty allows them to sell more weapons.

Headline: May warns rebels - Back me or risk 'no Brexit at all'
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May warned her divided party on Sunday that there may be "no Brexit at all" if they wrecked her plan to forge a close relationship with the European Union after leaving the world's biggest trading bloc.

Headline: May says Donald Trump told her to sue the EU over Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said U.S. President Donald Trump had previously advised her to sue the European Union as part of her Brexit strategy, disclosing a piece of advice Trump said last week she had ignored.

Headline: Factbox - What do May's critics say of her and her Brexit plans?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May warned her divided party on Sunday that there may be "no Brexit at all" if they wrecked her plan to forge a close relationship with the European Union after leaving the world's biggest trading bloc.

Headline: EU markets watchdog intervenes in share trading ahead of Brexit
Description: The European Union's markets watchdog has proposed measures to stop share trading platforms based outside the bloc having an unfair advantage over EU rivals as Britain readies for Brexit.

Headline: May looking forward to explaining Brexit stance to Trump - May spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is looking forward to sitting down with Donald Trump to talk him through her Brexit negotiating stance after the U.S. president criticised her plans in an interview, her spokesman said on Friday.

Headline: Setting out vision for future ties, May presses Brexit plans

Headline: Finance industry tears into Britain's Brexit trading plans
Description: Britain's finance industry attacked the government on Thursday for ditching its blueprint for trade with the European Union after Brexit, saying this was a blow for Britain's biggest exporter.

Headline: Factbox - Britain seeks narrower EU access for financial services after Brexit
Description: Britain published on Thursday its proposals for future trade with the European Union after it leaves the bloc next March, seeking a new arrangement that would offer less generous access than under today's EU "passporting" regime.

Headline: Ireland welcomes UK white paper as a step to softer Brexit
Description: Ireland's foreign minister on Thursday welcomed the release of the British government's blueprint for future ties with the European Union.

Headline: TheCityUK criticises UK government for ditching its Brexit blueprint
Description: Britain's industry body for promoting financial services abroad said it was "regrettable" that the government had ditched the sector's "mutual recognition" blueprint for trade with the European Union after Brexit.

Headline: Luxembourg favours enhanced equivalence for British financial firms
Description: Luxembourg Finance Minister Pierre Gramegna said on Thursday that the European Union should offer enhanced access for financial services firms from third countries, something Britain is seeking for its banks after it leaves the bloc.

Headline: German finance minister says EU must make its own decisions on financial services
Description: The European Union must make its own decisions and cannot have outside legislators deciding on financial services rules after Brexit, German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Thursday.

Headline: Factbox - UK plans to stay in Europol and Eurojust after Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May published her blueprint for relations with the European Union after Brexit on Thursday including plans for a new security partnership with the bloc which would see it remain in the Europol and Eurojust agencies.

Headline: Factbox - Britain proposes agri-food free trade, common rulebook
Description: Britain published its proposals on Thursday for future trade with the European Union after it leaves the bloc next March.

Headline: Factbox - How Britain plans to maintain flow of data with EU after Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May published her blueprint for relations with the European Union after Brexit on Thursday, covering everything from trade to services, immigration, airlines and cars.

Headline: Factbox - UK wants EU immigration policy that supports business, tourists and students
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May published her blueprint for relations with the European Union after Brexit on Thursday, including how the country will manage immigration, a key issue during 2016's referendum.

Headline: Factbox - UK pins Brexit hopes on free trade deal for goods with EU
Description: Britain's government said it wanted free trade in goods with the European Union after Brexit as it tries to avoid border delays and differing rules for industry, a risk that worries carmakers, aerospace firms and other manufacturers in Britain.

Headline: Britain's Brexit plan will damage financial services - City of London boss
Description: Britain's blueprint for relations with the European Union will damage the vast financial services sector, the policy chief of London's financial district said on Thursday after the government announced plans to diverge from the bloc's rules after Brexit,

Headline: Brexit minister tells EU - now it is your turn to respond
Description: British Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Thursday that it was now up to the European Union to respond after the government published a long-awaited white paper policy document.

Headline: EU to analyse UK Brexit plan - Barnier
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said the European Union would review the British government's latest proposal on Thursday for trading arrangements after the country leaves the bloc.

Headline: Factbox - Britain proposes new fishing arrangements after Brexit
Description: Britain published on Thursday its proposals for future trade with the European Union after it leaves the bloc next March.

Headline: Factbox - Britain wants to stay in EU aviation safety body, to maintain flying rights
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May published her blueprint for relations with the European Union after Brexit on Thursday, including proposals for the UK to participate in the European Aviation Safety Agency and maintain flying rights.

Headline: UK foreign minister says expects fierce debate over Brexit plan
Description: British foreign minister Jeremy Hunt said on Thursday he expects a lively debate in parliament around the government's soon-to-be-published Brexit policy, but that it offers a basis for talks to move forward in Brussels.

Headline: Britain's opposition Labour Party takes poll lead amid May's Brexit crisis
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party, led by socialist Jeremy Corbyn, has taken a lead over the Conservative Party as Prime Minister Theresa May's government grapples with a crisis over Brexit, according to two opinion polls.

Headline: "The worst" is still possible on Brexit, says French prime minister

Headline: EU tells UK financial firms time running out for Brexit licences

Headline: France to ease finance, tax rules to attract Brexit bankers

Headline: UK watchdog sees no appetite from banks to rip up rules after Brexit

Headline: EU and BoE clash over fate of financial contracts after Brexit

Headline: May says Brexit plan delivers 'people's vote'

Headline: UK's new Brexit strategy won't inhibit trade deals - minister

Headline: France warns Britain that time running out on Brexit
Description: Time is running dangerously low for Britain to reach an agreement on its post-Brexit relations with Europe, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Wednesday.

Headline: PM May urges her party to back EU Brexit plan - spokesman

Headline: UK must be able to diverge from EU on services after Brexit - minister

Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Tuesday welcomed proposals on Britain's exit from the European Union drawn up by Prime Minister Theresa May's government, saying that they brought the Brexit process "a whole step forward".

Headline: UK cabinet discussed Brexit policy document, plans no-deal exit - PM May's spokesman
Description: Britain's cabinet discussed the so-called white paper Brexit policy document and stepping up preparations for a no-deal exit, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday.

Description: Former British foreign minister Boris Johnson warned on Monday that the United Kingdom will end up like a colony to the European Union after the government announced plans for a close trading relationship with the bloc after Brexit next year.

Headline: PM May's meeting with party went 'very well' - business minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's crunch meeting with her party to sell her plan for Brexit went "very well", business minister Greg Clark told Reuters on Monday.

Headline: Unclear whether UK lawmakers have numbers to trigger PM May confidence vote - editors say
Description: It was unclear on Monday whether British lawmakers in Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party had the numbers to trigger a confidence vote, political editors said on Monday.

Headline: Lawmakers cheer and bang on tables as PM May arrives at party meeting
Description: Conservative lawmakers cheered, applauded and banged tables as British Prime Minister Theresa May arrived at a meeting of her party in a particularly upbeat welcome.

Headline: PM May says government will publish Brexit policy document on Thursday

Headline: PM May says EU needs to change course or risk 'no deal' Brexit

Headline: Britain must be free to maintain leading position in services after Brexit - May

Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May plans to name a new foreign minister later on Monday, her spokesman said, after the former Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson resigned in protest at her plans to retain close ties to the European Union after Brexit.

Headline: EU's Tusk raises 'no Brexit' idea in tweet on Johnson

Headline: Hammond says he fully supports May's Brexit plan
Description: Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond said on Monday that Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plan had his full support after Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson and Brexit Secretary David Davis quit within hours of each other.

Headline: EU's Tusk raises 'no Brexit' idea in tweet on Johnson
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk raised the idea that Brexit might be called off in a tweet on Monday after Boris Johnson, a campaigner for Britain to leave the EU, resigned as foreign secretary.

Headline: UK voters losing confidence in PM May's handling of Brexit - ORB poll shows

Headline: Factbox - Who is Dominic Raab, Britain's new Brexit minister?

Headline: UK Brexit position unchanged, time for Brussels to get serious - PM May's spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Monday her cabinet had agreed its Brexit negotiating stance and would press ahead with talks with the European Union, calling on Brussels to "get serious".

Headline: EU Commission says to continue talks with Britain after Davis resigns

Headline: UK bond yields rise as investors bet on Brexit deal

Headline: May appoints Dominic Raab as new Brexit minister

Headline: EU's Verhofstadt - Brexit talks must move on after UK minister quits

Headline: Davis says not calling for other resignations
Description: Britain's former Brexit minister David Davis, who resigned on Sunday over Prime Minister Theresa May's plan for leaving the European Union, said he was not calling on other ministers to quit and May could survive his resignation.

Headline: Text - David Davis to May: You are undermining Brexit
Description: The following is David Davis's resignation letter to Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: Factbox - David Davis quits UK government: who is he and why does he matter?
Description: Brexit Secretary David Davis has resigned because he was not willing to be "a reluctant conscript" to Prime Minister Theresa May's European Union exit plan, delivering a blow to a British leader struggling to end divisions in her cabinet.

Headline: Brexit department minister Steve Baker resigns - government source
Description: Steve Baker, a minister in the British government's Brexit department has resigned, a government source said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit minister Davis resigns over May's EU exit plan - letter

Headline: Brexit department minister Steve Baker resigns - Telegraph

Headline: Ireland says UK Brexit plan a significant move in talks

Headline: Irish, Austrian PMs welcome UK Brexit plan, questions remain
Description: The prime ministers of Ireland and Austria welcomed Britain's new Brexit plan as a step forward on Sunday but said many questions remained to be answered in the negotiations ahead.

Headline: Donald Trump's visit puts Britain's Brexit dependence on show

Headline: May wins support from divided government on Brexit plan
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May secured a cabinet agreement on Friday for her plans to leave the European Union, overcoming rifts among her ministers to win support for "a business-friendly" proposal aimed at spurring stalled Brexit talks.

Headline: PM May will sack foreign minister Johnson if he undermines Brexit deal - Times
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has told senior allies she will sack her foreign minister if he seeks to undermine a Brexit negotiating position agreed by her cabinet on Friday, the Times newspaper reported without citing sources.

Headline: EU's Barnier says will assess Brexit proposals to see if 'workable and realistic' - Twitter
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday he would assess the negotiating position agreed by British Prime Minister Theresa May and her cabinet to see if it was workable and realistic.

Headline: PM May reaches deal with cabinet on Brexit strategy
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May agreed Britain's Brexit negotiating position on trade and customs with her cabinet on Friday at a make-or-break meeting with senior ministers at her country residence.

Headline: Factbox - Key points from PM May's Brexit negotiating position
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May secured cabinet agreement on Friday for her plans to leave the European Union, overcoming deep rifts among her ministers to win support for "a business-friendly" proposal to try to spur stalled Brexit talks.

Headline: Still too many questions, few answers in Brexit talks - EU's Barnier
Description: There are still too many questions and too few answers in talks between the European Union and Britain over the country's withdrawal from the bloc, EU chief negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday.

Headline: Airbus CEO steps up warning on danger of hard Brexit

Headline: What will ministers discuss at crunch Brexit meeting?

Headline: Exclusive: JPMorgan triggers EU talent transfer as 'dozens' prepare for Brexit move

Headline: UK business minister confident cabinet will agree Brexit customs plan on Friday
Description: British business minister Greg Clark said he was confident his colleagues would be able to agree a common position on a future customs deal with the European Union when Prime Minister Theresa May calls them together for a crunch meeting on Friday.

Headline: Carmaker Jaguar says 'bad Brexit' would mean it could not stay in UK

Headline: Britain's May proposes new customs plan to divided government
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will propose on Friday a new plan to ease trade and offer Britain more freedom to set tariffs after Brexit, a last-ditch attempt to unite her divided government on plans to leave the European Union.

Headline: Time is pressing on Brexit negotiations - Merkel
Description: Time is pressing in Britain's negotiations with the European Union on its departure from the bloc, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Thursday before talks with British Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: May takes views of business seriously after carmaker Jaguar warning - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May takes the views of business seriously and looks forward to providing more detail on the future relationship with the European Union in a so-called white paper policy document, her spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: Blood and treasure or fantasy: What is the UK-U.S. 'special relationship'?
Description: Britain's so-called 'special relationship' with the United States was one of the most enduring alliances of the 20th Century, though Brexit and the election of U.S. President Donald Trump have raised questions about its future.

Headline: Pro-Brexit campaign group may have broken spending rules, former CEO says
Description: Britain's Electoral Commission is preparing to find the official campaign to leave the European Union guilty of breaking election law during the 2016 referendum, according to the former chief executive of the group.

Headline: UK wants to set own fishing access rules after Brexit - document
Description: Britain wants to decide how much access to its fishing grounds it gives after it leaves the European Union, according to a policy document on Wednesday.

Headline: Arch-Brexiteer Gove says - No senior British ministers will resign over Brexit

Headline: Global derivatives body adds Irish courts as Brexit 'future-proof'

Headline: May looking forward to full discussion with cabinet on Brexit - spokesman

Headline: Dutch PM Rutte - Clarity urgently needed about EU-UK relationship

Headline: Hammond says 'urgent' progress needed on Brexit stance

Headline: May gets new customs idea as party bickers over Brexit

Headline: May wants future customs relationship with EU by end of 2020

Description: Banks' Brexit worries were a key theme in a quarterly survey of Britain's financial services sector, published on Monday, even though business sentiment stabilised in the second quarter, ending a near two-year slide, and recruitment picked up.

Headline: Barclays shifting 50 jobs to Frankfurt as Brexit planning accelerates
Description: Barclays has begun shifting 40 to 50 investment banking jobs from Britain to Frankfurt as part of its plans to continue doing business in the European Union after Britain leaves the bloc in 2019, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headline: UK PM May's spokesman refuses to comment on reported new post-Brexit customs plan
Description: A spokesman for British Prime Minister Theresa May said he would not speculate about Brexit policy options ahead of a meeting of ministers later this week, after a report said officials have drafted a new way of handling customs with the European Union.

Headline: Three quarters of big UK firms downbeat on Brexit - Deloitte survey
Description: A record 75 percent of major British companies are now pessimistic about Brexit, a survey showed on Monday, adding to signs of anxiety around the economy as Britain's divorce with the European Union draws near.

Headline: NHS has started planning for Brexit no deal
Description: Britain's public health service has started "significant planning" to ensure medicines are still supplied to patients if the government fails to negotiate a Brexit deal with the European Union, its head said on Sunday.

Headline: Conservative lawmakers pile Brexit pressure on May
Description: More than 30 Conservative lawmakers have signed a letter demanding Theresa May "get tough" in negotiations to leave the European Union, increasing the pressure on the British prime minister before a crunch government meeting.

Headline: EU's Tusk says 'last call' to show cards in Brexit talks
Description: The chairman of the European Union summit on Friday said the most difficult issue remain unresolved in Brexit talks, saying time was running out for sides to put their cards on the table.

Headline: Less than sterling - British pound suffers worst quarter since Brexit vote
Description: The British pound has suffered its worst quarter since the vote to leave the European Union in June 2016 triggered one of the biggest selloffs in the currency's history.

Headline: EU's Barnier says progress in Brexit talks but 'big differences remain'
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday that EU leaders had made progress in Brexit talks but big differences remained and he hoped an upcoming British proposal would be "valuable and workable."

Headline: Protect your people, May urges EU leaders
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May urged the European Union on Thursday to consider Europe's safety before cutting Britain adrift from its security architecture, as she sought to push Brexit talks forward to address future ties.

Headline: Time to prepare for 'no deal' Brexit scenario - French presidency official
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will be told at a European summit this week that while there is progress on the terms of Britain's departure from the European Union, both sides should prepare for a "no deal" scenario, a French presidency source said.

Headline: 'No deal Brexit' would be unthinkable, says John Lewis chairman
Description: Britain is unprepared to leave the European Union without a deal and chaos would ensue were it to happen, the chairman of the biggest department store group John Lewis said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain is underestimating true size of EU divorce bill, say MPs
Description: The British government's estimate of how much it will have to pay the European Union as part of its divorce settlement is at least 10 billion pounds too low, a committee of MPs said on Wednesday.

Headline: 150 trucks a day - Auto manufacturers contemplate headache of Brexit
Description: For BMW  to run its factories in Britain, it needs 150 trucks a day full of parts and equipment to arrive from mainland Europe. It sends 118 trucks, also packed with products, in the other direction.

Headline: Give us real Brexit progress urgently, UK, EU workers and bosses plead
Description: Progress in the Brexit negotiations is needed urgently, British and European business and union representatives said on Wednesday in a joint plea to London and Brussels ahead of this week's European Union summit.

Headline: As investment stalls, auto industry warns PM May: Avert a Brexit car crash
Description: Uncertainty over Brexit has halved new investment in the British car industry and Prime Minister Theresa May should urgently change tack to keep the world's fifth largest economy in the EU's customs union, the country's main car lobby group said.

Headline: EU Galileo stance raises questions over security work post-Brexit - UK minister
Description: The European Union's stance on satellite navigation system Galileo, Europe's version of GPS, after Brexit raises questions over the Britain's future security relationship with the bloc, Guto Bebb, a defence minister, said on Tuesday.

Headline: A third of European firms to cut investment because of Brexit - survey
Description: One in three European firms plans to cut investment spending as a result of Brexit and more than one-tenth of those with operations in Britain expects to pull out of the country entirely, according to a survey by Swiss bank UBS .

Headline: Bank of America moves senior London bankers to Paris ahead of Brexit
Description: Bank of America Merrill Lynch (BAML)  is shifting three of its most senior UK-based bankers to Paris, as part of Brexit reorganisation plans aimed at ensuring "seamless" service to its European Union clients after Britain quits the bloc in March.

Headline: BMW talks up UK commitment but quietly expands Dutch site
Description: BMW  said it is not considering moving production out of Britain because of Brexit, although the carmaker has cut its dependence on its Oxford car plant by quietly expanding a new Dutch assembly site for its Mini brand.

Headline: Mandelson calls for extension in EU divorce talks
Description: Britain should ask the European Union for more time for exit talks to avoid a "blind" Brexit that maximises uncertainty for the country's financial services, a British lawmaker and former top EU official said on Tuesday.

Headline: Ferrovial to move international holding from Britain to Netherlands due to Brexit
Description: Spain's Ferrovial  plans to move its international holding to Amsterdam from Oxford in Britain to keep the business under European Union legislation after the United Kingdom leaves the bloc, a spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Responding to criticism, UK says has made 'considerable steps' on post-Brexit trade
Description: Britain has made considerable step to provide as smooth and frictionless Brexit as possible, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday responding to criticism from the automotive industry over her strategy.

Headline: EU wants 'realistic and workable proposals' from Britain on future relationship - draft
Description: EU leaders will call on Britain to provide "realistic and workable proposals" on its future relationship with the EU and leave the door open for London to change its mind on some of its "red lines" in negotiations - draft summit conclusions showed.

Headline: EU watchdog tells banks to speed up 'inadequate' Brexit preparations
Description: Banks have failed to make enough progress in their Brexit preparations and should not expect "miracle" public intervention to help them, the European Union's banking watchdog said on Monday.

Headline: Government's anti-business bias hurts UK economy - London finance chief
Description: The British government's hostile attitude towards business is damaging the economy and companies will move overseas if they continue to be unfairly attacked for warning about the dangers from Brexit, the City of London's policy chief told Reuters.

Headline: PM May's spokesman - It’s up to companies if they want to air their views over Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman on Monday said it was up to individual firms to decide if they wanted to speak out about Brexit, but that the government was confident of securing an EU exit deal that businesses can get behind.

Headline: Listen to companies with respect on Brexit - British minister
Description: Any company and industry that brings jobs to Britain is entitled to be listened to, business minister Greg Clark said on Monday after aircraft manufacturer Airbus was criticised for warning the government over Brexit.

Headline: Half of EU business leaders cut UK investment over Brexit - survey
Description: Britain's looming departure from the European Union has led nearly half of big companies from the rest of the bloc to cut investment in the country, a poll of 800 executives released two years after the Brexit referendum found.

Headline: UK ministers take aim at business over Brexit warnings
Description: The British government and business leaders clashed in a deepening row over Brexit on Sunday after a senior minister accused companies of issuing "completely inappropriate" threats and undermining the prime minister.

Headline: Thousands join London march to demand Brexit deal referendum
Description: Around 100,000 supporters of the European Union marched through central London on Saturday to demand that the British government hold a final public vote on the terms of Brexit, organisers said.

Headline: Airbus warns of threat to UK jobs from no-deal Brexit
Description: Airbus issued its strongest warning yet over the impact of Britain's departure from the European Union, saying a withdrawal without a deal would force it to reconsider its long-term position and put thousands of British jobs at risk.

Headline: Airbus, Thai Airways in maintenance facility joint venture
Description: Thai Airways International Pcl and Airbus SE signed a joint venture agreement for a maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) facility, the carrier said on Friday.

Headline: UK confident of good Brexit deal after Airbus concern - May's spokeswoman
Description: Britain is confident of getting a good trade agreement with the European Union when it leaves the bloc which will include the aerospace sector, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said after Airbus warned of the impact of a no-deal withdrawal.

Headline: German says Brexit timetable can be met
Description: Germany believes the timetable for Britain's withdrawal from the European Union can be kept to, a government spokeswoman said on Friday, adding that while some issues still needed to be resolved, there were still open questions.

Headline: Britain drifting toward 'disastrous' Brexit - German industry group
Description: Britain is heading towards a disorderly exit from the European Union that could have disastrous consequences for its economy and those of its partners in the bloc, Germany's BDI industry group has warned.

Headline: We want to say yes - UK unveils Brexit residency rules for EU citizens
Description: Britain unveiled its planned residency rules for European Union citizens living in the United Kingdom after Brexit on Thursday, promising an "easy" system that would work in the favour of those wanting to stay.

Headline: May faces down pro-EU rebel lawmakers to win Brexit vote
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May won a crucial Brexit vote in parliament on Wednesday, keeping her divided government's plans to end more than 40 years of British partnership with the European Union on track.

Headline: Britain's Fox dismisses talk of staying in single market for goods
Description: British Trade Secretary Liam Fox told Reuters on Thursday that he had heard the theory that Britain could remain in the European single market for goods but he dismissed the idea.

Headline: Britain's Fox says now zero chance of stopping Brexit
Description: A vote in Britain's parliament on Wednesday closed the door for good on any chance of the country staying in the European Union, Trade Minister Liam Fox told a debate in Geneva on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit will tarnish Scotland's appeal to low skilled-workers, research finds
Description: Scotland will struggle to attract the low-skilled workers it needs once Britain leaves the European Union, according to research by the universities of Edinburgh and Glasgow.

Headline: Hammond to reassure bankers he will protect them in Brexit
Description: The Chancellor of the Exchequer will try to reassure bankers on Thursday that he will protect their interests as London leaves the European Union, with a speech emphasising open trade and the relationship of financial services both with Europe and beyond.

Headline: Ex-Airbus boss urges UK-French defence industry ties after Brexit
Description: A leading French industrialist has urged France and Britain to preserve co-operation in the defence industry despite Britain's departure from the European Union next year.

Headline: Hammond to reassure bankers in speech he will protect them in Brexit
Description: The Chancellor will try to reassure bankers on Thursday that he will protect their interests as London leaves the EU, with a major speech emphasising open trade and financial services industry relationships both with Europe and beyond.

Headline: Leading pro-EU rebel lawmaker backs down, will support government on Brexit laws
Description: The pro-European Union MP leading a group of rebels threatening to vote against Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit law said on Wednesday that he had accepted assurances from minister and would now support the government.

Headline: Former UK financial district leader sees 75,000 Brexit job losses
Description: A former leader of London's financial district believes Britain is unlikely to get generous access to the European Union financial market after Brexit, resulting in a loss of 75,000 jobs and 10 billion pounds ($13.2 billion) in tax revenue.

Headline: PM May defeats pro-EU rebels, wins lawmakers' approval for Brexit plan
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday won approval for her plan on how much say MPs should get over Brexit, defeating a attempt by pro-European Union rebels to give parliament more influence.

Headline: Factbox - What does a 'meaningful vote' on Brexit really mean?
Description: A row over how much say Britain's parliament should have over the Brexit process is set to reach its conclusion on Wednesday as MPs finalise the wording of the laws that will end the country's membership of the European Union next year.

Headline: Government moves to calm fears over Brexit bill
Description: Government moved to calm fears in parliament over its proposal for a "meaningful vote" on any Brexit deal on Wednesday, saying MPs may be able to change ministers' plans in the event of a no deal with the European Union.

Headline: Upper chamber to debate Brexit laws later on Wednesday
Description: Britain's upper house of parliament will consider any changes made to proposed Brexit laws on Wednesday evening, shortly after they have been voted upon by the lower house of parliament, the opposition Labour Party said.

Headline: Setting up new showdown, May rejects Brexit proposal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May cannot accept a proposal to hand parliament more control over Brexit, her spokesman said on Tuesday, setting up a showdown with MPs who want the right to step in if Britain risks crashing out of the EU with no deal.

Headline: EU's Barnier says progress in Brexit talks, but divergences remain on Ireland
Description: Talks between Britain and the European Commission on the country's EU exit have made progress in some issues but they still disagree on how to tackle the Irish border, the bloc's chief Brexit negotiator said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU leaders worried over Irish border issue in Brexit talks - draft
Description: European Union leaders will express concern on Friday over a lack of progress in talks with London on how to avoid reimposing controls at the border between British-ruled Northern Ireland and the Irish Republic after Brexit.

Headline: PM May hopes MPs will back Brexit plan - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May hopes MPs will back her proposal to offer them a say over a Brexit deal, her spokesman said on Tuesday, before a showdown in parliament over her plans to leave the European Union.

Headline: UK government will not accept Lords proposal of 'meaningful vote' - source
Description: Britain's government will not accept a proposal from the upper house of parliament which hands lawmakers greater power over a Brexit deal, a government source said on Tuesday, setting up a showdown over plans for a "meaningful vote".

Headline: London construction firms rely heavily on EU workers, figures show
Description: More than a quarter of London's construction workers come from elsewhere in the European Union, according to new figures on Tuesday that highlight the British capital's reliance on EU immigrants ahead of Brexit next year.

Headline: FCA to investigate impact of EU asset management rules after criticism
Description: Britain's regulator will launch an investigation into the impact of new European Union rules on the asset management industry after concerns were raised about how they affect the pricing of investment research and other issues.

Headline: May's Brexit laws rejected by parliament, Wednesday showdown looms
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plans were rejected by parliament's upper chamber on Monday, setting up a confrontation with pro-EU MPs later this week which will test her ability to lead a minority government.

Headline: Brexit will give Britain more to spend on health even as payments to EU continue - May
Description: Britain will have more money to spend on its health service when it leaves the European Union, even as it continues to make payments to the bloc, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday.

Headline: British PM's Brexit plans set for Lords defeat, teeing up showdown
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plans face rejection by parliament's upper chamber on Monday, setting the stage for a confrontation with pro-EU rebel lawmakers later in the week which could rock her minority government.

Headline: PM May's healthcare funding rise wins broad cabinet support - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's pledge to increase healthcare funding by 20 billion pounds won broad approval from her cabinet of top ministers on Monday, her spokesman said.

Headline: Pro-EU lawmaker in Conservative party - 'We could collapse government'
Description: A leading pro-European Union lawmaker in Britain's ruling Conservative Party warned on Sunday that a row over parliament's influence on the Brexit process could collapse the government, but said he hoped to find a way to avoid that.

Headline: May says need to ensure parliament does not overturn Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Sunday it was important to ensure that parliament could not block Brexit, defending her approach to passing the legislation that will end Britain's membership of the European Union.

Headline: May pledges 20 billion extra pounds for healthcare post-Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May pledged on Sunday to increase funding for the National Health Service by 20 billion pounds after Brexit, funded by money no longer spent on membership of the European Union and possible tax rises.

Headline: British M&A booms two years on from Brexit vote
Description: Deal-making involving UK companies has picked up in the two years since the country's decision to leave the European Union, defying worries that Brexit would stifle mergers and acquisition activity, data from Thomson Reuters Deals Intelligence shows.

Headline: UK seeks 'closest possible' security pact with EU after Brexit - minister
Description: Britain wants to cement its foreign policy and security ties with the European Union via the "closest possible cooperation agreement" for when it leaves the bloc, a British minister said.

Headline: Brexit law compromise respects plans to leave EU - PM May's spokeswoman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government's new amendment to her Brexit blueprint on giving parliament a greater role on the exit process respects the public's desire to leave the European Union, her spokeswoman said on Friday.

Headline: May's Brexit compromise hits snag, wrangling to continue
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May failed on Thursday to win around pro-EU lawmakers in her party over parliament's role in the Brexit process, raising the risk of defeat in lower house votes next week.

Headline: Government has changed position on Brexit law compromise - MP
Description: Pro-EU MP Anna Soubry said on Thursday the government had changed its position after agreeing a compromise deal on handing parliament a "meaningful vote" on any Brexit deal, and that the new proposal had not been agreed by the leading rebel.

Headline: Pro-EU UK lawmaker wants to find way out of row over Brexit meaningful vote
Description: A pro-EU lawmaker said on Thursday he would now try to find a way around a standoff with British Prime Minister Theresa May over the role of parliament in her Brexit strategy after they failed to agree on a compromise.

Headline: UK government proposes three scenarios for parliament vote on Brexit deal
Description: Britain's Brexit department set out its proposed compromise with pro-European Union MPs on Thursday, outlining three scenarios under which a vote in parliament on its European union exit deal would be triggered.

Headline: Amendment on Brexit bill to be issued just before 1600 GMT - May's spokeswoman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's government will issue a compromise amendment to her Brexit blueprint just before 1600 GMT, her spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: UK parliament will have meaningful vote on Brexit, says pro-EU lawmaker
Description: Pro-EU British Conservative lawmaker Anna Soubry, one of a group of rebels pressing Prime Minister Theresa May for concessions over Brexit, said on Thursday parliament would have a meaningful vote on an exit deal, and there would be no "hard Brexit".

Headline: PM May agrees compromise deal with pro-EU MPs on Brexit legislation - source
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has reached a deal with pro-EU MPs over the wording of a compromise on the government's Brexit legislation, a source familiar with the negotiations said on Thursday.

Headline: UK will press ahead with Brexit laws despite lack of consent from Scotland - Secretary of State for Scotland
Description: The government will press ahead with passing legislation to end Britain's membership of the European Union despite the devolved Scottish parliament not having granted its consent, Secretary of State for Scotland David Mundell said on Thursday.

Headline: Weakened, May defeats final Brexit challenges in parliament
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May defeated the final challenges to her Brexit blueprint in parliament on Wednesday, leaving plans for Britain's departure from the European Union still largely on track but her authority weakened.

Headline: Brexit campaigner orders EU's Verhofstadt to retract claim of Russian collusion
Description: Lawyers for Brexit campaigner Arron Banks ordered the European Parliament’s chief Brexit coordinator on Wednesday to retract a claim that Banks colluded with Russia to deliver Britain's vote to leave the European Union.

Headline: May wins vote, parliament rejects staying in European Economic Area
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May won a vote in parliament on Wednesday that threw out a proposal which would have forced the government to negotiate staying in the European Economic Area, meaning it would participate in the European Union's single market.

Headline: May wins vote on customs in boost for her Brexit vision
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May won a vote in parliament on Wednesday that threw out a proposal which would have forced the government to report on the efforts it had made to negotiate membership of the European Union's customs union.

Headline: After winning Brexit compromise, UK's pro-EU rebels fear betrayal
Description: Pro-EU lawmakers threatened on Wednesday to withdraw their support for Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit strategy if she does not follow through on concessions they thought they had been promised.

Headline: Irish PM says EU needs decisions from UK, not internal debate
Description: The British government needs to move on from internal debates and make choices about what it wants from Brexit, and must acknowledge that it cannot have its cake and eat it, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Wednesday.

Headline: Scottish lawmakers walk out of UK parliament in Brexit row
Description: Lawmakers from the Scottish National Party (SNP) walked out of the British parliament on Wednesday to protest what they say is Scotland's voice being ignored over Brexit.

Headline: 'Contempt' for devolution means new UK framework needed -Scottish minister
Description: Scotland's devolved government will start to seek changes in how power is shared with Britain's four nations, as Brexit has made it clear that devolution does not work, Scotland's Brexit minister Michael Russell said on Wednesday.

Headline: Factbox: Britain's Brexit laws - What's changed and what happens next?
Description: Parliament is finalising laws that will formally end Britain's membership of the European Union, a process which has forced the government to make some important concessions that will change the dynamic of Brexit negotiations.

Headline: May will draw up new amendment to address lawmakers' Brexit concerns
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May told lawmakers on Wednesday the government was discussing concerns over parliament's role in Brexit and would come up with a new amendment to satisfy them.

Headline: May says she hopes for party support on Brexit laws - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is hoping for the support of her whole Conservative Party on the legislation that will end Britain's membership of the European Union, her spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Irish PM says EU needs decisions from UK, not internal debate
Description: The British government needs to move on from internal debates and make choices about what it wants from Brexit, and must acknowledge that it cannot have its cake and eat it, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit hits the drinks list at pub chain Wetherspoon
Description: Pub chain JD Wetherspoon , run by one of Brexit's most fervent supporters, will sell more British and non-European drinks, shunning French champagne and offering British and American beer instead of German brews.

Headline: May defuses revolt in parliament over Brexit plans
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May defused a rebellion in parliament over her Brexit plans on Tuesday but only after having to compromise and hand lawmakers more control over Britain's departure from the European Union.

Headline: Brexit campaigner Banks - Russia meetings were not an issue in the past
Description: Arron Banks, the man behind one of the main Brexit campaigns, said on Tuesday scrutiny of his meetings with the Russian ambassador over a potential business deal had turned into a "witch hunt" now Britain's relations with Moscow had soured.

Headline: Brexit campaigner Wigmore says never accepted Russian money
Description: Brexit campaigner Andy Wigmore told a parliamentary committee on Tuesday that he had never accepted money from the Russian government.

Headline: Parliament votes to reinsert EU exit day in law
Description: Lower house of parliament on Tuesday voted to reinsert the fixed time and date of the country's departure from the European Union, reversing an earlier defeat by the House of Lords.

Headline: Brexit secretary confident government can secure deal parliament will support
Description: British Brexit minister David Davis said on Tuesday he is confident the government will secure a deal with European Union that MPs will support, speaking during a debate on laws that could give parliament more powers over the divorce process.

Headline: Brexit campaigner Banks - I have no business interests in Russia
Description: Brexit campaigner Arron Banks, who bankrolled the Leave.EU campaign in Britain's 2016 EU referendum campaign, told a parliamentary committee on Tuesday he had no business interests in Russia.

Headline: Brexit campaigner Banks says Russian meetings 'no issue' in the past
Description: Arron Banks, a British businessman who campaigned for Brexit, told a parliamentary committee on Tuesday that his contacts with Russians had not been an issue before Britain's relations with the Kremlin soured.

Headline: Vote on government Brexit plans may complicate EU talks - PM May
Description: A vote in parliament on Tuesday on the government's plans for Brexit will send a message to the European Union and will make negotiations more difficult if lawmakers undermine the official position, Prime Minister Theresa May told her ministers.

Headline: David Davis says parliament vote cannot reverse Brexit
Description: Britain's Brexit minister David Davis said on Tuesday there would be no reversal of the decision to leave the European Union whatever the outcome of divorce talks with the bloc.

Headline: May urges Conservative unity before parliament votes on Brexit strategy
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May urged her Conservative Party on Monday to show unity and vote against changes to her Brexit blueprint, warning lawmakers they would undermine her negotiation with the European Union.

Headline: Factbox: Brexit plan faces parliamentary test - what to expect
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May faces crunch votes in parliament this week and a potential showdown with pro-European rebels in her ruling party that could create yet another twist in the tortured effort to reach a Brexit deal.

Headline: Brexit secretary Davis to put his name to 'compromise customs amendment' - BBC editor
Description: Brexit secretary David Davis will put his name to the "compromise customs amendment" on Wednesday when UK lawmakers vote on amendments to the European Union withdrawal bill, the BBC's political editor said on Monday.

Headline: British government looking for ways around customs amendment - minister
Description: The British government is in talks with lawmakers to find a way around an amendment proposed by parliament's upper house which challenges Prime Minister Theresa May's refusal to pursue a customs union with the EU, a Brexit minister said on Monday.

Headline: UK and EU aviation regulators should discuss Brexit plans, trade bodies say
Description: British and European airline regulators should be allowed to begin technical planning for Brexit that is kept separate from political discussions, aerospace trade bodies told the European Union's lead Brexit negotiator in a letter.

Headline: Brexit and the Irish backstop riddle
Description: Efforts to avoid a "hard border" in Ireland can seem baffling but as British Prime Minister Theresa May battles parliament over Brexit, the issue is central to understanding how her demands to the European Union may change.

Headline: PM May urges MPs to back EU withdrawal bill - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May urges MPs to back legislation to end Britain's membership of the European Union before crunch parliamentary votes this week, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit campaigner Banks says story on Russian ties 'absolute garbage'
Description: Arron Banks, a British businessman who bankrolled one of the main campaigns for Brexit, hit back on Sunday after a report said his links with Russia went further and deeper than he had previously disclosed, saying he was a victim of a "witch hunt".

Headline: We are not Russian secret agents, Brexit campaigner Banks says
Description: Brexit campaigner Arron Banks denied on Sunday ever receiving Russian money or assistance for the campaign to leave the European Union.

Headline: 'More questions than answers' in UK Brexit offer - Barnier
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday a British proposal for avoiding border problems with Ireland after Brexit "raises more questions than answers" but was still welcome progress toward solutions.

Headline: 'Respect your own red lines' Barnier tells 'paradoxical' UK ministers
Description: Britain does not respect its own red lines in talks with the European Union about the country's withdrawal from the bloc, the EU's chief negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday, responding to comments by British foreign secretary Boris Johnson.

Headline: Brace for a possible 'Brexit meltdown' but don't panic, Johnson says -BuzzFeed
Description: Foreign secretary Boris Johnson warned there could be a Brexit meltdown but it will be "all right in the end" and said that U.S. President Trump would take a tougher stance were he leading the talks, according to BuzzFeed.

Headline: Rebels muster as PM May battles for her Brexit vision
Description: A parliamentary vote on the shape of Britain's relationship with Europe next week is likely to force rebels in Theresa May's government into the open, threatening instability and adding yet another twist to the tortured effort to reach a Brexit deal.

Headline: PM May rebuts foreign minister's Brexit criticism
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May reacted defiantly to critical comments by her foreign minister Boris Johnson on Friday, stressing that he was not the only one with strong views on Brexit.

Headline: Northern Irish almost evenly split on whether to remain in the UK - survey
Description: Nearly as many Northern Irish people would back joining the republic of Ireland as support remaining in the United Kingdom, with Brexit pushing some to switch in favour of unification, according to a poll conducted for the BBC.

Headline: Business needs to prepare for worst-case on Brexit - German finance minister
Description: German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Friday that businesses readying for Brexit should prepare for a worst-case scenario even though there was "no guarantee" of a final deal  being reached between Britain and European Union.

Headline: May will never accept customs border between Northern Ireland and UK - spokesman
Description: Britain will never accept a customs border between Northern Ireland and the rest of the United Kingdom and that position will not change, a government spokesman said on Friday, referring to a plan for the Irish border.

Headline: Soros-backed anti-Brexit group targets lawmakers in push for new referendum
Description: An anti-Brexit group backed by billionaire financier George Soros launched a campaign on Friday targeting lawmakers, in an attempt to strengthen its call for a second referendum that could stop Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: Scottish judges reject challenge over Britain's ability to reverse Brexit
Description: Scotland's top court has rejected a bid by pro-EU campaigners to ask the European Court of Justice (ECJ) to rule on whether Britain alone can reverse its decision to leave the European Union.

Headline: Hammond says Trump tactics would not deliver better Brexit
Description: Britain's finance secretary said he favoured a collaborative rather than a confrontational approach to Brexit negotiations, rejecting a suggestion from his cabinet colleague Boris Johnson that Donald Trump-style tactics would produce a better deal.

Headline: May has confidence in Johnson after Brexit meltdown comment - spokeswoman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has confidence in her foreign secretary Boris Johnson after he was recorded warning that there could be a meltdown over Brexit, her spokeswoman said on Friday.

Headline: Back the bill, urges May as Brexit law faces crunch test
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May urged lawmakers to back the legislation that will end Britain's membership in the European Union, ahead of a series of crunch parliamentary votes that could see a rebellion by those who want closer EU ties.

Headline: British Brexit backstop plan welcome, with caveats - Irish foreign minister
Description: Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney on Friday welcomed a British plan for ensuring there are no customs checks along the Irish border when Britain leaves the European Union, but said it only told half the story.

Headline: UK economy set to lag peers again as Brexit approaches, CBI says
Description: Britain's economy is on course to lag behind its international peers again this year as it nears its departure from the European Union, according to new forecasts from the Confederation of British Industry, an employers' group.

Headline: Britain proposes one-year Brexit backstop plan to EU
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May unveiled a one-year backstop plan for the Irish border after Brexit on Thursday, finding a compromise that may paper over differences in her government but may also struggle to win over the European Union.

Headline: UK government drops plan for 'meaningful vote' on Brexit deal - Labour
Description: Britain's government has removed a legislative proposal for a "meaningful vote" in parliament on whatever deal it negotiates to leave the European Union, opposition lawmakers said on Thursday.

Headline: Bank of America raises planned Paris job moves before Brexit - sources
Description: Bank of America  is looking to move more jobs than originally envisaged to its new Paris office, in what is expected to be one of the biggest such shifts from London ahead of Brexit, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headline: No UK ministers will be resigning over Brexit backstop - BBC
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will not face any ministerial resignations over disagreements over a failsafe policy to prevent a hard border on the island of Ireland, the BBC's political editor said on Thursday.

Headline: Irish PM says time-limited Brexit backstop would not be acceptable
Description: Ireland cannot agree to a time-limited version of a post-Brexit backstop arrangement that guarantees the retention of an open border between it and Northern Ireland, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Thursday.

Headline: What Brexit? Investors warm to UK stocks as M&A surges
Description: Despite a torrid start to 2018 and with Brexit uncertainties looming large, British blue-chip stocks have jumped to record highs thanks to a weak pound, a torrent of mergers and acquisitions, and bouts of political anxiety in the euro zone.

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP says British backstop plan a step forward
Description: The Northern Irish DUP party that supports Britain's minority government welcomed Prime Minister Theresa May's backstop plan for the Irish border on Thursday as a positive step forward.

Headline: British lawmakers to discuss Brexit bill changes for two days next week
Description: British lawmakers will take two days next week to discuss amendments proposed by the upper house of parliament to the government bill ending UK membership of the European Union.

Headline: Barnier welcomes UK Irish backstop, sets conditions
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier welcomed a new British proposal on Thursday for a backstop plan to avoid a hard border in Ireland - but he stuck by key conditions that have led to a stalemate in talks so far.

Headline: Britain looking forward to talks with EU on Brexit backstop proposal
Description: Britain is looking forward to negotiating the details of a backstop plan for the Irish border with the European Union now the government has presented its proposal, a spokeswoman for British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday.

Headline: Factbox - Britain sets out plan for temporary Brexit backstop arrangements
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May on Thursday set out new plans for a fallback policy to prevent a hard border on the island of Ireland if Brexit talks with the European Union do not produce a deal.

Headline: In rare step, parliament passes motion ordering Vote Leave director to appear
Description: British lawmakers took the rare step on Thursday of ordering a director of Brexit campaign group Vote Leave to parliament to answer questions about campaign spending and advertising after he refused to comply with earlier requests.

Headline: UK proposes time-limited backstop, expects Brexit deal by end-2021
Description: The British government stuck to its proposal to offer the European Union a "backstop" plan that is time-limited but said it expected a future deal to be in place by the end of December 2021, a document said on Thursday.

Headline: EU's Barnier to speak on Brexit talks on Friday
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier will brief Brussels journalists on Friday at 2 p.m. (noon GMT) following the latest round of talks with British officials, an EU official said.

Headline: May has 'constructive' talks with Brexit minister over backstop
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May had "constructive" talks with her Brexit secretary David Davis, whom she expects to be in his post by the end of the day after a reported disagreement, her spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: EU 'shooting itself in the foot' over Galileo - Davis
Description: Britain said the European Commission was "shooting itself in the foot" with a plan to restrict UK access to the Galileo satellite navigation system after Brexit.

Headline: Pressuring May, Labour tries to force new single market deal
Description: The opposition Labour Party has thrown down the gauntlet to Prime Minister Theresa May on Brexit, urging MPs to defeat her in parliament by backing a proposal for Britain to stay in the EU's single market after leaving the bloc.

Headline: UK says Irish border 'backstop' Brexit proposal still being discussed
Description: Brexit secretary David Davis said a so-called "backstop proposal" on how to avoid a hard border between Northern Ireland and Ireland was still being discussed.

Headline: Bank of England blames Brexit for not changing EU insurance rule
Description: The Bank of England (BoE) has rejected calls from British lawmakers and insurers to ease a European Union insurance capital requirement rule, blaming Brexit uncertainty.

Headline: PM May sidesteps questions on publication of Brexit strategy
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May refused twice on Wednesday to answer whether her government would publish its Brexit negotiation policy proposals ahead of the June 28-29 EU summit.

Headline: EU lawmaker rules out 'mutual recognition' for UK financial firms
Description: The City of London financial district's preferred option for future trading relations with the European Union after Brexit won't work, a senior EU lawmaker said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit puts a ceiling on London housing demand, prices - Reuters poll
Description: Price rises in Britain's overvalued housing market will lag inflation this year and next and in London prices are likely to fall in 2018 as Brexit keeps a lid on demand, a Reuters poll found.

Headline: Jeremy Corbyn rejects pleas to stay in the EU single market
