Description: Opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Tuesday that Britain must leave the European Union's single market, disappointing some supporters who hoped he would support a proposal to retain membership ahead of a crunch vote in parliament next week.

Headline: Britain asks to join WTO procurement deal in latest Brexit step
Description: Britain has officially applied to join the World Trade Organization's government procurement agreement, a legal step it needs to take to maintain trading relationships after it leaves the European Union on March 29, 2019.

Headline: No-deal Brexit could cost businesses 20 billion pounds a year, tax official says
Description: Companies face an extra 20 billion pounds ($27 billion) a year in costs to comply with the customs arrangement if there is a no-deal Brexit, Britain's most senior tax official said on Tuesday.

Headline: Financial services to remain 'national priority' after Brexit - UK minister
Description: Financial services will remain a "guiding light" for Britain's economy after Brexit and there is no intention to "rip up the rulebook" to compete better as a top financial centre, a government minister said on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit legislation to return to House of Commons on June 12
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May faces a June 12 showdown with potential Brexit rebels, when the legislation underpinning Britain's exit from the European Union returns to the floor of parliament for a crucial debate.

Headline: UK government will seek to overturn some amendments to Brexit bill in parliament
Description: Britain's government will seek to overturn some amendments to its EU withdrawal bill to sever ties with the European Union when it returns to the lower house of parliament on June 12, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: UK confident Brexit won't bring Armageddon - PM May's spokesman
Description: The government is confident there will be no Armageddon after Brexit, British Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Monday, responding to a report that officials had predicted petrol, food and medicine shortages if there was no deal.

Headline: UK considering giving Northern Ireland joint UK, EU status - source
Description: The United Kingdom could propose giving Northern Ireland joint UK and European Union status so it can trade freely with both, in an attempt to break the deadlock in Brexit negotiations, a government official said.

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP dismisses idea of joint UK, EU status
Description: The Northern Irish party that supports Britain's minority government dismissed the idea of giving Northern Ireland joint European Union and UK status after Brexit as at best contradictory, one of its lawmakers said, adding that the idea had not been raised with the party.

Headline: France wants tighter foreign investment bank access to EU ahead of Brexit
Description: Foreign investment banks must not get a blank check to operate in the EU and should face tighter controls, France has told the bloc's member states in a document seen by Reuters.

Headline: UK business leaders to meet May on Monday to discuss Brexit
Description: British business leaders will meet Prime Minister Theresa May on Monday to discuss Brexit and investment, May's spokeswoman said.

Headline: Nomura gets trading licence for new Frankfurt unit ahead of Brexit
Description: Nomura  has been granted a securities trading licence for its new Frankfurt-based unit by German regulator Bafin as it prepares for Brexit, Japan's largest brokerage said on Friday.

Headline: EU industry lobby adds to pressure on Britain over Brexit talks
Description: By Gabriela Baczynska, Robert-Jan Bartunek and Andrew MacAskill

Headline: Not enough time for tech customs solution to Brexit - Aston Martin
Description: The boss of carmaker Aston Martin warned it was probably too late to roll out the kind of technology needed for the post-Brexit customs plan that is favoured by many British eurosceptics.

Headline: Britain wants Brexit talks to be more constructive - May's spokesman
Description: Britain wants the Brexit talks to be more constructive with less focus on sounds bites and anonymous briefings, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said, after the EU's Brexit negotiator urged the government to stop playing "hide and seek".

Headline: Swiss bank UBS hires Britain's former EU commissioner as Brexit adviser
Description: UBS  has hired Britain's former representative to the European Commission, Jonathan Hill, to advise corporate customers about Brexit, the Swiss bank said on Tuesday.

Headline: Market volatility, Brexit reinforce urgent need for EU27 reforms - German official
Description: Political turmoil in Italy and Britain's decision to leave the European Union underscore the need for reforms in the bloc, a senior official of the German finance ministry said on Tuesday.

Headline: Bank of England and UK finance ministry divided over city regulation after Brexit  - FT
Description: Britain's finance ministry and the Bank of England are at odds over how to regulate financial services in the City of London after Brexit, the Financial Times reported on Monday, citing unnamed officials.

Headline: Scotland wary of Northern Ireland gaining Brexit advantage
Description: Scottish leader Nicola Sturgeon cited concern about Northern Ireland gaining a competitive advantage over Scotland in any Brexit deal, to press her case in Brussels on Monday for staying in the EU single market.

Headline: Independent Scotland would not join euro - Sturgeon
Description: An independent Scotland would not join the euro currency, Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Monday, adding there was "absolutely nothing" stopping the country keeping the pound.

Headline: Norway hopes for bilateral UK trade talks during Brexit transition
Description: Norway hopes to open bilateral trade talks with Britain before London's transition period to leave the European Union ends in 2020, as Brussels seems willing to show some flexibility on the question, the Norwegian foreign minister said on Friday.

Headline: French central banker sees Paris emerging as a post-Brexit markets hub
Description: Paris is set to become a European financial markets hub as international banks look to the French capital to base some activities after Britain's departure from the European union, the head of France's central bank said on Friday.

Headline: EU dismisses latest British ideas on Ireland after Brexit
Description: Britain's post-Brexit adaptation will run through 2020, as planned, a British government spokeswoman said on Thursday as the EU dismissed London's ideas for a longer status quo on customs and trade in a fight over the Irish border.

Headline: EU criticises 'fantasy' UK Brexit gambits, sees little Irish progress
Description: European Union negotiators dismiss as "fantasy" some main British demands for Brexit, including on the sensitive issue of the Northern Ireland border, a senior EU official said on Thursday.

Headline: UK threatens to demand money from EU in Brexit feud over European GPS
Description: Britain told the European Union on Thursday it will demand the repayment of up to 1 billion pounds if the bloc restricts its access to the Galileo satellite navigation system, Europe's version of GPS.

Headline: Irish border Brexit progress 'elusive', EU says after talks
Description: British and EU negotiators have made little progress this week on efforts to avoid a post-Brexit hard border in Ireland, a senior EU official said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit customs plan could cost UK aerospace/defence industry £2.3 billion - trade body
Description: Britain's aerospace and defence industry could face extra costs of 2.3 billion pounds ($3 billion) to comply with the customs arrangement favoured by some Brexit supporters within the cabinet, according to forecasts by trade body ADS.

Headline: Britain may have to extend EU customs arrangements after Brexit - MPs
Description: Britain may have to stay in the EU customs union after the post-Brexit transition period finishes at the end of 2020 because new trading arrangements will not be ready, according to a parliamentary report on Thursday.

Headline: UK set for parliamentary showdown on Brexit law 'in weeks'
Description: The British government said on Thursday its key piece of Brexit legislation would return to the House of Commons in a matter of weeks, the next stage in what is expected to be a major test of Prime Minister Theresa May's authority.

Headline: Britain wants to continue in EU Galileo programme - May's spokeswoman
Description: Britain wants to continue fully participating in the European Union's Galileo satellite navigation programme, a spokeswoman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit customs paperwork to cost firms up to 20 billion pounds a year, tax official says
Description: Businesses will face a cost of up to 20 billion pounds ($27 billion) a year to comply with the customs arrangement favoured by the keenest Brexit supporters within the cabinet, Britain's most senior tax official said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit legislation to return to House of Commons next month
Description: The legislation underpinning Britain's exit from the European Union will return to the House of Commons for more debate next month, British media reported on Wednesday, after the government suffered a series of defeats on plans to leave the trading bloc.

Headline: Britain legally bound to pay Brexit bill before trade accord agreed - minister
Description: Britain is legally bound to pay its up to 39 billion pound ($52 billion) divorce bill to the European Union before it agrees a  future trade deal with the bloc, a Brexit minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britons dash to become German before Brexit
Description: Driven by the prospect of Britain's withdrawal from the European Union next year, the number of British passport holders who became German citizens jumped by 162 percent last year, Germany's Federal Statistics Office said on Wednesday.

Headline: Reuters poll: Britain's Brexit divorce skills get thumbs down - economists
Description: Britain's government has handled negotiations with the European Union over its departure from the bloc poorly, according to all economists in a Reuters poll, who did however say there was just a one-in-five chance of a disorderly Brexit.

Headline: Brexit exposes 'wishful thinking' of Norway's EEA foes - foreign minister
Description: Opponents of Norway's close ties to the European Union are wrong to assume a more beneficial relationship could be found, as shown by Britain's troubled negotiations to leave the bloc, the Norwegian foreign minister said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK financial sector wants global talent on tap after Brexit
Description: Costs for hiring bankers, accountants and lawyers from outside Britain will soar after Brexit and threaten London's standing as a global financial centre unless the immigration system is urgently reformed, a report said on Monday.

Headline: With Brexit clarity, Scotland will look again at independence - Sturgeon
Description: Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Sunday she would again consider another vote on independence for Scotland when the British government offers some certainty over Brexit.

Headline: Clock ticking on post-Brexit flights - EU official
Description: There is still a possibility that flights will not be able to take place the day after Britain's planned departure from the European Union next year, an EU official said on Friday.

Headline: PM May says Britain will leave customs union, to offer Ireland backstop
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday Britain would leave the EU customs union after Brexit but a source said London was considering a backstop plan that would apply the bloc's external tariffs beyond December 2020.

Headline: UK will not shelve debate on Brexit laws - May's spokeswoman
Description: The British government will take its time to consider amendments passed by the upper house of parliament to the EU withdrawal bill, but will not shelve the key piece of Brexit legislation, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: Factbox - Impact on banks from Britain's vote to leave the EU
Description: Thousands of banking jobs could move out of Britain as finance companies look to set up regulated subsidiaries in European Union countries to be able to sell products across the bloc once Britain leaves in 2019.

Headline: EU says it can't guarantee Brexit won't hit financial contracts
Description: There is no guarantee that Brexit won't disrupt millions of insurance and derivative contracts and it is still up to firms to take preventive measures, the European Union's financial services chief said on Thursday.

Headline: UK still negotiating with EU over Brexit backstop - May's spokeswoman
Description: Britain is still negotiating with the European Union over a workable backstop arrangement if any Brexit deal is delayed, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain to avoid motor insurance red tape after Brexit - trade body
Description: The UK government plans to keep Britain within an international motor insurance accord, cutting red tape for drivers and hauliers travelling in European Union states after Brexit, an insurance trade body said on Thursday.

Headline: UK dismisses report that it could stay in customs union after 2021
Description: A source in Theresa May's Downing Street office has dismissed a media report saying that Britain would tell Brussels it was prepared to stay in the European Union's customs union beyond 2021.

Headline: Britain seeks 30 billion pounds investment to boost economy after Brexit
Description: Trade secretary Liam Fox will invite overseas investors on Thursday to submit bids for financing 30 billion pounds of projects to help the world's sixth-largest economy cope with the upheaval of leaving the European Union.

Headline: MPs call for post-Brexit pharmaceutical deal with EU
Description: Britain must make a continued form of membership of the European Medicines Agency (EMA) a priority to protect the pharmaceutical industry and patients after Brexit, MPs said.

Headline: UK's risk of losing euro clearing after Brexit eases
Description: The threat of clearing in euro denominated financial contracts being forcibly moved from London to the European Union after Brexit eased on Wednesday after EU lawmakers backed more detailed economic tests for relocation.

Headline: UK government suffers new Brexit defeat as Lords demand environment safeguards
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government on Wednesday suffered its 15th defeat on legislation that will end Britain's membership of the European Union when parliament's upper chamber voted in favour of adding environmental safeguards to the bill.

Headline: May defeats Labour bid to force her hand on customs
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May defeated a bid by the opposition Labour Party on Wednesday to force her government to disclose details of its two Brexit customs proposals, thwarting efforts to embarrass her divided team.

Headline: No sign of illegal co-ordination among Brexit campaigners - data firm
Description: A data firm that worked for several pro-Brexit organisations that are subject of a campaign funding inquiry said on Wednesday it saw no evidence of illegal co-ordination between the groups before the 2016 referendum.

Headline: May disappointed by Scottish refusal to approve Brexit law
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she was disappointed by the Scottish parliament's decision to refuse consent for the flagship legislation which will end Britain's membership of the European Union.

Headline: ECB says Brexit transition period instrumental for banks
Description: A transition period before Britain leaves the European Union would be "instrumental" for helping banks adapt to the new regime, the European Central Bank said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain will not ask for longer Brexit transition period - minister
Description: Britain will not ask for an extension to the near-two year transition period with the European Union after Brexit when the government publishes its new detailed plans next month, Cabinet Office minister David Lidington said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain to publish Brexit position paper before June summit
Description: The British government will publish detailed plans for its future relationship with the European Union next month in an attempt to break the deadlock in Brexit negotiations.

Headline: Both British post-Brexit customs proposals unworkable - Irish PM
Description: Neither of Britain's proposed future customs arrangements with the European Union are workable, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Tuesday, dismissing the option favoured by hardline Brexiteers with a comic aside.

Headline: UK minister says Brexit deal must avoid new supply chain frictions
Description: Britain's business minister said the government understands the importance of avoiding friction in the automotive supply chain after Brexit, as ministers try to overcome differences as to what customs relationships Britain should have with the EU.

Headline: Upping pressure on PM, Labour Party to call for Brexit customs papers
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party will increase the pressure on Prime Minister Theresa May's government on Wednesday, by trying to force publication of documents on its two options for future customs arrangements with the European Union.

Headline: Sturgeon warns of catastrophic 'no deal' Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's failure to come up with a coherent Brexit stance means the United Kingdom is at greater risk of spiralling towards a "no deal" Brexit with catastrophic consequences, Scotland's leader said.

Headline: 'The clock is ticking' - EU warns Britain of poor Brexit progress
Description: The European Union on Monday warned Britain time was running out to seal a Brexit deal this autumn and ensure London does not crash out of the bloc next March, adding to pressure on Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: Sturgeon quips about Donald Trump's penchant for Irn Bru
Description: Scotland's leader on Monday weighed into row over the banning of Irn Bru, Scotland's most popular soft drink, in Donald Trump’s luxury golf resort, quipping that she was sure the U.S. president liked the luminous orange drink.

Headline: Spain and Catalonia could learn from Scotland, Sturgeon says
Description: Spain and Catalonia could learn lessons about how to handle independence movements from Scotland, Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Monday, adding that she was concerned by the Spanish authorities' treatment of some politicians.

Headline: Scottish independence is never off the table, Sturgeon says
Description: Scottish independence will never be off the table until it happens, Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Monday.

Headline: EU's Barnier has seen no big progress on Brexit since March - chairwoman
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator, Michel Barnier, told 27 ministers from the bloc on Monday that "no significant progress" has been made in negotiations with London since March, the chairwoman of the talks said.

Headline: Johnson backs May's position over EU customs' plans
Description: British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson, who has described proposals for a customs partnership with the European Union after Brexit as "crazy", said on Monday he backed Prime Minister Theresa May's stance on the issue.

Headline: Global banks signal pragmatism over EU access after Brexit
Description: Top banks in London have begun lobbying to improve the European Union's existing system of market access after the bloc's officials dismissed British calls for a bespoke Brexit deal.

Headline: Brexit edges UK companies out of EU supply chain
Description: Mandy Ridyard knew Brexit was going to be a challenge for her aviation components firm, but it was still a shock when she heard a French company bluntly ruling out British suppliers from an international bid for a contract in China.

Headline: UK spymaster tells EU - Let's work together to counter Islamist militants, Russia
Description: Britain and the European Union must retain close security ties after Brexit to foil Islamic State militant attacks and counter Russia's "pernicious" attempts to subvert Western democracies, the head of Britain's domestic spy agency said on Monday.

Headline: German spy chief says regulation may be needed for social platforms
Description: Germany's domestic intelligence agency on Monday suggested that regulations may be needed if the European Union cannot increase the accountability of social media platforms such as Facebook  regarding illegal or dangerous content.

Headline: Britain focussed on getting right customs decision - May's spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is focussed on getting the right decision on Britain's future customs arrangements with the European Union rather than meeting any deadlines, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Exclusive - Jumping ship: Brexit-hit EU staff ditch UK passports
Description: About one in 10 British civil servants at the European Commission has taken another EU nationality since the Brexit vote, but are nonetheless resigned to scant prospects of future promotion.

Headline: UK could lose influence on EU security and defence policy - report
Description: Britain may lose its influence on EU security and defence policy after it leaves the European Union, according to a parliamentary report on Monday which urges the government to put forward proposals for future co-operation.

Headline: France says June is 'ultimate deadline' for Brexit progress on Northern Ireland
Description: A June summit of European Union leaders is the "ultimate deadline" to make progress on issues related to Northern Ireland's border, French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian said on Sunday.

Headline: Trust me on Brexit, May says as ministers squabble
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Sunday she could be trusted to deliver Brexit, but that it could not be done without compromises on all sides -- a possible warning to cabinet ministers who are deeply split over future customs arrangements.

Headline: Brexit group fined for breaking spending rules in EU vote
Description: Britain's Electoral Commission imposed a record-matching 70,000 pound fine on Friday on one of the main groups that campaigned for Brexit, and said police might have to investigate possible criminal offences because of unreported campaign spending.

Headline: Exclusive - Banks to seek special exemptions for foreign staff after Brexit: sources
Description: Global banks in Britain are calling for a special work visa waiver after Brexit to preserve the City of London's standing as a top global financial centre, two industry sources said, a move that would be more generous than the current arrangements.

Headline: Factbox - Brexit group Leave.EU fined for breaking referendum spending rules
Description: One of the main Brexit campaign groups in Britain's 2016 EU referendum was fined 70,000 pounds ($95,000) on Friday by the Electoral Commission for incorrectly reporting its expenditure and breaching a spending limit.

Headline: Leave.EU founder says UK electoral fine is a part of plot by enemies of Brexit
Description: A 70,000 pound ($95,000) fine for campaign group Leave.EU is a politically motivated attack on Brexit by people who don't want it to happen, the group's founder said on Friday.

Headline: Carney says UK outlook 'clouded' by Brexit uncertainty
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Thursday the economic outlook for Britain remained obscured by uncertainty about the terms of its departure from the European Union.

Headline: U.S. asset manager MFS picks Luxembourg as post-Brexit EU hub
Description: U.S. asset manager MFS Investment Management said it will seek permission to create a European Union hub in Luxembourg as it positions itself for Britain's exit from the bloc.

Headline: UK food prices likely to rise without a Brexit deal - report
Description: Food prices are likely to rise after Brexit if no trade agreement with the EU is reached, a parliamentary report said on Thursday, and there could be shortages of some products.

Headline: Britain sets out plans for post-Brexit security cooperation with EU
Description: Britain floated proposals for future security cooperation with the European Union on Thursday, calling on the EU to make an exception and allow London to enjoy the same depth of ties after it leaves the bloc next year.

Headline: May suffers defeat in House of Lords over plans to leave EU single market
Description: Britain's upper house of parliament on Tuesday inflicted another embarrassing defeat on Prime Minister Theresa May's government on Tuesday, challenging her plan to leave the European Union's single market after Brexit.

Headline: UK government defeated by Lords over plans for fixed Brexit date
Description: Britain's upper house of parliament inflicted a second defeat on Prime Minister Theresa May's government on Tuesday, challenging her decision to fix the official date of the country's departure from the European Union.

Headline: Britain's upper house of parliament votes in favour of staying in EU's single market
Description: Britain's upper house of parliament on Tuesday inflicted another defeat on Prime Minister Theresa May's government, voting in favour of staying in the European Union's single market.

Headline: May orders more work on Brexit customs plans after 'crazy' jibe
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has told officials to do more work on future EU customs arrangements after her foreign minister attacked one of her Brexit proposals as "crazy".

Headline: Work on customs plans as a priority, May tells officials
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has asked officials to keep working on proposals for future customs arrangements with the European Union after Brexit as a priority, after deep divisions over her plans have broken into the open.

Headline: Waiting to hear from British government on customs plans, says DUP leader
Description: The Northern Irish party propping up British Prime Minister Theresa May in parliament is waiting to hear her government's plans to deal with future customs arrangements with the European Union, its leader Arlene Foster said on Sunday.

Headline: Coming to right post-Brexit customs plan takes time, minister says
Description: Britain's government is taking its time to make sure it comes to the right decision on a future customs arrangement with the European Union and is working on its two proposals, business minister Greg Clark said on Sunday.

Headline: EU scrutinises post-Brexit security deal
Description: EU officials who began talks with Britain on Friday on security ties after Brexit will raise problems that diplomats say may mean cooperation against terrorism and crime will be weakened more than many expected.

Headline: Topics agreed for post-Brexit relationship talks
Description: Negotiators from Britain and the European Union agreed a broad structure for further talks on their future relationship after Brexit, dividing economic issues from those on security, the EU said on Friday.

Headline: Insurers hit shift button despite Brexit grace period
Description: Lloyd's of London, AIG, Allianz and other insurers are ignoring assurances and establishing new hubs in Britain and the European Union before Brexit in March 2019 to ensure access to customers.

Headline: Pro-Brexit MPs pressure May over customs plan
Description: Pro-Brexit members of parliament heaped pressure on British Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday over her future customs plans with the European Union, calling on her to drop what some say is her preferred proposal.

Headline: Bank of America to shift 125 British jobs to Ireland ahead of Brexit
Description: Bank of America  will relocate up to 125 jobs from Britain mostly to Ireland as it prepares for Britain's exit from the European Union, according to a corporate filing.

Headline: Wizz Air granted UK licence to shore up flying rights ahead of Brexit
Description: Hungary-based budget airline Wizz Air  has shored up its post-Brexit flying rights after UK authorities granted its British subsidiary Wizz Air an Air Operator's Certificate (AOC).

Headline: No surprise future customs plans with EU are taking time - Davis
Description: There should be no surprise that it is taking time to decide on a future customs arrangement with the European Union, Britain's Brexit minister David Davis said on Thursday.

Headline: EU launches battle for bigger post-Brexit budget
Description: The European Commission proposed a bigger new multi-year budget on Wednesday that will trigger battles among member states over how to fill the funding gap left by Britain's exit next year.

Headline: EU proposes to cut farm subsidies, France says unacceptable
Description: The European Commission on Wednesday proposed to reduce farm subsidies and leave more latitude to member states under the bloc's Common Agriculture Policy (CAP), drawing swift condemnation from France, which called the move "unthinkable".

Headline: Factbox - EU sets out details of post-Brexit budget
Description: The European Commission announced on Wednesday proposals for a new multi-year budget that is expected to see EU countries squabble among themselves over how to fill the funding gap left by Britain's exit next year.

Headline: UK developing options for satellite system to rival EU's Galileo
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has asked experts to look into options for a British satellite navigation system to rival the European Union's Galileo project amid a row over attempts to restrict Britain's access to sensitive information after Brexit.

Headline: Germany wants 'fair burden sharing' across EU after Brexit
Description: Germany's finance and foreign ministers called on Wednesday for fair burden-sharing between European Union member states in the 2021-27 budget period, when the bloc will have to fill the funding gap left by Britain's exit next year.

Headline: Poland says can't accept members' differentiation in new EU budget
Description: Warsaw will oppose any European Union budget plan that doesn't balance the needs of its various member states, Poland's deputy foreign minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: EU Commission proposes 55 billion euros for euro zone in 2021-2027 budget
Description: The European Commission proposed on Wednesday 55 billion euros (48.4 billion pounds) in the next long-term European Union budget for supporting investment in the euro zone during economic shocks, structural reforms and help join the euro.

Headline: EU sees 22 billion euros of new budget funds from plastics, CO2, corporate tax
Description: European Union nations should contribute new funds to the bloc's budget to fill the gap left by Britain's exit next year collected from taxing digital services, plastic waste and carbon emissions, the European Commission said on Wednesday.

Headline: Dutch foreign minister says EU budget proposal 'unacceptable'
Description: A proposal to increase the multi-year European Union budget after Britain leaves the bloc is unacceptable for the Netherlands, Dutch Foreign Minister Stef Blok said on Wednesday.

Headline: May's latest Brexit headache - a customs deal with the EU
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's plan for Britain to leave the EU customs union when it quits the bloc - and not join a similar arrangement - has become a flashpoint in the Brexit process, setting up a possible parliamentary defeat that could force her government into a damaging policy U-turn.

Headline: Ideas on post Brexit customs setup are evolving - May's spokesman
Description: Britain's proposals for its future customs arrangements with the European Union are evolving as negotiations with the European Union progress, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Hard Brexit faction in May's party deny issuing threat over customs union
Description: The leader of a faction in British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative party demanding a clean break from the European Union, has denied issuing an ultimatum after asking her to drop a proposal for a customs partnership with the bloc.

Headline: British decision on post-Brexit customs position to take a few weeks, minister says
Description: Senior British ministers will likely take a few weeks to decide a final position on the future customs arrangement with the European Union after Brexit, a senior minister said ahead of a first major meeting to discuss the issue on Wednesday.

Headline: Senior Brexiteers demand May drops EU customs partnership option - BBC
Description: Senior British lawmakers that back Brexit have demanded that Prime Minister Theresa May drops a proposal for a customs partnership with the European Union once it leaves the bloc, the BBC reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit minister expects tussle over financial services
Description: Britain's Brexit minister David Davis said on Tuesday that there would be "something of a tussle" over financial services as part of negotiations with the European Union on Britain's future relationship with the bloc after it withdraws from it.

Headline: Liam Fox says unelected peers trying to block the people's will over Brexit
Description: Britain's trade minister said on Tuesday that unelected lawmakers in parliament's upper House of Lords were trying to block the will of the people over Brexit.

Headline: ECB tells banks to pay 12 percent more for their supervision
Description: The European Central Bank will ask banks to pay 12 percent more in supervisory fees this year, in part to cover the cost of Brexit related preparations and the cost of a regular stress test, it said on Monday.

Headline: UK, EU banking regulators team up in case of cliff-edge Brexit
Description: The Bank of England and European Central Bank will create a task force to keep markets orderly in the event of a "cliff edge" Brexit next March.

Headline: UK banks to be covered by EU law until 2020 under withdrawal deal - ECB
Description: UK banks will be covered by European Union law until the end of 2020 if the withdrawal deal agreed by Britain and the EU is ratified, the European Central Bank said on Friday.

Headline: Ireland says solid progress on post-Brexit border needed by June
Description: Britain and European Union negotiators must make further progress on the issue of the Irish border by June if talks are to move forward on a final withdrawal agreement, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Thursday.

Headline: EU's Barnier plays down bespoke Brexit deal for British financial sector
Description: The EU's chief negotiator on Brexit said on Thursday the bloc's existing system of market access for foreign financial firms can work well for Britain after it leaves the European Union.

Headline: May feels more heat over EU's customs union
Description: British lawmakers stepped up pressure on Prime Minister Theresa May over her Brexit strategy on Thursday, criticising her refusal to pursue a customs union with the European Union.

Headline: British lawmakers urge government to pursue customs union in symbolic vote
Description: British parliament approved a motion in favour of urging the government to pursue a customs union in Brexit negotiations on Thursday in a symbolic vote after most of the governing Conservative Party decided not to take part.

Headline: Britain will narrow its position to one customs option in Brexit talks
Description: Britain's government will narrow its position on a future customs arrangement with the European Union to one of the two options currently on the table in Brexit talks, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain pumps cash into artificial intelligence before Brexit
Description: Britain announced on Thursday a 1 billion pound ($1.4 billion) joint investment in the artificial intelligence (AI) industry to capitalise on what the government sees as a competitive advantage in the sector as it prepares for life after Brexit.

Headline: Hammond says in 'preliminary foothills' of Brexit banking talks
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Wednesday that London and Brussels remained at an early stage of discussions about how financial services will operate across the English Channel after Brexit.

Headline: May dealt new Brexit defeat in upper house of parliament
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May was dealt a new defeat by Britain's upper house of parliament on Wednesday over her Brexit plans, this time in a challenge to the government's push to adopt wide-ranging powers to amend laws.

Headline: UK parliament will back government on customs union - Brexit minister
Description: Britain's Brexit minister David Davis said on Wednesday he expects parliament to back the government's policy of leaving the customs union at a crunch vote which could come as early as next month.

Headline: High probability of a Brexit deal with EU, says Davis
Description: Brexit minister David Davis said on Wednesday he believed that there was a high probability that Britain would negotiate a deal to leave the European Union, dismissing fears that the country could crash out of the bloc.

Headline: EU dangles Brexit carrot if Britain changes mind and stays in customs union
Description: The European Union could offer Britain a closer relationship after Brexit if Prime Minister Theresa May decides to stay in the bloc's customs union, diplomats said.

Headline: Swipe right to remain? Brexit app leaves EU lawmakers wary
Description: British officials presented their plans to ensure 3 million European Union citizens can be granted rights to remain in Britain after Brexit, but their presentation in Brussels on Tuesday left EU lawmakers worried the system won't work.

Headline: EU downplays prospect of bespoke Brexit trade deal for banks
Description: The European Union's existing system of market access for foreign financial firms is not perfect but can work for Britain with "clear limits" after it leaves the bloc next year, the EU's financial services chief said on Tuesday.

Headline: Airbus CEO says post-Brexit production shift open for discussion
Description: Airbus  will not move its existing activities out of Britain when the country leaves the European Union but could forgo basing new projects there, its chief executive said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK markets watchdog urges joint action with EU on Brexit risks
Description: Britain's markets watchdog urged his European counterparts on Tuesday to work jointly to address risks from Brexit, saying unilateral action by the United Kingdom would only offer second-best measures.

Headline: Britain hails new optimism about Brexit deal for financial services
Description: The British government and senior finance executives said they are increasingly confident Europe will offer financial companies generous market access after Brexit, boosting London's hopes of retaining its status as a top global financial centre.

Headline: Britain sticks to plans on EU customs union, government 'as one'
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday her government was sticking to its proposals to ease trade with the European Union after Brexit, rejecting suggestions that plans to quit its customs union were again dividing her party.

Headline: May suffers another defeat in upper house over EU rights
Description: Britain's upper house of parliament handed the government its  third defeat over Brexit in less than a week on Monday, voting down plans not to retain EU rights in national law before Britain leaves the bloc.

Headline: Rolls-Royce could move engine design approval to Germany
Description: Rolls-Royce  may transfer the design approval process for its large jet engines from Britain to Germany as a "technical measure" to avoid disruption from Brexit, the company said on Monday.

Headline: Switzerland and Britain looking to match EU ties in time for Brexit
Description: Switzerland and Britain are working to transpose Switzerland's current trade relationship with the European Union into a bilateral arrangement to ensure there are no major headaches immediately after Brexit.

Headline: Gemalto says post-Brexit UK passport contract will create jobs, protect data
Description: Franco-Dutch digital security group Gemalto  said on Monday that its contract to make the new, post-Brexit British passport would create new jobs and that it would ensure citizens' key data details are protected.

Headline: Britain confident in Brexit talks, sees no return to hard Irish border
Description: Britain expressed confidence on Friday that no hard border with Ireland would return following Brexit, but European Union negotiators have dismissed a proposal by Britain on how to ensure goods would flow freely after it quits the EU.

Headline: EU's Barnier says still some 25 percent of work to do on Brexit
Description: The European Union's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday some 25 percent of work remained to be done on a pact covering UK withdrawal from the EU, including crucial issues such as management of the Ireland/Northern Ireland border.

Headline: Irish firms becoming less spooked by Brexit - Bank of Ireland chairman
Description: Irish firms who held back on investing due to the uncertainty caused by neighbouring Britain's decision to leave the European Union are beginning to make investment decisions again, Bank of Ireland's  chairman said on Friday.

Headline: Britain confident of finding way to avoid hard border with EU member Ireland
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is confident Britain and the EU can find a solution to avoid any return to a hard border with Ireland after Brexit, her spokesman said on Friday, saying he did not recognise reports that the bloc had rejected her plans.

Headline: May dealt embarrassing Brexit defeat in House of Lords
Description: The House of Lords inflicted an embarrassing defeat on Theresa May's government on Wednesday, challenging her refusal to remain in a customs union with the EU after Brexit.

Headline: JPMorgan mulls moving 200 bankers to Paris post-Brexit - Les Echos
Description: JPMorgan  is considering moving almost 200 banking jobs from London to Paris after Britain leaves the European Union, Les Echos newspaper reported on Wednesday, citing unidentified sources.

Headline: Canada tells Britain it can pursue trade deal quickly after Brexit - May's office
Description: Canada and Britain will be able to quickly pursue a new trade deal after Brexit, Canadian PM Justin Trudeau told British counterpart Theresa May at a bilateral meeting on Wednesday, according to May's office.

Headline: May faces embarrassing Brexit defeat in upper house
Description: Britain's upper house of parliament is expected to inflict an embarrassing defeat on Theresa May's government on Wednesday, challenging her refusal to remain in a customs union with the European Union after Brexit.

Headline: Factbox - Britain's Brexit legislation: What is left to do ahead of EU exit?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's minority government needs to pass a raft of legislation to prepare for Britain's divorce from the European Union on March 29, 2019, but many key bills have become bogged down in parliamentary process.

Headline: May seeks Commonwealth trade boost as final Brexit talks begin
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May on Monday extolled the benefits of free trade among Commonwealth countries, seeking new sources of commerce as Britain looks to finalise divorce terms with its current biggest trading partner, the European Union.

Headline: MPs, celebrities call for 'people's vote' on Brexit
Description: MPs, celebrities and business leaders launched a campaign on Sunday to call for a vote on any final Brexit deal, stepping up a campaign to try to stop what they describe as Britain's damaging departure from the European Union.

Headline: Goldman's Schwimmer to steer London Stock Exchange through Brexit
Description: The London Stock Exchange  named Goldman Sachs' veteran David Schwimmer as chief executive officer on Friday, with an initial challenge of helping the 300-year-old institution to navigate Brexit.

Headline: Pro-Brexit campaign group may have broken spending rules -law firm
Description: The main "Leave" group in Britain's 2016 EU referendum may have broken electoral rules by over-spending during the campaign, according to a legal opinion published by a parliamentary committee on Friday.

Headline: Airbus CEO warns Britain over Brexit uncertainty
Description: Airbus wants Britain to provide more clarity over the country's future relationship with the European Union, or risk losing investment, the European planemaker's CEO said.

Headline: Hammond warns 'catastrophe' for Ireland situation if no EU deal
Description: Chancellor Philip Hammond told a German newspaper that it would be a "catastrophe" for the situation in Ireland if Britain and the European Union failed to find a solution during talks on Brexit.

Headline: British financial regulator urges EU Brexit coordination
Description: Britain's financial watchdog called on Monday for immediate coordination with European Union counterparts to ensure that Brexit is as smooth and stable as possible for markets.

Headline: Sterling forecasts at post-Brexit high on BoE, negotiation hopes - Reuters poll
Description: Sterling forecasts are at their highest since Britons voted to leave the European Union, a Reuters poll found, partly as a result of optimism driven by progress in divorce talks and expectations of another interest rate rise next month.

Headline: English law faces Brexit crunch under push to change financial contracts
Description: Euro zone banks that have issued bonds under English law may face capital shortfalls after Britain leaves the EU, regulators in the currency bloc said as they encourage banks to switch to continental law for future contracts.

Headline: UK shop prices fall at fastest pace in over a year - BRC
Description: British shop prices dropped in March at the fastest pace in more than a year, adding to signs that inflation pressure caused by the pound's post-Brexit drop is fading away, an industry survey showed on Wednesday.

Headline: The future is bright, vows May on tour of Brexit-divided country
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May promised Britain bright prospects outside the European Union on Thursday as she toured a country still profoundly divided about its future as the countdown to Brexit enters its final 12 months.

Headline: May commits to spend more on healthcare after Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday that leaving the European Union will mean more money will be available to spend on healthcare, delivering on a central promise made by campaigners to leave the bloc.

Headline: A year away from Brexit, Britons' views remain as entrenched as ever
Description: Leaning over the counter of his seafood stall in the English seaside town of Great Yarmouth, Darran Nichols-George says those still moaning about the British vote to leave the European Union need to stop complaining.

Headline: Trade minister Fox says would not support longer Brexit transition period
Description: British trade minister Liam Fox said on Thursday he would not support an extension to the near-two year transition period that has been agreed with the European Union to smooth the country's exit from the bloc.

Headline: 5,000 UK finance jobs may be moved by Brexit, half earlier forecast - Reuters
Description: The number of finance jobs to be shifted out of Britain or created overseas by March 2019 due to Brexit has dropped by half compared to six months ago to 5,000 roles, firms employing the bulk of UK-based workers in international finance told Reuters.

Headline: Brexit and the City - Tracking the fortunes of London's financial districts
Description: Is London's position as the largest international centre of finance slipping as a result of Brexit?

Headline: Britain will deliver Brexit despite funding allegations - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday her government would deliver on Britain's vote to leave the European Union, after the referendum result was questioned by some critics who say funding rules were broken by Brexit campaigners.

Headline: Factbox - Reuters surveys UK financial services jobs post-Brexit
Description: Around 5,000 finance jobs will be shifted out of Britain or created overseas by March 2019 because of Brexit, half the number forecast six months ago, according to a Reuters survey of firms employing the bulk of workers in international finance.

Headline: BoE to update guidance on banks' preparations for Brexit on Wednesday
Description: The Bank of England said it will publish later on Wednesday updated guidance on how banks and other financial services firms should prepare for Brexit, following a 21-month transition deal struck by Britain and other European Union countries this month.

Headline: Brexit and the City - the real estate agent's view
Description: Like the towers now dominating its skyline, London property prices have moved in almost only one direction in recent decades, ever higher.

Headline: Brexit and the City - Food for thought from London dining room
Description: Diners are still flocking to the elegant, glass-domed dining room at 1 Lombard Street, despite uncertainty about London's future after Britain exits the European Union next year.

Headline: Britain to propose new solution to avoid hard border in Ireland, The Times says
Description: Irish officials have been told to expect new proposals imminently from Britain on how it plans to avoid a post-Brexit hard border, The Times newspaper reported on Wednesday, citing unidentified sources.

Headline: Corbyn under fire over Russia, anti-Semitism and Brexit
Description: British opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn's path to the prime minister's residence at 10 Downing Street is not proving as smooth as the veteran socialist had hoped.

Headline: Restricting migration after Brexit likely to slow growth, says official report
Description: Restricting migration into Britain will very likely lead to lower output and employment growth, an interim report commissioned by the British government said on Tuesday, warning that firms were not prepared for a tightening labour market.

Headline: Whistleblower questions Brexit result, says campaigners broke election law
Description: A whistleblower at the heart of a Facebook data scandal on Monday questioned the result of Britain's 2016 Brexit referendum as his lawyers presented evidence that they said showed the main campaign for leaving the EU had broken the law.

Headline: Parliament must have power to stop 'No Deal' Brexit - UK opposition
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party on Monday demanded that parliament have the final say on the government's Brexit deal, including an option to send ministers back to the negotiating table rather than leave without an exit agreement.

Headline: May welcomes Brexit transition, trade talks loom
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May welcomed the approval by European Union leaders on Friday of a transition period to help business adapt after Brexit, telling the bloc to ride the "new dynamic" in upcoming trade talks.

Headline: Factbox - Parlez-vous Brexit? A 'Brexicon' of the UK-EU break-up
Description: As Britain's Brexit negotiations with the European Union moved into a new phase on Friday, the process has generated a new language all of its own, some of it colourful, much of it mystifying to the uninitiated.

Headline: Who's your friend? Wistful EU embraces May before Brexit
Description: With Brexit a year away, European Union leaders made a point on Friday of embracing Theresa May, with some treating her troubles with Russia and the United States as an opportunity to show Britain who its friends are.

Headline: EU leaders confirm Brexit transition offer, joint trade line
Description: European Union leaders formally adopted on Friday their joint negotiating stance on a future trade relationship with Britain after it leaves the bloc, said the chairman of the summit, Donald Tusk.

Headline: Chemical companies fear toxic consequences of Brexit
Description: Julian Sarkar has spent more than 10 years and around 600,000 euros (525,000 pounds) making his small British company compliant with strict European Union regulations to import chemicals into the bloc.

Headline: Britain, EU make significant progress in Brexit talks - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday Britain and the European Union had made significant progress in Brexit talks and that she was looking forward to talks on their future economic partnership.

Headline: Seize on 'new dynamic' to agree Brexit deal, May tells EU
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May urged EU leaders to seize on "a new dynamic" in Brexit talks and solve differences over a future border with Ireland to agree a deal on their future partnership.

Headline: UK minister urges regulators to reassure banks on Brexit transition
Description: European Union regulators should offer financial firms reassurances that they can carry on operating as usual during the 20-month Brexit transition deal agreed this week, British financial services minister John Glen said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain urged to prioritise travel in Brexit talks to help create jobs
Description: Britain must prioritise the needs of the travel and tourism sector as part of its Brexit negotiations or risk losing out on predicted growth in the sector that could create new jobs, an industry association said on Thursday.

Headline: EU's Tusk confirms Brexit transition offer to London
Description: European Union leaders will on Friday offer Britain a Brexit transition deal, the summit chair Donald Tusk said - but the deal will only be finalised if London honours its commitments on the Irish border and Gibraltar.

Headline: Devolved UK parliaments pass bills to keep current powers after Brexit
Description: Britain's devolved parliaments in Scotland and Wales on Wednesday approved bills that aim to keep their current powers unchanged after Brexit, a backstop in case a dispute with Prime Minister Theresa May's government drags on.

Headline: EU leaders to warn May on Brexit backsliding - draft
Description: EU leaders will issue a warning to Britain on Friday that it will only finally secure a Brexit transition period if it stands by its commitments on the Irish border and Gibraltar, a draft statement showed on Wednesday.

Headline: EU financing arm ready to boost bloc funding after Brexit
Description: The European Union's financing arm, the EIB, on Wednesday offered to help offset a financing gap caused by Britain's departure from the bloc and other emerging needs by leveraging higher budgetary guarantees and other financial instruments.

Headline: BMW says Brexit free trade deal not good enough to tackle customs issues
Description: BMW's special representative in Britain said a free trade deal after Brexit would not tackle many of the non-tariff issues affecting the car industry which relies on the unfettered movement of components and models across borders.

Headline: Brexit campaigner Banks says - Cambridge Analytica pitched but we did not hire them
Description: Brexit campaigner Arron Banks said Cambridge Analytica pitched for work with the Leave.eu campaign ahead of the 2016 Brexit referendum but that ultimately it never did any work - paid or otherwise - for the campaign.

Headline: Court rules in favour of case on Britain's ability to reverse Brexit
Description: A legal attempt by anti-Brexit campaigners to establish that Britain could unilaterally reverse Brexit was given a boost on Tuesday by Scotland's top court, which said it wants to examine the case in greater depth.

Headline: EU primes UK trade offer, seeks Brexit transition endorsement
Description: EU governments agreed on Tuesday to offer British banks and airlines hope of good market access after Brexit but kept London waiting for confirmation it will get the transition deal it wants to avoid disrupting business.

Headline: Scots take hard line on Brexit fishing rights
Description: Politicians on both sides of the divide in Scotland criticised a Brexit transition deal which failed to deliver full control over fishing rights, with Conservatives suggesting they could not support a final agreement unless it did so.

Headline: UK wins Brexit transition deal in return for Irish vow
Description: Britain and the European Union agreed on Monday to a transition period to avoid a "cliff edge" Brexit next year -- though only after London accepted a potential solution for Northern Ireland's land border that may face stiff opposition at home.

Headline: Merkel pleased about Brexit transition deal but says many problems remain
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Tuesday she was pleased that the European Union and Britain had agreed on a Brexit transition deal but added that there were still many challenges to overcome in negotiating Britain's departure from the bloc.

Headline: EU's Barnier sees most difficult Brexit issues to come at the end of talks
Description: European Union Brexit negotiator, Michel Barnier said on Tuesday he expected the most difficult negotiations with London to come at the end of the process.

Headline: EU watchdog tells banks to Brexit-proof their capital
Description: Banks in the European Union must quickly Brexit-proof a special type of debt they use to shore up their capital defences, the EU's banks rescue agency said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU demands 'unilateral' power over UK banks' access after Brexit
Description: European Union governments will insist on their "unilateral" control over whether and how British banks can operate in the bloc after Brexit, ministers will agree on Tuesday ahead of their leaders' summit on Friday.

Headline: Britain withdraws offer to lead EU military force after Brexit
Description: Britain has withdrawn its offer to lead a European Union military force next year because of Brexit, the Ministry of Defence said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK business lobby says Brexit deal a victory for pragmatism
Description: The deal on Brexit transition gives British businesses 20 months of valuable time and marks the victory of pragmatism over politics, the head of British business lobby CBI said on Tuesday.

Headline: Rating firm DBRS picks Frankfurt as post-Brexit EU base
Description: Credit rating agency DBRS is to open a new office in Germany's financial capital Frankfurt and transfer some staff from London to ensure it can keep operating in the European Union after Brexit.

Headline: Irish Foreign Minister sees 'good progress' in Brexit transition agreement
Description: Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said an agreement between the European Union and Britain on Monday on a Brexit transition period represented "good progress" and made the British commitment to address Irish issues clearer.

Headline: DUP not concerned by Brexit transition deal - source
Description: Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party is not concerned by the British government's commitment on Monday to a "backstop" solution to avoid a hard post-Brexit border as no final agreement has been made, a party source said.

Headline: Factbox - EU, British concessions in post-Brexit transition deal
Description: The European Union on Monday agreed to give Britain a status-quo transition after Brexit until the end of 2020, though the deal - important to Prime Minister Theresa May and the business - came at the expense of another fudge over the Irish border.

Headline: Ireland says Brexit border deal 'legally firm'; DUP says not resolved
Description: The Irish government on Monday said an agreement that would leave Northern Ireland within the European Union's customs union after Britain leaves the EU was "legally firm," but Northern Ireland's largest party said the issue remained open for debate.

Headline: EU firms scale back presence in UK as Brexit nears - survey
Description: One in seven businesses from European Union countries with a presence in Britain have moved parts of their business out of the country because of concerns about disruption after Brexit, according to a survey published on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain wins fresh EU, NATO support over nerve attack
Description: Britain's foreign minister won further support from the European Union and NATO on Monday over a nerve agent attack on a former Russian double agent as he denounced Moscow's denials of involvement as "increasingly absurd".

Headline: Transition deal alone won't let banks stall Brexit moves - industry officials
Description: London-based banks and other financial firms won't put their Brexit moves on hold despite a transition deal between Britain and the European Union as it lacks full legal certainty, industry officials said on Monday.

Headline: Carmakers' group warns of post-Brexit customs, approvals mess
Description: European carmakers said they want Britain and the European Union to establish urgently how vehicle approvals, environmental targets and customs will work after Brexit to avert disastrous consequences for the automotive sector.

Headline: Sterling soars as EU announces Brexit transition deal for Britain
Description: Sterling surged on Monday after the European Union said it had agreed to grant London a status-quo transition after it exits the bloc next year, until the end of 2020.

Headline: Amid Brexit deal talk, EU summons envoys, media
Description: EU Brexit negotiators summoned national envoys and journalists at short notice on Monday as speculation mounted among diplomats of an interim deal to grant Britain a transition -- though some urged caution.

Headline: Trade body urges EU to scrap changes to supervision of funds
Description: A major revamp of how investment funds are managed and regulated in Europe appears to be aimed at taking business from Britain and should be scrapped because there is no evidence it is needed, leading international trade body ICI Global said.

Headline: Japanese companies call for EU-Japan trade deal to apply to UK during transition
Description: Japan's leading business bodies have called for Tokyo's trade deal with the European Union to apply to Britain during the around two year transition phase that will help smooth the UK's exit from the bloc.

Headline: French markets watchdog wants tougher rules for UK firms after Brexit
Description: The European Union system for granting financial market access to foreign firms must be toughened up given that a dominant financial centre will become a close neighbour after Brexit, the head of France's markets watchdog said on Thursday.

Headline: French regulator asks UK funds about Brexit plans
Description: France's financial markets regulator said on Thursday it had written to British-based investment firms active in the country  and French firms with UK clients to ask about their preparations for Brexit.

Headline: Hopes of Brexit transition deal face Irish barrier
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May and British businesses are banking on European Union leaders granting a Brexit transition deal next week but diplomats said they could face disappointment unless a deadlock is broken over the Irish border.

Headline: EU publishes draft text of Brexit treaty, some key issues unresolved
Description: The European Commission published on Thursday an updated draft text of the treaty that will regulate Britain's exit from the European Union on March 29th, 2019, but some of the key sticking points remain unresolved.

Headline: Author of disputed Brexit blueprint for banks says gaining ground
Description: A disputed blueprint for financial services trade with the European Union after Brexit is finding favour with Britain's government, the financial lawyer who wrote the proposal said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK's devolved nations see potential deal over post-Brexit power-sharing
Description: Scotland and Wales are within reach of a deal with the central government over power-sharing, Scotland's Nicola Sturgeon said on Wednesday, easing the pressure on the British government as it negotiates its exit from the European Union.

Headline: Outgoing UK financial regulator says City's future uncertain due to Brexit
Description: London's future as a global financial centre is uncertain because of Brexit and Britain faces a tough task to secure European Union market access for its banks and insurers, a top UK regulator said on Wednesday as he steps down.

Headline: Payden & Rygel opens Milan office, optimistic on Brexit deal
Description: U.S. asset manager Payden & Rygel said on Wednesday it had opened a first continental European office, in Milan, but did not expect to have to turn it into a formal subsidiary as Britain leaves the European Union.

Headline: Sterling to spoil any boost to bonds from Brexit deal doubts
Description: Investors in short-dated sterling bonds could be the main winners if Britain and the European Union fail to hammer out the contours of a Brexit transition deal at a summit starting on March 22.

Headline: UK budget watchdog pencils in 37.1 billion pound Brexit bill
Description: Britain's government budget watchdog said on Tuesday it estimated the cost of settling Britain's outstanding liabilities to the European Union would be 37.1 billion pounds ($51.8 billion), three quarters of which would fall due in the next five years.

Headline: German industry needs Brexit clarity next week - BDI
Description: German companies on Tuesday demanded that Britain agree by next week to an interim phase based on the status quo for its transition from the European Union and said that otherwise they would implement 'worst case' contingency plans.

Headline: Time to turn Brexit speeches into treaties - EU's Juncker
Description: Speeches made about the future relationship between Britain and the European Union needed to be translated into treaties and agreements as soon as possible, EU Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU wants capital market plan in place before Brexit
Description: The European Union stepped up efforts on Monday to create a more unified and cheaper capital market by next year when it faces the loss of Britain, the bloc's biggest financial centre.

Headline: 'No deal' Brexit could cost UK, EU companies 58 billion pounds - report
Description: Companies in Britain and the European Union face an extra 58 billion pounds in annual costs if there is a no-deal Brexit, with Britain's vast financial sector set to be the worst-hit industry, according to a report on Monday.

Headline: Britain still confident on winning transition deal at EU summit - spokesman
Description: Britain is still confident it can reach agreement with the European Union on a transition period after Brexit at an EU summit later this month, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Britain very close to Brexit transition deal with the EU -minister
Description: Britain is very close to agreeing the details of an implementation period with the European Union for its transition out of the bloc, junior Brexit minister Robin Walker said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit and NAFTA dispute making firms wary, says Canadian minister
Description: There are parallels between the way companies in North America and Britain are holding back on investment as they wait for clarity on the re-negotiation of NAFTA and the outcome of talks on a Brexit deal, Canada's finance minister said on Monday.

Headline: Britain, EU should aim for customs union - Germany's BDI industry lobby
Description: Germany's BDI	 industry body wants the European Union to agree a customs union with Britain to limit the impact on trade after it leaves the European Union, its managing director told the Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung newspaper.

Headline: UK border stance threatens to stall Brexit talks -EU's Tusk
Description: Brexit negotiations risk stalling if Britain does not present a realistic solution for the future of the Irish border after London rejected an EU fallback proposal last week, European Council President Donald Tusk said on Thursday.

Headline: UK should not favour financial services in Brexit - Labour Party
Description: Britain should not favour financial services over other sectors of the economy as it negotiates its future trading relationship with the European Union after Brexit, Labour Party finance spokesman John McDonnell said on Thursday.

Headline: Punishing UK for Brexit is 'language of a gang' - trade minister Fox
Description: Any suggestion from the European Union that Britain should be punished for leaving would turn it into a "gang", not a voluntary club of nations, and goes against the interests of EU member states, trade minister Liam Fox said on Thursday.

Headline: May UK rate rise still likely but Brexit obscures next moves - Reuters poll
Description: British interest rates are still expected to rise in May following a barrage of hawkish signals from Bank of England policymakers, but most economists polled by Reuters don't see a follow-up move for another year.

Headline: EU says finance sector ready for disorderly Brexit
Description: Financial businesses have realistic expectations about serving European Union customers after Britain leaves the bloc next year and could deal with a so-called hard Brexit, a top EU official said on Thursday.

Headline: EU lawmakers tell UK - post-Brexit deal should be about more than trade
Description: The European Parliament will call for a broad-based "association agreement" with Britain after Brexit that goes beyond a narrow focus on trade, according to a draft resolution to be voted on next week.

Headline: EU snubs Britain's post-Brexit trade demands, offers banks no special deal
Description: The EU on Wednesday offered Britain a free trade deal for their post-Brexit ties that fell well short of ambitions set out by Prime Minister Theresa May last week, notably for the country's dominant financial sector.

Headline: UK's Hammond - trade deal with EU will only happen if it is fair
Description: A trade deal between Britain and the European Union will only happen if it is fair to both sides, finance minister Philip Hammond said on Wednesday, adding that it would be hard not to include services as well as goods.

Headline: Goldman Sachs starts to transfer some senior bankers to Frankfurt due to Brexit
Description: Goldman Sachs is starting to move some senior bankers to Frankfurt in preparation for Britain's exit from the European Union, the investment bank's co-chief for Germany said on Wednesday.

Headline: Trade with Britain after Brexit won't be easier - EU's Tusk
Description: The chairman of European Union leaders, Donald Tusk, made clear on Wednesday that trade between the bloc and Britain would only get more difficult after Brexit.

Headline: Trade options for UK financial services after Brexit
Description: A stand-off between Britain and the European Union over the future of London's vast financial services industry is shaping up as one of the key Brexit battlegrounds of this year.

Headline: EU-UK trade deal could be deeper, but modelled on Canada, Japan accords - Tajani
Description: Britain and the European Union could negotiate a deeper free-trade accord that goes beyond the bloc's new deals with Canada and Japan, but such agreements remain the model, the head of the European Parliament said on Wednesday.

Headline: Banks line up behind British government in EU trade battle
Description: Banks and insurers lined up to back the British government's demand that a future trade deal with the European Union must include financial services, putting them on a collision course with Brussels.

Headline: Britain says financial services must be in Brexit deal after EU rejects plan
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Wednesday that financial services should be at the heart of a new trade deal and the European Union should drop its tough stance on limiting the sector's market access after Brexit.

Headline: EU to propose limited market access for British-based banks - Bloomberg
Description: The European Union plans to offer British-based financial services companies only limited access to the Single Market after Brexit, according to a draft document quoted by Bloomberg.

Headline: France rejects Britain's plan for banks to access EU after Brexit
Description: France said that it was not taking a hard line in Brexit talks on Tuesday but that it saw little chance of securing a free trade deal for financial services that would provide the degree of access sought by Britain's biggest taxpaying sector.

Headline: Paris to get thousands of jobs due to Brexit - French finance minister
Description: Several thousands jobs will probably be relocated to Paris as a result of Britain's decision to leave the European Union, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Tuesday during a visit to London.

Headline: France not taking hardline in Brexit talks - minister
Description: France is not taking a particularly hard line in Brexit negotiations as sometimes suggested in the British press, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said in London on Tuesday.

Headline: EU cool towards British "associate membership" in bloc's agencies
Description: The European Union is cool to the idea of Britain's "associate membership" in various agencies of the bloc as proposed by London to make Brexit less disruptive for British business, with officials saying the approach boils down to cherry picking.

Headline: Brexit deal on citizens' rights close - EU's Verhofstadt
Description: Britain and the European Union are close to agreeing a deal guaranteeing the rights of expatriate citizens after Brexit, the European Parliament's Brexit negotiator, Guy Verhofstadt, said on Tuesday after meeting Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: UK parliament will not be able to overturn EU referendum - David Davis
Description: Parliament will not be able thwart Brexit by using a vote expected later this year on the final deal negotiated with the European Union to overturn the result of the 2016 referendum, Brexit secretary David Davis said on Tuesday.

Headline: Aston Martin says failure to agree Brexit transition could delay sale
Description: Aston Martin's market window for a sale or stock market listing may close for at least another year if no deal is reached on a Brexit transition period, the British sports car maker's chief executive told Reuters.

Headline: EU agrees first defence projects, delays decision on British role
Description: A group of European Union countries agreed on Tuesday to develop their first joint defence projects under a pact that excludes Britain, giving London a taste of life outside the bloc's foreign policy decision-making process.

Headline: Ford calls for Brexit clarity to help it make UK investment decision
Description: Ford  needs clarity on post-Brexit trading conditions as it decides on future investment in Britain, the carmaker's Europe boss told Reuters on Monday.

Headline: Irish PM says U.S.-Canada not a border example for Northern Ireland
Description: The border between the United States and Canada does not provide an example for how to solve the issue of the future border between Ireland and Northern Ireland after Brexit, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Monday.

Headline: UK does not plan to produce rival Brexit legal text - Hammond
Description: Britain does not plan to produce its own draft version of a legal text setting out some of the arrangements around Brexit before a meeting later this month of European Union leaders, finance minister Philip Hammond said on Monday.

Headline: UK wants financial services to be in Brexit deal with EU - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday that she wanted financial services to be part of a deal on the country's new relationship with the European Union after Brexit, echoing comments she made in a speech last week.

Headline: UK business growth gauge rises to two-year high - CBI
Description: British businesses grew at the fastest rate in more than two years in the three months to February, despite uncertainty about Britain's prospects as it prepares to leave the European Union, the Confederation of British Industry said on Sunday.

Headline: May defends stance on post-Brexit financial services rules
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May defended her decision to rule out so-called 'passporting' rights for banks after Brexit, saying Britain could not become a "rule taker" when it came to financial services.

Headline: Hardliners give cautious welcome to May's Brexit vision
Description: The head of a hardline group of pro-Brexit lawmakers on Saturday gave a cautious welcome to Prime Minister Theresa May's plans for Britain's future ties with Europe, saying now was not the time to nitpick.

Headline: Setting out Brexit vision, Britain's May appeals to EU to show flexibility
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May urged the European Union on Friday to show more flexibility in talks on a future relationship after Brexit, saying Britain realised it could not get all it wanted but believed an ambitious trade deal was still possible.

Headline: Airbus says Brexit still unclear as it faces extra costs
Description: Airbus  urged Britain on Friday to provide more clarity on post-Brexit customs rules as it faces an imminent rise in spending to start preparing for possible delays in the movement of aircraft parts.

Headline: Irish PM says remains concerned about UK Brexit position
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar on Friday said he remained concerned that British Prime Minister Theresa May did not fully recognise the implications of leaving the European Union's customs union and single market.

Headline: Reaction to May's speech on Brexit
Description: Following are reactions to British prime minister Theresa May's speech on Friday setting out her priorities for Brexit ahead of negotiations this year on a new relationship with the European Union.

Headline: As May readies trade speech, Tusk sees difficulties
Description: "Real political difficulties" lie ahead for Brexit, EU summit chair Donald Tusk said after Prime Minister Theresa May gave him a preview of the vision of future trade ties she will unveil on Friday.

Headline: May to make 'real step forward' in EU talks with Friday speech
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will set out her vision for an "ambitious economic partnership" with the European Union on Friday, which her team of ministers agreed would be a "real step forward" in talks with the bloc, her spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: Dutch PM rejects 'romance' of ever closer European union
Description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte on Friday rejected the notion that the European Union is on an inevitable path towards greater political integration after Britain leaves next year, and he called for a narrower focus on projects with an economic payoff.

Headline: EU's Barnier welcomes 'clarity' in May Brexit speech
