Description: The European Union's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier welcomed "clarity" from Prime Minister Theresa May on Friday and her recognition that Britain faces "trade-offs" when it leaves the EU single market and customs union.

Headline: Factbox - May sets out stance for new trade ties with EU
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May delivered a speech on Friday setting out her priorities for Brexit ahead of negotiations to forge a new relationship with the European Union.

Headline: May says close to agreeing Brexit implementation period terms
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday Britain was close to agreeing the terms with Brussels of an implementation period that will help smooth the country's exit from the European Union.

Headline: May says ECJ cannot be ultimate arbiter after Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday the European Court of Justice could not be the ultimate arbiter of any disputes that develop between Britain and the European Union after Brexit.

Headline: May says will not let Brexit risk Northern Irish progress
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday she would not let the United Kingdom's exit from the European Union jeopardise the progress made on securing peace in Northern Ireland.

Headline: May says need for reciprocal binding trade agreements after Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday Britain's future trading relationship with the European Union would need to maintain links and ensure reciprocal binding agreements.

Headline: May sets out plans to maintain frictionless trade after Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday she wanted to maintain close ties between Britain and the European Union on regulations and standards after Brexit, in a bid to prevent goods from being delayed at the border.

Headline: May says Britain could enter into customs partnership with EU
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday Britain could enter into a customs partnership with the European Union after Brexit, with a highly streamlined customs arrangement at the border reducing any delays at ports and airports.

Headline: May says will uphold environmental standards after Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday Britain would seek to uphold environmental standards after Brexit and manage its fishing stocks in a sustainable way.

Headline: May says sectors would need to abide by EU rules to retain position post-Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday Britain would seek to remain within certain EU regulatory agencies such as those governing chemicals, aviation, and medicine, in order to retain market position.

Headline: Highlights - May sets out Brexit vision for trade deal deeper than any other
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May set out her vision on Friday for a Brexit deal deeper and wider than any free trade agreement in the world, telling the European Union it is in their "shared interest".

Headline: May says message to EU is clear: "let's get on with it"
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday Britain would not be buffeted by European Union demands in divorce talks nor would threaten to walk out of negotiations, adding her message to the bloc was "let's get on with it".

Headline: Britain to protect Hungarians' rights in UK after Brexit - Johnson
Description: Britain will remain committed to the security and defence of Central Europe after Brexit, and will protect the rights of Hungarians working in the United Kingdom, Foreign Minister Boris Johnson said on Friday.

Headline: May tells Tusk EU draft legal text would undermine the UK
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May told European Council President Donald Tusk on Thursday the European Commission's draft legal text on Brexit is unacceptable to Britain, her office said, after a meeting aimed resolving differences with the bloc.

Headline: EU's negotiator says Britain can only get a free-trade deal now
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator said on Thursday that London's stance on its future ties with the bloc only left a free trade agreement as an option.

Headline: EU's Tusk talks 'real political difficulties' on Brexit with May - source
Description: The chairman of European Union leaders, Donald Tusk, and British Prime Minister Theresa May discussed on Thursday the "real political difficulties ahead" on Brexit, an EU official said.

Headline: Blair, in Brussels, urges EU to help Britons stop Brexit
Description: Former British premier Tony Blair called in Brussels on Thursday for European Union leaders to commit to reforms, notably on migration, to help convince Britons not to go ahead with leaving the bloc next year.

Headline: EU says to regulate Northern Irish trade unless Britain acts fast
Description: The European Union on Wednesday laid out how it would regulate Northern Ireland's trade if no better solution was found in the fast-closing window before Britain's departure from the EU, prompting furious reactions in London and Belfast.

Headline: Facebook says finds no new evidence Russia interfered in Brexit referendum
Description: Facebook Inc  has told a British parliamentary committee that further investigations have found no new evidence that Russia used social media to interfere in the June 2016 referendum in which Britain voted to leave the European Union.

Headline: Britain sets out dividing lines on EU citizens' rights
Description: European Union citizens arriving in Britain during a post-Brexit transition period will be able to apply for indefinite leave to stay in the country but their rights will be governed by British, not EU law, the government said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain's parliament should have free vote to reject Brexit - former PM Major
Description: Former British Prime Minister John Major called on Wednesday for a free vote in parliament on whether to reject any deal negotiated with the European Union, warning the current plans are "bad politics" that will damage the economy.

Headline: EU, Japan seek to push through trade deal before Brexit
Description: The European Union and Japan are rushing to ensure that their planned free trade agreement can enter force early in 2019, ideally before Britain leaves the EU, the lead negotiators of both sides said on Wednesday.

Headline: Agreeing a customs union with EU would betray Brexit - May
Description: Agreeing a new customs union with the European Union after Brexit would be a betrayal of the 2016 referendum, British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday, challenging the opposition Labour Party over its plans.

Headline: May to make Brexit policy statement to parliament on Monday - speaker
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will make a statement to parliament about Brexit on Monday, the speaker of parliament's lower house said on Wednesday.

Headline: May sticks by December Brexit commitments, cannot agree EU draft text
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May sticks by the commitments she made on Brexit in a joint report with the European Union in December, but cannot agree to a draft legal text the bloc published on Wednesday, her spokesman said.

Headline: Johnson says Northern Irish border issue being used to frustrate Brexit
Description: The issue of Northern Ireland's border with the Republic of Ireland is being used to try and keep Britain in a customs union with the European Union and frustrate Brexit, Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said on Wednesday.

Headline: EU withdrawal text constitutionally unacceptable - DUP leader
Description: The draft of a Brexit treaty that the European Commission published on Wednesday is "constitutionally unacceptable", the leader of the Northern Ireland party that props up Britain's minority government said.

Headline: May says EU draft legal text would undermine the UK
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said a draft legal text on Brexit published by the European Commission on Wednesday would undermine the United Kingdom's common market and threaten its constitutional integrity.

Headline: EU-UK committee to oversee Irish border deal - draft Brexit treaty
Description: A joint committee between the European Union and Britain shall oversee arrangements for the Irish border, the bloc said in its draft withdrawal treaty published on Wednesday, also setting out a special zone covering Ireland and Northern Ireland.

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP says proposed Irish border arrangements 'will not go anywhere'
Description: Reported details of a draft Brexit treaty between Britain and the EU, notably regarding proposals for a hard border with Ireland, are a "ludicrous" suggestion that will not go anywhere, the deputy leader of the Northern Ireland party that props up Britain's minority government said.

Headline: BoE puts premium on solving post-Brexit insurance puzzle
Description: Avoiding chaos in the insurance market due to Britain's European Union exit is a top Bank of England priority and making sure cross-border contracts continue to pay out after Brexit is a major concern, its deputy governor Sam Woods said.

Headline: Scotland, Wales defy London with bills to keep powers after Brexit
Description: The Scottish and Welsh governments said on Tuesday they will introduce bills into their parliaments aimed at keeping regional powers that come back from Brussels after Brexit, in a move that could complicate British plans to leave the EU.

Headline: EU's Barnier warns time running out for Brexit deal
Description: EU negotiator Michel Barnier accused the British government on Tuesday of clinging to "illusion" while time runs out for a Brexit deal to avoid massive disruption when Britain leaves the European Union next year.

Headline: EU's Barnier warns time running out for Brexit deal
Description: EU negotiator Michel Barnier accused the British government on Tuesday of clinging to "illusion" while time runs out for a Brexit deal to avoid massive disruption when Britain leaves the European Union next year.

Headline: Differences with EU over Brexit transition are normal - May's spokesman
Description: Differences between Britain and the European Union over what a Brexit transition period should look like are normal, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday, responding to comments from EU chief negotiator Michel Barnier.

Headline: Britain's trade choice - EU customs union or going it alone?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has said Britain will not join a customs union with the European Union after Brexit, splitting her ruling Conservative Party and upsetting many business leaders.

Headline: Staying in a customs union would betray Brexit voters, minister says
Description: Britain’s trade minister Liam Fox attacked the opposition Labour’s party plans to remain in a customs union with the European Union on Tuesday, calling it a betrayal of the millions of people who voted for Brexit.

Headline: German firms doing business in UK gloomy about Brexit - survey
Description: German businesses that trade in Britain are pessimistic about their prospects there, and some are planning to move operations to other markets, a survey by Germany's DIHK Chambers of Industry and Commerce showed on Tuesday.

Headline: Not in EU or Britain's interest to restrict trade after Brexit - Fox
Description: It would not make sense for either the European Union or Britain to restrict business after Brexit, Britain's international trade minister Liam Fox said on Tuesday as he warned against staying in a customs union with the bloc.

Headline: EU's Barnier firmly rules out British 'cherry-picking' on Brexit
Description: The European Union's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier firmly ruled out on Tuesday Britain "cherry-picking" the aspects of the EU it liked when it leaves the bloc.

Headline: Scotland to introduce own Brexit bill, increasing pressure on UK government
Description: Scotland's devolved government will shortly introduce its own, alternative Brexit bill, increasing pressure on the UK government over legislation needed to pass in Britain's national parliament.

Headline: Macron says UK-EU customs union would not offer full access to single market
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday said a post-Brexit customs union between Britain and the European Union was possible but would rule out full access to the single market, making reference to the bloc's relationship with Turkey.

Headline: UK will continue talking to devolved governments over Brexit - May's spokesman
Description: Britain will continue talking with its devolved governments about the Brexit settlement, a spokesman for British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday.

Headline: Hammond says will speak next week on Brexit deal for services
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond will make a speech next week on how Britain will be able to secure a Brexit deal with the European Union that includes services as well as goods, he said on Tuesday.

Headline: Putting pressure on May, Labour backs new customs union with EU
Description: Britain should enter a new customs union with the European Union, Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Monday, setting up a possible parliamentary defeat for Prime Minister Theresa May who has vowed to leave the arrangement after Brexit.

Headline: UK financial regulators seen endorsing Brexit transition deal - industry
Description: Britain's financial regulators are expected to formally endorse a Brexit transition deal in a bid to reassure firms concerned about disruptions to their operations after March 2019, the head of the Association of British Insurers (ABI) said on Tuesday.

Headline: Foreign Secretary Johnson says post-Brexit UK will not remain subject to ECJ rulings
Description: British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said on Tuesday Britain would not remain subject to rulings from the European Court of Justice (ECJ) under any deal struck following the country's exit from the European Union.

Headline: Tory MP calls government Brexit advice to firms "extraordinary"
Description: The head of a British parliamentary committee criticised the government on Tuesday for advising companies to prepare for Brexit without first telling them what to expect when the country quits the European Union.

Headline: Corbyn says Brexit must not leave Britain worse off
Description: Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Monday that Brexit must not leave the country worse off and that his party would try to get the best divorce deal for jobs and the economy.

Headline: UK must be able to influence EU trade deals after Brexit - Corbyn
Description: British opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Monday that Britain must be able to influence the European Union's trade deals if the country signs up to a new customs union with the bloc after Brexit.

Headline: Corbyn blasts May for 'rigid' position on immigration
Description: Opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Monday he would take a more flexible approach than Prime Minister Theresa May to immigration after Brexit, addressing one of the concerns of employers about the risks of leaving the European Union.

Headline: May to set out Brexit wishes; EU says ideas so far are 'pure illusion'
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will outline her wishes for Britain's post-Brexit ties with the European Union next week after winning support from key ministers, although European Council President Donald Tusk on Friday called the ideas floated so far "pure illusion".

Headline: EU leaders draw up battle lines for post-Brexit budget
Description: European Union leaders staked out opening positions on Friday for a battle over EU budgets that many conceded they are unlikely to resolve before Britain leaves next year, blowing a hole in Brussels' finances.

Headline: EU leaders resist push for elected Commission chief, merging of posts
Description: European Union leaders rejected on Friday a push to have the head of the EU's executive European Commission determined by voting in elections to the European Parliament, or to merge that job with that of the chairman of EU summits.

Headline: UK ideas on post-Brexit ties are 'pure illusion', EU's Tusk says
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk on Friday dismissed as "pure illusion" the ideas floated by Britain so far on what sort of relationship it wants with the European Union after it leaves the bloc.

Headline: EU leaders agree to spend more on migration, defence, security
Description: European Union leaders agreed on Friday to spend more on common defence and security policy, as well as on "fighting illegal migration" in their next long-term budget after Britain leaves the bloc, the chairman of EU leaders, Donald Tusk, said.

Headline: Tusk expects joint EU stance on post-Brexit ties with Britain in March
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said on Friday he expected the 27 European Union leaders to adopt their joint stance on the bloc's post-Brexit ties with Britain in March, regardless of whether London provides input.

Headline: After war cabinet, May to set out 'way forward' on Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will set out "the way forward" for Brexit next week after a meeting with top aides on Thursday intended to resolve differences over strategy that are dividing her team, and frustrating European Union negotiators.

Headline: Chance of halting Brexit now close to 50:50, says leading campaigner
Description: Opponents of Britain's exit from the European Union are preparing a major campaign they say now has close to a 50:50 chance of stopping Brexit by blocking Prime Minister Theresa May's divorce deal, a leading pro-EU campaigner said.

Headline: Who sucks? EU mocks Gove 'green Brexit' talk on plastic straws
Description: A top European Union official scoffed at Britain's environment minister, the Brexit campaigner Michael Gove, for suggesting leaving the EU will make it easier for London to pass green legislation like banning plastic drinking straws.

Headline: Highlights - EU leaders' summit on top jobs and future budget
Description: European Union leaders meet in Brussels on Friday for an informal summit to discuss the future post-Brexit budget and other issues, such as how to determine the next European Commission president and what to do with Britain's seats in the European Parliament.

Headline: Hammond says government Brexit talks 'constructive'
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Friday that talks the previous evening to soothe Brexit differences within Prime Minister Theresa May's government had been "positive and constructive".

Headline: Legal limbo looms for banks in Brexit transition tumult
Description: Even if Britain agrees a Brexit transition deal with the European Union next month, bankers and regulators say it is unlikely to provide the legal certainty they are seeking.

Headline: Gove says May's Brexit meeting 'agreed on the way forward'
Description: British Environment Secretary Michael Gove said Thursday's meeting with Prime Minister Theresa May and her senior ministers on Brexit went well with agreement on strategy reached.

Headline: Labour would seek to replicate customs union post Brexit
Description: If Britain's Labour Party won power it would seek to join a new customs union with the European Union after Brexit, according to the opposition party's spokeswoman for foreign affairs.

Headline: UK to align auto regulations with EU post Brexit - health minister
Description: Britain will align its regulations with the European Union's in some areas, such as the automotive sector, after it leaves the bloc in 2019, health minister Jeremy Hunt said on Friday.

Headline: British ship insurer Steamship opts for Dutch hub as Brexit hedge
Description: British ship insurer Steamship Mutual plans to set up a new Dutch subsidiary to ensure continued access to trade in the European Union in case Britain loses single market access.

Headline: EU rejects three-pronged British approach to new ties after Brexit
Description: The European Union would not agree to a post-Brexit deal in which Britain would stick to the bloc's rules in some areas, diverge moderately in others and go for distinctively different solutions for the rest, sources in Brussels said.

Headline: UK, Scotland edge towards deal on devolved powers after Brexit
Description: Scotland said on Thursday progress was being made towards a deal to ensure that all devolved powers transfer back to Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland after Brexit.

Headline: UK will be able to sign trade deals during Brexit transition - May's spokesman
Description: Britain will be able to agree and sign trade deals during a transition period after it leaves the European Union, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Thursday after some Brexit campaigners feared a new document cast doubt on the ability to trade independently.

Headline: Leaders to discuss EU money, top jobs after Brexit
Description: Money and top jobs will be the main topics of an informal summit of 27 European Union leaders on Friday, as the bloc tries to deal with the consequences of Britain's exit from the EU in 2019.

Headline: EU guidelines on future British relations due in March, with or without London's input
Description: European Union leaders will issue guidelines for chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier in March on the future relationship he should negotiate with Britain, regardless of whether London clarifies what it wants, a senior EU official said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit reversal: Pro-Europe bus gets stuck on streets of London
Description: An anti-Brexit campaign bus was forced into a reversal of its own on Wednesday as it got stuck in a narrow side-street in central London during its first day on the road.

Headline: Britain wants to discuss length of Brexit transition with EU
Description: Britain wants to discuss the length of any post-Brexit transition period with the European Union, but believes that around two years should be enough time to prepare "new processes" and "new systems", according to a draft paper.

Headline: Brexit customs deal may still lead to Irish border checks - minister
Description: Border checks could be required on the island of Ireland even if Britain strikes a "very satisfactory" customs agreement with the European Union if the post-Brexit deal does not keep standards aligned, Ireland's agriculture minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: May wants EU citizens to stay after Brexit
Description: Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she wants all European Union citizens lawfully living in Britain to remain after Brexit in 2019 and promised a streamlined system for them to register to be able to stay.

Headline: EU should raise fossil fuel taxes to plug Brexit budget gap - former officials
Description: The European Union should raise taxes on fossil fuels to help meet goals on climate change and plug a budget gap after Britain leaves the bloc, former senior EU officials said in a letter to EU leaders.

Headline: Hard Brexit faction in May's party demands clean break from EU
Description: More than 60 Conservative lawmakers have written to Theresa May demanding a quick, clean break from the European Union, adding pressure on the prime minister before her ministers meet to decide Britain's negotiating position.

Headline: Britain still wants Brexit implementation phase of around two years - source
Description: Britain still wants an implementation phase with the European Union of around two years, a government source said on Wednesday, saying there was no change in the government's Brexit policy.

Headline: Britain urges EU to work jointly on Brexit deal, won't undercut rivals
Description: Brexit minister David Davis said on Tuesday Britain and the European Union could reach a deal to access each others' markets and dismissed fears Britain would use Brexit to cut regulation to attract global businesses, despite past threats to do so.

Headline: As clock ticks, UK manufacturers demand clarity on Brexit
Description: With little more than a year to go before Britain leaves the European Union, many British manufacturers are stepping up their calls for Prime Minister Theresa May and her government to explain what Brexit will mean for them.

Headline: Johnson says UK can leave customs union and have no hard border in Ireland
Description: Britain should be able to leave the European Union's single market and customs union and still ensure there is no hard border in Ireland after Brexit, Foreign minister Boris Johnson said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK promises post-Brexit agriculture plan as farmers demand more clarity
Description: The British government will publish a consultation paper on future agriculture policy "very shortly", Environment Minister Michael Gove said on Tuesday, as farmers demanded more clarity on their prospect after the country quits the European Union.

Headline: Ford aims to set up German bank this year to offset any Brexit risk
Description: Ford  said on Tuesday it hopes to set up a bank in Germany in the second half of the year after applying for a licence in the country as part of its strategy to mitigate any risk from Britain leaving the European Union.

Headline: Brexit prompts Euroclear to open settlement unit in Ireland
Description: Pan-European securities settlement house Euroclear will open a new unit in Ireland in March next year to avoid Brexit disrupting its ability to process Irish stock and bond transactions.

Headline: Britain confident of securing Brexit deal, urges EU to work together
Description: Brexit minister David Davis said on Tuesday he was certain Britain and the European Union could reach a deal but urged the bloc to see securing an agreement as a "mutual endeavour".

Headline: Britain does not want to undermine the EU after Brexit - Davis
Description: Britain does not want to undermine the European Union after it leaves the bloc, instead it wants to become a respectful partner in driving new standards for a changing economy, Brexit minister David Davis said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain is setting out its vision for future EU ties - May's spokesman
Description: Britain's government is setting out what it wants to achieve from its future partnership with the European Union, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Monday, countering criticism that ministers are still divided over Brexit.

Headline: Rotterdam Port CEO 'preparing for the worst' with Brexit
Description: The Port of Rotterdam is bracing for a British exit from the European Union without any deal on customs, and looking at measures such as hiring 100 extra customs agents and dozens of fresh produce inspectors.

Headline: Partial UK-EU customs union could solve Brexit impasse - employers
Description: Britain and the European Union could reduce their differences over future trade ties by agreeing a compromise deal that would keep a chunk of British exports within the EU's customs union after Brexit, a British employers' group said.

Headline: May heads to Berlin to face tough German line on Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May travels to Berlin on Friday to meet German leader Angela Merkel, hoping to overcome near-deadlock in her attempts to negotiate a Brexit deal with the European Union.

Headline: Germany gives UK banks until June to secure access post-Brexit
Description: UK banks wanting to secure a foothold in Germany after Brexit should submit their applications for a banking licence by June, Bundesbank director Andreas Dombret said on Thursday.

Headline: Johnson keeps hard Brexit stance in speech aimed at mending fences
Description: British foreign minister Boris Johnson showed little sign of softening his tough stance on Brexit in a speech on Wednesday that was intended to soothe the concerns among pro-European Union voters about the economic impact leaving the bloc.

Headline: UK might stay aligned with some EU regulations - Johnson
Description: Britain may choose to remain aligned with European Union standards for some products to help trade after Brexit, British foreign minister Boris Johnson said on Wednesday, but London  must have ultimate control over national regulatory decisions.

Headline: UK border and immigration system unprepared for Brexit - report
Description: Government delays, uncertainty and under-resourcing have left the British borders and immigration system unprepared for Brexit, according to a parliamentary report on Wednesday.

Headline: With no time for Brexit, Macron sets out plans to redraw EU political map
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said he would not waste too much of his time on Brexit and would instead seek to redraw the map of "ossified" EU politics by launching an initiative of European progressives for EU elections next year.

Headline: Macron says doesn't want to waste too much time over Brexit
Description: French President Macron said on Tuesday he did not want to waste time over negotiations concerning Britain's departure from the European Union and that it was in the EU's interest that Michel Barnier was the bloc's only negotiator.

Headline: EU should be firm with Britain but not punish it, French spokesman says
Description: Europeans should take a firm line in negotiations over Britain's exit from the European Union but not seek to punish or humiliate London, the French government's spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Farage warns 'Brexit betrayal' would plunge UK into crisis
Description: If Prime Minister Theresa May allows Brexit to be watered down or halted by supporters of European Union membership, Britain will be thrust into its gravest constitutional crisis since World War Two, Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage said.

Headline: Investor Soros pledges new donation to pro-EU group
Description: Billionaire financier George Soros will pledge an additional 100,000 pounds to Best for Britain, a campaign group seeking to keep Britain in the European Union, the group said in an email to Reuters.

Headline: May to set out 'Road to Brexit' in speech
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will attempt to unite her feuding cabinet and convince a sceptical European Union that Britain knows what it wants from Brexit in a series of speeches over the next few weeks.

Headline: 'Common sense will prevail' on Brexit transition deal - Penny Mordaunt
Description: British aid minister Penny Mordaunt said on Sunday she believed the government would be able to strike a transitional Brexit deal with the European Union.

Headline: EU's Barnier warns Britain post-Brexit transition 'not a given'
Description: A post-Brexit transition is "not a given", Michel Barnier warned Britain on Friday, saying London had "substantial" objections to the European Union's offer and that parts of it were not up for negotiation.

Headline: Bank of England's Cunliffe warns EU over curbing cross-border funds after Brexit
Description: Curbing the ability of asset managers located in Britain to run funds based in the European Union after Brexit would be costly and inefficient and could fragment markets, Bank of England Deputy Governor Jon Cunliffe said on Friday.

Headline: Britain 'surprised' EU unclear on its position over transition period
Description: Brexit minister David Davis said on Friday he was surprised to hear that the European Union's chief negotiator Michel Barnier was unclear on Britain's demands in any transition period.

Headline: EU's Barnier warns Britain post-Brexit transition 'not a given'
Description: A post-Brexit transition period is "not a given", the European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier warned Britain on Friday, saying London had raised "substantial" issues with the plan proposed by the bloc.

Headline: Ford has applied for German banking licence due to Brexit - Frankfurter Allgemeine
Description: U.S. carmaker Ford  has applied for a banking licence in Germany to ensure its car financing business can continue on the continent once Britain leaves the European Union, a German newspaper said.

Headline: Japan warns on Brexit - we cannot continue in UK without profit
Description: Japan warned Prime Minister Theresa May on Thursday that its companies would have to leave Britain if trade barriers after Brexit made them unprofitable.

Headline: Britain scolds EU over plan to restrict single market access to UK during transition
Description: Brexit Secretary David Davis criticised the European Union's decision to publish a document that shows it has the power to restrict British access to the single market during a transition period after it leaves the bloc.

Headline: May's government has not yet finalised its Brexit strategy - Davis
Description: MPs still have not finalised an approach to Brexit after discussions led by Prime Minister Theresa May on the government's strategy this week, Brexit minister David Davis said on Thursday.

Headline: UK and Japanese firms agree on need for quickly agreeing post-Brexit free trade
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May and Japanese companies agreed on the need for Britain to secure the most open possible trade with the European Union after Brexit, a spokesman said.

Headline: EU doubts 2020 Brexit vision, sees longer goodbye
Description: The European Union believes Britain will not be ready to make a full break from the bloc by the end of 2020 as Brexit transition plans foresee and several senior EU figures said they are bracing for a much longer goodbye.

Headline: UK gave nothing firm to Japanese firms on keeping free trade after Brexit - source
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May and her ministers assured Japanese businesses of the importance of maintaining free and frictionless trade after Brexit but said nothing firm on the matter, a source familiar with the discussions told Reuters.

Headline: YouTube found no evidence of Russian interference in Brexit referendum
Description: YouTube found no evidence of Russian interference in the 2016 Brexit referendum, a senior executive told a British parliamentary committee inquiry into fake news.

Headline: Brexit a chance for Britain to build on ties with Japan - May
Description: Britain will have the opportunity to build on its relationship with Japan after it leaves the European Union, Prime Minister Theresa May told Japanese firms at a meeting in London on Thursday.

Headline: Japan tells UK on Brexit - If there is no profit, we cannot continue
Description: Japan's ambassador said on Thursday that no firm would be able to continue to operate in Britain if they are not profitable due to Brexit-related trade barriers.

Headline: Soros donation to halt Brexit causes storm in Britain
Description: News that billionaire financier George Soros is a backer of a campaign group seeking to keep Britain in the EU added fire to Britain's Brexit debate on Thursday, with supporters of quitting the bloc accusing opponents of plotting a "coup".

Headline: British insurers see China, India as top non-EU markets after Brexit
Description: Insurers see China and India as top priority non-EU markets once Britain leaves the European Union and want bilateral trade deals to ensure those states relax restrictions on foreign ownership, the Association of British Insurers (ABI) said on Thursday.

Headline: France's SocGen hiring for Brexit 'execution and delivery' team
Description: France's Societe Generale showed how banks are pushing ahead with Brexit contingency plans this week by advertising for someone to join the team reshaping its investment banking.

Headline: Britain will not hold a second EU vote after donation to stop Brexit: May's spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government will not hold a second referendum on Britain's membership of the European Union, her spokesman said on Thursday after the billionaire George Soros donated money to stop Brexit.

Headline: Bank of England to send new rates message in last year before Brexit
Description: The Bank of England is expected to say on Thursday that another interest rate increase could be nearing as Britain's economy grows faster than expected ahead of its departure from the European Union in just over a year's time.

Headline: Britons' Brexit citizenship case to be heard by EU court
Description: Britons dismayed by the loss of their European Union citizenship next year as a result of Brexit will have their complaints reviewed by the EU's top court following a ruling by a Dutch judge on Wednesday.

Headline: Curbing migration post-Brexit would be 'catastrophic' for Scotland - report
Description: Curbing migration after Britain leaves the European Union would be "catastrophic" for Scotland's economy, the devolved Scottish government said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain tells business - We cannot guarantee your Brexit future
Description: Britain cannot tell businesses for certain what its relationship with the European Union will be after Brexit, business secretary Greg Clark said on Wednesday, as ministers met to discuss the government's approach.

Headline: May promises to be robust with EU over Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she would be robust in her arguments during talks to leave the European Union, calling on parliament to disregard the "noise" surrounding the Brexit talks.

Headline: Irish finance minister expects UK to honour December Brexit deal
Description: Irish Finance Minister Paschal Donohoe said on Wednesday he still expected Britain to honour the pact it made with the European Union in December, which was designed to prevent a hard border developing between Northern Ireland and the Irish Republic after Brexit.

Headline: EU wants right to curb UK single market access during transition
Description: The European Union wants the power to restrict British access to the single market during a transition period after Britain leaves the bloc, as a way to punish London if it violates agreed rules, a document showed on Tuesday.

Headline: UK will detail post-Brexit immigration proposal 'as and when we're ready' - spokesman
Description: Britain will set out its proposals for a post-Brexit immigration system when it is ready, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Court rejects legal bid to show Britain could stop Brexit
Description: A Scottish court rejected on Tuesday a legal attempt to ask the European Court of Justice (ECJ) to clarify whether Britain could unilaterally stop the Brexit process.

Headline: Brexit hit to UK food prices pushes up spending in January - BRC retailers group
Description: Britain's shoppers carried on spending more on food in January, reflecting the rise in inflation since the Brexit vote, while they again cut back on non-essential purchases, a survey showed on Tuesday.

Headline: EU's chief negotiator tells Britain - Time has come to make a Brexit choice
Description: The European Union's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier told Britain on Monday that the time had come for Britain to make a choice on what sort of relationship it wanted with the bloc after Brexit.

Headline: Navigating Brexit’s choppy waters – with help from big data
Description: LONDON - To investigate whether Britain’s impending departure from the European Union would help or hurt the country’s fishing industry, the Reuters graphics team navigated an ocean of data.

Headline: UK watchdog calls for finance pact with EU to avoid Brexit chaos
Description: British and European Union watchdogs could sign a pact to avoid Brexit disrupting trillions of pounds in cross-border financial contracts and undermine market stability, a top UK regulator said on Monday.

Headline: EU tells Britain - Time has come to make a Brexit choice
Description: The European Union's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Monday that the time had come for Britain to make a choice on what sort of relationship it wanted with the bloc after Brexit.

Headline: Key dates in Brexit process
Description: British and EU negotiators this week hold their first formal Brexit talks since an interim deal in December unlocked discussions on their future relationship.

Headline: Britain offers two options for future customs ties with EU - May's spokesman
Description: Two possible forms of future customs ties between Britain and the European Union are still on the table as the two sides start talks on their future relationship, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday.

Headline: Navigating Brexit’s choppy waters – with help from big data
Description: LONDON - To investigate whether Britain’s impending departure from the European Union would help or hurt the country’s fishing industry, the Reuters graphics team navigated an ocean of data.

Headline: UK will not 'surrender' over bespoke Brexit deal with EU - minister
Description: Britain will not "surrender" in its fight to win a bespoke deal with the European Union that would offer tariff-free trade as well as control over immigration, a minister said on Sunday before a crunch week for the government in Brexit negotiations.

Headline: All Brexit economic forecasts were wrong, British minister says
Description: Brexit minister David Davis rekindled a debate about the credibility of the government's own forecasts by saying on Thursday that every economic prediction on the British economy since the EU referendum has been wrong.

Headline: Britain demands right to sign new trade deals during Brexit transition
Description: Brexit Secretary David Davis said on Thursday that Britain's right to sign new trade deals will be one of its main demands in talks with the European Union over the terms of any transition period.

Headline: Trade deal with Britain must prevent unfair tax, labour competition - EU
Description: The European Union is looking at ways to prevent Britain using low taxes, state subsidies or lower environmental and labour standards to gain a competitive edge over the EU after Brexit, EU diplomats said.

Headline: UK and EU set for clash over citizens' rights during transition
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has warned that European Union citizens arriving in Britain after Brexit next year may lose some rights, setting up a clash with the EU over their treatment during any transition period.

Headline: UK, China to hold joint trade and investment review
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping and British Prime Minister Theresa May agreed to hold a joint trade and investment review as the first step towards delivering an ambitious future trade agreement after Brexit, May's office said.

Headline: EU cannot guarantee Britain's rights vs. third states after Brexit
Description: The European Union cannot guarantee third countries will grant Britain the same benefits it currently enjoys from trade pacts and other agreements during the 21-month transition period after it quits the bloc.

Headline: Factbox - Parlez-vous Brexit? A 'Brexicon' of the UK-EU break-up
Description: As Britain's Brexit negotiations with the European Union move into a new phase, the process has generated a new language all of its own, some of it colourful, much of it mystifying to the uninitiated.

Headline: EU very clear on free movement during Brexit transition - Dombrovskis
Description: The European Union has been very clear that freedom of movement is a condition for continued single market access during the transition period easing Britain out of the bloc, European Commission Vice President Valdis Dombrovskis said on Thursday.

Headline: Reuters Graphic: British fishing could be on the hook post-Brexit
Description: British fishermen hopeful of a post-Brexit boom may find life outside the European Union choppier than expected, a Reuters Graphic shows.

Headline: EU holding line against passporting for British banks after Brexit
Description: European Union negotiators see no room for discussion with Britain on maintaining "passport" access to EU financial markets for its banks after Brexit, but they are willing to look at free trade in the sector, diplomats said.

Headline: EU car sales seen slowing in 2018 with Brexit risk - ACEA
Description: Car sales growth in the European Union are likely to slow to 1 percent in 2018, the European Automobile Manufacturers Association (ACEA) said on Wednesday, saying stricter rules on car emissions and Brexit were threats to the industry.

Headline: Trade rules mean even soft Brexit may hit investment into UK - expert
Description: The fine print of any future trade agreement between Britain and the European Union will have to be very carefully managed if London wants to avoid losing investment, a leading researcher on "rules of origin" in trade deals said on Wednesday.

Headline: Ryanair to put Brexit clause into ticket sales for summer 2019
Description: Irish budget airline Ryanair will put a "Brexit clause" into ticket sales for summer 2019, warning customers that their tickets will not be valid if the issue of aviation regulation after Britain's departure from the EU remains unresolved.

Headline: EU to put banks through Brexit mill in toughest stress test yet
Description: European Union banks will face the toughest "stress test" of their ability to withstand theoretical shocks this year, including the impact of Britain's exit from the bloc, the EU's banking watchdog said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK government will hand over Brexit analysis after damaging leak
Description: Britain's government said on Wednesday it would hand over to parliament a leaked report that suggested Brexit would hurt the economy, trying to deflect accusations that ministers are badly prepared for leaving the European Union.

Headline: UK parliament committee calls for immediate publication of leaked Brexit report
Description: Britain's government should immediately publish a leaked report about the economic costs of leaving the European Union, the lower house of parliament's Treasury Committee said on Wednesday.

Headline: Gibraltar says can implement Brexit selectively - report
Description: Gibraltar can choose elements of any Brexit deal Britain agrees with the European Union and avoid those it considers detrimental, the chief minister of the British territory said.

Headline: Irish Central Bank sees Brexit-related authorisations increasing
Description: Ireland's central bank expects to see an increase in Brexit-related authorisations from financial services firms looking to set to set up in the country or extend their current operations, governor Philip Lane said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit may hurt popular Erasmus student exchange scheme, officials say
Description: Britain's exit from the European Union may hurt one of the most popular programmes launched by the EU -- the Erasmus student exchange -- cutting the number of available destinations and participating students, officials said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain worse off in three Brexit scenarios, leaked analysis says
Description: Britain's economy will be worse off after Brexit whether it leaves the EU with a free trade deal, single market access, or with no deal at all, according to leaked analysis that fed the view that the government is badly prepared.

Headline: Britain will get stuck in long post-Brexit transition - EU lawmaker
Description: Britain is likely to get stuck in a long transition period in which it will pay the European Union and abide by its laws but have no say in the bloc's affairs, a European lawmaker handling Brexit said.

Headline: Leaked Brexit analysis is 'selective interpretation' of research - minister
Description: A leaked analysis on the economic impact of Brexit is a selective interpretation of early research and does not include Britain's desired outcome from the divorce, the country's junior Brexit minister told parliament on Tuesday.

Headline: Leaked Brexit analysis only 'initial' work - UK PM's spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May told her top team of ministers on Tuesday that a leaked analysis of the Brexit impact was only initial work that had not been approved by government, her spokesman said.

Headline: EU offers Brexit transition, but UK must 'accept rules'
Description: The European Union offered on Monday to let Britain keep its membership benefits for 21 months after Brexit to help businesses adapt but it rejected the idea that London could block new EU laws during the transition.

Headline: UK risks higher energy prices, supply shortages from Brexit - lawmakers
Description: Britain's decision to leave the European Union could lead to higher energy prices and energy supply shortages if the exit is not managed properly, a report by an upper-house parliamentary committee said on Monday.

Headline: Britain must be bound by EU changes during transition - EU's Barnier
Description: Britain will have to accept any legal changes the European Union makes during a 21-month transition period following its exit from the bloc, the EU's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Monday.

Headline: Britain welcomes EU agreement on transition terms
Description: Britain welcomed the European Union's agreement on Monday on transition terms after Brexit, with Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman saying the two sides' positions were well aligned.

Headline: Challenged on all fronts, May faces pressure over Brexit law
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May came under further pressure over her Brexit blueprint on Monday, with members of the upper house of parliament saying there were "fundamental flaws" in a law crucial to the departure.

Headline: Factbox: The EU's Brexit transition demands -- and what they mean
Description: EU ministers endorsed on Monday their instructions to Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier, setting the 27 states' demands on what Britain must do to secure a transition period after leaving the European Union on March 29, 2019.

Headline: EU offers UK 'status quo transition', but no votes after Brexit
Description: The European Union agreed on Monday to offer Britain a 21-month transition period after Brexit next year during which it will keep the "status quo" of EU membership without getting a vote, officials said.

Headline: Business survey says Brexit biggest threat to UK financial centre
Description: Uncertainty over Britain's future trading relations with the European Union after Brexit is the most serious threat to London as the world's top financial centre, a business survey showed on Monday.

Headline: Trump says he would negotiate Brexit with 'tougher' attitude than Theresa May
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump would take a "tougher" approach to Brexit negotiations than Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May, he said in a television interview to be broadcast later on Sunday.

Headline: I tweet from bed sometimes, U.S. President Trump says
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump, who has garnered a large following on social media with rambunctious postings, said he sometimes tweets from bed, though he occasionally allows others to post his words.

Headline: 'I am a stable genius,' Donald Trump says
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he was a stable genius and that he eats good quality food.

Headline: Lidington calls for unity after latest Brexit skirmishes
Description: Britain's Cabinet Office minister David Lidington urged his party to unite to heal growing rifts over how to leave the European Union that could threaten the prime minister's fragile grip on the leadership.

Headline: 'Door is open' if Britain wants to change mind on Brexit, says EU's Moscovici
Description: The "door is open" should Britain want to reverse its 2016 vote to leave the European Union, Pierre Moscovici, the European Commissioner for Economic and Monetary Union, told French media in an interview on Sunday.

Headline: Most Britons favour a vote on final Brexit terms - Guardian/ICM poll
Description: Most Britons would support a vote on whether or not to leave the European Union once the terms of departure are known, a poll by ICM for the Guardian newspaper said on Friday, but the result of a new vote would be too close to call.

Headline: Lawmakers say UK regulators could help city stay top dog in finance
Description: Britain could make it a requirement for regulators to help London remain a top global financial centre after Brexit, lawmakers said on Saturday in a report pitting parliament against the Bank of England.

Headline: UK ministers pledge business as usual with EU during Brexit transition
Description: Three British ministers wrote a joint letter to business leaders on Friday assuring them they will be able to trade with the EU as normal during a transition period before Britain finally leaves the bloc.

Headline: UK spells out Brexit transition demands as pressure mounts on May
Description: Britain wants to benefit from European Union trade deals and have a say over EU laws passed during its transition out of the bloc, Brexit minister David Davis said on Friday, seeking to defuse tension between senior ministers over the interim deal.

Headline: EU and UK negotiators eye accelerated Brexit transition talks
Description: British Brexit negotiators are expected to launch fortnightly rounds of talks in Brussels from as early as next week with the aim of agreeing a swift deal on a transition period, EU diplomats said on Friday.

Headline: Brexit minister says no difference with PM and finance minister over EU exit
Description: Britain's Brexit minister said there was no difference between himself, finance minister Philip Hammond and Prime Minister Theresa May over their aims on Brexit.

Headline: UK should access EU's trade deals during implementation phase - Davis
Description: Brexit minister David Davis said Britain should be able to access the European Union's existing trade deals with other nations during the implementation phase.

Headline: UK and Europe must follow same rules during Brexit implementation - Davis
Description: Britain's Brexit minister David Davis said Britain and Europe must follow the same rules during the implementation period to smooth the country's path out of the European Union.

Headline: Davis confident of political agreement over Brexit implementation by March
Description: Britain's Brexit minister David Davis said he was confident a political agreement could be reached at a European Union council meeting in March to secure a time-limited implementation period after the country leaves the bloc in March, 2019.

Headline: Hammond 'increasingly confident' of good access to EU markets after Brexit
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Friday he was increasingly confident that Britain would be able to get very good access to European Union markets after Brexit.

Headline: Hammond calls for very modest divorce from EU
Description: Britain's finance minister called for a modest Brexit on Thursday that would keep the world's sixth-largest economy as closely aligned as possible with the European Union after its 2019 exit.

Headline: EU signals some flexibility on Brexit transition
Description: The European Union is willing to be flexible on the duration and other terms of a Brexit transition period, EU diplomats said as Britain prepares to detail its hopes for what happens after it leaves the bloc in March 2019.

Headline: Two more lawmakers mull joining legal case to show UK can stop Brexit alone
Description: Two more lawmakers in Britain's national parliament are considering joining a legal case seeking to show that Britain can, if it chooses, alone change its mind on Brexit, intensifying its potential political scope.

Headline: Rees-Mogg urges May to change tone
Description: Britain's government must start promoting the opportunities from leaving the European Union and its negotiators should stop being "cowed by the EU," the leader of an influential parliamentary group in Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party said.

Headline: Brexit could mean JP Morgan moves more than 4,000 jobs from Britain
Description: JPMorgan  could move more than 4,000 jobs out of Britain if Brexit talks result in a divergence of regulations and trade agreements between Britain and the European Union, the U.S. banking giant's Chief Executive Jamie Dimon said on Thursday.

Headline: Irish PM says no sign of Britain backtracking on border deal
Description: There has been no sign that Britain intends to backtrack on the commitments it made in December on the Irish border and doing so would erode trust for the rest of the Brexit negotiations, Ireland's Prime Minister said on Thursday.

Headline: UK Brexit minister to set out transition aims on Friday - BBC political editor
Description: Brexit minister David Davis will set out Britain's approach to a post-EU membership transition period, the BBC's political editor said on Thursday.

Headline: France's Le Maire wants deal on Brexit transition, sees March agreement as possible
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Thursday he wanted the European Union to secure a deal with Britain on its Brexit transition process, and said an agreement by March was a possibility.

Headline: BoE's Carney sees 10 billion-pound Brexit hit to UK economy - Times
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney told business leaders that the 2016 Brexit vote is costing Britain's economy around 10 billion pounds a year, the Times newspaper said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit campaigners gear up for fight back to stop betrayal
Description: Brexit supporters are gearing up for a fightback against "ultra-Remainers" to ensure the result of Britain's referendum on leaving the European Union is fully respected, a prominent campaigner said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain is not a vassal state, says minister defending EU transition deal
Description: Brexit minister David Davis was forced to defend on Wednesday a transition deal with the European Union that leaves little changed, rejecting criticism that Britain will continue to be a "vassal state".

Headline: British EU space police axed by Brexit, moving to Spain
Description: A security centre for the European Union's Galileo navigation satellites will be moved from Britain to Spain because of Brexit, the EU executive said on Wednesday after a meeting of its commissioners.

Headline: Europe's Brexit serenade failing to lure many London bankers
Description: Frankfurt and Paris are set to see a trickle rather than a wave of London bankers arrive in 2018, with the prospect of a softer Brexit discouraging them from leaving Britain immediately, executives and lobbyists say.

Headline: Britain will not be 'vassal state' to the EU during transition - minister
Description: Britain will not be "vassal state" to the European Union during a transition period after Brexit, minister David Davis said on Wednesday, responding to criticism about plans to remain under the jurisdiction of the European Court of Justice.

Headline: Brexit minister expects agreement on transition deal by end of March
Description: Brexit minister David Davis said on Wednesday that he expects Britain and the European Union will agree to a transition deal on exiting the bloc by the end of March.

Headline: Don't worry, you won't be deported - UK minister tells EU citizens
Description: Brexit minister David Davis told EU citizens living in Britain on Wednesday not to worry about the country's departure from the European Union, saying they were not about to be deported.

Headline: UK will be subject to ECJ rulings under Brexit transition deal - minister
Description: Britain will remain subject to the rulings of the European Court of Justice during a transitional period, Brexit minister David Davis said on Wednesday.

Headline: Venezuela says 'petro' cryptocurrency pre-sale will be in hard currency
Description: Venezuela's "petro" cryptocurrency will initially be offered in a pre-sale in hard currency and other cryptocurrencies, the government said on Tuesday, and not initially available in the country's collapsing bolivar currency.

Headline: Empty British seats in EU parliament go up for grabs post-Brexit
Description: The European parliament on Tuesday began divvying-up British seats that will be left empty post-Brexit from 2019 with Spain, France, Italy and the Netherlands scooping up most initially.

Headline: Brexit implementation period has not been agreed with EU - PM May's spokesman
Description: Britain is still working to agree a transitional agreement on exiting the European Union, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday, after a report by The Independent that a deal had been reached.

Headline: Lloyds Bank readying Berlin base ahead of Brexit - source
Description: Lloyds Banking Group  aims to get its Berlin branch ready for business in Europe by the end of the year ahead of Britain leaving the European Union, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

Headline: Resigned to Brexit, Scots push case for staying in single market
Description: Scotland's government thinks campaigns to halt Brexit have little chance but believes it can persuade British negotiators to try to stay in the European Union's single market, a senior Scottish minister said on Monday.

Headline: French customs to hire hundreds of extra staff to cope with Brexit
Description: France will hire an extra 95 customs officers this year in a fast-track procedure to cope with the consequences of Brexit on its borders, officials said on Monday, bringing to 250 the number of additional British-focused staff recruited in 2018.

Headline: UK government under fire for leaving finance sector in dark on Brexit
Description: Business leaders have criticised Britain's government for its failure to publish a long-delayed paper on the future of its financial services industry after Brexit.

Headline: Jaguar Land Rover to cut output due to Brexit, diesel uncertainty to hit sales
Description: Britain's biggest carmaker Jaguar Land Rover  will temporarily reduce production at its northern English car plant in Halewood later this year in response to weakening demand due to Brexit and tax hikes on diesel cars.

Headline: Explainer - Britain's Lords sharpen knives for EU exit laws, but can they block Brexit?
Description: Legislation to end Britain's European Union membership begins months of debate in the upper house of parliament this month and is likely to be given a rough ride by largely pro-EU lawmakers.

Headline: British talks on trade deals outside EU received warmly - May's spokesman
Description: Britain will be leaving the EU's customs union to strike its own free trade deals and has had positive responses from countries with which ministers have held preliminary trade talks, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday.

Headline: UK government questions Scottish bid to show Britain can alone revoke Brexit
Description: The British government believes the question of whether it alone can stop Brexit is irrelevant, since it does not intend to change its mind about leaving the European Union, according to its response to a legal challenge by Scottish lawmakers opposed to Brexit.

Headline: Britain able to have bespoke deal with EU - Macron
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Saturday Britain would be able to have a bespoke deal with the European Union after Brexit, one of Prime Minister Theresa May's objectives.

Headline: Britain wants comprehensive trade deal with EU - May
Description: Britain wants to have a comprehensive trade deal with the European Union as well as a defence pact in place once its leaves the bloc, Prime Minister Theresa May said in remarks published in a German newspaper on Saturday.

Headline: Luxembourg to advocate 'delegation' model post-Brexit - finance minister
Description: Luxembourg's finance minister Pierre Gramegna said on Friday the European Commission should stick to the current rules that allow  funds managed in London to be domiciled and regulated in another country.

Headline: France says no for now to Johnson's idea of giant Channel bridge
Description: France on Friday politely rejected Boris Johnson's idea of building a giant bridge across the English Channel after Brexit, saying that, while far-fetched ideas were worth considering, there were plenty of major European projects to finish first.

Headline: London finance chief sees fewer jobs shifting because of Brexit
Description: Britain's vast financial services industry will suffer far fewer job losses from Brexit than first feared, the City of London's policy chief told Reuters, in remarks that will boost supporters of leaving the EU who say the threat has been exaggerated.

Headline: 'Be my guest' - France's Macron spells out reasons for Britain to stay in EU
Description: "Be my guest," French President Emmanuel Macron told Britain on Thursday, saying he would welcome any move by Prime Minister Theresa May to stay in the European Union's single market.

Headline: Macron hails UK defence cooperation, warns on single market post-Brexit
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday hailed the strength of Franco-British ties despite Brexit, but warned that he would not allow Britain's financial industry to have privileged access to the EU single market.

Headline: MPs back Brexit legislation, stiffer tests yet to come
Description: British MPs voted in favour of the government's legislative blueprint for Brexit on Wednesday, marking a victory for Prime Minister Theresa May over political opponents who want a softer approach to leaving the European Union.

Headline: Irish negotiator says 'challenging' to bring effect to Brexit border agreement
Description: It will be extremely challenging to give effect to the commitments made by the British government on the future of Northern Ireland's border, one of Ireland's lead Brexit negotiators said on Wednesday.

Headline: Facebook widens probe into alleged Russian meddling in Brexit
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Wednesday it would conduct a new, comprehensive search of its records for possible propaganda that Russian operatives may have spread during the run-up to Britain's 2016 referendum on EU membership.

Headline: House of Commons approves bill to sever EU ties
Description: Britain's lower house of parliament approved a bill on Thursday that will sever ties with the European Union, handing the legislation over to the upper chamber where it may face a more difficult journey.

Headline: Juncker says would like Britain to rejoin EU after Brexit
Description: EU chief executive Jean-Claude Juncker renewed an offer to Britain on Wednesday to stay in the European Union and said he hoped that even if it goes through with Brexit it would apply to rejoin the bloc.

Headline: Farage backs off second Brexit referendum talk as EU says UK still welcome
Description: Leading British anti-EU campaigner Nigel Farage rowed back on Wednesday from remarks favouring a second referendum on Brexit, a week after he unleashed a new round of debate and a chorus of invitations from European politicians for Britain to reconsider.

Headline: Second vote not undemocratic, Irish PM says on Brexit
Description: It would not be "anti-democratic" for Britons to reverse their Brexit vote in a second referendum, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said at the European Parliament on Wednesday, but he denied working to promote one.

Headline: Deutsche Bank to move fewer London jobs than expected due to Brexit
Description: Deutsche Bank  expects to move fewer staff than some senior officials had expected from London to the continent following Britain's departure from the European Union.

Headline: Macron promises steps on Calais migration, acknowledges Brexit worries
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron promised to stem the flow of migrants through the port of Calais on Tuesday, saying there would be no return to the "jungle" migrant camp, and said he understood the region's concerns about the threat from Brexit.

Headline: France's Macron vows no return of Calais migrant camp
Description: President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday said he would not allow another makeshift migrant camp to mushroom in the northern port city of Calais and pressed Britain to provide answers to French demands on the matter of unaccompanied children.

Headline: UK drugs regulator plays down Brexit disruption threat
Description: Britain's drugs regulator said on Tuesday it would work to minimise disruption caused by the country leaving the European Union as it tried to allay some of the worst fears of pharmaceutical companies.

Headline: UK's saving after Brexit even bigger than 350 million pounds, Johnson says
Description: Britain will have even more money to spend on public services than the disputed 350 million pounds a week Brexiteers promised after the country leaves the European Union, Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said in an interview published on Tuesday.

Headline: Dutch government says EU countries hurt most by Brexit shouldn't pay more into EU budget
Description: The Dutch finance minister said on Tuesday that it would not be fair for countries that stand to suffer disproportionately from lost trade after Britain leaves the European Union to also increase their contribution to the EU budget.

Headline: EU still open to Britain changing mind on Brexit
Description: Leaders of the European Union institutions weighed into a new British debate on whether to hold a second referendum on Brexit by saying on Tuesday that Britons would be welcome to stay in the EU.

Headline: May's spokesman - Britain will be leaving the EU
Description: Britain will be leaving the European Union, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday after European Council president Donald Tusk suggested the country would be welcome to change its mind and stay in the bloc.

Headline: BoE says details of Brexit transition deal needed by end March
Description: Banks in Britain will move operations to the European Union at a faster pace if there is no Brexit transition deal by the end of March, the Bank of England (BoE) said on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit creeps up UK risk managers' worry list - survey
Description: Risk specialists in British businesses are more worried about Brexit and other regulatory change than they were a year ago, though cyber attacks remain the biggest concern, a survey showed on Tuesday.

Headline: At port in northern France, Brexit occupies minds and looms over planning
Description: With construction underway, Jean-Marc Puissesseau may have to rework an 800 million euro (£712 million) project to double the capacity of Calais' port because of Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: Brexit vote may be reversed, says British campaigner Farage
Description: Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage said on Sunday he was increasingly concerned that a vote for Britain to leave the European Union could be overturned by a powerful group of the bloc's supporters.

Headline: British government will hold emergency meeting on Carillion, says minister
Description: The British government will hold a meeting of its COBRA emergency response committee on Monday to discuss Carillion's collapse, defence minister Gavin Williamson said.

Headline: UK parliamentary committee launches inquiry after Carillion collapse
Description: A British parliamentary committee said on Monday it would hold an inquiry into government sourcing practices following the collapse of contractor Carillion.

Headline: Sturgeon sees growing support for UK to stay in single market
Description: Scottish leader Nicola Sturgeon has sought to up the pressure on the British government to stay in Europe's single market after Brexit, saying a growing political majority backs such a deal.

Headline: Johnson fears 'waste of time' watered-down Brexit - report
Description: Foreign minister Boris Johnson has told friends he is worried that Britain will accept a Brexit deal that leaves it subordinate to Brussels, making the 2016 EU referendum a "total waste of time", the Sun newspaper reported on Monday.

Headline: Trade options for UK financial services after Brexit
Description: A stand-off between Britain and the European Union over the future of London's vast financial services industry is shaping up as one of the key Brexit battlegrounds of this year.

Headline: May wants Brexit deal that works for whole of UK - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has been clear that she wants to negotiate an exit from the European Union works for the whole of the United Kingdom, her spokesman said on Monday after the Scottish government set out its impact assessment for Brexit.

Headline: Britain has provided additional help to France on border security - PM May's spokesman
Description: Britain has provided additional security help to France, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Monday when asked about the possibility of having to pay more for border security around the northern French port of Calais.

Headline: Exclusive - EU Parliament expected to soften euro clearing relocation powers
Description: The European Parliament is aiming to soften plans to give European Union regulators the power to force London's main clearing house to relocate if it wants to continue doing business in the single market after Brexit, an EU lawmaker said.

Headline: Spanish, Dutch deny joint plan to seek softer Brexit
Description: The Netherlands and Spain have not reached an agreement about how Britain should leave the European Union, a Dutch Finance Ministry official said on Friday, denying an earlier report of a deal that drove sterling sharply higher.

Headline: Former Brexit campaign boss says no desire for a re-run of the EU referendum
Description: British voters do not want a re-run of the referendum on European Union membership and any hint of another vote undermines the government's Brexit negotiations, the former CEO of Britain's main "Leave" campaign told Reuters.

Headline: May tells bankers they are a priority for Brexit amid job warnings
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May told bankers from firms such as Goldman Sachs on Thursday they were a priority for her in the Brexit talks, just as new warnings emerged of job losses in the London financial sector unless there is a trade deal.

Headline: Bankers demand more Brexit clarity at meeting with UK PM May
Description: Bankers told Prime Minister Theresa May they needed more clarity on the future regulatory relationship between Britain and the European Union even though they were reassured by last month's preliminary Brexit divorce settlement, May's spokesman said.

Headline: Brexiteers back second EU referendum to stop 'soft' departure from bloc
Description: Two of Britain's most prominent Brexit campaigners endorsed a second referendum on leaving the European Union on Thursday as the best way to stop EU supporters from trying to water down, or even halt, the country's departure from the bloc.

Headline: Brexit caused 37 percent fall in new London financial jobs in December - report
Description: Britain's forthcoming exit from the European Union was the main reason for a 37 percent decline in new jobs available in London's financial sector last month, according to a report from recruiting firm Morgan McKinley released on Thursday.

Headline: UK will not pay EU for access to financial services market - May's spokesman
Description: Britain will not pay the European Union for access to its financial services market after Brexit, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday.

Headline: May to meet financiers as London mayor warns of 'lost decade' due to Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May meets financiers from firms including Goldman Sachs on Thursday to discuss the impact of Brexit on Europe's financial capital, as London's mayor said Britain could face a "lost decade" of low growth and investment.

Headline: Second referendum on Brexit is only option now, says Brexit campaigner Arron Banks
Description: Britain should hold a second referendum to confirm support for a clean break with the European Union, Arron Banks, the co-founder of influential pro-Brexit campaign group Leave.EU, said on Thursday.

Headline: German car suppliers could lose thousands of jobs over hard Brexit - study
Description: A so-called "hard Brexit" involving tariffs and a lasting devaluation of the pound could cause thousands of job losses at German automotive suppliers, a study by accounting firm Deloitte showed.

Headline: PM May says working for best Brexit deal for the British people
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday she is working to secure the best trade deal with the European Union after London's mayor warned that Britain could lose almost 500,000 jobs if it fails to agree a deal.

Headline: Britain will not hold a second EU referendum - May's spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will not hold a second referendum on Britain's membership of the European Union, her spokesman said on Thursday in response to growing calls for a new vote on Brexit.

Headline: 'No deal' Brexit could cost UK about 500,000 jobs, London mayor says
Description: Britain could lose almost 500,000 jobs and 50 billion pounds investment over the next 12 years if it fails to agree a trade deal with the European Union, according to a report commissioned by London Mayor Sadiq Khan.

Headline: Cutting out Brussels middleman, UK ministers make Brexit pitch to Germany
Description: Facing a tough line from Brussels on what economic ties between Britain and the European Union will look like after Brexit, a pair of senior British ministers made a direct pitch to Germany to cut Britain a good deal.

Headline: Scotland prepares contingency Brexit laws in stand-off with London government
Description: The Scottish government said on Wednesday it was preparing legislation that would ensure legal continuity in Scotland after Brexit as a fallback option in case it fails to reach agreement with Prime Minister Theresa May on her exit plan.

Headline: May to meet finance bosses on Brexit
Description: Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May will meet executives from major finance companies on Thursday to give them a clearer idea of what Britain's European Union exit will mean for them.

Headline: EU unity paramount to Germany in Brexit talks, insists Berlin
Description: Germany will remain focused on preserving a united stance between the European Union's 27 members in talks with London on Brexit, a government spokesman said on Wednesday after British ministers made a direct appeal to Berlin to cut it a good deal.

Headline: UK plans three-month window after Brexit to start court cases under EU law
Description: Britain said on Tuesday it wanted to give businesses and citizens a three-month window after leaving the European Union in which they can start court cases about a breach of EU legal principles.

Headline: British Brexit minister complains about EU's planning for no-deal
Description: Brexit minister David Davis has complained in a letter to the prime minister that Brussels is damaging British interests by talking up the threat to companies if the UK leaves the European Union without a deal.

Headline: Who will lead the Bank of England after Brexit?
Description: Britain is expected to choose a new central bank chief this year to succeed Canadian Mark Carney, who will step down in June 2019, three months after the country's scheduled exit from the European Union.

Headline: Dutch PM Rutte: Britain must clarify post-Brexit relationship
