Description: Britain has only a "remote" chance of balancing its public finances by the mid-2020s, as sought by the government, and reversing the fiscal damage from the financial crisis will take more than 40 years on current plans, a leading think tank said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit putting Europe's UK friendship to the test - ECB's Villeroy
Description: Top European Central Bank policymaker Francois Villeroy de Galhau said Britain's divorce with the European Union was putting strain on its friendship with the bloc, and that deregulation would put global financial systems on course towards another crisis.

Headline: ECB's Villeroy plays down talk of taking over from Draghi
Description: The Bank of France's member on the European Central Bank's Governing Council played down talk on Thursday he was in the running to take over from Mario Draghi as the central bank's president in 2019.

Headline: Waiting for May, Brussels eyes December Brexit deal
Description: When Theresa May visits Brussels on Friday, EU negotiators will be listening intently for signs the British prime minister is preparing to risk a domestic backlash and raise her offer to secure a Brexit deal in December.

Headline: May to meet EU's Juncker, Barnier Dec. 4, EU confirms
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will meet European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker and his chief Brexit negotiator in Brussels on Monday, Dec. 4, the EU executive confirmed on Thursday.

Headline: EU's Juncker says will see in 'next few days' if Brexit talks can enter second phase
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said on Thursday that it would be seen in the next few days whether Brexit talks with Britain had made enough progress to enter a second phase of negotiations.

Headline: Brexit withdrawal bill to be debated from Dec. 4
Description: Britain's parliament will debate the Brexit withdrawal bill on Dec. 4, and on a further four days in the month, the leader of the House of Commons said on Thursday.

Headline: City to May - Don't haggle over pennies in Brexit talks
Description: Britain must not get bogged down haggling over "pennies" in settling its Brexit divorce bill and focus instead on the "big pounds" that a trade deal with Europe would bring, the new Lord Mayor of London said.

Headline: Britain urged to map out post-Brexit future for lawyers
Description: Britain needs to set out plans to make sure its lawyers can keep working across Europe after Brexit, a lobby group said on Thursday.

Headline: Sweden wants Brexit progress in December, but UK must move on money
Description: Swedish Prime Minister Stefan Löfven said on Wednesday he wanted Brexit talks to move to the next stage in December but there were red lines and Britain needed to make commitments to the rest of the European Union, especially on finance.

Headline: Paris watchdog win bolsters its fight for Brexit banks
Description: The surprise decision to move the European Banking Authority to Paris will boost its chances of attracting London banks after Brexit, French officials said on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit and the City - Taking London's financial pulse
Description: Will Britain's decision to leave the European Union in 2019 damage one of its most successful industries?

Headline: UK government averts Brexit rebellion, giving ground on EU rights plan
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's government averted a rebellion in parliament on Tuesday over plans to ditch the European Union's Charter of Fundamental Rights, promising to review its approach and make changes if needed.

Headline: Britain to detail Brexit bill when EU agrees to move talks forward
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will only detail how big a divorce settlement Britain is willing to pay the EU when the bloc gives a commitment to moving talks forward, according to a plan rubber-stamped by even her most pro-Brexit ministers.

Headline: UK Brexit minister says EU agreement likely, but UK ready for no deal
Description: Britain's Brexit minister David Davis said on Tuesday that reaching a deal with the European Union was the most likely outcome of talks, but added that the British government was prepared for no agreement with the bloc.

Headline: Britain will honour commitments made to EU - May's spokesman
Description: Britain will honour its commitments made while a member of the European Union, but specific figures on how much the country will pay for Brexit are subject to negotiations, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit gets real for drugmakers as regulator moves to Amsterdam
Description: Drugmakers are racing to implement Brexit contingency plans to prepare for a jolt to their regulatory system as the European Medicines Agency is uprooted from London to Amsterdam.

Headline: BoE's 'smooth' Brexit view hinges on market, economy reaction - Vlieghe
Description: The Bank of England would likely reconsider its assumption of a "smooth" transition to Brexit if a breakdown in talks between London and Brussels causes big shifts in financial markets and economic indicators, rate-setter Gertjan Vlieghe said.

Headline: May meets senior ministers to discuss Brexit divorce bill offer
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May met with senior members of her ministerial team on Monday to discuss their response to European Union demands for more detail on how much Britain is willing to pay as part of its Brexit divorce package.

Headline: DUP says Northern Ireland will leave EU on same terms as rest of UK
Description: The head of the Democratic Unionist Party said on Monday Northern Ireland would leave the EU on the same terms as the rest of the United Kingdom, rebuffing a suggestion from the bloc that the region remain subject to some of its rules.

Headline: Amsterdam, Paris win post-Brexit EU agencies in lucky dip
Description: Amsterdam and Paris won the right to host two EU agencies that must leave London because of Brexit after an extraordinary ministerial meeting in Brussels that left both results decided by drawing lots from a fishbowl.

Headline: Macron hails banking agency win as victory for EU commitment
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron on Monday hailed his EU peers' decision to relocate the European Banking Agency (EBA) to Paris after Brexit as proof of the country's attractiveness and a reward for its pro-Europe efforts.

Headline: EU picks Paris as new host for EBA after Brexit, sources say
Description: The European Union has picked Paris as the new host for its London-based banking authority after Britain leaves the bloc, in a second drawing of lots in just one evening, following three rounds of voting that failed to produce a winner.

Headline: Frankfurt out of race for EBA, Dublin leads Paris - sources
Description: Dublin and Paris went into a runoff on Monday to host the European Banking Authority after Britain leaves the EU, diplomatic sources said after second round in which Frankfurt was eliminated.

Headline: EU picks Paris as new host for EBA after Brexit, sources say
Description: The European Union has picked Paris as the new host for its London-based banking authority after Britain leaves the bloc, in a second drawing of lots in just one evening, following three rounds of voting that failed to produce a winner.

Headline: EU drugs agency move to Amsterdam minimises likely staff losses
Description: Amsterdam's success in winning the battle to host the European Medicines Agency (EMA), which is relocating from London because of Brexit, was welcomed by drug manufacturers on Monday hoping for the least disruption due to staff losses at the regulator.

Headline: UK commits billions to 'industries of future' to ward off Brexit shocks
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May on Monday announced 4 billion pounds of spending on research and development and regional growth strategies, setting out plans to help the economy grow after Brexit.

Headline: Milan and Amsterdam go into runoff to host EU drug agency after Brexit, sources say
Description: Milan and Amsterdam went into a runoff on Monday after a second European Union vote failed to pick the new host for European Medicines Agency, three diplomatic sources said.

Headline: Brexit campaign probed over possible breach of electoral finance rules
Description: Britain's Electoral Commission has opened an investigation to establish whether Vote Leave Limited, the organisation behind the official campaign to leave the European Union, breached campaign finance rules during the 2016 referendum campaign.

Headline: Milan leads after first EU vote on moving drug watchdog from London
Description: Milan came out in the lead after the first round of a European Union vote on Monday to pick the new host for the London-based European Medicines Agencys (EMA), three diplomatic sources said.

Headline: EU's Barnier presses UK on Irish border Brexit problem
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier stepped up pressure on the United Kingdom on Monday to propose how to avoid having a physical border with the Republic of Ireland if London wants to get a good trade deal with the EU.

Headline: Factbox - Impact on banks from Britain's vote to leave the EU
Description: Banks have said they could move thousands of jobs out of Britain to prepare for the country's planned exit from the European Union.

Headline: Factbox - Insurers' preparations regarding Britain's planned EU exit
Description: British ship insurer North is setting up a subsidiary in Dublin, joining a growing list of insurers setting up regulated European Union operations in case Britain does not have access to the single market after Brexit.

Headline: Don't try to be clever, ECB tells City banks post Brexit
Description: UK-based banks seeking access to the European Union after Brexit should avoid "inventive set-ups" to enter the single market from Britain, a top European Central Bank supervisor said on Monday.

Headline: Goldman to have two EU hubs post-Brexit - Frankfurt and Paris: report
Description: Goldman Sachs  Chief Executive Lloyd Blankfein said the bank would have hubs in Frankfurt and Paris after Brexit and that it would be up to the staff to decide where they want to move to from London, he told French newspaper Le Figaro.

Headline: Brexit and the City - The real estate agent's view
Description: A booming financial services industry has reshaped London's skyline over the past 20 years, with gleaming towers dubbed the "Cheesegrater" and the "Walkie Talkie" testament to its impact.

Headline: Brexit and the City - View from the dining room
Description: In a former bank building just across from the Bank of England in the City of London, the glass-domed 1 Lombard Street restaurant offers a taste of the financial district's mood.

Headline: Post-Brexit border checks could add 1.5 billion pounds to UK aerospace costs
Description: Britain's aerospace industry could face 1.5 billion pounds a year in extra costs after Brexit if firms exporting components to the European Union face additional checks at the border, industry body ADS Group said on Monday.

Headline: Face time with May - UK listens to bankers' Brexit worries
Description: A few hours before Theresa May lost her second cabinet member in a week, the prime minister found time amidst the crisis to meet one of the world's most powerful bankers.

Headline: Britain to submit 'Brexit bill' proposal before December EU meeting
Description: Britain will submit proposals on how to settle its divorce bill with the European Union before an EU summit next month and is expected to negotiate hard, finance minister Philip Hammond said on Sunday.

Headline: Hammond says hopeful main elements of EU-UK trade deal agreed before Brexit
Description: Finance minister Philip Hammond said he was hopeful the main parts of Britain's post-Brexit trade deal with the European Union could be agreed "in principle" by March 2019, when the country is due to leave the EU.

Headline: Hammond increasingly confident Britain will get Brexit deal
Description: Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond said on Sunday he was becoming more convinced Britain would secure a Brexit deal with the European Union.

Headline: Two weeks to unlock Brexit, EU tells May
Description: "There is more work to be done" to unlock Brexit talks, British Prime Minister Theresa May was told on Friday, as the European Union repeated an early December deadline for her to move on the divorce bill and border with Ireland.

Headline: Brexit progress needed by early Dec. to unlock talks - EU's Tusk
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said he told British Prime Minister Theresa May that the European Union wants progress on Irish border and financial issues by early December to move Brexit talks forward.

Headline: EU's Tusk - no deadlock on Brexit, very cautious but optimistic
Description: There is no deadlock in divorce talks between Britain and the European Union, EU summit chair Donald Tusk said on Friday, adding he was very cautious, but optimistic that negotiations could move on to the next phase in December.

Headline: Ireland says not ready to let Brexit talks move on to trade
Description: Britain and Ireland clashed over Brexit on Friday with Dublin saying it was not ready to allow talks to move on to trade issues next month and London ruling out the much longer transitional period preferred by its neighbour.

Headline: To our readers: How we are measuring Brexit’s impact on London’s financial district
Description: More foreign exchange transactions are done in London than anywhere else on the planet. Hundreds of banks and some of the world’s biggest hedge funds call London home. Britain’s capital is, by most measures, the first or second most important financial centre in the world.

Headline: Europe's drug industry waits for white smoke in Brussels
Description: It may be a cross between the Eurovision Song Contest, a papal conclave and a social club raffle but a ballot among EU ministers on Monday could hurt Europe's pharmaceutical industry and the health of millions.

Headline: EU watchdog tightens grip over use of foreign credit ratings
Description: The European Union's markets watchdog has tightened its grip over the use of credit ratings compiled outside the bloc in a taste of what the "Big Three" ratings agencies in London face after Brexit.

Headline: Britain's government to push ahead with plan on specific Brexit date
Description: Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May will push ahead with plans to fix into law the time and date of the country's European Union exit for March 2019, her spokesman said on Friday, despite opposition from some members of her party.

Headline: Goldman CEO Blankfein calls for second vote on Brexit
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  Chief Executive Lloyd Blankfein said on Thursday that many people want Britain to have a "confirming vote" on whether to leave the European Union.

Headline: Visitors to UK hits August record after Brexit fall in pound
Description: The number of visitors to Britain hit a record high in August but fewer Britons travelled abroad, the latest sign of how the fall in the value of the pound after last year's Brexit vote is helping Britain's tourism industry.

Headline: Bankers shifting from London after Brexit may face lower pay
Description: Bankers relocating from London to other European financial hubs following Britain's exit from the European Union could face  lower pay packages, according to an industry survey published on Friday by compensation consultant Emolument.

Headline: Some EU countries want Brexit talks to move to trade - Davis
Description: Some European countries want the Brexit talks to move on to focus on trade and, although Germany and France are key to allowing that progress, it is a decision for the whole of the bloc, Britain's Brexit minister David Davis said on Friday.

Headline: Ireland not ready to let Brexit talks move to stage two - minister
Description: Ireland is not ready to allow talks on Britain's withdrawal from the European Union to move to the second phase next month, Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain wants trade deal with EU 'much closer than Canada'- Davis
Description: Britain wants the freest possible trade in goods and services with the European Union in a Brexit deal that goes further than the bloc's trade agreement with Canada, Brexit Secretary David Davis said on Thursday.

Headline: Davis says no Brexit deal 'incredibly unlikely'
Description: It is "incredibly unlikely" that Britain will not be able to negotiate a deal with the European Union on its departure from the bloc, Brexit Secretary David Davis said on Thursday.

Headline: Nimble Bank of England will shield UK from Brexit effects - Carney
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Thursday the central bank would be nimble enough to keep inflation under control whatever the outcome of the country's negotiations to leave the European Union.

Headline: 'No cash, Carney?' Bank of England Governor unable to find wallet
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney appeared unable to find his wallet on Thursday while attending a central bank event to promote public understanding of economics.

Headline: Brexit deters some international staff from London tech firms - survey
Description: One in three tech companies in London have seen talks with potential international hires fall through due to Britain's decision to leave the European Union, according to a survey from industry body Tech London Advocates.

Headline: May's spokesman says report UK will raise Brexit bill offer is speculation
Description: A newspaper report that British Prime Minister Theresa May is preparing to offer up to 20 billion pounds more to the European Union as part of Brexit divorce bill is speculation, her spokesman said on Thursday.
